JobTitle: Intern Program Event & Marketing Internship- Summer 2021 (Virtual)
Text:
Internship Description:

The Intern Program is part of the wider recruitment team that helps bring the best talent to Discovery. We aim to create a top caliber Intern Program that brings in top students and provides them with an amazing hands on learning experience. We are a small but mighty team that handles all of the recruitment for our nationwide program, executes events and workshops, fosters an alumni program and markets Discovery on campus.

As an Intern Program Marketing & Events Intern, your adventure could lead you to work on projects and tasks such as:
Hands-on experience with program management, community management, event planning and corporate recruitment.Facilitate planning and executing summer intern eventsBuild camaraderie amongst interns across the nationBrainstorm creative ideas to advertise and market Discovery Inc. on campus
Although our summer internship program will be completely remote (students can apply from anywhere), please be aware that this intern will report into a New York City based manager and therefore should expect to work on eastern standard time.
Requirements:
Must be currently enrolled as a student (proof of enrollment will be required if selected for an internship)Must be a rising Junior, Senior, or Graduate studentMust have at least a 3.0 GPAMust have the legal right to work in the United States.Design skills are a plus
More About the Intern Program:

Discovery’s internationally recognized intern program attracts the country’s boldest and brightest students for a paid, for-credit, real-world work experience in the entertainment and media industry.
Like other Fortune 500 companies, we believe in immersing our students in all aspects of our business, giving them first hand experience working for the global leader in real life entertainment. So what sets us apart? We’re passionate about investing in our interns- both personally and professionally. Whether our program is in-person or remote, every semester is packed with speaker sessions with executives, LinkedIn profile reviews, recruiter panels, roundtable events and professional seminars- and that just scratches the surface.
Think our program sounds pretty awesome? Our former interns thought so too! This year, we were voted into Vault’s 2021 internship rankings for best overall internships, best media and telecom internships, best sales and marketing internships and best internships for diversity.
Ready to learn more? Here’s what we offer:
Mentorship from some of the industry’s kindest and most passionate entertainment veterans
Professional development seminars, panels with recruiters and former interns, intern-exclusive events, and so much more
Access to top level executives and employees through our Speaker Series and Roundtables
Incredible networking opportunities and a robust intern alumni network
A creative, collaborative and inclusive company culture
What you can expect to take away from the semester:
Opportunity to develop professionally and uncover skills you didn’t know you had
The insider scoop on the TV industry and what happens behind the scenes
Relationships that will go beyond your collegiate career
Real life experiences that will provide you with the confidence to delve into your next adventure
And finally, what to know before applying:
We offer 12 week spring and summer opportunities
Our Summer 2021 program will be fully remote- the program will run from June 2-August 20.
The application deadline for Summer 2021 is March 19th. After this date, we cannot guarantee your application will be reviewed for the position.
Our internships are paid opportunities. Credit is not required; however, we will provide necessary documentation for school credit if desired.
We do not require a cover letter- please do not submit one. Instead, demonstrate your passion for the position through your resume and interviews.
Interviewing will take place from February through mid-April. A Discovery Intern team member will contact you if your experiences and interests match an open internship position. Due to the high volume of applications, we are unable to give individual status updates.

Job Summary If you are an experienced, aggressive sales leader, now is your chance to join Zurich Alternative (Direct) Markets. We have a highly sought after opening for a Regional Finance and Insurance Producer in our New York State territory. The ideal candidate could live in either the Albany or Syracuse markets. About Zurich Direct Markets: This business unit specializes in providing F&I products, to the automotive industry. We have a dedicated sales force who meet regularly and directly with our customers. Our Regional Finance and Insurance Producers: Generate new F&I opportunities within the large retail automotive space and support the marketing of F&I products in assigned territory (This opportunity requires candidates to live within the covering territory.) Drive a high volume of new business opportunities within an existing territory to increase growth and profitability Earn a competitive base salary with generous incentives and unlimited earning potential Receive excellent benefits AND a company car (All candidates are subject to an MVR check) Work in an entrepreneurial atmosphere Job Qualifications Basic Qualifications: • High School Diploma or Equivalent and 2 or more years of experience in the Sales area OR Zurich approved Apprenticeship program including an Associate Degree and No prior experience required in the Sales area AND Knowledge of principles of sales, sales techniques, and sales terminologyKnowledge of requirements within insurance industry regulatory environmentKnowledge of Microsoft OfficeThe ability to be licensed to sell insurance in the states where required Preferred Qualifications: • 4 or more years of sales experience, Automotive industry experience preferred Licensed to sell insurance in the states where requiredExperience analyzing financial statements A future with Zurich Now is the time to move forward and make a difference. At Zurich, we want you to share your unique perspectives, experiences and ideas so we can grow and drive sustainable change together. As part of a leading global organization, Zurich North America has over 148 years of experience managing risk and supporting resilience. Today, Zurich North America is a leading provider of commercial property-casualty insurance solutions and a wide range of risk management products and services for businesses and individuals. We serve more than 25 industries, from agriculture to technology, and we insure 90% of the Fortune 500®. Our growth strategy is not limited to our business. As an employer, we strive to provide ongoing career development opportunities, and we foster an environment where voices are diverse, behaviors are inclusive, actions drive equity, and our people feel a sense of belonging. Be a part of the next evolution of the insurance industry. Join us in building a brighter future for our colleagues, our customers and the communities we serve. The company was founded in 1996 and is headquartered in midtown Manhattan, with employees spread out across the country.The RoleWe are seeking a moderately experienced production associate to help us produce content originating from our editorial team (and broad network of partners) and manage it across a growing network of websites and online services. MAXIMUS Introduction: Since 1975, Maximus has operated under its founding mission of Helping Government Serve the People, enabling citizens around the globe to successfully engage with their governments at all levels and across a variety of health and human services programs. Maximus delivers innovative business process management and technology solutions that contribute to improved outcomes for citizens and higher levels of productivity, accuracy, accountability and efficiency of government-sponsored programs. With more than 30,000 employees worldwide, Maximus is a proud partner to government agencies in the United States, Australia, Canada, Saudi Arabia, Singapore and the United Kingdom. For more information, visit https://www.maximus.com. Â : EEO Statement: Active military service members, their spouses, and veteran candidates often embody the core competencies Maximus deems essential, and bring a resiliency and dependability that greatly enhances our workforce. We recognize your unique skills and experiences, and want to provide you with a career path that allows you to continue making a difference for our country. We’re proud of our connections to organizations dedicated to serving veterans and their families. If you are transitioning from military to civilian life, have prior service, are a retired veteran or a member of the National Guard or Reserves, or a spouse of an active military service member, we have challenging and rewarding career opportunities available for you. A committed and diverse workforce is our most important resource. Maximus is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. Maximus provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status or disabled status.

Our Story
WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others. The organization also includes Xandr’s suite of advanced advertising solutions designed to help to improve advertising for brands, publishers, and consumers.
Xandr is a technology platform powering one of the largest global Advanced TV and Video advertising marketplaces in the industry. For more than a decade, our data insights, premium content, powerful technology, and scaled direct-to-consumer distribution have given us a competitive edge — leading us to improving advertising for all brands, publishers, and consumers.
How do we do this? With talented, passionate people like you! We bring together people from diverse backgrounds and give them an opportunity to bring their ideas to life.
The Job
The Data Science team at Xandr is responsible for driving algorithmic product innovation across the company. Our projects underlie major features for both buyers and sellers on our platform, as well as the marketplace design for our ad exchange itself. We combine elements of theory with the practical tools and techniques for exploring vast quantities of data, all with the aim of designing effective algorithms to achieve product goals. Data Science partners closely with Engineering, Product, and Data Analytics to ensure that our solutions are solving the right business problem, are scaling as needed, and are achieving the expected results for our clients.
We seek an intern with experience in analytics and problem solving and who is looking to gain exciting real-world data science experience at a thriving company.
The Daily
This program will have our interns work side-by-side, virtually this year, with the team’s data scientists and analysts while we create an impact on our business. They will be a contributing part of all our team’s daily status and weekly planning meetings, along with any design and problem-solving activities the team conducts.
We frequently work in small teams to solve problems, explore new technologies, and learn from one another. The ideal intern for this environment will be enthusiastic and collaborative and has a sincere desire for learning and growth.
The Essentials
You are a currently enrolled student with a BA/BS or Master’s degree expected in December 2021 or Spring 2022 in Computer Science, Math, Engineering or a related field
You are familiar with machine learning and/or deep learning techniques
You have foundational knowledge of programming languages (such as Python, and/or R, and/or SQL) and various operating systems (Linux, Mac, Windows)
You are passionate about a culture of learning and teaching. You love challenging yourself to constantly improve, and sharing your knowledge to empower others
You like to take risks when looking for novel solutions to complex problems. If faced with roadblocks, you continue to reach higher to make greatness happen
You care about solving big, systemic problems. You look beyond the surface to understand root causes so that you can build long-term solutions for the whole ecosystem
You believe in not only serving customers, but also empowering them by providing knowledge and tools
Internship Program
Students must apply by the application deadline on February 26.
Students must be currently enrolled in a college degree program for full duration of the internship
Summer 2021 program dates are June 7th - August 13th; must be available for full program duration
Must be able to accommodate full-time schedule (40 hours/week) for full program duration
Fully remote/virtual experience; company owned laptop provided for the duration of the internship program
Salary based on office location; relocation is not provided
The Perks
Hands-on work with passionate, talented team members in your field
Networking opportunities with industry-leading professionals
Engaging events including executive speakers sessions, professional development workshops, and more
Warner Media, LLC and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

At Getaround, we’re building a global platform to enable a future where all cars are shared. There are more than 1 billion cars in the world, and these cars are parked, on average, more than 95% of the time. With instant and keyless carsharing via our patented hardware and software platform and our industry-leading mobile apps, we’re helping communities around the world share these underutilized resources to reduce their vehicle footprint while increasing mobility solutions.
Reporting to the VP, People & Culture, the Head of Total Rewards will serve as a trusted leader. You will be instrumental in creating and implementing our total rewards strategy that aligns with Getaround’s values and objectives. The successful candidate will be a hands-on leader ready to roll-up their sleeves, with the ability to think strategically and has a deep understanding of scaling systems, programs, and policies that effectively drive increased employee engagement. You will help pivot the culture and improve the overall effectiveness of the business and teams.
What you'll be doing
Lead, manage and evolve our Global Total Rewards programs and processes by elevating our HR systems, employee lifecycle management, total compensation, global mobility, performance management, learning & development programs, and standardizing all systems, processes, and policies
Design and implement People metrics dashboard to identify trends in quantitative and qualitative data to improve organizational health, utilize data to make objective, informed decisions, interpret complex analyses and tie analyses back to business objectives
Build, improve and implement training plans and communication strategies in collaborations with other department designed to educate and inform managers and employees of new programs, building a strong employee value proposition
Manage vendor relationships and establish performance metrics to maximize ROI within the partnership, and conducting periodic audits with the finance and accounting teams
Serve as a resource for compliance and legal employment matters
What you'll need
8+ years of Total Rewards experience building and implementing high-impact and scalable programs
Demonstrated change management and project management experience and experience driving programs independently
Ability to operationalize complex People programs through process improvement, systems integration, end-user training, and thoughtful change management
Highly efficient in the design, management, and execution of complex projects and programs in an innovative and performance-driven environment
Experience partnering on global matters with international partners
Demonstrated analytical and data management experience with experience translating data into action planning
Strong interpersonal and communication experience and experience building relationships at all levels of the organization
Experience working in technology or internet business with in-depth knowledge of industry trends and best practices, as well as regulatory requirements in the US
Hands-on experience with HRIS and People related tools
#LI-Remote
At Getaround, we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no matter your race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status, your perspective has value.

Come join us in continuing to make Getaround a great place to work!

Company Description

Shopify is the leading omni-channel commerce platform. Merchants use Shopify to design, set up, and manage their stores across multiple sales channels, including mobile, web, social media, marketplaces, brick-and-mortar locations, and pop-up shops. The platform also provides merchants with a powerful back-office and a single view of their business, from payments to shipping. The Shopify platform was engineered for reliability and scale, making enterprise-level technology available to businesses of all sizes. Headquartered in Ottawa, Canada, Shopify currently powers over 1,000,000 businesses in approximately 175 countries and is trusted by brands such as Allbirds, Gymshark, PepsiCo, Staples, and many more.

Job Description

Data Science & Engineering is a crucial part of Shopify’s mission to make commerce better for everyone. We organize and interpret petabytes of data to provide solutions for our merchants and stakeholders across the organization. From pipelines and schema design to machine learning products and decision support, data science at Shopify is a diverse role with many opportunities to positively impact our success. The Data Science & Engineering team acts as the impact multiplier for Shopify’s product teams, putting over 11 petabytes of data to work to make our merchants more successful. From delivering merchandising insights, to optimizing shipping and processing rates, to reducing credit card fraud, to ad campaign recommendations - our Data Scientists deliver solutions from pipeline to platform via an array of open source tools.
We are looking for Data Science Managers to join our Data Science teams and help shape the insights and algorithms that will inform our strategies as we grow globally.
What your role will look like:
Partner closely with product, engineering and other RnD stakeholders to guide their decisions using data
Proactively identify and champion projects that solve complex problems across multiple domains
Apply specialized skills and fundamental data science methods (e.g. experimental design, recommender systems and machine learning when needed) to inform improvements to our business
Design and implement end-to-end data pipelines: work closely with stakeholders to build models, tables or schemas that support business processes
Empower teams to build and maintain actionable KPIs, production-quality dashboards, informative deep dives, and scalable data products

Qualifications

You will need to have experience with:
Experience building and managing high performance data science teams
Experience delivering business impact through analysis and data products
Experience building data pipelines and driving ETL design decisions
Technical leadership and management experience (you enjoy doing both). You can jump into the code to the level that your direct reports admire and respect, but are also interested in developing people and capacity for your team
Experience creating data product strategies, shipping data products, iterating after launch, and trying again
Extensive experience using Python including a strong grasp of object oriented programming (OOP) fundamentals
Strong ability to prioritize and communicate to technical and non-technical audiences alike
It would be great if you have:
Previous experience using Spark (either via Scala or Pyspark)
Experience with statistical methods like regression, GLMs or experiment design and analysis, shipping productionized machine learning systems or other advanced techniques are also welcome
Experience with data storytelling using Tableau, QlikView, Mode, Matplotlib, D3, or similar data visualization tools
Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
If you’re interested in helping us shape the future of commerce at Shopify, click the “Apply Now” button to submit your application. Please submit a resume and cover letter with your application. Make sure to tell us how you think you can make an impact at Shopify, and what drew you to the role.
Closing date: February 5th, 2021, 5pm EST
At Shopify, we are committed to building and fostering an environment where our employees feel included, valued, and heard. Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We strongly encourage applications from Indigenous people, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and/or people with intersectional identities.

JobTitle: Solution Platform RTM Manager - Opportunity for Working Remotely New York, NY
Text:
Business Summary:
VMware accelerates digital transformation through a software-defined approach to business and IT. The trusted platform provider of choice for more than 500,000 customers globally, VMware is the pioneer in virtualization and an innovator in cloud and business mobility. A proven leader, VMware allows customers to run, manage, connect and secure applications across clouds and devices in a common operating environment.
Our team of 20,000+ people working in 50+ locations worldwide is committed to building a community where great people want to work long term by living our values of passion, innovation, execution, teamwork, active learning and giving back. If you are ready to accelerate, innovate and lead, join us as we challenge constraints and problem solve for tomorrow today.
The Solution Platform RTM Manager will report into the Worldwide Partner and Commercial Organization, working very closely with the Business Units executives and leaders as well as Corporate and field sales functions. You will be accountable for defining and executing go-to-market strategy, plans and activities to enable VMware partners to sell and deliver offerings based on the VMware Cloud Foundation solution to their existing and new customers. You will work with Product Management, Product Marketing, Partner Marketing, Partner Enablement, Partner Operations and Incentives, Education, Support and the Partner field teams to develop an engaged and productive channel go-to-market strategy.
The ideal candidate is an individual with expertise in driving channel strategy and initiatives, profitability models, messaging and have a track record of execution. A deep understanding of how a partner ecosystem works is a key. Outstanding executive communication, organization and people management skills are required to achieve success.
Job Role and Responsibilities
Build the Partner Route-To-Market strategy for VMware Cloud Foundation, connecting the solution to the partner GTM strategies for the underlying products.
Work with cross-functional teams to build and execute on plans in order to meet or exceed product GTM goals with an Integrated Go-to-Market Execution Plan for assigned product areas.
Participate and/or lead cross-functional teams in delivering on the business-critical initiatives identified therein, driving alignment across BU, sales regions and GTM functions in developing and executing integrated end-to-end GTM plan.
Conduct and present analysis to inform decision-making during execution planning and for course correction throughout the execution process.
Identify, analyze and drive strategic and critical initiatives that would help drive plan execution.
Define services strategy for partner profitability.
Develop communication for executive reviews.
Demonstrate excellent collaboration, interpersonal and communication skills, and experienced in communication at the executive level.
Be a trusted advisor to the planning community.
Ensure execution and measurement of results across BUs, sales regions, and functions.
Required Skills
8+ years’ experience in partner GTM, sales strategy, product or product marketing roles
Solid expertise in Storage and/or Virtualization technologies
Proven experience of building and running a Partner Programs, GTM or Sales team across multiple countries, ideally globally.
Deep understanding of the channel and the various partner types
Ability to drive proven sales plays
Able to demonstrate repeated experience of creating business plans which have resulted in growth and achievement of revenues and goals
Worked successfully within a matrix management environment
Ability to interact and communicate with various levels in the organization from individual contributor to senior executives.
High energy and comfort working in a fast-paced, multi-faceted environment
Self-starter and proven team player in a high achievement-oriented environment
Preferred Skills
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
Home Office - Anywhere in the United States
This job requisition is not eligible for employment-based immigration sponsored by VMware.

Paid training, company car, home office, medical, dental, vision, 6% 401K matching, promotion from within...what a great way to start a career in sales!Position Description: Reynolds and Reynolds is seeking motivated and hard-working Entry Level Software Sales Trainee to join our growing team. As an Entry Level Software Sales Trainee, you will enroll in our 12 month training program. This program is comprised of both field based and classroom style training. The classroom training is located at our award winning Reynolds University in Dayton, OH. Every month you will travel to Dayton for 1-2 weeks of courses covering a variety of topics, including dealership operations, sales techniques, and negotiation skills. When you are not in Dayton, you will be working with your assigned Sales Mentor in the field, observing the sales process and assisting them on their calls. You will also be given the opportunity to travel with our customer service and installation teams to enhance your knowledge of our products. During the 12 months of training, you can expect to travel up to 75% of the time.Once you complete the training program, you will relocate to your assigned territory and become a Sales Professional. Relocation assistance to this new territory will be provided by the company. In this role you will be responsible for achieving designated monthly and annual quotas by selling Reynolds software products and services to new and existing customers. As a Sales Professional (and Trainee) you will have a home office and will be provided a company car, laptop, iPhone, and other office equipment.Requirements: Bachelor’s degreeMust be a self-starter with good time management skillsAbility to build strong customer relationshipsExcellent oral and written communication skillsWilling to relocate after successful completion of the 12 month training program (relocation assistance provided by the company)Ability to travel (overnight) approximately 75% during trainingBenefits: We strive to offer an environment that provides our associates with the right balance between work and family. We offer a comprehensive benefits package including:Medical, dental, vision and life insurance401(k) with up to 6% matchingCompany car for business and personal useWorking remotely with an iPhone, laptop, and other provided home office equipmentProfessional development and trainingPromotion from withinReferral bonusesAssociate discounts for cell phones, cars, computers, entertainment, and much moreCompany Information: Founded in 1866, Reynolds and Reynolds provides print, marketing, and software solutions to the automotive industry (www.reyrey.com). We offer solutions for each area of the dealership including parts, service, accounting, and sales.Reynolds and Reynolds promotes a healthy lifestyle by providing a non-smoking environment. Reynolds and Reynolds encourages applicants of all ages and experience to apply, as we do not discriminate on the basis of age.Job Type: Full-timePay: $50,000.00 per year

JobTitle: Program Manager/Instructional Designer, MAPBU Sales (Partners & Services) - Opportunity for Working Remotely New York, NY
Text:
Program Manager/Instructional Designer, MAPBU Sales (Partners & Services)
Team: GTM Readiness and Sales Acceleration
Direct Manager: Director, GTM Readiness & Sales Acceleration
Role: Program Manager/Instructional Designer, MAPBU Sales (Partners & Services)

Business Summary:
VMware accelerates digital transformation through a software-defined approach to business and IT. The trusted platform provider of choice for more than 500,000 customers globally, VMware is the pioneer in virtualization and an innovator in cloud and business mobility. A proven leader, VMware allows customers to run, manage, connect and secure applications across clouds and devices in a common operating environment.
Our team of 20,000+ people working in 50+ locations worldwide is committed to building a community where great people want to work long term by living our values of passion, innovation, execution, teamwork, active learning and giving back. If you are ready to accelerate, innovate, and lead, join us as we challenge constraints and problem solve for tomorrow.
Our Modern Applications Business Unit (MAPBU) and GTM Readiness & Sales Acceleration team (GTM R&SA), internally known as FUEL, is looking for a strong program manager (PM) with an instructional design and/or content creation background to support our Sales team. This position will be in Eastern EST, Central or Pacific PST time zones and will report into the Director, GTM Readiness & Sales Acceleration, MAPBU, and will support our partners and services offerings.
The PM will orchestrate the cross-functional collaboration required to produce high-impact enablement content that will be consumed directly by our partner and services sales specialists.
Key Responsibilities
Content Curation & Coordination
Lead the design and development of curriculum paths for “How to sell…” specific products or product portfolios, and/or “how to sell into….” a market segment in collaboration with Product Marketing
Consult & collaborate with product marketing and segment marketing leaders on the partners and Services teams, and Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to define the knowledge requirements, then validate the requirements with global sales leadership.
Lead and project manage the development of new materials and the improvement of existing materials, writing some content yourself, curating content from external sources, and leveraging vendors as necessary.
Review and approve the content built by others, maintaining high quality standards.
Support the Director of GTM R&SA in assessing the inventory (sort/organize/cull) of existing materials to support current and future enablement objectives
Maintain a cadence of continuous improvement across all assigned curriculum areas
Establish and participate in feedback loop from the field to marketing counterparts to ensure content produced is relevant and engaging.
Work with Product Marketing, Customer Marketing, Competitive Intel, etc. to deliver sales-ready content that is actionable and includes details (when/how/what) from current use cases.
Establish protocol for content tagging and categorization to optimize rep engagement and buyer activation.
Internal Sales Communications- Sales intranet (Vault) page admin and maintenance, and newsletter support
Ensure content and resources on Field Enablement Vault Pages are up-to-date, manage page changes
Manage and respond to questions/requests that are directed to the enablement email alias and slack channel.
Support enablement newsletter delivery through editing, and help frame content based on the curation efforts established with field and Marketing
Program Management & Execution
Contribute to other large or priority projects across the Core Strategy & Enablement team as requested
Maintain expertise in adult learning approaches and sales enablement techniques by attending external conferences and seminars, and participating in professional groups such as the Sales Enablement Society
Analyze and leverage metrics on content usage, training relevance and effectiveness to update and improve existing programs
Provide functional sales team members with coaching and guidance to create effective, actionable enablement content and manage backlog and deadlines
Collaborate with peer enablement teams on the Partner and Services teams to align development objectives
Ensure alignment between new content and existing frameworks and priorities
Determine training validation objectives and work with the Enablement Operations Specialist to standardize individual and team reporting standards

Partner & Services Support Alignment:
Act as primary enablement liaison with the Partners and Services Sales teams
Educate yourself on the partners, channel and services landscapes
Attend and participate in territory team calls and quarterly business reviews
Collaborate with Services practitioners to integrate agile methods in customer interactions
Collaborate with Services and Partner Marketing and Product teams to develop and launch product-related online learning and enablement sessions (e.g. Industry Calls, Partner and Ecosystem Services)
Ensure instructors and SMEs are properly prepared to deliver trainings accurately & effectively. Participate in the delivery of virtual and live training as a facilitator

Required Skills:
5-7+ years in a content development and/or content coordination role
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent required
Experience developing sales enablement programs that have had proven success across field sales, services and technical roles
Experience developing content and collateral successfully in fast-moving environments
Exceptional written communications, presentation, and facilitation skills
Experience and proven success working at a global level
Project management detailed mentality, with a strong process orientation
Understanding of sales training methodologies and best practices
Ability to multi-task in a high-volume, fast-paced environment where change is constant
Ability to problem solve and “think on your feet”
Ability to work independently and in a team environment
Preferred Skills:
Ability to synthesize, simplify and explain complex problems to different types of audiences, including executives
Experience in Instructional Design and course creation
Proficiency with Xyleme, Adobe Captivate, Articulate 360, or similar e-learning authoring development tools
Ability to implement the latest trends in distance learning and design
Experience sourcing content from throughout the organization (i.e curation)

Introduction to SWA/Balsley:
Join SWA/Balsley to leverage your emerging design & technical expertise into growth and leadership opportunities beyond NYC and into domestic and international projects of all types and scales.
SWA/Balsley is actively seeking a creative, highly skilled Entry-Level Landscape Designer for immediate employment in the award-winning New York City Studio.
In this role, you will collaborate with studio leadership to support the execution of projects in New York City as well as nationally and internationally. This is a unique opportunity to help shape a new dynamic studio, develop a robust portfolio of built work of the highest design caliber, and additionally engage with SWA – the largest landscape architecture firm in the US with a unique ‘design-first' reputation.
SWA/Balsley offers a competitive benefit package including health, dental, life, long-term disability, 401k, profit sharing, and performance-based bonus. SWA is 100% Employee Owned. SWA/Balsley is an equal opportunity employer.
About the position:
SWA/Balsley is seeking an exceptionally competent and highly motivated entry level candidate with 0-3 years of professional experience. This is a promising opportunity for a recent graduate who aspires to contribute to and thrive within a studio practice that works both locally and internationally and is empowered by a collaborative and congenial office setting.
This role includes:
Design and design support with input and critiques at all project phases
3D modeling & rendering
Producing presentation graphics and presentations
Assisting in preparation of construction drawings/documents, specifications, and cost estimates
Attending and participating in meetings
Working with and learning from senior designers on a collaborative team
Why SWA/Balsley?
Grow with a new firm with a national design reputation.
SWA/Balsley places equal design value on all phases and facets of work.
Extraordinary growth potential within SWA/Balsley and the affiliate SWA Group.
Opportunities to cross-fertilize with SWA's eight other studios across the US and abroad.
Unparalleled benefits package unique to SWA Group including fully funded bonuses, profit sharing, employee stock ownership, full 401k match, generous health insurance, and H1B sponsorship in the U.S. where applicable.
COVID-19
SWA/Balsley is following all CDC, local, and state guidelines for COVID-19. At this time, our staff is partially remote and accessing the office as needed for project work to continue while following strict health and safety protocols.
Remote candidates will be considered, however, once COVID restrictions are lifted, it is anticipated that this role will require a physical presence in the NYC office.
Minimum Requirements:
Accredited Degree in Landscape Architecture
Strong problem solving, critical thinking, and analytical skills
Attention to detail and organization
Strong communication skills (written and verbal)
Effective time management skills
Positive attitude and sense of accountability
Proficiency in:
o AutoCAD 2014+
o Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, InDesign, Photoshop, esp.)
o Microsoft Office
o 3D modeling (Rhino preferred)

Lumion
Revit
Grasshopper

Hand sketching

Watson Salembier is seeking a Full-Time Junior Landscape / Urban Designer to join our New York office. Candidates should be committed to a 4 days/per week (currently remote) work schedule.Watson Salembier, founded by Julia Watson & Marie Salembier, is a New York landscape and urban design studio. The studio specializes in rewilding — an untaming of design using biodiversity as a building block for designing new symbioses between people and place. Watson Salembier imagines a revision of urbanism towards radical localism informed by indigenous cultures & inspired by nature-based practices, planting techniques & technologies. With careers built in practice complemented by unique expertise, Watson Salembier offers the full spectrum of design services.Julia Watson is a designer, author and academic teaching at Columbia University, and a the preeminent expert on indigenous cultures and nature-based technologies. Her recent book published with Taschen, Lo—TEK, Design by Radical Indigenism, is an award-winning bestseller. As a horticulturist, landscape designer and educator, Marie is an international expert in biophilic planting design, who teaches sustainable planting design at the New York botanical garden and is currently writing a book on sensory relationships between people and the planted environment.We’re looking for a highly motivated candidate who shares Watson Salembier’s values and collaborative spirit, to work on a diverse variety of design projects in the private and public realm.Responsibilities include:Informing projects with design ideas.Preparing renderings & visual communication graphics for presentations.Preparation of design development documents.Hands-on experience with active projects and promotional work tasks.The candidate will:Have previous professional experience of 1+ years in a landscape design practice.Be comfortable working independently in a fast-paced, collaborative and interdisciplinary environment.Possess exceptional design skills with the ability to think at multiple scales and demonstrate design innovation and creativity.Possess exceptional visual representation skills.Have the ability to clearly articulate design concepts, processes, and solutions via verbal and written communication, as well as outstanding graphic representationsBring a positive attitude and spirit to the team.Be proficient in: AutoCAD, GIS, 3D Modeling and Rendering, Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Photoshop & Illustrator), and Microsoft Word (Word, Excel & PowerPoint)Job Type: PermanentJob Types: Part-time, InternshipPay: $15.00 per hourWork Location:Fully RemoteCompany's website:www.watsonsalembier.comCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview process

Technical Writer
Location: Remote
It takes a team with a wide range of talents to create ground-breaking products. Our Proposal Management team within Professional Services has the expertise to bring the process together. We support the opportunity lifecycle from development through to contracting, acting as the primary liaison between the customer and the financial support organizations. RPF tenders, customer business case analysis, total cost of ownership modelling – we take it all in our stride.
Join us to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact as a Technical Writer on our North America Sales Team team.
What you’ll achieve
The successful candidate will providing expert technical writing services to facilitate the generation of customer-specific proposals and marketing brochures for data-center and other complex solutions.
As a Technical Writer, you will interact with Dell sales teams and various technical experts to interpret customer business requirements and then produce proposal/marketing verbiage that articulates how the requirements intersect with Dell solutions and benefits.
You will:Work closely with the Dell sales and technical teams to understand potential solutions as they are designed and proposed for customer requirementsProduce customer-facing proposal and marketing verbiage that clearly marries the customer requirements with Dell designed solutionsApprove final content before it is sent to Marketing for publishing of final customer-facing documentAttend technical training to maintain up to date knowledge on the latest Dell enterprise technical solutions (servers, storage, networking, cloud services and infrastructure, enterprise business transformation, intrinsic security, etc).
Take the first step towards your dream career
Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:

Essential RequirementsUnderstanding of server, storage, data-center, and other complex enterprise technical solutions offered by Dell (servers, storage, networking, cloud services and infrastructure, enterprise business transformation, intrinsic security, etc).Ability to work closely with multiple sales teams and a wide variety of technical subject matter experts.Bachelor’s Degree required along with 10+ years of relevant experience with technical background in related IT field.Must have the ability to obtain and maintain a U.S. Government personnel security clearance.
Desirable Requirements Strong organizational skills to meet tight deadlines.Expert knowledge of Microsoft Office - Word, Excel, Power Point, and Adobe.
Here’s our story; now tell us yours
Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.

What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life - while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.

We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today.

You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here.

Job ID: R085269

For more than 35 years, PCMag has been the leading authority on technology buying, delivering independent reviews of more than 2,000 products per year. Our product and news coverage spans various areas of consumer and business tech, including computers, mobile, software and security.
ZMG is looking for a Product Designer to help lead the direction of the PCMag brand. The Product team is a collection of product managers and designers that are both analytical and creative. We believe that investing in the customer experience is the key to growing our business. As a Senior Product Manager, you will work alongside our product managers, engineers and stakeholders to ideate, prototype, build, and deliver a best-in-class user experience.
Responsibilities
As a Product Designer, you will stay with projects from start to finish. You can deliver design solutions while also demonstrating a well-rounded sense of business skills ranging from project management to business analysis. Your approach is rooted in mobile-first design systems. Your methods are agile and scale well. You contribute to the teams around you through mentorship and sharing user-centered methods of problem solving.
Product Discovery & Definition
Build understanding of our business and empathy for the people that use our products. Be able to lead user interviews, stakeholder interviews, design discovery sessions, competitive research, visual design explorations, strategic analysis and contribute to technical feasibility
Product Design
Define features and functions. Product designers determine the right deliverables based on the needs of the project. These include design comps, functional prototypes, etc.
Product Development
You will be the product design lead throughout development. It’s your responsibility to work closely with developers and collaborate on development progress to protect design intent and ensure product quality. Typically in parallel with development, you will update pattern libraries and visual design systems as a companion to the code.
Product Outcomes
You will be the product design lead working with teams to gather data on the outcomes of what we design and build. You will be able to drive conversations around engagement and conversion and use that knowledge to determine next steps.
Throughout the Project
You’ll be responsible for the product vision from start to finish. You will keep stakeholder, customer, product and business goals at the forefront of your conversations and work throughout the lifecycle of a project. You must have a strong point of view on what you are designing and you must be able to clearly articulate the goals – its objectives, who it’s for, why it matters – and be able to share your view and back it up with data. Representing and speaking for design decisions will mean presenting both internally and to stakeholders.
Qualifications
3-5 years of professional experience as a Product Designer
Expert level product designer with extensive and demonstrated expertise in visual hierarchy, layout, user research and information architecture
Displays an expert level understanding of user-centered design methodologies and a willingness to help and mentor those around them.
Expert in current design tools like Figma and old school tools like whiteboards or pencil and paper
Strong ability to prioritize competing opportunities, experience needs with business priorities and manage scope/time/value tradeoffs effectively
Excellent relationship management skills and an ability to drive consensus quickly, across a broad organization
Passion for tech products a plus
Benefits
Healthcare, vision, and dental plans, with generous contributions from the company
Pre-Tax Flexible healthcare spending account (FSA), Dependent Care FSA and Commuter Benefits
Flexible Paid Time Off
Position is NYC or Austin based, but offices are currently 100% remote with potential for future WFH flexibility
Generous 401(k) Matching
Employee stock purchase plan
Fitness Membership Reimbursement ($300)
Generous paid parental leave
Life and disability insurance
Pre-Tax Flexible healthcare spending account (FSA), Dependent Care FSA and Commuter Benefits
Employee referral bonuses
About Us
Ziff Media Group (ZMG), is a subsidiary of J2 Global, Inc., is a leading global digital-media company operating in three core verticals: Technology, Gaming, and Shopping. Its brands – PCMag, Mashable, RetailMeNot, Speedtest, ExtremeTech, IGN, AskMen, Offers.com, TechBargains, emedia and Salesify – produce and distribute premium content across multiple platforms and devices. ZMG delivers advertising, performance marketing, data services and licensing solutions to thousands of clients worldwide. ZMG publishes in 26 languages and successfully partners with local publishing operators across 115 countries.

JobTitle: Engineering Program Manager - Threat Research - Opportunity for Working Remotely New York, NY
Text:
Engineering Program Manager – Threat Research
Carbon Black is now part of VMware! As a standalone company, Carbon Black established itself as a leader in the endpoint security space. The product portfolio includes the rapidly growing Carbon Black Cloud platform that delivers next-generation endpoint protection capabilities from the cloud. Our software protects customers from small to medium businesses all the way through 34 of the fortune 100 with over 18,000 customers worldwide.
As an Engineering Program Manager (EPM), you will work to promote a culture of agility, operational rigor, visibility, accountability, and data-informed decisions. You will responsible for coordinating execution across many functional teams to execute the product roadmap. You will partner with business leaders to drive transformation that result in greater organizational effectiveness and efficiency.
As an Engineering Program Manager for Threat Research, you will additionally work with the Threat Research (TAU) team to focus and coordinate product roadmap across all other engineering teams in the SBU to increase our overall security efficacy.
Responsibilities for this role include:
Driving cross functional programs through the full project / program lifecycle with visible results to deliver capabilities and value to customers
Information driven management of execution, risks and dependencies
Ability to connect the dots between functions and processes in terms of broader business implications, including tactical, strategic, and enterprise dependencies, with an awareness of the up/downstream requirements Partnering very closely with counterpart EPMs, Engineering and PM leadership
Providing clear, concise, and insightful communication to the team, executives, and a diverse set of stakeholders
Defining program reviews to provide feedback and requirements for future projects
Required Qualifications:
BA/BS minimum
5+ years’ experience in leading/managing large scale software product projects
2+ years’ experience with agile development practices and product life cycle experience
Program/project portfolio management experience, managing a portfolio at a business unit or corporate level
Very well versed with collaboration tools, Jira, Confluence
Background in threat detection and overall security domain knowledge

Text: Hello, and thank you for taking the time to view this job posting! My name is Matthew Alexander, and I am a fitness professional, an advocate for people with disabilities, and in direct sales. As you can tell already, I have a lot on my plate handling three jobs! I want to give you experience, so that you can go out and have a better chance at the job of your dreams! I unfortunately do not have the money to pay right now, so I am willing to give you a letter of reference to a future employer, and/or write a letter of reference to give you college credit if you shall desire. But the main thing is, I will expose you to what it's like to make a difference in people's lives, teach you about sales (to be a good marketing person, you need to be able to sell products), and teach you about the fitness industry as a whole. And, as you prove yourself, you can potentially grow into a personal assistant role if you shall choose.On the day to day side of things, I really need help with content writing and graphic design. You will need to create content that people are interested in, and design posts for the appropriate content. Then, you will create a content calendar for the week, and tell me what to post and what day. I try to post at least 3-4 times a week if possible not to overwhelm everyone, but I will work with you if you have a better idea. And, I want you to feel respected. If you have any ideas that I am missing, I want you to feel comfortable telling me, so that I will have engagement on my posts and I will get the best leads for me!In order to complete this job, you will need a high school diploma or a GED, and a college student from the United States or Canada would be preferred. And, people with disabilities in the United States and Canada are encouraged to apply as well! Also, you need a computer (Mac or PC is fine) with high speed internet connection, Google Chrome or Firefox, and access to an email and cell phone. A smartphone would be preferred if you want to do work on the go. Also, I am requiring that the person I hire speak fluent English. I will also give preference to candidates who are bi-lingual as well.Some benefits to this job include that you can work whenever you want! I understand that you have a life, and I don't want my job taking that over. As long as you get done what is asked of you, I don't have an issue of when you work. And, you will be in an environment where you feel respected, and that you can have a voice!Thank you so much! I hope to see your application in my inbox!Job Types: Part-time, InternshipPay: $0.00 per hourBenefits:Flexible scheduleCOVID-19 considerations:All work will be done from home, so it is your responsibility to ensure that you are making sure that your work environment is clean and that you are following proper precautions for your state.Education:High school or equivalent (Required)Experience:Marketing: 1 year (Preferred)Language:Fluent English (Required)Work Location:Fully RemoteHours per week:10-19This Job Is:A “Fair Chance” job (you or the employer follow Fair Chance hiring practices when performing background checks)A good fit for applicants with gaps in their resume, or who have been out of the workforce for the past 6 months or moreOpen to applicants who do not have a college diplomaA job for which people with disabilities are encouraged to applyCompany's website:matthewaofficial.siteBenefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

OUR MISSION

Obesity is America's underlying pandemic, and science shows that lasting weight loss is driven by improving our metabolic health.

At Calibrate, we're defining metabolic health as a new consumer category, one that mirrors what the research shows—that weight reflects our biology, not our willpower. Our program was designed by world leaders in obesity and nutrition science to drive long-term weight loss in a way that's proven to be impactful, realistic, and sustainable.

To bring Calibrate to everyone who needs it, we're building the first direct-to-consumer telemedicine business within the healthcare ecosystem, aligning incentives for doctors, insurers, pharmaceutical companies, and consumers. By leveraging technology, Calibrate is closing the gap in care for 175mm American adults in a $600bn market where Americans spend millions of dollars and do not lose millions of pounds.

Our doctor-guided program defines a new standard of clinical care, bringing decades of academic research to everyone, everywhere. Calibrate combines FDA-approved metabolic medication with a holistic curriculum and 1:1 virtual coaching sessions that drive lasting behavior change. The result is a metabolic reset that delivers sustainable weight loss and success beyond the scale, with improved whole-body health that enables our members to embrace a new day-to-day.
ABOUT THE ROLE

Calibrate is looking for a hands-on content designer to develop inspiring and engaging assets across our marketing channels, including ads, social media posts, emails, website updates and more.

You will play a critical role in helping us nurture and develop our brand's visual identity, partnering closely with the marketing and product teams and working across a variety of different assets and content.

The ideal candidate is skilled in layout design and visual communication and has superb organization and communication skills.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Conceptualize and design emails, digital marketing ads, social media posts, and website content
Curate and organize image selection across all content needs
Create web-ready image assets including slicing graphics, file naming, image compression, and optimization
Create an organized filing and asset management system that can be easily navigated by stakeholders
Collaborate with creative and marketing team members to ensure consistency across platforms and assets

BACKGROUND AND EXPERIENCE

3-5 years of relevant design experience
Proficient in Figma and Photoshop/Creative Cloud
Have an excellent eye for photography and an obsessive attention to detail
Have a deep understanding of visual and social media trends
Have strong prioritization and organizational skills
Are unafraid to ask questions and over-communicate with team members
Enjoy working in a fast-paced environment
Must be authorized to work in the United States

ABOUT OUR TEAM

Calibrate launched Summer 2020 and has raised $27.6mm in Seed and Series A funding from leading healthcare and consumer investors, including Threshold Ventures, Forerunner Ventures, and Redesign Health. Our team helped build businesses at the intersection of technology, consumer, and healthcare, including Capsule, Oscar, One Medical, Galileo, Ro, Rent the Runway, Harry's and more. Our Clinical Advisors include Donna Ryan, the President of the World Obesity Federation, and Darriush Mozafarrian, cardiologist and Dean at the Tufts Friedman School of Nutrition Science and Policy.

Calibrate is committed to bringing together people from different backgrounds and perspectives to deliver real results for our members.

Calibrate recruits, employs, compensates, and promotes regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity, disability, age, veteran status, and other protected status as required by applicable law and as a matter of our company values.

OUR VALUES

We're in this together: We have an audacious mission, and we're building a lot of things for the first time — from the first DTC pharma business within the healthcare ecosystem to the data infrastructure for providing real-world evidence in the largest category of chronic disease. It takes superpowers to build something simple and intuitive within the complex healthcare market, so we identify and work as a team from our individual points of strength. Not everyone has to be good at everything, but we know that when we harness what we're each great at, we're unstoppable.

Small wins create big wins: We ground every experience in optimism, recognizing and celebrating successes along the way. We break projects down into smaller components. And we focus on where we have momentum. We always plan for larger goals with the knowledge that our plans will evolve as we achieve smaller milestones.

You're in control: While we're headquartered in New York, we don't let location stand in the way of the best talent — and from coaches to engineers, many of us are fully remote. Our business is multi-faceted, so each Calibrater is hired to be an expert in their piece of it — in control of their own initiatives, in control of their own impact, and in control of driving their own (real) results.

Real results matter: We're obsessed with outcomes because when our members win, we win, and the data proves that we've built the best metabolic health program on the market. We're purposeful, optimistic, and relentlessly confident that we can solve the biggest medical issue of the 21st century.

For over 75 years, Episcopal Relief & Development has been working together with supporters and

partners for lasting change around the world. Each year the organization facilitates healthier, more

fulfilling lives for more than 3 million people struggling with hunger, poverty, disaster and disease.

Inspired by Jesus’ words in Matthew 25, Episcopal Relief & Development leverages the expertise and

resources of Anglican and other partners to deliver measurable and sustainable change in three

signature program areas: Women, Children and Climate.
Program Officer, International Programs (Remote USA or Ghana)

The Program Officer works closely with international partners to implement international social and

economic development programs that have an impact on women, children, and climate resilience.

You will manage an assigned portfolio of partnerships and work closely with the Director of Gender

Initiatives in identifying new opportunities to achieve Episcopal Relief & Development’s strategic

plan while supporting the organization’s core values.

As Program Officer, you will:

 Manage a portfolio of key program relationships through office and site visits, regional
meetings, phone calls and emails, including guiding the grant management and risk

management of these programs
 Ensure transparency and data integrity while managing and maintaining all partner
proposal development, budgeting and reporting requirements in close collaboration

with partners
 Support partners in establishing rational and participatory monitoring and evaluation
framework for their programs including, but not limited to, establishing baseline

studies, effective benchmarks, outcomes and measurement tools
 Create materials and train staff and partners in best practices with a particular focus on
thematic areas of women, children and climate resilience
 Facilitate administrative and logistical management of training workshops, partner learning
peer-exchange trips and training programs
 Support the Director of Gender Initiatives in strategy planning and writing and assist as a
lead on integration of gender strategies within specific projects
 Liaise across the organization to cross-pollinate ideas, provide technical insights related to
gender mainstreaming and analysis and develop effective integration of gender into

program activities that maximize impact in all core strategic areas of the organization
 Support resource mobilization by assisting proposal writing teams with technical input,
reviewing drafts, ensuring information accuracy and reporting to donors as needed
 Collaborate inter-departmentally on a wide array of communications for internal and
external audiences such as technical papers, media releases, narrative compositions,

articles, stories and videos



You Are:

• A confident communicator with exceptional facilitation, critical analysis and conflict
resolution skills, including in a remote work environment with digital communications

methods
A detail-oriented multi-tasker who is adept at managing competing priorities and meeting
deadlines in a fast-paced environment
An enthusiastic team member who is excited to work across technical sectors and with a
diverse array of community and faith-based actors with tact, diplomacy and sensitivity to

cultural diversity
Visionary, energetic and entrepreneurial
Able and willing to travel up to 30-40% of the time and work a varied schedule including
evenings and weekends in a remote context


You Have:

A shared commitment to Episcopal Relief & Development’s values, principles and
philosophy
A Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience
An Advanced Degree (MA) in International Development, Public Health, Gender Studies
or equivalent degree preferred

A minimum of six (6) years of experience in program management and monitoring,
evaluation and learning in a regional or international context, preferably with partner-
based field implementation work in a developing county in a faith-based context
A minimum of one (1) year of government and foundation grant planning and
management
A demonstrated track record in designing and managing community-based programs in
the Global South, preferably West Africa, Central and Southern Africa, or East Africa
Experience with quantitative and qualitative research methods, and experience
conducting field-based gender analyses and human rights based approaches to

development

How To Apply:

Email resume and cover letter to careers@episcopalrelief.org with the subject line “Program

Officer.” For more information, visit our website at www.episcopalrelief.org.
Generous benefits package offered.

Episcopal Relief & Development provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees
and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age,

disability, sexual orientation or any other legally protected status.


Episcopal Relief & Development offers reasonable accommodations in the hiring and employment

process for individuals with disabilities. If you need assistance in the application or hiring process to

accommodate a disability, you may request an accommodation at any time.


Women, people of color, lesbian, gay, bisexual, intersex, trans and gender non-conforming people
and people living with disability are encouraged to apply. We also encourage applications from

people of diverse religious, spiritual and cultural backgrounds.


Authorization to work in the US is not required.

We are an online musical theater education company based in New York City that provides four key programs: Hello Broadway, Broadway’s online academy; Hello Broadway Live, a 4 week online training program; Prescreen Prep, a college audition coaching program; and Gathered NYC, our summer intensive. The Hiring Coordinator oversees the entire hiring process for the organization — from recruitment to onboarding.MEET YOUR TEAMThis 1099 contractor position reports to our Operations Manager. You will work closely with the CEO and Director of Operations.WHO WE AREThe Broadway Collective is a training academy for young aspiring performers who dream about pursuing a career in the Musical Theatre industry. We prepare our students for success in the performing arts — and everywhere else in life, creating well rounded humans. Our team is composed of like-minded educators and performers who seek opportunities to challenge and develop students and push them towards their dreams.DIVERSITY, INCLUSION + ANTI-RACISMThe Broadway Collective is a multi-mission dollar educational company founded by a gay Black man.It goes without saying, we believe that Black Lives Matter.We are committed to creating an anti-racist, trans-positive, and inclusive environment in our workplace, in our classrooms, and on Broadway stages.We celebrate diversity and provide equity and opportunity to our team, students, and their parents—regardless of their ability, background, race, or orientation.OUR COMPANY CULTUREThe Broadway Collective has grown tremendously in the short five years of its existence. Founded by an artist, the company was built to help sustain and inspire other artists. Our team has a strong bond where everyone works together to make sure our students have the best possible experience. If you’re motivated to make a difference, this is the place for you.WHO WE SERVEThe Broadway Collective trains forward thinking musical theatre students who choose to show up, do the work, and embrace stepping outside their comfort zone. We provide an emotionally supportive learning space, mentorship, structured curriculum, accountability, and direct access to the Broadway industry. This inclusive community of young artists–and the adults who support them–work towards their future by committing to process over product. By insisting on building better humans first, our students step into the world focused, courageous, resilient, and ready to achieve their highest potential.DUTIES, RESPONSIBILITIES, AND Text: Company DescriptionMedSec is exclusively dedicated to the unique challenge of medical device and healthcare cybersecurity. MedSec partners with medical device manufacturers and healthcare delivery organizations to help address cybersecurity in medical devices throughout all stage of the device lifecycle. With medical device manufacturers MedSec leverages its cybersecurity expertise, coupled with its intimate knowledge of the healthcare regulatory and operating environments to offer support in design, architecture, verification, penetration testing, risk assessments, regulatory filings, and execution of security best practices in the development of new medical devices as well legacy systems. With Healthcare Delivery Organizations MedSec leverages its intimate knowledge of medical devices to offer software solutions for cybersecurity and asset management of connected medical devices in hospitals. MedSec is an active participant in helping move the cybersecurity healthcare community forward, and participates in a number of standards and best practice committees involved in furthering cybersecurity for medical products.We are looking for a DevOps Lead with a passion for healthcare and helping protect patient safety through controlling cybersecurity risk. Goal driven and results oriented who is excited and skilled in scaling, automating and security cloud native workloads.Responsibilities includeManaging and improving our cloud automation strategy and implementationOptimize our use of cloud and serverless infrastructuresOwn the observability and monitoring platformsDrive and improve our CI/CD process for product deliveryExperience RequirementsHave managed large scale production systems previouslyHave created and implemented public-cloud automation strategies beforeHave a solid grasp on cloud operating principles (including cloud-first architecture, serverless and containers, Paas/IaaS, etc).We are a distributed team, primarily operating on East Coast hours. Company Description
KIPP
Great education transforms lives. KIPP, the Knowledge Is Power Program, is a non-profit network of 255 college-preparatory, public charter schools educating more than 100,000 early childhood, elementary, middle, and high school students. KIPP schools are tuition-free, public charter schools open to all students. KIPP schools, KIPP regions, and the KIPP Foundation are united by a common mission, a commitment to excellence, and a belief that if we help children develop the academic and character strengths they need for college and career success, they will be able to build a better tomorrow for themselves, for their communities, for us all.
KIPP Foundation trains and develops outstanding educators to lead KIPP schools, provides tools, resources, and training for excellent teaching and learning, promotes innovation, and facilitates the exchange of insights and ideas within the KIPP network and with partners including: other charters, districts, colleges and universities, and non-profit organizations across the country.
Why work at KIPP?
By working for the KIPP Foundation, you help more students across the country receive the high-quality education they deserve. If you believe all children deserve great schools and programs where they can gain the knowledge, skills, character, and habits necessary to achieve their dreams while making the world a better place, please join us!
Job Description
The Event Design and Operation Team (EDO) provides planning and execution support for programs across teams at the KIPP Foundation. Our goal is to ensure that events (live, virtual, hybrid) are supported from start to finish and executed seamlessly and consistently across teams.
The EDO team is a high functioning team with keen attention to detail that provides thought partnership and appropriate logistical support. The EDO team is responsible for planning and executing high quality events by managing logistical details, stakeholder communication, program evaluation support, and critical financial functions.
We are seeking a highly organized Event Design and Operations Coordinator with a passion for anti-racism and equity. This role is a full-time, exempt position that reports to the Director, Event Design and Operations. He/she/they is a member of the EDO Team and will work collaboratively with the Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Team.
The candidate should enjoy planning and executing on programming events and special projects and be eager to work with multiple high-level stakeholders in a fast-paced environment. A successful candidate will have excellent critical thinking and problem-solving skills, strong written and verbal communications skills, and the ability to adapt as the Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Team’s projects expand.
Key Responsibilities and Duties
Team Support:
Create and manage, with support, an integrated project management plan across multiple work streams
Create deadlines for each project, ensuring colleagues complete key action steps by target date
Manage project expenses, with support, at or below budget, maximizing profitability, and identifying opportunities to reduce costs or reallocate resources
Secure and schedule regional site visits
Consolidate and organize resources on the KIPP Share Equity platform
Coordinate a range of special projects to be determined
For events:
Compose and deliver event communication, including the programming agenda, logistical information for instructors, participants, and team, and other event-related documents
Monitor attendee registration and enhance each event’s success by driving adequate attendance
Research, secure, manage and evaluate vendors to provide needed services at live and virtual events within purchasing and operating guidelines and within budget
Develop creative and resourceful ideas to enhance the audience experience
Provide speaker and facilitator support and coordination
Design event evaluations and summarize trends/results with stakeholders
For virtual events:
Manage logistics and delivery of real-time virtual events via Zoom and other digital platforms
Provide tech support for event hosts and attendees via phone, chat, and/or video chat during the event
Train and provide technical guidance to other team members and support teams as needed
For live events:
Execute all event related operations, including set-up, registration, session logistics, off-site social activities/dinners, break-down, and ordering/shipping materials
Oversee external vendors, including hotel, catering, and transportation vendors prior to and during events to ensure that events run smoothly
Monitor operations team supplies and materials including printing, packing, and shipping materials
Key Competencies
Drive Results: Planning and Execution
Detail oriented, execution focused and an ability to see the big picture while managing every detail
Drive Results: Continuous Learning
Proactively takes initiative and continually seeks opportunities to improve systems and processes
Build Relationships: Cultural Awareness and Competency
Creates an inclusive environment that respects the culture and community of the students being served
Build Relationships: Stakeholder Management
Team player; able to impact and influence others to get their work done
Demonstrated successful experiences managing a project and/or managing stakeholders
Qualifications
Experience managing in-person and/or virtual events preferred.
Demonstrated passion in the field of anti-racism, equity, and anti-oppressive practices.
Committed to the belief that outstanding school leaders and teachers can achieve excellent outcomes for all students, and energized by working with leaders in K-12 education.
Previous project management experience preferred.
Maintains a positive, service-oriented mindset and an eagerness to learn.
Demonstrated professional finesse that will allow you to successfully handle the unique and ever evolving needs of our facilitators (many of whom are high profile) and attendees.
A demonstrated ability to roll with the punches and handle the unknown.
Proficiency with Survey Monkey, Qualtrics, Cvent, Zoom and Microsoft Office Suite.
Additional Information
Location
Location is flexible as position is remote. We also have offices in New York City, Chicago, San Francisco, and Washington, DC.
35% travel post-COVID
Compensation and Benefits
KIPP offers competitive salary commensurate with experience. A comprehensive benefits package, generous vacation and PTO, 401k retirement plan with both pre- and post-tax options, as well as gym reimbursement, flexible spending account (FSA), and cell phone reimbursement are also offered by KIPP.
KIPP Foundation is an equal opportunity employer and an organization that values diversity. People from all diverse backgrounds are strongly encouraged to apply.
