About Devpost
Software developers use Devpost to discover and participate in the world’s software competitions (hackathons), and for finding inspiration to build their next project. Paying customers who trust us to reach these developers include Amazon, Google, TechCrunch, Microsoft, Atlassian, Facebook, Twitter, Snapchat, DocuSign, and many others big and small.
Our employees are empowered to take ownership of their initiatives, and to make decisions in line with our metrics and mission. That mission - to inspire developers to build - is firmly rooted in the belief that technology can bring about important change and improve lives.
We're small (<15 employees), growing, profitable, and the leaders in our space. Our office is in NYC but remote is OK and we have several remote employees. We have a great culture with superb individuals who stay here an average of 6 years; the two biggest reasons employees say they stay are "the people" and "the impact."

Responsibilities
The Marketing and Community Director role involves inspiring, growing, and nurturing our community of software developers. You'll create and execute partnership programs with third-party developer communities, publish community-focused virtual hackathons, build community ambassadorships, highlight developers and their projects to the public and media/blogosphere, and whatever else you think will best achieve our goals. You'll work closely with every employee at the company including our very impressive CEO who wrote this hilarious sentence.

You

Have 3+ years community marketing experience, and success working on technical and software developer-focused products and services
Have a strong understanding of community marketing
Take a data-driven approach
Are passionate about software
Are organized and reliable
Excel in a fast-paced environment where you're given freedom, resources, and clear priorities

Hours and compensation

This is a full-time position
Salary is commensurate with experience
Stock options
Great benefits

If this sounds like a great fit for you, please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining why you'd be a great candidate.
This is a remote position.

JobTitle: Entry Level Advertising Account Manager Trainee
Text:
Naked Lime Marketing, a division of Reynolds and Reynolds, is seeking motivated and hard-working Entry Level Advertising Account Manager Trainees to join our growing team. The goal of this position is to prepare you for your own territory as a Sales Professional. Our sales team has been an essential part of Reynolds’ success over the last 150 years. If you are ready to join the exciting and rewarding career path of outside sales, with opportunities for travel, training, unlimited earning potential and growth, this is the ideal opportunity for you!
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree
Ability to build strong customer relationships
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Self-starter with good time management skills
Ability to relocate after training (assistance will be provided by the company)
Training:
As an Advertising Account Manager Trainee, you will enroll in our strategically designed training program that will consist of on-the-job and classroom style training. Throughout our 12 month training program you will shadow seasoned sales representatives as they visit clients and sell our marketing, advertising and digital media solutions. The travel will vary based on your training territory. This field based training will assist in your education of our industry and solutions as well as allow you to observe the sales skills taught in the classroom training. You will also receive world class training on sales techniques, negotiations, dealership operations, and in-depth product training at our Headquarters in Dayton, OH. Throughout the training program, you will complete progress checkpoint assessments to help you identify areas for improvement and to ensure that you are on the right track.
Once you complete the training program, you will be relocated to your assigned territory and become a Sales Specialist. Relocation assistance to this new territory will be provided by the company. In this role you will be responsible for achieving designated monthly and annual quotas by selling Naked Lime Marketing solutions and services to new and existing customers. You will perform lead generation, gather competitive intelligence, complete product demonstrations, operation analysis and proposals to customers. You will also participate in team sales presentations, as well as plan and implement sales strategies and programs within your region. As a Sales Professional (and Trainee) you will have a home office and will be provided a company car, laptop, iPhone, and other office equipment.

Text: Job Details: Part-time Unpaid internshipFull Job DescriptionSocial Media Team Supervisor Mad Growth, LLC is a well established natural hair and beard care company based in New York. Formulated with the utmost respect for it’s customers, Mad Growth's product line was crafted with meticulously selected ingredients along with extensive research on essential oils and their individual benefits for optimal hair and beard growth. In doing so, Mad Growth has managed to cultivate a loyal customer base. As expected from any thriving brand, Mad Growth is constantly looking for ways to expand their reach.This is where you come in!Tired of getting turned away from those supervisor jobs because you lack the experience? If you’re looking for a major multi faceted resume booster with on the job training and experience that will make any fortune 500 company eager to hire you on the spot, you’re in the right place! We are looking for a Social Media Team Supervisor, whose mission will be to learn how to successfully procure a team of dedicated and resilient brand ambassadors that you will gain hands-on experience supervising. Coming on board as the Social Media Team Supervisor will arm you with a plethora of skills needed for roles such as Director of Operations, Social Media Strategists, Human Resource Generalists and countless others. The Social Media Team Supervisor will report directly to the Founder/CEO.Our ideal candidate will be a social butterfly who will learn how to manage a remote team while maintaining the eagerness to learn valuable business management skills. JobTitle: Incident Response & Red Team Internship - Remote Summer 2021
Text:
Company Description

FireEye is the intelligence-led security company. Working as a seamless, scalable extension of customer security operations, FireEye offers a single platform that blends innovative security technologies, nation-state grade threat intelligence, and world-renowned Mandiant® consulting. With this approach, FireEye eliminates the complexity and burden of cyber security for organizations struggling to prepare for, prevent, and respond to cyber attacks. FireEye has over 9,000 customers across 103 countries, including more than 50 percent of the Forbes Global 2000.

Job Description

This role will be remote for summer 2021 but candidates should be open to working in New York City if they are converted to a full time employee after graduation.
Do you love the challenge of figuring out solutions to intricate technology puzzles?
Do you like to help others solve their network and information security issues?
If you answered YES, then consider a career at FireEye Mandiant as a Consulting Intern!
We have the expertise and experience in information security. This is our focus.
You’re not just a number and you won’t get lost in the shuffle.
You will be working on challenging technical projects that make an impact. You’ll be visible.
You’ll be exposed to many different environments and technologies.
You’ll learn from our best incident responders and red teamers.
We investigate breaches that make headlines (and many more that don’t), as well as break into applications and systems to identify security gaps for our clients. We find evil and solve crime, and are seeking candidates who possess the ability to think like an attacker and stay one step ahead of the game.
Find your niche among the cool projects you’ll be involved with, such as:
Incident response
Host and network forensics
Network traffic analysis
Malware analysis and reverse engineering
Penetration testing
Network, web and mobile application security assessments
Source code reviews
And more…
Responsibilities:
Conduct host forensics, network forensics, log analysis, and malware triage in support of incident response investigations
Recognize and codify attacker tools, tactics, and procedures in indicators of compromise (IOCs) that can be applied to current and future investigations
Perform network penetration, web and mobile application testing, source code reviews, threat analysis, wireless network assessments and social engineering assessment
Build internal scripts, tools and methodologies to enhance our capabilities
Develop comprehensive and accurate reports and presentations for both technical and executive audiences
Work with security and IT operations at clients to implement remediation plans

Qualifications

Requirements:
Currently pursuing a degree in computer science, computer engineering or information technology
Technical skills in at least two of the following areas:
Strong knowledge of Windows OS and networking protocols
Basic knowledge of tools used for forensic collection and analysis
Knowledge of application testing and network security concepts
A technical security-related internship or other professional experience
Must be eligible to work in the US without sponsorship
Additional Qualifications:
Strong technical acumen and ability to quickly assimilate new information
Ability to successfully interface with clients (internal and external) and manage expectations of others
Ability to document and explain technical details in a concise, understandable manner
Additional Information

At FireEye we are committed to our #OneTeam approach combining diversity, collaboration, and excellence. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability. Requests for accommodation due to disability can be sent directly to HR-Accommodations@FireEye.com.
Hourly Pay Range: $20-34, commensurate with cost of living, education, experience level, and/or any other legally permissible considerations
Benefits: Employer subsidized benefits include Medical Insurance. FireEye also provides Flexible Paid Sick Time and Paid Holidays.

Text: Are you a born tinkerer? Have you taken apart household appliances, just to see how they work? When you’re not tinkering, are you a decently cool person?Instead of assaulting your Vitamix, join us in helping some of Manhattan’s most influential companies maintain their technology infrastructure. We’re a boutique IT company that builds bulletproof management systems for our clients. This job involves understanding, maintaining, and enhancing these systems, while providing help to users in need.You’ll work under our support manager, but you’ll have direct contact with our founder. We’re presently a 3-person company, so your influence matters tremendously! In addition, your role will include other entrepreneurial tasks, for a birds-eye view of what it’s like to run a small business. This is a tremendous opportunity to learn about the intersect of business and tech, and to service our clients, who we believe make this city great.Bonus for creative minds - our newest venture focuses on media production workflows, so you will have plenty of exposure to creative firms. We are presently going through the Goldman Sachs 10,000 small businesses program to solidify this new opportunity.ResponsibilitiesReport to our support leadSolve IT tickets from our automated systemInterface with clients via phone, email, and SlackUse Remote Desktop to diagnose and solve computing issuesPerform research for clients as neededAssist with on-site repair tasks, such as storage array hard drive swapAssist with IT buildouts - deployments of new hardware, cabling, and softwarePerform client-related inventories and checksA multitude of other entrepreneurial tasks, TBD. Remember, this is a small company. There's always something to do!SkillsAbility to interpret a body of existing knowledge (ITGlue) and apply it to troubleshooting methodologyAbility to learn new systems quicklyCalm under pressureGlowing demeanor! We handle our clients’ worst moments with style and grace. You get to be the hero.Awesome written communication and documentation skills. EEC is key - Effective, Efficient, CompellingAirplane-tested: If we like you, our clients will tooBonusesOur philosophy is to choose great people and build them a skillset. You should have some computing intuition and tinkering passion. The rest, we provide.You have access to our founder and his large global network of entrepreneurs across any area.Our clients really are some of NYC’s most influential businesses. You never know whom you might meet.Job Types: Part-time, InternshipPay: $15.00 per hourBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingEmployee assistance programFlexible schedulePaid time offParental leaveRetirement planSchedule:Day shiftMonday to FridayCOVID-19 considerations:Vast majority of work is remote, and on-site work is in empty or nearly-empty offices.Experience:Windows: 1 year (Preferred)Mac OS: 1 year (Preferred)Work Location:Multiple locationsThis Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneousPeople-oriented -- enjoys interacting with people and working on group projectsAdaptable/flexible -- enjoys doing work that requires frequent shifts in directionDetail-oriented -- would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger pictureCompany's website:www.jstechgroup.comCompany's Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/jstechgroup/Benefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyOnly full-time employees eligibleWork Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

Spine Media, a fast-growing, data-driven, publishing technology company, is looking for an experienced BI Analyst to join our team. Our ideal candidate is comfortable in a dynamic environment and encourages learning new skills while rolling up your sleeves on projects both big and small.

Responsibilities:


Analyze and disseminate performance data and demonstrate data to evolve tactics and continually improve performance across business departments.
Assist in improving the company’s sophisticated performance optimization algorithms and automation workflows.
Create reports for monitoring performance and to support performance optimization
Design, implement and analyze A/B tests to effect positive change
Investigate data to identify and understand anomalies and to develop solutions
Continuously confirm assessments via automated tests
Drive profitability of media campaigns across Taboola, Outbrain, Yahoo/Gemini, while also testing new channels.
Help with QA operations and enhancement of our optimization algorithms
Help develop operational tools, efficiencies, processes, documentation, and more.
Monitor costs and return on investment (ROI)
Define the strategy and standard methodologies for audience extension campaigns


Basic Qualifications:


3+ years of proven experience in analyzing, modeling, reporting, and optimizing data.
A data-driven, results-oriented person who is passionate about understanding and controlling details and trends.
Ability to manage and analyze large sets of data
Knowledge of a scripting language (SQL, Python, R, etc.).


Additional Qualifications:


Self-starter who can balance range of projects, prioritize work assignments, meet deadlines, and work independently in a fast-paced environment
Strong communication skills and the ability to easily collaborate with a variety of colleagues
Strong interest and curiosity in the world of progressive Digital Advertising


Why Spine Media is an Awesome Employer


Early/growth stage company that boasts consistent double-digit month-over-month growth where you can do cool work while having fun
A community of smart, innovative and passionate thinkers who foster an upbeat culture
Fast-paced environment, solve complex problems and push the limits of the Content Audience Marketing
Competitive salary plus bonus, benefits, flexible vacation policy

We are looking to hire a technical recruiter to help us attract top talent. As ActionIQ’s technical recruiter, you will use data and creativity to attract diverse talent in order to help our hiring managers build high performing, inclusive teams. We are looking for someone who has recruited for tech startups in a full-cycle capacity, and who has solid knowledge of the competitive landscape.
The People team at ActionIQ is responsible for deriving and executing strategy for our employees based on our business strategy and culture. We are data-driven, collaborative, and span the entire employee life cycle. If you join us, you’ll be part of a small, mighty, growing team who are working on programs and policies that will help the organization scale to the next level.

One year from now you will have:
Enhanced and streamlined our tech recruiting practices
Helped ActionIQ solidify our presence in the tech community
Built a solid network of candidates from which to recruit

Responsibilities:
Manage full cycle recruiting for our engineering teams
Work with the VP People and tech leadership team to create a scalable recruiting strategy
Using a data driven approach, iterate on recruiting strategies to build an efficient and effective hiring process
Balance internal needs with ensuring we continue to provide an excellent candidate experience
Create and maintain a strong network of diverse candidates through multiple channels of engagement
Requirements
Preferably 5-8 years of technical recruiting experience with a proven track record in sourcing and engaging passive candidates
The ability to develop strategic sourcing and recruiting strategies beyond LinkedIn
Experience in the Tech startup space
Proven experience building strong relationships with stakeholders at multiple levels of the organization
A data-driven approach to recruiting
Experience helping to build a solid employer brand in the tech community
Inclusive sourcing and recruiting practices
Benefits
Work with a fun, inclusive, and smart team of people as we build a NYC-based enterprise software company!
Competitive compensation package, including significant equity component
Backed by top-tier VCs (Sequoia, Andreessen Horowitz, FirstMark Capital)
Top health insurance benefits
Currently remote with expectation to be back in office in 2021.
Work from Home stipend to optimize office set up
ActionIQ is committed to building an inclusive, equitable, and diverse organization. We embrace equal opportunity for all applicants and seek to foster a culture of belonging for our employees. We recognize and appreciate that the more inclusive we are, the better we will function as a team. AIQ welcomes qualified applicants of any race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or family status, disability, military veteran status, and any other status or background. Join us on our journey to build a product that will help our customers deliver memorable experiences that will drive loyalty and growth.

The Care Advisor serves as a point contact (phone, email, SMS) for patients to provide resources and assistance with accessing clinical and supportive care activities offered for the program. The Care Advisor provides patients with education and information to understand product and their disease, to educate patient about side effect management, and support patient adherence to prescribed therapy. The Care Advisor will offer only approved services and program materials.
Additional CARE ADVISOR Duties:
Respond to inbound calls and make scheduled outbound call for patients. Interactions utilize scripts and approved FAQs.
Provide patient support information for patients on prescribed therapy
In conducting calls with patients, the Care Advisors will identify potential barriers to treatment; may utilize approved assessments or other approved techniques to help mobilize patients to access Patient Services.
Care Advisors will use proprietary CRM and telephony to maintain information and track patient progress and to trigger calls, correspondence, or other program directed activities.
Provide education to help patients better communicate with their respective health care providers.
Education to support prescribed therapy consistent with FDA approved indication and dosing: disease state information, side-effect management.
Any additional duties as assigned by program management.
Job Qualifications:
Associates degree required; Bachelor’s degree Preferred
Licensed Clinical Social Worker preferred
Direct patient education/patient support experience required
Experience in remote/virtual call center providing patient education and support preferred
Experience in case management or AIDS Service Organization (ASO) highly preferred
Knowledge of HIV patients and issues required
Experience in motivational interviewing preferred
Demonstrated time management skills; planning and prioritization skills; ability to multi-task
Demonstrated ability to work with enthusiasm
Demonstrated ability to effectively build positive relationships
Demonstrated ability to be adaptable to changing work environments and responsibilities
Fully competent in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Flexibility to work evenings
Dedicated home workspace
Bilingual on English/Spanish preferred

Workman Publishing—an independent publisher of award-winning cookbooks, fun and educational children’s books, and high-end lifestyle books, as well as parenting/pregnancy guides, gardening and country living reference titles, literary fiction, and more—is seeking an energetic, proactive, and creative Special Sales Coordinator. The position is remote for now and then will be based in our NYC office when it fully reopens.

In the Special Sales department, our goal is to seek out niche sales opportunities beyond the world of traditional bookstore and retail sales. Our business includes everything from promotional and non-profit giveaways to corporate gifts, specialty retail and more, so we are seeking a curious, out-of-the-box thinker who can act as a matchmaker and help connect our books with new, untapped markets.

The Coordinator will oversee outreach for key brands across many of our imprints, while also leading the charge in new business brainstorming and outreach for individual front- and backlist titles with the goal of opening new accounts for each new title that we publish.

The ideal candidate should feel comfortable with some post-pandemic travel and they should feel excited to build relationships with customers not only by phone and email, but in person, as well.

What You’ll Bring to the Job:

A love of books, plus a particular interest in exploring new, non-traditional ways of selling them.
Curiosity and an entrepreneurial spirit, as the heart of this role is generating new business (often opening accounts and working with individuals who have never ordered a book before) inspired by the books themselves.
Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills, as this job requires a lot of creative pitch writing, as well as direct sales pitching to customers by phone, virtual meetings, and email, and eventually, attending in-person sales calls and exhibiting at conferences.
Excellent time-management and organizational skills; we publish hundreds of books a year and strive to create innovative, thorough outreach campaigns for as many as we can.

What You’ll Do and Learn:

Brainstorm and execute title-specific outreach for frontlist titles, including researching new markets, building mailing lists, and writing pitch letters and copy for sales materials (sell sheets, brochures, etc.).
Support backlist sales through regular outreach to active accounts, with a special focus on key brands, including What to Expect, Brain Quest, and more.
Act as our department’s primary liaison with the promotions department, creating sell sheets, brochures, PowerPoints, and other sales and marketing assets.
Maintaining customer relationships and upselling active accounts, ensuring that samples of new titles are pitched to relevant accounts.
Collaborate with editorial, sales and marketing teams, as well as key authors to provide book sales support for author events and other partnerships.

Qualifications:

Minimum of one year of experience in book publishing, preferably within a sales department
Bachelor’s degree
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office

Please send your résumé and a cover letter to jobs@workman.com.We apologize in advance, but not all applicants will receive a response.

Company

Truckers move America's economy. They should never struggle to find decent pay and fair treatment. SmartHop is on a mission to arm truckers with the information, technology, and know-how to take control of their business and feel the freedom of being an independent trucker again. SmartHop is a tech-enabled platform giving owner-operators and small trucking companies easy load booking, end-to-end back-office support, and above-market rates. We want truckers to earn more and stress less by giving them the tools and recognition they need to succeed in the changing world of trucking.

The Opportunity

Uplifting truckers is what moves us, and in doing so, we will change the industry. Our service aims to become the market standard, so that respect, recognition, and transparency become the norm for every other business that serves truckers. We are building an organization that works together with the shared passion of empowering truckers, the lifeblood of our economy.

About the Role

SmartHop is looking for a Head of Finance and in this newly created role will develop and lead all finance efforts for the Company, work with our outsourced finance, accounting, and legal partners, and will have the opportunity to structure and build the in-house team needed. This individual will be working closely with our CEO and the executive team and will provide tactical and strategic support in all aspects of our finances. The candidate will be a strategic individual with 7-10 years of managerial accounting and financial management experience in a rapidly growing start-up environment. This role will be ever-changing and will require the candidate to be flexible and open-minded, with close attention to detail and processes.

Responsibilities

Act as the primary financial strategist and strategic partner to the CEO and executive team.
Manage financial planning and analysis.
Define and deliver on all objectives and targets set for the business, with excellence and effectiveness.
Work with in place consultants and team members to direct all aspects of finance and accounting operations.
Demonstrate a proficiency for evaluating ROI, cost variable, and other dimensions of the financial opportunities or risks in proposed new projects.
Oversee all transactions related to general ledger, receivables, payables, payroll, and financial reporting locally and overseas.
Communicate, engage and interact with the Board of Directors, CEO, General Manager, and the rest of the Executive Team.
Coordinate and review monthly, quarterly, and annual reports
Oversee stock administration
Provide strategic guidance around capital financing options to support the startup's growth
Develop future corporate fundraising strategy and manage relationships with partners and investors
Represent the company externally, as necessary, particularly in banking and lease negotiations
Manage internal and external teams by setting expectations, training internal staff accountants, and developing training modules and templates
Manage outside vendors
Build the team as the Company Grows

Requirements

7 – 10 years experience leading a Finance Team; additional experience serving on an Executive or Senior Leadership Team.
MBA or CPA Required
Recent experience scaling a finance team from inception to multi-million in annual revenues
Strong knowledge of corporate finance and accounting experience with financial analysis and forecasting, including experience with three statement financial modeling, preparing statistical reports, and making recommendations based on analysis and research
Strong knowledge of and experience with financial reporting and tax processes
Mastery knowledge of Microsoft Office, G-Suite and accounting software
Comfort in the startup environment and able to create structure and foundational accounting processes
Strong priority management skills
Proven experience leading, managing, and hiring a team
Strong oral and written communication skills

Additional Details

Department: Operations
Job Type: Full-time, Exempt
Location: NYC preferred; options in Miami or Remote.
Work Authorization required: US
Benefits:
Dental Insurance
Health Insurance
Life Insurance
Paid Time Off
Referral Program
Vision Insurance

In aller Kürze

In spite of corona, our business is thriving, digital transformation is on a new rise, so come and join us, we are rapidly growing!

Our Product Managers are essential for us. They guide Spryker in the most innovative direction and know that the best way to create an outstanding product is to research experience and continuously iterate.

Do you have a strong technical background and passion for building innovative products? Do you love guiding the product roadmap, suggesting new innovative features, and making the entire experience as smooth as it gets for developers?

Take a look at our last product release VIDEO to sense the vibe of the way our Product Management team works and join as Technical Product Manager (m/f/d) to help us to revolutionize the world of commerce!

Deine Herausforderungen


Researching and analyzing developer experience (DX) of sophisticated e-commerce applications
Providing a strong DX to the Spryker engineering community and internal product teams
Setting a DX product vision and defining the DX scope
Creating and maintaining a product portfolio and roadmaps on SDK and engineering toolchains
Capturing, structuring, and prioritizing functional and nonfunctional requirements
Preparing and grooming technology roadmap, discovering requirements along with application architects
Communicating product strategies and DX updates to stakeholders and taking care of release notes
Enriching and structuring requirements to be executed by the development team
Leading your features through implementation to realization and supporting the development team with clarifying and redefining requirements
Owning and managing the product/feature delivery
Keeping an eye on the market and competitive dynamics

Dein Profil


You have 3+ years of experience in the relevant field of Product Ownership or Software development
You have both strong technical background, as well as an understanding of the business side
You are experienced with SDKs, developer tools consoles, etc., as well as best practices such as MVP, UDD, etc.,
You can quickly understand complex technical concepts and transpose them into clear and concise documentation
You are analytical, creative, open-minded, and not afraid of expressing your opinion
You have great communication skills in English

Das bieten wir – 5 Gründe Teil der Spryker Herde zu werden


We integrate work into our lives, not the other way around: To be your most productive, creative, and amazing self, make use of our work from anywhere policy, benefit from flexible and unlimited vacation days and flexible working hours from 6 am to 10 pm. To support your health, in our newly designed offices, we offer fresh fruits, healthy cereals, and cool drinks. Benefit from our remote budget and set up your own personalized mobile office.
We challenge and grow: Our mission is to provide each Sprykee with a framework for holistic and regular 360° feedback as well as for personal and professional development, enabling you to master daily challenges and continuously develop your own skills further via self-learning tools and training. To invest in your future, we offer a company pension scheme and free language classes.
We focus on our vision: Join an ambitious global journey, work and collaborate with masterminds and best in class colleagues while enjoying trust, flexibility, and full ownership to excel in an outcome-oriented environment. Go green with us, Spryker is a climate-neutral company and together with our employees, we support climate action projects. Grasp our vision even better during our regular all-hands and executive Q&A sessions.
We celebrate our success: Knowledge sharing sessions, digital Yoga and work-out classes, thanksgiving dinners, “Glühwein” nights, regular “herd events” such as cocktail mixing workshops, BBQ, movie nights and many more allow you to get in touch and exchange with colleagues living the Spryker spirit and never stop learning.
We live and breathe innovation: Constant innovation is not only essential to our product but the key to our DNA in all areas of business. Choose between the newest hardware versions e.g. Mac or Lenovo laptops and work on the latest business models and technologies. We strive for excellence in everything we do, so help us by providing feedback and suggestions via regular internal pulse surveys.

We are looking for an experienced Principal / Lead of Market Management to join our next Ney York Hub and develop strategies to make Blacklane the partner of choice for our preferred supply partners (professional chauffeurs) in the Americas market.

Build, lead and develop a new team of market managers in the US to manage Blacklane's supply side in the Americas region.
Design and implement strategies for supply partnerships of ground transportation services for your designated region to ensure Blacklane's guests are served with the best possible quality at a good cost level.
Drive process improvements by collaborating with internal stakeholders across the organisation to address opportunities and challenges.
Manage, negotiate and improve the resulting supply costs, quality metrics, and supply availability within the region, and translate those metrics and KPIs into actions.
Contribute in shaping the global supply strategy of Blacklane
Support brand awareness and Blacklane's positioning in the US market.

ABOUT YOU

Entrepreneurial mindset and excited about shaping the future of a fast-growing startup
Self-starter and passionate about your work
Hands on: you support your team with getting the work doneGreat leader, people love working with and for you and you love getting the best out of people
Strong analytical skills coupled with excellent written / verbal communication to ensure what you find can be understood and acted on by others.
Excellent interpersonal skills. You are able to network and build trusting relationships quickly with partners and Blacklane staff.
Strong negotiator, able to quickly get to scenarios which are a win-win for Blacklane and our partners.
Fluent in written and spoken English

MORE THAN A JOB:

A journey of learning: We believe that open, candid, constructive, and actionable feedback is the essential component of our continuous development and collaboration. Set your personal development plan and take an active role in our internal learning communities and deep dives.
Peace of mind: Even the most ambitious Blacklaner needs some time to unwind. Find out what works for you and your team with flexible working hours and home office days (working from home is the new standard with the current situation) Enjoy 26 days of holidays, plus 1 extra for each year you are with us.
Become part of an inspired global crew: Get to know your fellow Blacklaners on our Freaky Fridays over a drink (virtual now)
We want all Blacklaners to benefit from the company's success, so every employee gets virtual stock options with our Employee Stock Option Plan (ESOP)

ABOUT US

Blacklane provides outstanding ground travel experience worldwide. Our success comes from a collaboration of more than 350 people from 70 nations and we are looking for more exceptional people to join us! Care is one of the values at the core of our culture and we welcome anyone who shares it.
Blacklane is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. A company is only as strong as its crew, so we are driven to develop a work environment that is inclusive, inspiring and open. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.
Feel inspired? Then join us in solving the challenges of moving travelers around the world and support a thriving community of professional chauffeurs!

Text: Do you want to work with a fun start-up group who wants to make the world a better place and make money doing so? We've got 'em!Do you want to sell to attorneys who have been hearing from us for at least a year? We've got 'em!Do you want to sell to attorneys who are already familiar with our services either directly or via legal publications? We've got 'em!Do you want a short sales cycle? We've got it!Do you want uncapped earning potential? We've got it!Do you want renewals paid at the same commission rate? We've got 'em!Do you want to protect consumers from a plethora of lawyer referral sites who publish inaccurate information? Here is your chance to make your difference!Do you want to protect consumers from being taken advantage of by predatory lawyer referral sites? Here's your chance to make a difference!Do you want the possibility of a 1099 position converting to a W-2 position? The potential is there! We are a start-up, we are flexible and nimble.Do you want to work with a group that will take your suggestions on improving processes and procedures seriously? That's us!Do you want to work with a group of high-energy, dynamic, always innovative, legal professionals who think outside the box and push the envelope with everything they do? We work closely with all US State Bar Associations, the American Bar Association, and the Council of Bars and Law Societies of Europe to bring consumers an accurate network of attorneys. At HSBC, the health and well-being of our employees remains of utmost importance. Many of our roles are permitted to work from home (in states in which HSBC is licensed to operate) until further notice.
The position has responsibility for client facing requirements gathering to capture as-is process and map to-be process vision in the areas of advanced automation and robotics. Exposure in the areas of Enterprise Architecture, customer digital experience, AI and machine learning will be beneficial. It involves identifying automation blockers and identifying automation enablers and articulating them to the client. The role is also responsible for producing process definition document (PDD) - a keystroke level process map to transition process into next stage of delivery and bringing understanding of business process/robotics to support development/testing during delivery.
Responsibilities:
Interface directly with stakeholders and clients on daily basis
Running workshops with stakeholder/client SMEs to understand the end to end process while identifying any automation blockers and the suitability of the process for automation.
Calculate automation % and FTE benefit and build effort estimates and perform initial prioritization
Present summary of findings to the client and walk them through to-be design of the automated process.
Provide outputs for weekly due diligence updates with the client.
Understanding the risks, assumptions, and dependencies associated with the process.
Analyze business processes and identify areas of opportunity to implement RPA
Work closely with development team to ensure requirements are accurately mapped and suitable for development.
Be involved in all process automation activities from the initial prioritization, development and testing through implementation and continuous improvement.
Build, review, and own Process Definition Documentation
Build, review, and own test plans and test cases, facilitate the gathering of test data
Qualifications
Employment eligibility to work with HSBC in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.
4 years of experience in Business Process Analysis.
Experience of working on projects using automation and robotic tools such as Blue Prism/Automation Anywhere/UI Path/Open Span
Experienced with spectrum of offerings across basic automation to machine learning and cognitive RPA capabilities across client projects.
Must have leveraged Customer Experience centric approaches such as journey maps, pain point identification & moments of truth to drive digital transformation initiatives.
Must have experience in RPA / automation assessment work to drive key automation outcomes
Desire to grow professionally in sales, high quality delivery and practice development realms.
White paper authorship or publications are a plus.
Project management experience a plus
Visio or similar workflow documentation tool.
Bachelor degree in Business Administration/Technical degree.
Nice to have awareness of Devops,Agile,Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe).

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Virtual UX Design Intern, Summer 2021
Location New York, New York
Business: Turner
Position Type: Intern
Job ID 181565BR
Company Overview

WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.
The WarnerMedia Story
WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Now, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.

The Job
The WarnerMedia Innovation Lab is creating new ways for fans to discover and consume content across news, sports and entertainment assets. The UX / Interaction Designer will work with the Lab team and its partners to imagine, design, and build diverse and innovative products and experiences with an empathy for consumers, and leveraging data, world-class content, and evolving immersive and interactive mediums.


The Daily
Meet with product and creative stakeholders
Sketch / wireframe concepts, workflows, core UX
Design concepts variably for iOS / Android / Web / Smart TVs or other
Build interactive prototypes
Create appealing visual and interactive presentations
The Essentials
Graphic and visual design / illustration
Product design (mobile / web applications)
Complex user workflows and information architecture
Rapid Prototyping tools; usability research/analysis a plus
Motion design / animation a plus
AR / camera-based technologies a plus
Strong creative sensibilities
Presentation and communication skills
Optimistic and collaborative
Field of Study: Visual Communication, Interaction Design, HCI or related fields
Some Engineering Computer Science, Data Science a plus
Internship Program
Students must be currently enrolled in a college degree program for full duration of the internship
Summer 2021 program dates are June 7th - August 13th; must be available for full program duration
Full-time schedule (40 hours/week) designed to work around class schedule
Fully remote/virtual experience; company owned laptop provided for the duration of the internship program
Salary based on office location; relocation is not provided
The Perks
Hands-on work with passionate, talented team members in your field
Networking opportunities with industry-leading professionals
Engaging events including executive speakers sessions, professional development workshops, and more
Opportunity to join the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands

At Verizon Media, we connect people to their passions. With brands like Yahoo, TechCrunch and more, we help people stay informed and entertained, communicate and transact while creating new ways for advertisers and partners to connect. From XR experiences to advertising and content technology, Verizon Media is an incubator of innovation and is revolutionizing the next generation of content creation in a 5G world.
Reporting Intern
Yahoo News is looking for an active college student to join our team of reporters for a summer internship that will also involve contributing to Yahoo Entertainment & Lifestyle. This person will be part of the daily news operation as we seek to both cover urgent developments and provide users with informative, powerful features. This internship position will be fully remote. Since location is not relevant, you can be based from anywhere domestically in the U.S. during your internship.
Responsibilities:
Attend all team meetings, contributing short-term and long-term editorial ideas. And then be able to multi-task on both depending on our daily priorities.
Report out and file stories with clean copy when assigned by editors.
Aggressively monitor news developments, both within the Yahoo ecosystem and from our competitors. What should we be covering that we’re not?
Occasionally partner with, or otherwise assist, other Yahoo journalists with their own editorial projects.

Minimum Qualifications:
Familiarity with national politics.
Track record of working on deadline.
Ability to be a team player.

Preferred Qualifications:
Knowledgeable about social-media news platforms.
Familiarity with content-management systems.

Who We Are

Click Therapeutics, Inc. develops and commercializes software as prescription medical treatments for people with unmet medical needs. Through cognitive and neurobehavioral mechanisms, Click's Digital Therapeutics™ enable change within individuals, and are designed to be used independently or in conjunction with biomedical treatments. The Clickometrics® adaptive data science platform continuously personalizes user experience to optimize engagement and outcomes. Following a groundbreaking clinical trial, Click's industry-leading smoking cessation program is available nationwide through a wide variety of payers, providers, and employers. Click's lead prescription program is entering into a fully remote execution of a multi-center, randomized, controlled, parallel-group, phase III FDA registration trial for the treatment of Major Depressive Disorder in adults. Click also has major pipeline expansion and progression in multiple therapeutic areas.


About the Role

The Clinical Trial Assistant (CTA) reports directly to the Associate Director of Clinical Operations and is responsible for administrative support in the advancement of Digital Therapeutic (DTx) clinical trials. The position will play a key role in all clinical team activities pertaining to the life cycle of a clinical trial, this includes study start-up, maintenance, and closure.

This is a highly visible, creative, and agile role within a rapidly growing pre-IPO company in a nascent and fast-growing space. The role is located in our trendy Tribeca HQ, includes great benefits, and is an excellent wealth-building/equity opportunity for the right individual.


Responsibilities

Support the Clinical Operations team in end-to-end execution of clinical trials, including study start-up, maintenance, and closure
Assist the Clinical Trial Manager (CTM) and Clinical Research Associates (CRA) with accurately updating and maintaining clinical systems (i.e., Clinical Trial Management System)
Responsible for maintaining the Trial Master Files (TMF) for all clinical trials and ensuring the TMF is inspection ready
Assist in the creation of monitoring tools (i.e., Monitoring Visit Report templates, Clinical Monitoring Plan)
Lead identification of clinical trial sites and feasibility for clinical trials
Participate in project team meetings and conference calls to review progress of ongoing clinical trials
Develop meeting agendas, minutes, and track action items to resolution
Create and improve internal processes to ensure the successful execution of clinical trials
Work closely with a great, close-knit team


Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree required in life sciences, health care or related discipline; at least 1 year of experience with clinical trials in a biotech/pharmaceutical company or CRO setting
Working knowledge of applicable clinical research requirements, i.e., Good Clinical Practice (GCP) and International Conference of Harmonization (ICH) guidelines
Strong written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills, with exceptional attention to detail
Ability to deliver results, execute on required activities independently, and prefers working in a cross-functional team
Highly responsive, proactive, enjoys problem-solving, and willing to tackle new challenges
Ability to think outside of the box and challenge the status quo
Advanced computer skills including working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Google Sheets, Google Docs, and Google Slides


Benefits

Stock options | Competitive salary with annual review | 401(k) matching | Annual performance-based cash bonus | Comprehensive medical benefits through Aetna | Flexible Spending Accounts | Life insurance and disability benefits | Open vacation policy / unlimited PTO | Generous paid parental leave | Commuter subsidies | Monthly catered lunches | Choice of Mac, Windows, or Linux equipment | Sponsored company events | Free, unlimited office snacks and beverages | Much more…


Equal Employment Opportunity

Click Therapeutics is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Click Therapeutics also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act. All applicants must have authorization to work for Click Therapeutics in the U.S. In certain circumstances it may be advantageous to Click Therapeutics to support the application(s) for temporary visa classification and/or sponsor applications for permanent residence so that a foreign national colleague can accept or remain in a work assignment in the U. S. For certain classes of temporary visas, the resulting work authorization may be specific to Click Therapeutics and the specific job and/or work site. Click Therapeutics may at its business discretion decide to or refrain from obtaining, maintaining and/or extending the temporary visa status and/or sponsoring a colleague for permanent residency and /or employment eligibility, considering factors such as availability of qualified U.S. workers and the colleague's long-term prospects for securing lawful permanent residence, among other reasons. Employment applicants requiring immigration sponsorship must disclose, when initial application for employment is made, whether or not they are legally authorized to work for Click Therapeutics in the U.S. and, if so, whether that authorization permits them to work in the job they seek. In no case should Click Therapeutics support of a colleague's temporary visa application or sponsorship of a colleague for permanent residence be construed to guarantee success of that application or amend or otherwise invalidate the "at-will" employment relationship between the colleague and Click Therapeutics.

Text: Part-time Focus Group Recruiter: A progressive market research firm based in NYC seeks an experienced recruiter to manage projects from start to finish. This position will be fully-remote. Home office required.The job is to find qualified candidates for research opportunities that offer participation incentives. The successful recruiter owns the end-to-end process of talent acquisition and will focus on the following:Manage focus and group implementation from start to finish.Manage overall spreadsheet documents associated with the groups.Specialize in recruiting for all groups with specific focus based on client requests  * Attracting and sourcing candidates, pre-screening, and presenting qualified candidates to the project manager.Internally and externally soliciting recruitment referrals.Serving as the main point of contact throughout the research process.  * Participate in research onboarding to ensure the recruit is prepared to participate in the focus groupSkills: Proficiency in writing, reading, speaking (heavy phone contact)Great coordination skills, follow up, must be detailed.Be able to see all that happens within a tight time frame, “big picture”!Administrative Functions : Proficient with Microsoft Suite (Excel, Word and Outlook) GSuite knowledge preferred Database entry (familiar with grids and spreadsheets)Educational Requirements : HS Diploma; some college preferred.Minimal training will be provided to the right candidate.***Salary ranges from $10 to $20 an hour based on location*** This is a part-time, non-exempt position.Job Type: Part-timePay: $10.00 - $20.00 per hourSchedule:Monday to FridayEducation:High school or equivalent (Required)Experience:Customer service: 1 year (Required)Work Location:One locationWork Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processSocial distancing guidelines in placeSanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

Text: Wolf Dental Solutions has a lucrative opportunity in New York for dentists, hygienists, and dental assistants with extensive clinical 3D cone beam CBCT experience looking to work in sales and be their own boss for a leading brand of CBCT machines. Candidates with proven CBCT sales experience are also encouraged to apply.To succeed this will involve phone and email prospecting and onsite canvassing of dental offices, as well as relationship-building with referral partners like dental implant reps and existing customers. You will be scheduling and running onsite and Zoom demos for dentists, practice managers, and their staff. While Zoom demos and meetings are an important aspect, the most successful reps go onsite as much as possible and throughout the sales process (local COVID restrictions notwithstanding). Our team of experienced sales development partners will be scheduling qualified demos to give you even more sales opportunities. We will alleviate some of the load of administrative tasks by assisting you with putting together order forms, arranging financing with our lending partners, trading in or disposing of customers' old equipment and coordinating installation.This is a 1099 commission-only opportunity to start with the possibility of a salaried position being offered in the future dependent on performance. You will have the freedom and autonomy of self-employment and the ability to offer a wide range of products. Commission payouts can be well over $10,000 per CBCT machine. Someone who puts in the daily work to schedule and run quality demos and can have intelligent and educated conversations with dentists and their staff can realistically make well over $250,000 a year. Initial and ongoing training will be provided at no cost.Scope of the job: Scheduling and running onsite and Zoom demos.Meeting with prospective clients onsite throughout the sales process.Answering client questions about our products with knowledge and authority.Working with us to discuss credit terms and secure financing for clients.Coordinating successful installs with our company and clients.Requirements for success: A minimum of 4 years of proven clinical experience directly using CBCT machines is required, in addition to the ability to read and interpret CT scans and other x-ray images. Candidates without this experience will NOT be considered.A commitment to representing our company and products with professionalism at all times.Possession of all necessary tools including a laptop/tablet, cell phone and a vehicle for onsite visits.A valid driver's license and insurance and the ability to pass a criminal background check.Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, ContractPay: Up to $500,000.00 per yearSupplemental Pay:Commission payEducation:High school or equivalent (Required)Experience:clinical CBCT 3D cone beam: 4 years (Required)direct CBCT 3D cone beam sales: 4 years (Preferred)License/Certification:Driver's License (Required)Contract Renewal:PossibleFull Time Opportunity:YesWork Location:On the roadPaid Training:NoCompany's website:www.wolfdentalsolutions.comWork Remotely:Yes

Discover. Savor. Connect. Welcome to the chef's table!

Consumers and companies alike use Cozymeal to discover new ways to connect through classes, food tours, mixology and more unforgettable culinary experiences. Whether it be for date nights, birthdays, holiday celebrations or team building events, you’re guaranteed a world-class experience. Plus, you can purchase our highly curated quality cookware as a gift or for use at home.

About the Role:

Understanding Cozymeal's services and providing solutions to customer and chef inquiries relating to our products in a timely manner

IMPORTANT NOTE FOR APPLICANTS: To apply, please visit: (https://100hires.com/j/tSBeE8F)

Minimum of 2 years of experience in leading a customer support team.

Professional with excellent verbal and written communication skills

Proficient in Google Suite and Excel
Experience working with a CRM

Location: New York City, NY or Anywhere in the US. This is a remote role and qualified candidates from anywhere in the US can apply for this role.

If this sounds like you, then Cozymeal just might be the right place for you! Welcome home!

Internship Description:

Discovery's Digital group is a well-funded start-up within Discovery, Inc., the company behind beloved brands such as Food Network, HGTV, TLC, and Discovery.
We are fast, nimble, and have fun developing new, innovative, and immersive digital products and content for iconic brands. We are working at the crossroads of technology, entertainment, and every day utility. As content creators across the digital ecosystem, we continuously leverage our technology to create immersive viewing and interactive experiences. We tell engaging stories to millions of viewers across the Internet every day and bring new interactive experiences to life to not only entertain but improve the lives of our customers.
Most recently, in January 2021, our group launched discovery+, a global streaming service across Web, Connected TV and Mobile devices - serving as the definitive destination for real life entertainment.
The UXR Intern will assist our Digital UX team in multiple aspects of the product discovery cycle: empathize with customers, understand their needs, gather customer insights and help disseminate them in ways that are clear and actionable.
Typical day-to-day tasks:
Participate in team activities to help define and understand user needs, including remote workshops
Help plan user research activities with multidisciplinary teams
Participate in competitive audits and analysis
Help define standards and best practices for integrating Research data into the UX practice
Maintain insights repository up to date
Although our summer internship program will be completely remote (students can apply from anywhere), please be aware that this intern will report into a New York City based manager and therefore should expect to work on eastern standard time.
Requirements:
Must be currently enrolled as a student (proof of enrollment will be required if selected for an internship)Must be a rising Junior, Senior, or Graduate studentMust have at least a 3.0 GPAMust have the legal right to work in the United States.Strong understanding of qualitative research methods, as demonstrated through a portfolio of school or work case studies
Enthusiasm for multi-device streaming streaming video experiences, as well as relevant industry trends: 10 FT (TVs), Mobile, Web.
Familiarity with remote collaboration & whiteboarding tools, such as Google Suite, Miro, Mural etc.Exposure to digital product design and prototyping tools
More About the Intern Program:

Discovery’s internationally recognized intern program attracts the country’s boldest and brightest students for a paid, for-credit, real-world work experience in the entertainment and media industry.
Like other Fortune 500 companies, we believe in immersing our students in all aspects of our business, giving them first hand experience working for the global leader in real life entertainment. So what sets us apart? We’re passionate about investing in our interns- both personally and professionally. Whether our program is in-person or remote, every semester is packed with speaker sessions with executives, LinkedIn profile reviews, recruiter panels, roundtable events and professional seminars- and that just scratches the surface.
Think our program sounds pretty awesome? Our former interns thought so too! This year, we were voted into Vault’s 2021 internship rankings for best overall internships, best media and telecom internships, best sales and marketing internships and best internships for diversity.
Ready to learn more? Here’s what we offer:
Mentorship from some of the industry’s kindest and most passionate entertainment veterans
Professional development seminars, panels with recruiters and former interns, intern-exclusive events, and so much more
Access to top level executives and employees through our Speaker Series and Roundtables
Incredible networking opportunities and a robust intern alumni network
A creative, collaborative and inclusive company culture
What you can expect to take away from the semester:
Opportunity to develop professionally and uncover skills you didn’t know you had
The insider scoop on the TV industry and what happens behind the scenes
Relationships that will go beyond your collegiate career
Real life experiences that will provide you with the confidence to delve into your next adventure
And finally, what to know before applying:
We offer 12 week spring and summer opportunities
Our Summer 2021 program will be fully remote- the program will run from June 2-August 20.
The application deadline for Summer 2021 is March 19th. After this date, we cannot guarantee your application will be reviewed for the position.
Our internships are paid opportunities. Credit is not required; however, we will provide necessary documentation for school credit if desired.
We do not require a cover letter- please do not submit one. Instead, demonstrate your passion for the position through your resume and interviews.
Interviewing will take place from February through mid-April. A Discovery Intern team member will contact you if your experiences and interests match an open internship position. Due to the high volume of applications, we are unable to give individual status updates.

INSTRUCTOR Role Description
Company Overview

At Bundle, we are disrupting the traditional care industry and transforming the employer funded care model. We are determined to provide personalized virtual care experiences that benefit employees and families every day.

Working parents and families are struggling at home during these unprecedented times, juggling parenting, homeschooling, work. Bundle hopes to provide these families a sense of joy and positivity by giving parents and caregivers a much-needed break!

Role Overview

Bundle is currently looking for personable, organized, and thoughtful instructors to join our diverse and inclusive instructor community. Our instructors will help make a difference by facilitating one-on-one fun and engaging virtual learning experiences to children 3 – 11 years old and elderly 65+. Our lesson topics range from science and technology to arts and culture. We compensate instructors for their time or they can receive school credit if applicable.

Role Requirements
Conduct Bundle Breaks over a video conferencing call to participants of all ages.
Based on your experience and comfort level, Bundle will match you with participants you feel most conformable working with!
Review and maintain a comprehensive understanding of all the content for each Bundle Break lesson plan.
Bundle does ALL the lesson planning and prep for you. All you do is review the plan before the start of your Bundle Break and Bundle will match you with a participant based on the lessons and topics you feel most confident facilitating!
Build excellent rapport with the participant and drive the conversation.
Engage with participants by maintaining enthusiasm, eye contact, and interest throughout the Bundle Break.
Check-in with the participant throughout the lesson to reinforce learnings.
Effectively manage the time and pace of the session to complete it in a timely manner.
Troubleshoot technical issues with participant and/or families as needed.

Required Skills
2-5+ years of previous care experience working with children and/or the elderly, especially in an instructor capacity (ex. babysitting, teaching, tutoring, camps, nursing homes). 2 years of experience required; 3-5 years preferred.
Ability to manage conflict using active listening and empathy.
Excellent verbal communication skills.
Ability to handle multiple tasks with interruptions and able to problem-solve efficiently and effectively.
Technical competency. Experience with video conference calling, screen shares, launching videos, hyperlinks and PowerPoint Presentations.
College degree or currently completing preferred.
Ability to demonstrate patience and compassion.
Must provide at least 2 professional or educational references.
Must be able to pass a social media and background check.
Must have a functioning computer that can run the most updated web browsers and has video capabilities.
Must be fluent in English.
Must be 18 years of age or older.

Commitment Details
Generally available at least 6-10 hours per week.
Provides feedback to the Bundle Team after each Bundle Break.
Maintains excellent communication with the Bundle Team staff.
Provides Bundle with updated schedule every 1-2 weeks.

JobTitle: Associate Account Executive / Account Executive - TECH (NYC)
Text:
Associate Account Executive / Account Executive - TECH (NYC)
Finn Partners, a dynamic integrated marketing global agency, seeks an Assistant Account Executive or Account Executive for its expanding public relations New York technology practice.
Our team is one of the best in the industry. We seek people who are passionate about communications, ready to roll up their sleeves, and contribute to the success of the team. This is an opportunity to work with clients who are leader in their technology sectors, including those focused on remote work, artificial intelligence, virtual and augmented reality, sustainability, cybersecurity, cloud computing, and consumer devices/technologies.
You will join one of the leading agency technology teams working with national and international B2B and B2C technology clients. Candidates must have related prior agency based professional work experience to effectively manage and grow client campaigns. This position will also pursue, develop, and lead new business presentations, manage and cultivate staff members, and help set the tone for how the business is managed.
Responsibilities:
Monitoring client and competitive media coverage
Developing and maintaining media lists
Drafting pitches and conducting media outreach
Conducting secondary research and writing measurement report drafts
Writing news releases and other media content
Staffing media briefings and/or events
Participating in team brainstorms
Supporting new business initiatives
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in communications, PR or journalism
1 year of prior work experience in PR (including related cumulative internship timeframes
Prior PR agency technology practice internship experience highly desirable
Familiarity with public relations/communications programs as evidenced through coursework, internships, or related work experience
An interest and desire to work with technology clients
Self-starter with excellent organizational skills and ability to meet deadlines
Ability to think creatively
Ability to adapt to new situations/challenges
Strong verbal and writing skills
Experience with measurement tools (i.e., TrendKite) highly preferred, but not required
To Apply:
Please upload your resume, cover letter (and indicate the website where you store your samples of work), and state your target annual salary in $USD. While we greatly appreciate that most applicants are “open” or “negotiable” regarding salary, we are seeing your answer to this question in US Dollars please.
About Finn Partners:
Finn Partners was launched in late 2011 to realize Peter Finn's vision to create a leading communications agency dedicated to shaping a bold new future in which innovation and partnership are strong drivers of the brand. Finn Partners specializes in the full spectrum of communications services, including digital and social media. Specialty areas include technology, consumer, education, travel & lifestyle, CSR, arts, health, and public and corporate affairs.
Finn Partners was named “Best Midsize Agency” in 2020 and in 2015, "Best Agency to Work For" in 2013 and "Best New Agency" in 2012 by the industry's Holmes Report. Headquartered in New York City, the company has over 850 employees, with offices in Chicago, Detroit, Fort Lauderdale, Boston, Jerusalem, London, Los Angeles, Munich, Nashville, Paris, San Francisco and Washington D.C., and has additional international capabilities through its own global network and PROI Worldwide. Find us at www.finnpartners.com and follow us on Twitter @finnpartners. While we appreciate the interest of all applicants, we will respond to the applications most closely aligned with the requirements of this position.

Who We Are
MOSTLY AI is a Vienna, Austria based high-tech startup that has developed game-changing AI technology for synthetic data. Our solutions enable organizations across the world and across industries to safely share big data assets, internally as well as externally, while keeping the privacy of their customers fully protected. This breakthrough in data protection is made possible by leveraging generative deep neural networks that extract patterns, structures and variations from existing data to generate highly realistic & highly accurate synthetic customers.
Who You Are
You are a passionate new business sales professional with experience in selling Enterprise products to mid and large organizations. You are interested in latest data management technology around AI and Machine Learning. You know how to manage an Enterprise sales cycle from initial qualification to closing. You are a great communicator with strong ability to navigate within a client organization and to develop key points of contact in multiple departments and multiple levels of leadership. You understand how Enterprises work with data today, what systems they use and what challenges they have. You are a Self-starter with the ability to make impactful presentations and to articulate complex problems in a simple and effective way. You are experienced in advanced sales qualification methodology e,g, MEDDIC, Challenger Sales etc.
If that sounds like you then you should read further!
Responsibilities
Lead commercial growth in North America by establishing long-term multi-year business with new and existing prospects
Maintain and extend a prioritized list of target prospects and grow relationships to fuel pipeline
High volume of outreach and client engagement via different channels such as calls, emails, LinkedIn, Zoominfo and other sales tools
Manage complete sales funnel from A-Z including initial qualification, discovery activities, PoCs, to push prospective clients down the funnel to close
Close business to meet and exceed quarterly and annual booking objectives
Collect customer insights and provide feedback to leadership to help direct sales strategy and product development
Work closely with Marketing and VP Sales to continuously update content, messaging and collateral to support new initiatives and campaigns
Requirements
5+ years of experience in an Enterprise sales role (Financial Services or Telco are a plus)
Good understanding how privacy sensitive data is used in today’s Enterprise business
Proven track record of closing multi-year deals in an Enterprise environment exceeding targets
Demonstrated success of building relationships at various management levels
Highly energetic personality with a “can do / get things done” attitude
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple deals and grow pipeline simultaneously
Results-driven with excellent interpersonal, communication and collaborative skills
Willingness to travel extensively in North America (once possible)
Must be able to navigate and blend into a high paced start-up environment
Ambition and desire to learn and grow within the role and the AI ecosystem
Location: East Coast (Remote)
Our Perks
You'll be joining an international team of dynamic, highly skilled and smart people
Competitive compensation
100% covered healthcare
Between holidays and PTO, you’ll have one month off per year – and we want you to use it!
Once travel is possible we'll make sure you can join our major team events in Austria
Some recent team events include: a cross country ski trip, team building workshops where we built an actual table, Friday lunches, etc.
We don’t measure how much time you spend in the office; we’re all about production and trust the people on our team
Individual budget for training and learning
$90.000 annual gross salary incl. overtime, additional payment according to skills and experience, plus competitive commission plan
If you love data as much as we do, then come and join us to advance, deploy and promote our category-defining novel solutions around privacy-preserving generative AI.

JobTitle: Food Network Digital Convergence Internship- Summer 2021 (Virtual)
Text:
Internship Description:

The Food Network Convergence and Social teams work at the unique, exciting intersection of digital and on-air programming. We focus on promoting awareness of and driving tune-in to all linear programming premieres through original digital-first content that serves both super-fans and untapped audiences across Food Network’s digital and social platforms, which includes 29 million Facebook followers and 9 million Instagram followers. Our teams work closely with Food Network’s video, PR and programming teams on a daily basis to make engaging, buzzy and on-brand flat and video content on tight timelines and strict deadlines. We work hard to promote Food Network’s culinary brand, talent and programming in new ways that inspire and engage.

As a Food Network Convergent & Social Intern, your adventure could lead you to work on projects and tasks such as:

Create photo galleries, blog posts, show pages, articles and memes to support shows, schedule and draft social media content for Food Network brand pagesSource user-generated videos for Instagram video regrams, with a keen eye on quality and shareabilityMaintain the organization of incoming and outgoing video footage for the team, and monitor social media conversations on managed platformsCreate bylines on FoodNetwork.com and publish original videos across Food Network's digital platforms
