As our Talent Acquisition Manager you will focus on growing the 360Learning team by sourcing, attracting and recruiting top talent with an initial focus on client-facing roles.

You will join a team of four senior talent acquisition professionals and report to the Director of Talent Acquisition. Your home base will be our New York entity but the role can be held remote from anywhere on the East Coast.
Within 1 month, you will:
Graduate in Convexity through our onboarding process
Understand our product offering through training
Meet the global team through virtual coffee meets and happy hour
Learn our hiring processes, tools and analytics framework
Take on your hiring list
Within 3 months, you will:
Source highly relevant profiles for our client-facing teams
Pitch 360Learning like you own it
Lead end-to-end hiring processes
Close your first candidates
Within 6 months, you will:
Expand the breadth of profiles you own
Design well-crafted interviewing processes
Close the expected number of candidates each month
Take on your first talent acquisition project (fields: employer brand, analytics…)
Within 12 months, you will:
Coach 360Learners on interviewing best practices
Deliver impactful improvements to the way we hire
The Skills Set
1-2 years in-house recruiting experience in high growth tech companies
Proven experience in detecting outstanding talent
Good eye for talent with ability to quickly screen resumes to identify fit
Sharp interview skills with ability to screen for both technical and cultural qualities
Ability to work in a metrics-driven fast-paced environment
Eager to work in a remote first company
Enthusiasm for our culture explained here
What We Offer
Compensation. Competitive salary + equity
Benefits/Perks. Comprehensive medical, vision and dental insurance. 401k matching after 6 months. Generous parental leave policy. Level up your skills with our very own platform. Apero with team members from around the world.
Balance. We offer 20 days of annual PTO + 5 days for sick leave + holidays! We are remote-friendly and promote flexible work hours.
Culture. Be a part of a global team. We are powered through our culture called Convexity (ask us about it)! Make an impact in a high autonomous, low authority and highly nimble environment.
Who We Are
360Learning empowers Learning and Development teams to drive culture and growth through Collaborative Learning. Our learning platform combines collaborative tools with the power of an LMS, enabling high-growth companies to unlock learning based on collective expertise instead of top-down knowledge. 360Learning is the easiest way to onboard new employees, train customer-facing teams, and develop professional skills–all from one place.
360Learning powers the future of work at 1,200 organizations, including Toyota, Criteo, and Airbus. Founded in 2012, 360Learning has raised $41 million with 180 team members across New York, Paris, and London. You can learn more in this blog post from our CEO.
Learning Includes Everyone.
In concert with our culture, 360Learning believes learning includes everyone and that means embracing the strengths of diversity, connectedness, and inclusion. Through conscientious efforts, our global footprint celebrates cultures, perspectives, and experiences from all over the world to support our platform that is built for all regardless of race, ethnicity, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, veteran status or any other aspect which makes an individual unique or protected by laws and regulations in the locations where we operate. Thus, 360Learning is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace, and we commit to continue this throughout our processes for recruitment, compensation, benefits, performance, promotion, and all other conditions and terms of employment. We want to learn from and with you!

Altice USA is a cutting-edge communications, media, and tech company. We connect people to what matters most to them; texting with friends, advertising that resonates, or binge watching their favorite show. Our differentiated approach centers around technologies that push the envelope and deliver the ultimate customer experience. We're building a workforce that attracts and retains the best talent, not only to meet the needs of our customers, but that also reflects the diverse communities we serve. We're not the only ones who have seen it; we've recently been recognized by Forbes as one of America's Best Employers as well as by the Human Rights Campaign, DiversityInc Magazine, and Cablefax for our diversity & inclusion program.
In June 2019, Cheddar was acquired by Altice USA, which grew Cheddar's news family to include News12 and i24 as well as introduce a new portfolio of ad products. While our culture remains start-up in feel, the opportunity for success is now even greater.
Responsibilities
The Product Team seeks a smart and energetic Junior Product Manager to support a diverse portfolio of responsive web and mobile app experiences for Cheddar, News 12, and Rate My Professors.
In this role, you will:
Work with product managers, designers, and engineering team to define and prioritize the roadmap
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and validate opportunities to improve our products
Write User Acceptance Criteria and check projects against them before launch, also work with engineers to troubleshoot bugs
Support current process frameworks and workflows, but also proactively introduce efficiencies and improvements
Organize and write documentation on process and projects to be communicated in demos, presentations, etc
Liaise with other departments (Growth, Content, Marketing, Analytics, Legal) to ensure the appropriate implementation and communication
Qualifications
A Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience e.g. 1 year in project management, product management, or UI/UX research and design
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
A drive to learn new skills and understand a wide variety of topics, products, and businesses
Self-motivation to operate independently and proactively with minimal supervision
A varied and flexible skillset with the ability to adapt to a range of activities and project types
Nice to Haves:
Experience in start-up tech environments preferred
Experience in media or news industry preferred
Experience working remotely or with remote teams
Experience in HTML and programming a plus
Understanding or experience in user experience design or research, visual design, design thinking
Altice USA is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to recruiting, hiring and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds regardless of gender, race, color, creed, national origin, religion, age, marital status, pregnancy, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law.
Altice USA, Inc. collects personal information about its applicants for employment that may include personal identifiers, professional or employment related information, photos, education information and/or protected classifications under federal and state law. This information is collected for employment purposes, including identification, work authorization, FCRA-compliant background screening, human resource administration and compliance with federal, state and local law.

We’re looking for a creative, passionate, and strategic Category Manager to join Spotify’s Marketing team in New York working on SoundBetter Tracks.
Location
New York, NY
Job type
Full Time Contractor
SoundBetter is the leading music-talent marketplace, helping musicians connect and work with top music pros, while helping creators earn a living, now part of Spotify for Artists. Artists can discover service providers in several specialized categories on SoundBetter.
SoundBetter Tracks is a new and growing product, enabling artists to license pre-made tracks (a digital good), rather than services. Singers can discover curated tracks & beats that inspire them from top producers, license them exclusively, write and record a topline and release their song. At the same time Tracks empowers producers to license their pre-made tracks with friendly licensing terms and earn money.
You’ll focus on the success of the new Tracks product for SoundBetter. This will include sourcing and curating tracks & beats from producers, identifying producers to source from, understanding their needs and crafting supply-side messaging, and managing the relationship with our top producers. It will also include working closely with the Marketing team on demand-side acquisition, reaching and attracting artists who are seeking Tracks for their music.
You will help develop the strategy for SoundBetter’s Tracks product, driving liquidity and contributing to innovation and execution within the organization. You will ultimately be responsible for the quality and quantity of supply in the category, and be jointly responsible for demand and revenue generated by the category.
The role will sit within the Creator Marketing team and report into the Co-Founder and current Head of Marketing for SoundBetter.
This is a contract position. Can be remote within the US*
What You'll Do:
Own supply-side sourcing, curation and onboarding for sellers and goods in SoundBetter’s Tracks category
Help craft the category strategy, as well as messaging and positioning within the marketplace
Help craft and execute demand-side customer acquisition strategies
Help drive awareness and adoption, and own category balance and marketplace health
Understand which supply and demand gaps exist and develop tactics and processes to close them
Contribute to the category’s growth tactics, setting the right milestones and working on their execution
Monitor performance, synthesize user feedback and help inform Product & Marketing tactics. Work closely with SoundBetter Product and Product Marketing teams to improve and optimize product features, messaging and positioning for this category
Who You Are:
Deep domain expertise in the music production space, specifically with track/beat production, and ideally with distribution and sourcing
Experience working in a technology company, ideally an e-commerce or digital goods marketplace
An existing understanding of the music production process
An understanding of music-producer/beatmaker client-producer work processes
A discerning ear for music production quality, commercial appeal, and passion for and ability to curate track submissions
Familiarity with the competitive landscape of tracks/beats online retailers or platforms. Ideally familiarity with the competitive landscape of digital goods marketplaces.
Ideally you have a robust rolodex of talented producers in the Pop/EDM/Hip-Hop genres
Comfortable interfacing directly with artists and producers, and managing relationships
Strong familiarity with marketing best practices
Able to work autonomously with strong organizational and collaborative skills
Effective communicator who enjoys cross-functional projects
Proactive attitude and results oriented
Perks of being in the band
Extensive learning opportunities, through our dedicated team, GreenHouse.
Flexible share incentives letting you choose how you share in our success.
Global parental leave, six months off - fully paid - for all new parents.
All The Feels, our employee assistance program and self-care hub.
Flexible public holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
Spotify On Tour, join your colleagues on trips to industry festivals and events.
Learn about life at Spotify
You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service with a community of more than 345 million users.

The Social Media Coordinator supports our social media team on the day-to-day management and growth of Yelp’s corporate social media presence across numerous channels. We are seeking a long-term, 19 hours per week, coordinator to support our efforts across Instagram, Tiktok, Twitter and Facebook. Yelp’s social landscape includes 300+ national and local handles across North America.

This is a long term part-time remote role based in the United States
#LI-Remote
Where You Come In:
You’ll handle social community interactions and conversations about Yelp.
You’ll compile social community feedback to share with relevant stakeholders.
You’ll assist the Customer Service department in identifying, routing and escalating social. community issues to the proper personnel and departments.
You’ll utilize social listening/sentiment tools to recommend content adjustments.
You’ll coordinate content calendar executions on Instagram, including asset management.
You’ll produce video content for TikTok launch.
You’ll report to the Director of Social Media.
What it Takes to Succeed:
You have a bachelor’s degree in Journalism, Communications, Marketing or relevant professional experience.
You have 1+ years of experience in social media.
You have a passion for community management and customer support with experience executing video content on Tiktok and sourcing content for Instagram.
You have direct, hands-on experience supporting social properties in a corporate environment with consumer-facing channels/messages.
 You have experience with social media copywriting and asset coordination for multiple accounts.
You have direct experience with creating video content for TikTok.
You have experience with social community management as it relates to interacting directly with followers, accounts and the community at large.
You have the ability to follow processes and maintain organization in your execution of tasks for maintaining a community management process.
At Yelp, we believe that diversity is an expression of all the unique characteristics that make us human: race, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, and education — and those are just a few. We recognize that diverse backgrounds and perspectives strengthen our teams and our product. The foundation of our diversity efforts are closely tied to our core values, which include “Playing Well With Others” and “Authenticity.”
We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status, medical condition or disability.
We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities in our job application process. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-recruiting@yelp.com or 415-969-8488.
Note: Yelp does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to any recruiting alias or employee. Yelp is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Latham & Watkins, a global law firm consistently ranked among the top firms in the world, is currently seeking a Technology Analyst l to join our winning team, located in New York. The success of our firm is largely determined by our commitment to hire and develop the very best and brightest, creating a team that provides our clients with the highest quality of work and service. We are driven by our core values: respect, innovation and collaboration.

As the global outbreak of COVID-19 continues to unfold, Latham has taken precautions to help protect our people, clients, and the communities where we live and work. This includes a temporary shift to remote working for the majority of our lawyers and staff. This role will likely start remotely while the firm continues to evaluate the situation.

The Technology Analyst l will receive a generous total compensation package. Bonuses are awarded in recognition of individual and firm performance. Eligible employees can participate in Latham's comprehensive benefit program including healthcare, life and disability insurance, flexible spending accounts, a 401k plan, and more! In addition, employees receive 10 paid holidays per year, and a PTO program that accrues 23 days during the first year of employment and grows with tenure.

As a Technology Analyst l at Latham, you will provide support to the office regarding the resolution of complex desktop, notebook, and remote computing issues. He or she is responsible for installation and maintenance of firm PC and notebook computer hardware and software. You will quickly identify, troubleshoot, and repair various hardware and applications-related issues. The Analyst will act as mentor and provide support to the Technology Support Specialists while accomplishing these and other critical functions:

Installing and testing L&W standard image on desktops and notebooks.
Setting up conference rooms to use technology services (e.g., presentations, network connections, audio/visuals).
Using Active Directory for general network administration tasks (e.g., password change, security group assignments).
Using AssetCenter to manage firm assets (e.g., assign, retire and order assets).
Assisting with special projects on various issues as needed.
Administering training for staff and new hires, including new product demonstrations
Promoting effective work practices, working as a team member, and showing respect for co-workers.

As a Technology Analyst l, you will be expected to apply your organizational and communication skills while displaying a positive, high-energy attitude. The successful Technology Analyst l must have analytical skills necessary to troubleshoot a variety of symptoms, diagnose problems, and test, recommend and implement solutions to technology problems, as well as leadership skills (i.e., organizing, planning, problem-solving and decision-making) necessary for effective mentoring. An ideal candidate will possess expert knowledge and proficiency in a wide variety of software programs, including Windows 10 and Microsoft Office 2016 and expert knowledge of standard hardware components and peripherals. The Analyst must also display knowledge and proficiency of various remote communication methodologies including VDI and VPN technology as well as handheld wireless devices (i.e. iOS and Android) in a corporate environment.

A High School Diploma or equivalent is required. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Information Systems is preferred. A minimum of five (5) years of technology support experience in PC hardware/software is desired. Familiarization with remote communications hardware including WAPs, VPNs and wireless routers is desired. A minimum of three (3) years of related experience working on notebook computers is required. Experience with IBM/Lenovo notebooks is preferred.

Qualified candidates are encouraged to apply by clicking the ‘Apply Now’ link.

Latham & Watkins is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our commitment to diversity, equal opportunity and sustainability enables Latham & Watkins to draw from a remarkable wealth of talent to create one of the world's leading law firms.

Internship Description:

Digital Content Operations streamlines the production, organization, management, and distribution of video and associated assets across digital platforms in support of strategic initiatives. Basically, we ensure all Discovery-produced videos of the cooking of pasta by celebrity chefs, the booping of puppy noses, the crafting of recycled-wood side tables, and numerous whirlwind marriage proposals get in front of the largest possible audience. Digital is a rapidly changing landscape, and we are the sowers of those seeds.
The Digital Content Operations intern will be involved directly in helping to oversee and organize Discovery's digital and creative asset libraries. They will learn the ins and outs of the content supply chain, from greenlight to delivery to our platforms and partners. She/he will help ensure the entire globe can access the best digital content that exists. When someone watches a video produced by a major media brand on YouTube, they do not get insight into the pipeline behind that video, including specs, transcoding, closed caption files and more. This internship will give insight into what truly is involved in getting a piece of digital content from someone's brain to a viewer's eyes.
Although our summer internship program will be completely remote (students can apply from anywhere), please be aware that this intern will report into a New York City based manager and therefore should expect to work on eastern standard time.

Must be currently enrolled as a student (proof of enrollment will be required if selected for an internship)Must be a rising Junior, Senior, or Graduate studentMust have at least a 3.0 GPAMust have the legal right to work in the United States.

Internship Description:

The Corporate Relations department oversees Executive Events, the Global B2B Merchandise Program, Global Hospitality Programs & much more! Corporate Relations is an awesome place to be, as it allows the opportunity to work on multiple initiatives/events around the company. We get to work collaboratively and creatively with multiple groups around the company on a daily basis. Every day feels different & new opportunities pop up all the time.

As an intern on the Corporate Relations team, you’ll get experience with many different projects & support every member of the team. You will support the B2B Merchandise Program by managing the General Merchandise Catalogue and researching new fashion/merchandise trends on a daily basis, while also maintaining Executive Resources and supporting virtual programs. You will also help the team brainstorm new ideas for virtual events, ensuring the ideas are fresh, creative and unique to Discovery.
You will also play a key role in the annual Shark Week Mailer, a global mailer sent to about 1,500 clients & on-air talent in celebration of Shark Week. You will help brainstorm gift ideas, build presentations, and support the mailing process.
Although our summer internship program will be completely remote (students can apply from anywhere), please be aware that this intern will report into a New York City based manager and therefore should expect to work on eastern standard time.
Requirements:
Must be currently enrolled as a student (proof of enrollment will be required if selected for an internship)Must be a rising Junior, Senior, or Graduate studentMust have at least a 3.0 GPAMust have the legal right to work in the United States.
More About the Intern Program:

Discovery’s internationally recognized intern program attracts the country’s boldest and brightest students for a paid, for-credit, real-world work experience in the entertainment and media industry.
Like other Fortune 500 companies, we believe in immersing our students in all aspects of our business, giving them first hand experience working for the global leader in real life entertainment. So what sets us apart? We’re passionate about investing in our interns- both personally and professionally. Whether our program is in-person or remote, every semester is packed with speaker sessions with executives, LinkedIn profile reviews, recruiter panels, roundtable events and professional seminars- and that just scratches the surface.
Think our program sounds pretty awesome? Our former interns thought so too! This year, we were voted into Vault’s 2021 internship rankings for best overall internships, best media and telecom internships, best sales and marketing internships and best internships for diversity.
Ready to learn more? Here’s what we offer:
Mentorship from some of the industry’s kindest and most passionate entertainment veterans
Professional development seminars, panels with recruiters and former interns, intern-exclusive events, and so much more
Access to top level executives and employees through our Speaker Series and Roundtables
Incredible networking opportunities and a robust intern alumni network
A creative, collaborative and inclusive company culture
What you can expect to take away from the semester:
Opportunity to develop professionally and uncover skills you didn’t know you had
The insider scoop on the TV industry and what happens behind the scenes
Relationships that will go beyond your collegiate career
Real life experiences that will provide you with the confidence to delve into your next adventure
And finally, what to know before applying:
We offer 12 week spring and summer opportunities
Our Summer 2021 program will be fully remote- the program will run from June 2-August 20.
The application deadline for Summer 2021 is March 19th. After this date, we cannot guarantee your application will be reviewed for the position.
Our internships are paid opportunities. Credit is not required; however, we will provide necessary documentation for school credit if desired.
We do not require a cover letter- please do not submit one. Instead, demonstrate your passion for the position through your resume and interviews.
Interviewing will take place from February through mid-April. A Discovery Intern team member will contact you if your experiences and interests match an open internship position. Due to the high volume of applications, we are unable to give individual status updates.

Are you an experienced professional looking to join a company that will appreciate your talent and hard work?

Are you caring and friendly? Are you the "go-to" problem solver?

Consider joining the largest and fastest-growing dermatology group practice, that will recognize your hard work and value!

Schweiger Dermatology Group, a leader in the field of dermatology practice with multiple locations throughout New York, New Jersey, and Pennsylvania is searching for a Patient Representative to join our corporate team. The ideal candidate will live in the Greater New York Region, New Jersey, or Pennsylvania and able to commute to our Corporate office in Long Island City, NY on a limited basis.

Patient Representative

Promote a professional and welcoming atmosphere that enhances the quality of service and care offered to patients, providers, and fellow colleagues. Lead by example and maintain the highest level of professionalism.

If in the office, PR is expected to always practice good personal hygiene and dress appropriately; business casual attire required. Professional body language and communication with colleagues & patients must be always adhered to. This includes adherence to our clean desk policy.

Execute working knowledge of HIPAA privacy laws by protecting patient information during phone calls and discussing private information respectfully. Maintain confidentiality of all patient and employee information.

Responsible for answering incoming phone calls, scheduling appointments, while consistently adhering to proper scripts, trainings, and protocols.

Responsible for thoroughly triaging visit reasons and confirming insurance participation at the time of scheduling, prior to the appointment. Assist in maintaining efficient in-office patient flow by informing patients of all information and materials required for the appointment (e.g., out of pocket fees, insurance cards and insurance referrals, in office safety protocols).

Responsible for accurately triaging and submitting requests for prescriptions, lab results and medical record releases according to protocol. Responsible for educating patients on the process and turn-around time for such requests, while being mindful of delivering the ultimate patient experience.

Responsible for accurately triaging "non-appointment calls" and relaying messages to the appropriate personnel in real time.

Constant attention to personal email inbox and timely handling of all time-sensitive emails. Effectively communicating to supervisor/colleagues when assistance is required.

Document necessary notes within patient charts/appointments in real time.

Demonstrate initiative and superior customer service in assisting patients with solving problems. Refer the patient to direct supervisor if the situation cannot be handled to the patient's satisfaction. Refer the more complex issues and more involved patient needs to the appropriate department for resolution while maintaining proper phone etiquette in accordance with scripts/trainings.

Become proficient in provider specialties, biographies, and appointment durations information. Have current, thorough knowledge of all medical and cosmetic services offered at our offices.

Trains with QA and Training Dept as needed to improve call handling and company knowledge skills.

Qualifications

Strong communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills.
Excellent patient relations and customer service skills.
Must be computer savvy and familiar with Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook.
Must be an engaging and professional communicator with excellent phone and writing etiquette.
Must be able to meet all requirements to work remote whenever necessary. This includes, but not limited to, having reliable, working internet service that supports high quality voice and data and a quiet work environment with little to no background noise.
Must be available to work weekends on a rotating schedule.
Experience using EMR software and patient scheduling systems preferred.
Prior experience working in a dermatology or medical environment preferred.

Schweiger Dermatology Group, is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in its hiring process with applicants, whether internal or external, because of race, creed, color, age, national origin, ancestry, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, genetic information, veteran status, military status, application for military service or any other class per local, state or federal law.

About Capgemini
Capgemini is a global leader in consulting, digital transformation, technology and engineering services. The Group is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of clients’ opportunities in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50-year+ heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. Today, it is a multicultural company of 270,000 team members in almost 50 countries. With Altran, the Group reported 2019 combined revenues of €17billion.
Job Description
Job title: Salesforce Business Analyst
Location: New York (Remote)
Responsibilities:Experience in CRM solution such as Salesforce or MSD preferable.SFDC Experience creating user stories from workshop notes.Experience creating business process flows.Experience creating Business blueprint document.Experience creating architecture diagrams with guidance.Agile methodology and related terminology
What We Offer
Your career matters to you and is important to us too. Because your goals and needs are constantly evolving, we offer visibility, leeway and support to help you grow and progress in your career. This approach builds notably on our comprehensive competency framework, our personal development, training and career management programs, and our University innovative and business-focused learning curriculums.
We promote a culture of diversity. We believe working with talented individuals from different backgrounds and points of view is a strategic advantage and an ongoing opportunity. Diversity enriches our creative solutions and adds value for our clients.
With the digital tech sector growing at a rapid pace and women significantly underrepresented in the industry, we are determined to inspire and recruit more women into technology and build diverse teams that reflect the clients we serve.
Our Shared values have been at the heart of the group since our formation. They are honesty, boldness, trust, freedom, team spirit, modesty and fun. These values influence the way we meet client needs while respecting the regulatory requirements of each country in which we operate, and the way we promote ethically sound practices within Capgemini and in our partnerships.
Capgemini is committed to building a workforce of employees with diverse backgrounds and work experiences. We strongly encourage women, veterans and active military service personnel to apply.

We're looking for someone who is obsessed with creating world-class shopping experiences for our customers and takes delight in building visually compelling creatives. The Graphic Designer will collaborate closely with the Brand Growth team to create an engaging and imaginative portfolio of graphic assets for our consumer products and our brand stores across various ecommerce shopping channels.
What You'll Do
Specific ownership of initiatives and day-to-day responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:
Be The Expert. Follow market trends and apply a keen understanding of the Amazon and ecommerce landscape to maximize the effectiveness of our creative designs.
Deliver Results. Drive improvements in conversion rate and other KPIs by creating visually compelling creative assets that accurately inform and showcase the benefits of our products.
Customer-Centric Innovation. Work with Brand Growth leaders to develop and push design concepts, gather data through split testing, discuss alternatives, and review design specifications for product listings and brand storefronts.
Simplify. Through your visual designs, tell the stories of our products in ways that are crisp, clear, and memorable for our customers.
NOTE: This is a remote role through Q2 2021, at which point we expect to transition the team back into company headquarters located in New York, NY.
Requirements
With this role, we are looking to bring on a trusted, long-term partner to support Brand Growth operations for many years to come. Specific qualifications include:
Bachelor’s degree in Visual Arts, Computer Aided Drafting & Design, Graphic Design, Marketing, or related discipline preferred.
Experience working with Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, and XD) and other design tools.
Experience working cross-functionally and/or in matrixed organizations.
Strong aesthetic and conceptual skills to help bring life to existing graphic assets and help elevate the visual identity of our brands.
Highly organized with a critical attention to detail and impossibly high standards.
Clear and concise written and oral communication skills.
Bonus points if you have...
Launched and/or operated your own ecommerce store.
Video editing and production experience.
Strong portfolio that demonstrates graphic design, art direction, interactive design, typography, or storytelling with attention to detail.

Why You Fit At Forum
You are customer obsessed. Customers are your "North Star" and you bring them "into the room" when planning and making decisions. You worry about customers more than competitors.
You are an owner. For you, there's no such thing as "it's not my job." You take pride in, and accountability for, results. No problem is too big, too small, or too outside of your scope to jump in and help.
You are a doer. You have a bias towards action and are able to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment. You independently identify both issues and opportunities and run towards them.
You are scrappy. You find ways to do more with less. You recognize that resources are easily depleted, but resourcefulness is a skill that compounds over time.
Benefits
Why You'll Love Forum Brands
We are builders. We believe that the only way to get the future that we want is to build it. Building consumer brands that excite and delight customers is our highest calling, and we come to work each day in service of that cause.
"First Who, Then What." We believe that if you begin with “who,” rather than “what,” you can more easily adapt to a changing world. We apply immense rigor in making people decisions, and take seriously our responsibility to develop our people, because we know that it is our people that will take us from good to great.
We are explorers. We are curious by nature and constantly learning. We design experiments and test hypotheses quickly, cheaply, and in all facets of our business.
We are not perfect. We hold a worldview of humility and recognize that we will make mistakes, but that they will not define us — they are simply data points to inform future decisions.
You come as you are. You draw inspiration from an environment where the best ideas win, regardless of where they come from. Like us, you celebrate diversity of all kinds. You share our commitment as an equal opportunity employer to building an inclusive Forum where people thrive by being their authentic selves and are empowered to do their best work each day.
We share the pie. We offer great compensation packages and are always seeking to increase the pie for everyone at the table. We also offer comprehensive benefits, including:
Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)
Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
Family Leave (Maternity, Paternity)
Short Term & Long Term Disability

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has a seat at the table and the opportunity to excel. We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company and in ecommerce overall. That’s why we commit ourselves to hire and cultivate diverse teams of the best and brightest from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives.
Equal Opportunity Employment

Snappy is an award-winning all-in-one enterprise gifting platform. We're reinventing the way companies express appreciation to their employees by offering a fun and interactive digital experience that lets employees choose a gift they actually love. We specialize in building recognition programs for all sorts of businesses - Zoom, Salesforce, Microsoft, Uber, Deloitte and over 800 more. Plus, we're growing everyday - 400% YOY, if you want to get technical! We've seen firsthand that our experience boosts morale, improves performance, and (most importantly!) spreads joy.

Of course, we practice what we preach! Here at Snappy, we believe wholeheartedly in building a culture of appreciation, dedication, and fun! We offer all sorts of benefits and perks to our employees including but not limited to: Free healthcare including vision and dental and a generous 401k match, unlimited PTO and paid family leave, Snappy Summer Fridays (which we actually enjoy year around!), snacks and lunches delivered to your home while we're working remotely, and Snappy gifts galore!

Tripleseat, a leading cloud, sales and catering management platform, is seeking a highly motivated, driven, and talented, Hotel Sales Manager that has experience working the full sales funnel from lead generation to close. Overview:

All who are selected to participate in CFR’s Blavatnik Internship Program and Robina Franklin Williams Internship Program receive training in the field of foreign policy and international affairs as well as skills training in writing, research, program planning and much more.
The intern will have the opportunity to assist in efforts related to marketing, research, and analytic reporting for the Education department. By actively participating in this project, this intern will gain a deeper understanding managing social media accounts across multiple platforms, developing assests for marketing purposes, and performing analytics reporting to determine ROI (return on investment) of multiple campaigns. The intern will also participate in learning how to creatively educate a diverse audience on these particular topics.
CFR internships are paid, require a 14 - 18 hour commitment, and are filled on a rolling basis.
Spring semester internship opportunities are on a fully remote/virtual basis.
The major responsibilities of this position will include (but are not limited to)::
Assisting with the Education department initiative social media accounts and brand messaging through a variety of platforms
Researching various channels and accounts with relevant and potential audiences for advertising
Compiling a database of educational influencers across higher education, high school, and general public audiences
Assisting with content development for the website and other promotional or advertising materials
Assisting with the day to day operations of marketing, including social media and analytic reporting
Qualifications:
Undergraduate student focusing on marketing, business, international relations, political science, communications or related field
Students should have completed the equivalent of four semesters of collee coursework (not including AP classses in high school) by the time they begin an internship
Relevant office experience preferred, with interest in advertising and market analysis
Previous web or multimedia, analytics experience a plus
Proficiency in MS Office and various social media platforms
About CFR:

Founded in 1921, the Council on Foreign Relations (CFR) is a leading nonprofit membership organization, research center, and publisher, with headquarters in New York, an office in Washington, DC, and programs nationwide. It is dedicated to increasing America's understanding of the world and contributing ideas to U.S. foreign policy. CFR's 5,000+ members are leaders in international affairs and foreign policy. CFR also publishes Foreign Affairs, the preeminent magazine on global issues, and provides up-to-date information about the world and U.S. foreign policy on its award-winning website, CFR.org.
CFR’s Internship Program is made possible through the generous support of the Blavatnik Family Foundation, the Robina Foundation, CFR members, and the family and friends of Franklin Williams.
The Council on Foreign Relations is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Quality, diversity, and balance are the key objectives sought by the Council on Foreign Relations in the composition of its workforce.

HOMER has a newly created opportunity for a Product Design Manager, Growth to join our growing team! This role will report into our New York City office (upon re-opening) or can be based remotely within select US states (AL; CA; CO; CT; FL; GA; ID; MA; MD; MI; MO; NC; NE; NJ; NY; OR; PA; TN; TX; WA; WY).

HOMER is the essential early learning program for kids 2-8. Powered by the HOMER Method, the most effective way for your child to learn— our expert-designed proprietary learning framework is research-backed and kid-tested to give your child the best start to their learning journey. Focused on both academic and personal skills, HOMER develops confident learners prepared for both school and life.

We are a high-growth business with an amazing set of investors. We offer competitive compensation including equity and full benefits in a creative, flexible environment that invests in professional development.

Reporting into our Senior Director of Product Design, the Product Design Manager (Growth) will be a coach/player role and responsible for the output of Monetization work on the Growth Web Squad, which will include introducing new products in market, price testing and launching new methods of e-Commerce.

This role will also manage the work of two designers on our Conversion and Parent Activation/Retention Squads. This role will also help to build out a web design system.

This role will contribute to a strong design team culture and a thriving product design practice at HOMER, partnering with the Director of Product Design to create relevant, structured design processes. This role will also inspire design solutions that are user-centric, research backed (where appropriate), while also being mindful of the business needs.

The role will contribute to highly scalable design processes that support the growing velocity of HOMER's tech teams, champion our design standards, and own design execution across our products.

You will:

Create on brand Product Design work relevant to Monetization, price testing, introducing new plans in market and strategize around e-Commerce approaches
Contribute to a thriving Product Design culture at HOMER, including driving a strong sense of cohesion and collaboration across the design team.
Consider market context, industry and competitor trends, customer feedback, site metrics, and usability in your output of work.
Partner with UX Research to contribute to the strategy of the digital products you manage through both qualitative and quantitative studies (field observations, customer interviews, play testing/usability studies and surveys).
Drive UX Research behind work to determine the best solutions and iterate on these solutions, resulting in user flows, wireframes, sitemaps, prototypes, and low-fidelity sketches.
Encourage a creative process and design culture of curiosity and openness that knows when to explore broadly, but is attentive to details.
Communicate design principles, frameworks and provide direction where needed to your focused team and lead the team in best practices.
Mentor designers that report to you while being a leader as well to other team members.
Partner with cross-functional teams (Product, Engineering, Content, Marketing and Data) to deliver a consistent and high quality experience across multiple products.
Work on partnered solutions for efficiencies of scale throughout Product and Engineering teams. This includes developing the framework and ultimate evolution of a robust, effective design system for relevant digital products.
Evolve the product roadmap by expressing input in strategy conversations with product management.

Must Haves:

At least 4+ years of product design experience with consumer-facing products.
At least 1 year managing multiple designers
Experience navigating process and strategy in product design and development.
A distinctive portfolio of work that demonstrates a strong understanding of user-centered design and a deep understanding of UI/UX best practices on web and mobile.
Deep acumen with design systems, tools, processes and best practices
Proven effectiveness partnering with engineering organizations to deliver best-in-class design-intensive product experiences.
Excellent communication skills with the capacity to create alignment across multiple creative teams, marketing, product and engineering.
Ability to balance long-term strategic thinking with getting features and products out the door.
Strong knowledge of prototyping, user testing and research, validated learning, A/B testing and agile development practices.
A passion for HOMER's mission.

Nice-to-Haves:

Experience in designing children's media / product or games.
Experience with e-commerce design or A/B testing/conversion design experience
Understanding of children's learning processes and approaches.
Experience in designing for different audiences within and across multiple products under one brand.
Experience in designing purchase flows and conversion funnels.
A bachelor's degree in Graphic Design, UI Design, or a related field.

We like people who: (below is suggested - feel free to edit!)

Are open to suggestions, collaborative, and thrive in team environments
Love and are willing to learn new technologies and styles
Are scrappy, entrepreneurial with the ability to turnaround high-quality projects quickly without depending on a large team

What you'll get:

HOMER offers competitive compensation including equity and full benefits.
Smart, passionate, and engaged co-workers.
Excellent top-tier Medical/Dental/Vision benefits
401k with 4% company match
The chance to have a big impact, quickly
The rare opportunity to make a dent in the universe. We're bringing a love of reading and learning to children globally!

HOMER is a proud equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

At HOMER, we are committed to building a diverse team of talented people who are passionate about creating educational content kids love. We believe in fostering a culture where productivity can flourish, one that is empathetic, respectful, and inclusive. At HOMER, we know that diversity, equity, and inclusion aren't just an idea, a one-time initiative, or phrases to throw into a job post: they're a daily practice and an ongoing conversation. We survey our team about inclusivity, run trainings on DEI topics, and have a committee to ensure we are all continuing to learn and grow.

Who We Are
MOSTLY AI is a Vienna, Austria based high-tech startup that has developed game-changing AI technology for synthetic data. Our solutions enable organizations across the world and across industries to safely share big data assets, internally as well as externally, while keeping the privacy of their customers fully protected. This breakthrough in data protection is made possible by leveraging generative deep neural networks that extract patterns, structures and variations from existing data to generate highly realistic & highly accurate synthetic customers.
Who You Are
You are a passionate new business sales professional with experience in selling Enterprise products to mid and large organizations. You are interested in latest data management technology around AI and Machine Learning. You know how to manage an Enterprise sales cycle from initial qualification to closing. You are a great communicator with strong ability to navigate within a client organization and to develop key points of contact in multiple departments and multiple levels of leadership. You understand how Enterprises work with data today, what systems they use and what challenges they have. You are a Self-starter with the ability to make impactful presentations and to articulate complex problems in a simple and effective way. You are experienced in advanced sales qualification methodology e,g, MEDDIC, Challenger Sales etc.
If that sounds like you then you should read further!
Responsibilities
Lead commercial growth in North America by establishing long-term multi-year business with new and existing prospects
Maintain and extend a prioritized list of target prospects and grow relationships to fuel pipeline
High volume of outreach and client engagement via different channels such as calls, emails, LinkedIn, Zoominfo and other sales tools
Manage complete sales funnel from A-Z including initial qualification, discovery activities, PoCs, to push prospective clients down the funnel to close
Close business to meet and exceed quarterly and annual booking objectives
Collect customer insights and provide feedback to leadership to help direct sales strategy and product development
Work closely with Marketing and VP Sales to continuously update content, messaging and collateral to support new initiatives and campaigns
Requirements
5+ years of experience in an Enterprise sales role (Financial Services or Telco are a plus)
Good understanding how privacy sensitive data is used in today’s Enterprise business
Proven track record of closing multi-year deals in an Enterprise environment exceeding targets
Demonstrated success of building relationships at various management levels
Highly energetic personality with a “can do / get things done” attitude
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple deals and grow pipeline simultaneously
Results-driven with excellent interpersonal, communication and collaborative skills
Willingness to travel extensively in North America (once possible)
Must be able to navigate and blend into a high paced start-up environment
Ambition and desire to learn and grow within the role and the AI ecosystem
Location: East Coast (Remote)
Our Perks
You'll be joining an international team of dynamic, highly skilled and smart people
Competitive compensation
100% covered healthcare
Between holidays and PTO, you’ll have one month off per year – and we want you to use it!
Once travel is possible we'll make sure you can join our major team events in Austria
Some recent team events include: a cross country ski trip, team building workshops where we built an actual table, Friday lunches, etc.
We don’t measure how much time you spend in the office; we’re all about production and trust the people on our team
Individual budget for training and learning
$90.000 annual gross salary incl. overtime, additional payment according to skills and experience, plus competitive commission plan
If you love data as much as we do, then come and join us to advance, deploy and promote our category-defining novel solutions around privacy-preserving generative AI.

JobTitle: Project Employee - Global Investigations & Compliance - Fraud Research Specialist - Remote Location

Text:
JOB OVERVIEW

As a Mid-Enterprise Regional Sales Manager (RSM-2), you will hunt and land Mid-Enterprise accounts, using a solution driven sales methodology, to generate and close new business within an assigned territory. The ideal candidate is an energetic sales and SaaS professional who can assess product market fit and time to revenue to engage with new prospects about the on-demand and live opportunities.

This full cycle sales role will allow the ideal candidate the opportunity to navigate and attract new target accounts, work with a business development representative and marketing to qualify opportunities, run sales cycles, and close deals. This newly established role on our sales team is focused on customer acquisition for Mid-Enterprise accounts and is part of a team-based selling Pod structure.

NOTE: Position is remote - U.S. based.

JOB DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES

Discover the needs and industry challenges of prospects and provide relevant solutions.

Manage quota and activities to exceed quarterly and annual revenue goals.

Research organizations and relationships between prospects to create a penetration strategy.

 Lead virtual presentations and demos to C-level executives and senior stakeholders.

Leverage Salesforce data to manage and forecast sales activity and ensure pipeline growth aligns with targets.

Work closely Marketing and Sales to evolve strategy as part of an Account Based Marketing (ABM) approach 

Become an expert in our platform, customer needs, competitors and industry issues and trends.

Attend key industry events to enhance networking opportunities.


QUALITIES

5+ years B2B SaaS with a strong track record with high growth companies. Video and/or SaaS industry expertise, preferred.

Record of success qualifying, building, and managing your book to close new business

Ability to build and maintain strong relationships with senior executives and departmental teams.

You love technology, think outside of the box and know enough to be your own sales engineer.

Adept in engaging with prospects to understand their unique and specific pain points and produce compelling business cases to meet their needs.

Comfortable leveraging CRM data to construct, forecast, and manage sales activity and drive pipeline to meet revenue targets.

Driven to find solutions as you map stakeholders into decision-makers and influencers and sell to everyone's unique pain.

Excellent communication style presenting and writing. Tenacious yet tactful.

Collaborative with internal product teams and provide feedback from the field to help shape future development.

Customer-centric as you work seamlessly with internal team members to ensure successful customer handoff and onboarding for new clients.

JobTitle: Technical Product Manager - New Verticals - New York
Text:
Octane is a Fintech company whose mission is to connect people with their passions. The $21B powersports market is fast and fun, but the purchasing process is slow and frustrating. Octane is changing that through automated underwriting, innovative credit products, and financing through our in-house lender Roadrunner Financial. Octane reaches millions of riders through editorial brands like CycleWorld.com and helps consumers buy their favorite vehicles with instant, frictionless financing on Octane.co.

Octane is gaining traction quickly with customers, as evidenced by growth in originations through our platform of more than 3X year-over-year. Octane works with more than 3,500 dealers in the USA, provides financing coverage for most major powersports makes, and offers promotional financing with low rates for 40 OEM brands. Because we’re the platform and the lender, we have both high growth and positive unit economics - rare for a fintech. We have raised more than $139M in venture capital from leading investors such as IA Ventures, Valar Ventures, and Contour Venture Partners.

As a Technical Product Manager, you will expand our backend platform beyond powersports to serve new verticals. You need to be a pathological empathizer, data junkie, and proven leader with a history of success building innovative and efficient backend software. You know how to balance research, analytics, common sense, and a drive to win to inform a product roadmap and align multiple teams to our mission and drive key results. You are naturally curious and love efficiency; you enjoy coming up with innovative answers to complex problems and are comfortable weighing trade-offs to deliver the most appropriate solutions. This role reports to the Director of Product, Technical Products. This position can be based in our NYC location or remote (U.S. only)

Specifically, you will:

Partner cross-functionally to develop strategies aimed at improving and scaling our backend systems as we move into new verticals
Help scale our “secret-sauce” decisioning engine to handle new assets and risk appetites
Build and maintain a roadmap and evangelize your vision across Octane
Work closely with engineering to align our why and what with our how
Collaborate with other Product Managers to ensure our back end products work seamlessly with our front end
Develop group Objectives and Key Results and drive your teams to hit them
Work closely with our credit risk, sales, operations, and servicing teams to build products that holistically serve our business
Collaborate with senior leaders to define requirements and KPIs and communicate the performance of new verticals

Requirements

4 + years of experience in a technical product management position or similar
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience
You have significant/meaningful experience building and scaling backend products in an agile product development environment
You are rigorous about testing and ensuring new products are production-ready before introducing them into our platform
You’re a strong cross-functional communicator who can utilize the data on hand to gain internal support for your vision and strategies
You have an entrepreneurial mindset, with a bias for innovation

Benefits

Robust Health Care Plans (Medical, Dental & Vision)
Up to 5 weeks PTO (self-managed)
Generous Parental Leave
Retirement Plan (401k) with Company contribution
Educational Assistance/Tuition Reimbursement up to $3K/year
Powersports Safety Benefit: reimbursement of up to $500/year for the purchase of any powersports safety equipment
Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)
Short Term / Long Term Disability & Life insurance
Team Activities (remotely)
Monthly company gift

Octane Lending is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or any other protected status with respect to recruitment, hiring, promotion and other terms and conditions of employment.

JobTitle: Internship, Foreign Affairs, Marketing Design, Summer 2021
Text:

All who are selected to participate in CFR’s Blavatnik Internship Program and Robina Franklin Williams Internship Program receive training in the field of foreign policy and international affairs as well as skills training in writing, research, program planning and much more.

They will develop and deepen their graphic design skills for a reputable brand and will be exposed to marketing strategies, composing of digital operations, social media, analytics and more. The intern will also learn about niche marketing as we try to target specific communities. The intern will develop office, organizational, and strategic marketing skills.

Spring semester internship opportunities are on a fully remote/virtual basis.
The major responsibilities of this position will include (but are not limited to)::

JobTitle: Partner UI Integration Product Designer - Navigation
Text:
About GM
There’s never been a more exciting time to work for General Motors.

To achieve our vision of a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion, we need people to join us who are passionate about creating safer, better and more sustainable ways for people to get around. This bold vision won’t happen overnight, but just as we transformed how the world moved in the last century, we are committed to transforming how we move today and in the future.
Why Work for Us
Our culture is focused on building inclusive teams, where differences and unique perspectives are embraced so you can contribute to your fullest potential as you pursue your career. Our locations feature a variety of work environments, including open work spaces and virtual connection platforms to inspire productivity and flexible collaboration. And we are proud to support our employees volunteer interests, and make it a priority to join together in efforts that give back to our communities.
Job Description
Summary
Do you have a passion for user-centered problem-solving and storytelling? Are you obsessed with studying, understanding and responding to human needs? Do you want to create engaging products that solve real problems and create unique emotional experiences? Then imagine what you can do working with a like-minded, multi-disciplinary team in our User Experience group.
Our growing User Experience team is seeking passionate and talented Partner UI Integration Product Designer to weave together customer-facing experiences from different partners, across multiple in-vehicle brands. Our work touches the lives of drivers and passengers across the globe.
As a Partner UI Integration Product Designer, you will collaborate internally with other GM product designers, visual designers, user researchers, engineers, architects, and business stakeholders to craft meaningful experiences for our customers through thoughtful design integration. You’ll also collaborate externally with key GM partners whose own product experiences live within our vehicle. The ideal candidate will have strong communication skills, interaction design skills, an understanding of and commitment to user-centered design, and have experience designing digital products through execution.
Description
Partner UI Integration Product Designers support multi-disciplinary teams focused on weaving external partner experiences and UI with internal GM user experiences and UI. This designer will need to fully understand the GM in-vehicle design system as well as our partner design systems and platforms in order to create one seamlessly designed experience for the end user.
Responsibilities
Collaborate closely with team members and valued partners to craft world-class integrated user experiences across all products and platforms for vehicle features
Balance user needs, technical constraints, partner requirements and business objectives to solve problems effectively
Identify user experience gaps due to conflicting product requirements
Craft interaction designs, being the champion of usability and user-centered design principles
Create design deliverables to communicate your work as needed, including sketches, logic and flow, prototypes, wireframes, and specifications
Facilitate workshops and collaborative design activities with stakeholders, team members and partners
Participate in user experience research and testing to validate designs, get user feedback, and identify opportunities to improve the customer experience
Work with product owners and key stakeholders to brainstorm and identify opportunities, executing them as a flawless part of the overall user experience
Contribute to the continued evolution of the team’s workflows and processes to further improve quality and performance
Requirements
Experience creating digital interfaces for web, mobile, in-vehicle interfaces, or other surfaces
Strong UX portfolio with work samples showcasing expertise in user experience design, iterative design, quality of craft, and depth of thought
Successful track record for bringing digital products to execution and working closely with software engineers
Open to feedback, knows how to give and receive criticism, and how and when to defend design decisions
Strong written, visual, and verbal communication skills
Ability to work collaboratively
Proficient in Axure and Sketch
Preferred Qualifications
Interests aligned with Tech and Automotive industries
Experience incorporating research into the design process, including contextual inquiry, usability testing, heuristic evaluation, etc
Some experience with software development or a baseline understanding of coding language (Kotlin knowledge is a plus)
Some design prototyping experience (Axure or similar)
2+ years designing digital products
Degree in HCI, Product Design, Interaction Design or equivalent experience
Additional Job Description
Location
This is a remote position, the selected candidate can reside and perform the work from anywhere within the United States or choose relocate near General Motors Technical Center in Warren, Michigan.
PLEASE ONLY APPLY IF YOU DO NOT NEED SPONSORSHIP TO WORK IN THE UNITED STATES NOW OR IN THE FUTURE. WE ARE UNABLE TO CONSIDER CANDIDATES WHO REQUIRE SPONSORSHIP.
Benefits Overview
The goal of the General Motors total rewards program is to support the health and well-being of you and your family. Our comprehensive compensation plan incudes, the following benefits, in addition to many others:
Paid time off including vacation days, holidays, and parental leave for mothers, fathers and adoptive parents;Healthcare (including a triple tax advantaged health savings account and wellness incentive), dental, vision and life insurance plans to cover you and your family;Company and matching contributions to 401K savings plan to help you save for retirement;Global recognition program for peers and leaders to recognize and be recognized for results and behaviors that reflect our company values;
Tuition assistance and student loan refinancing;Discount on GM vehicles for you, your family and friends.
Diversity Information
General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities. GM is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.

(SAFe experience is a plus)Ability to coach and provide direction to team in the initial stages of adopting scrum methodologiesExcellent written and verbal communication skills; ability to handle JobTitle: Biostatistical Analyst/SAS Programmer (Clinical Trials, CDSIC, STDM & ADaM (open to remote workers))
Text:
Your Mission:
Leverage your statistical expertise, advanced programming skills and solid ADaM and SDTM experience, to support the statistical team and assist in the development and support of innovative approaches to optimize clinical trials, including synthetic control arms
Your Competencies:
Review protocols, statistical analysis plans, and other study related documents to support accurate data mapping and statistical analysis. Review specification for different datasets, SDTM/ADaM. Develop SAS programs to generate/validate variables and datasets.
Work collaboratively with data standardization subject matter experts, statistical programmers and biostatisticians and other Acorn AI groups to assist in evaluating the accuracy of integrated historical data
Perform statistical analysis and reporting of clinical trial data, both safety and efficacy, utilizing SAS programming
Your Education & Experience:
Master’s degree or equivalent, in Statistics, Biostatistics or Mathematics
6+ years of statistical analysis and/or SAS programming experience in the Pharmaceutical & Biotech industry. Experience with additional programming languages a plus.
Familiarity with drug development life cycle and experience with the manipulation, analysis and reporting of clinical trials’ data.
Regulatory submissions experience utilizing define.xml and other submission documents. Understanding of FDA guidelines.
Strong SAS analysis and reporting skills. Solid experience implementing CDISC Standards (SDTM/ADaM). Proficiency in SAS MACRO development.
Excellent written and verbal ability, including the ability to be persuasive to a technical or non-technical audience
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and work on multiple projects at the same time
Experience with ISS and ISE
Experience in Oncology trials a plus
Experience with multiple sponsors a plus
Medidata is making a real difference in the lives of patients everywhere by accelerating critical drug and medical device development, enabling life-saving drugs and medical devices to get to market faster. Our products sit at the convergence of the Technology and Life Sciences industries, one of most exciting areas for global innovation. Nine of the top 10 best-selling drugs in 2017 were developed on the Medidata platform.
Medidata Solutions have powered over 17,000+ clinical trials giving us the largest collection of clinical trial data in the world. With this asset, we pioneer innovative, advanced applications and intelligent data analytics, bringing an unmatched level of quality and efficiency to clinical trials enabling treatments to reach waiting patients sooner.
Medidata Solutions, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Medidata Solutions provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by the law. Medidata Solutions complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

#LI-AS1

At PAIR Eyewear, we're building the first personalized eyewear brand where glasses can be an extension of your personality, mood and interests. With funding from leading venture capitalists in the consumer space, partnerships in the entertainment, sports and fashion arenas and a team of passionate individuals, we are on a mission to completely revolutionize the eyewear industry. We're excited that we already have the support of Good Morning America, The Today Show, Oprah Magazine, CNN and Forbes helping us share our story.
We are seeking a Textile (CAD) Associate to help assist the design and execution of PAIRs top frame product lines. Reporting to our VP of Merchandising & Product Development. You will help design, create colorways and files to send out to production on our new top frame development for our tri-monthly collections for adults and kids. You will also work closely with our licensed partners to help the development and design of partnership collections with (Marvel, Harry Potter, MLB, etc...).

What you'll Do:

Help communicate and assist PD with our licensed partners on approvals and production
Work closely with your manager to design trend right art for each collection
Use Photoshop and Illustrator to prepare, modify, and resize artwork
Assist with PD on our on demand printing process
Approve Strike off/Sample approvals and comments

Who you are:

You are equipped with 2+ years of print and pattern/graphic design experience in retail
You have a portfolio
You have a strong eye for color and colorways with the ability to match colors accurately
You are efficient in Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop
You have designed for both women/girl & men/boy
You are a positive team player and collaborator who enjoys working with various team members to execute cross functional strategies
Nice to Have:

Experience is kids and adults design
Packaging experience
Experience in the eyewear industry is a plus but not required
Experience working with Licenses a plus

Some Benefits and Perks of Working At PAIR:

Health, vision and dental insuranceUnlimited vacation policyCompetitive salaries with equity opportunitiesRetirement savings plan optionsNYC dog friendly office with flexible remote work optionsFree eyewear (plus discounts for family and friends)
Pair is an equal opportunity employer. Overview:

All who are selected to participate in CFR’s Blavatnik Internship Program and Robina Franklin Williams Internship Program receive training in the field of foreign policy and international affairs as well as skills training in writing, research, program planning and much more.
CFR’s new podcast seeks to explain pressing IR issues to a new, wide audience. Under the umbrella of the Multimedia team, the podcast intern will prepare research briefings on episode topics, and aid in other logistical and production-related tasks.
CFR internships are paid, require a 14- 18 hour commitment, and are filled on a rolling basis.
Spring semester internship opportunities are on a fully remote/virtual basis.
The major responsibilities of this position will include (but are not limited to)::
Prepare research briefings on episode topics, including compiling and highlighting articles on multiple subjects, uncovering fresh angles and points of interest, and assembling lists of speakers and guests
Assist with application for festivls, awards etc.
Photo, website content, and podcast production research; editing photos and audio, and copyediting news stories and multimedia projects; reviewing and editing transcripts
Assist with organizing interviews and other logistics
Qualifications:
Undergraduate or graduate student focusing on journalism, international relations, or related field
Students should have completed the equivalent of four semesters of college coursework (not including AP classes in high school) by the time they begin an internship
Strong research and writing skills
Previous journalism, web, multimedia experience a plus
Proficiency in MS Office and Google
About CFR:

Founded in 1921, the Council on Foreign Relations (CFR) is a leading nonprofit membership organization, research center, and publisher, with headquarters in New York, an office in Washington, DC, and programs nationwide. It is dedicated to increasing America's understanding of the world and contributing ideas to U.S. foreign policy. CFR's 5,000+ members are leaders in international affairs and foreign policy. CFR also publishes Foreign Affairs, the preeminent magazine on global issues, and provides up-to-date information about the world and U.S. foreign policy on its award-winning website, CFR.org.
CFR’s Internship Program is made possible through the generous support of the Blavatnik Family Foundation, the Robina Foundation, CFR members, and the family and friends of Franklin Williams.
The Council on Foreign Relations is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Quality, diversity, and balance are the key objectives sought by the Council on Foreign Relations in the composition of its workforce.

JobTitle: Internship, International Economics, Economic History, Summer 2021
Text:
Overview:

CFR’s internships give selected interns the opportunity to receive training in the area of foreign policy; as well as skills training in areas such as writing, research, and program planning.
The Council has a internship available in the Studies Department. The intern will work with a team in the studies department and will assist the fellow with research, writing, and editing. The intern will gain firsthand experience with the tools scholars use to analyze economic policy questions.

Spring semester internship opportunities are on a fully remote/virtual basis.

Attending general Council meetings and other programs on foreign policy issues, as time permits

Students should have completed the equivalent of four semesters of college coursework (not including AP classes in high school) by the time they begin an internship
Experience in research, writing, and editing

Strong Microsoft Office skills; citation management experience a plus
