JobTitle: WEB CLIENT EXPERIENCE (CX) ANALYST - Remote Opportunity
Text:
At Pitney Bowes, we do the right thing, the right way.
As a Web Client Experience (CX) Analyst for Pitney Bowes, you can too.
We have amazing people who are the driving force, the inspiration and foundation of our company. Our thriving culture can be broken down into four components: Client. Team. Win. Innovate.
We actively look for prospects who:
Are passionate about client success.
Enjoy collaborating with others.
Strive to exceed expectations.
Move boldly in the quest for superior and best in market solutions.
You are:
A Results-driven Leader who can support our client base by synthesizing Voice of Customer (VoC) and operational data with the goal of improving customer experience and customer satisfaction on the Pitney Bowes website. You are a Forward thinking individual who is the advocate for our clients helping to improve their online experience as well as drive change in conjunction with internal processes, goals and KPIs.
You will:
Research and analyze global quantitative and qualitative VoC and other internal data and requests reporting on needs, gaps and pain points to increase client satisfaction scores: NSAT, CSAT, NPS, etc.
Monitor and provide continual CX recommendations on surveys, questions, data capture and new opportunities, like text analytics and other tools to analyze large amounts of data.
Structure and simplify internal stakeholder view of data through dashboards, reports and data exports to align with incoming data, new components and enhancements.
Provide a comprehensive view of monthly and quarterly metrics with cause and effect analysis.
Oversee new customer comments and help close the loop for dissatisfied web clients following established service level agreements (SLAs).
Help to identify immediate concerns with site performance or client trends and escalate to the appropriate team(s).
Qualifications
Your background:
As a Web Client Experience (CX) Analyst, you have:
Must have experience with complex websites.
Strong analytical, project management and problem-solving skills and ability to manage multiple activities.
Ability to creatively resolve conflicts for clients and promote the importance of client initiatives to busy teams.
Capability to interact with and present to all levels of the organization and to convey complex concepts and data structures simply.
A Bachelor's degree (BA/BS), 2-5+ years relevant digital and CX experience applying data analysis practices and business insights on websites.
Preferred :
Operational or strategic exposure to contact centers
Adobe Analytics, Target, Salesforce, CX SaaS tools for surveys, text analytics and session tools or similar.
We will:
Provide the opportunity to grow and develop your career
Offer an inclusive environment that encourages diverse perspectives and ideas
Deliver challenging and unique opportunities to contribute to the success of a transforming organization
Offer comprehensive benefits globally (pbprojectliving.com)

Work it! Here at Shake Shack, we take care of each other first and foremost so that we can make raves for our guests, community, suppliers, and investors. After all, teamwork makes the dream work. We work our buns off, but we play hard too, with a Team Appreciation Day, unlimited meal discounts, volunteer opportunities, and so much more. If you’re looking for a deeply fulfilling, financially rewarding, and really fun career, you’re in the right place.
Design Manager- Remote
This role contributes to Shake Shack’s success by supporting the design process to create outstanding designs that uphold the Shake Shack experience and brand. The role is inclusive of all phases of design from test-fits through construction documents and administration while respecting budget, schedule and brand.
Key Responsibilities
Manages the design of restaurants within parameters of individual Shack budgets and market requirements with alignment from cross-functional teams.
Contributes to design team goals by achieving target deliverables on new restaurants and meeting all established deadlines.
Manages the production of design and construction documents by external consultants. Responsible for the integrity and quality from test fits through construction documents; inclusive of working knowledge of detailing, code requirements, and MEP.
Conducts site visits as needed.

Skills & Knowledge
Organized and self-motivated individual who is passionate about the brand and dedicated to seeing their designs come to life in a thoughtful and practical way
Ability to manage and execute multiple projects under tight deadlines
Ability to leverage knowledge of industry trends with strong 3D visualization ability and knowledge of color and design principles
Proficiency in Bluebeam, AutoCAD, and Revit is required
Proficiency in Photoshop, InDesign, SketchUp and other design software is preferred
Experience
4-6 years of related work experience
3+ years of project management experience
Retail, hospitality or restaurant design or development organization including management of construction documents
Managing outside architectural, MEP and other design consultants and vendors
Other
Domestic travel required
Colorado Applicants: $86,000- $90,000 base salary (potential for higher depending on experience)
Benefits include:
Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
Transit Discount Program
401K Plan with Company Match
Paid Time Off Program
Flexible Spending Accounts
Employee Dining Program
Referral Bonus
Online Training Program
Career Development
Corporate Fitness Discount Programs
Choice of Global Cash Card or Direct Deposit
About Us
Beginning as a hot dog cart in New York City’s Madison Square Park, Shake Shack was created by Danny Meyer, Founder and CEO of Union Square Hospitality Group and best-selling author of Setting the Table. Shack Fans lined up daily, making the cart a resounding success, and donating all proceeds back to the park beautification efforts. A permanent stand was eventually built…and the rest is Shack history! With our roots in fine dining and giving back to the community, we are committed to high quality food served with a high level of hospitality. Our team members enjoy a positive work environment that is deeply committed to the philosophy they we "Stand for Something Good.
Shake Shack is an Equal Opportunity Employer
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, creed, age (over 40), disability (mental and physical), sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, gender expression, medical condition, genetic information, marital, military and veteran status.
Our company will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable laws.

JobTitle: Associate Project Manager, Business Operations- REMOTE
Text:
Are you looking for a rewarding career in a collaborative environment passionate about growth? To keep pace with our growing agency we are on the hunt for a savvy Associate Project Manager to join our Business Operations team.

PRECISIONvalue is the top payer marketing agency in the country. We partner with global pharmaceutical and life sciences companies who are developing ground breaking treatments to make medicines accessible and affordable. We excel at demonstrating the economic, clinical, and societal value of creative medical treatments to payers, providers, patients, and policymakers. With us, you will collaborate with teams as we improve market access and support our clients in their mission of improving care for patients around the globe.

About you:
Consider yourself a highly organized, self-starter with an eye for detail and a pulse on the bottom line? Do you flourish in face-paced environments and relish the particulars? If you’re a born problem-solver and enjoy when no day is the same - keep reading. Oh and “process” is your middle name.

You are interested in collaborating with a team of professionals who are encouraging, driven to succeed, and committed to quality contributions crucial to the successful execution of a variety of initiatives. You work passionately, never satisfied with the status quo. You are flexible, able to handle multiple projects at once and do your best work in an energizing environment.

What you can expect day-to-day:
You will be responsible for supporting the day-to-day management of key projects, working with senior leaders within the Business Operations team in ensuring organization, quality, efficiency, and delivery of work. You will implement the pull-through of enhancements and standardization of workflow processes, while coordinating workflow and management of projects with cross-matrix teams.

Essential duties include but are not limited to:
Maintains financial trackers and metrics dashboards
Develops daily/weekly/monthly project management tools including but not limited to; meeting agendas, hot sheets, status reports, timelines, project plans, creative briefs, budget worksheets, contact reports, and meeting re-caps/notes
Manages workflow management platform folder organization and maintenance
Works directly with Finance to open project job codes and tracks time billed to the job/manages the opening and closing of project job codes
Primary note taker during key project meetings, with an eye to helping organize action items and executing next steps communications
Routes projects according to processes and within workflow management platforms
Manage and coordinate meetings for key assignments
Helps prepare slide deck presentations for department team members and senior management

Qualifications :
Minimum 1-3+ years project management experience
Proficiency at least mid-level with Excel
Excellent organizational and prioritization skills and detail oriented
Strong project management and operational skills within the service industry
Ability to problem solve
Basic financial acumen and experience tracking budgets
Self-starter attitude and ability to build a strong rapport and trust with management and resources across multiple functional areas
Ready and willing to understand the various internal and external processes
Excellent communication skills with ability to present effectively to a variety of audiences, foster open communication, listening effectively to others and prepare effective written communications and presentations
Proficiency in Microsoft Office, PowerPoint, Word, Excel, and Adobe Acrobat, etc.
Project management experience within a creative agency preferred
Working knowledge of Smartsheet and/or Microsoft Project

Precision Medicine Group is an integrated team of experts in fields from advanced lab sciences to translational informatics, clinical trial delivery, and regulatory affairs, payer insights to marketing communications. Together, we help our pharmaceutical and life-sciences clients conquer product development and commercialization challenges in a rapidly evolving environment.

JobTitle: Work-study: Diversity, Community Affairs and Equity
Text:
Position Overview:

Work collaboratively with the Office of the Vice President for Diversity & Community Affairs (ODCA) team, including, Vice President for Diversity and Community Affairs, Associate Vice President, Diversity, Community Affairs and Equity, Director Diversity, Community Affairs and Equity the Administrative Manager. Ideal candidates will demonstrate keen interest in diversity, community affairs, equity, and social justice. This is a Federal College Work Study position and employment is contingent upon candidates’ receiving a work study award for the 2021 Spring Semester. The position is virtual while TC classes and administrative operations remain remote.


Responsibilities:

Assist in creating panel discussions, activities, projects, and grant programs that enhance community building and improve civility at Teachers CollegeMaintain confidentiality and displaying excellent judgment is essentialWork collaboratively and supportively with TC community members and departments
Design program flyers and assist in advertisingAssist with programmatic logistical matters as neededDisplay timeliness, excellent organizational skills, initiative and creativity while working under pressure and strict deadlinesRespond remotely during designated work-hoursAttend committee meetings and take notes as neededPrepare comprehensive meeting minutes as neededDemonstrate academic and work professionalism while balancing responsibilitiesResearch assistance and data entry

Preferred Qualifications:
Demonstrated interest and commitment to diversity, community affairs and equitySkilled researcher and interest in Higher Education Compliance matters including but not limited to; Discrimination, Harassment, Title IX, Title VII, and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

This is a Federal College Work Study position and employment is contingent upon candidates’ receiving a work study award for the 2021 Spring Semester.

Interest in DEI matters and demonstrated ability to support research, administrative and programatic requirements of the role
Must have been awarded federal work-study for the term in which a work-study position is being sought.

Must be a student matriculated in a TC degree program.

 Must be taking at least 6 credits (or equivalent, which includes full-time equivalent offerings - HBSK 6480, CCPJ 6480, CCPX 6480, or any 8900 course).

Full-time TC employees are not eligible for this position.

Must be able to abide by the Student Confidentiality Agreement.

Must be able to abide by the Student Privacy Requirements.

Overview:

All who are selected to participate in CFR’s Blavatnik Internship Program and Robina Franklin Williams Internship Program receive training in the field of foreign policy and international affairs as well as skills training in writing, research, program planning and much more.
The Latin America program analyzes the dynamic relationships between the United States and the nations in the Western Hemisphere. Current projects address the causes and effects of widespread phenomena such as democratization, globalization, migration, and economic development on domestic politics, foreign relations, and transnational ties within the Western Hemisphere.
CFR internships are paid, require a 14 - 18 hour commitment, and are filled on a rolling basis.
Spring semester internship opportunities are on a fully remote/virtual basis.
The major responsibilities of this position will include (but are not limited to)::
Research specific areas for blog posts, articles, and other publications, with focus on Latin America, trade, and global supply chains
Conduct research, write memos, analyzing quantitative data, and assisting in writing and editing for fellow’s upcoming book
Collect news articles from U.S. and Latin American newspapers for a weekly news roundup
Assist in logistical support for meetings
Attend general meetings as time permits
Qualifications:
Undergraduate or graduate student with a concentration in International Relations, Economics, or Latin American Studies
Students should have completed the equivalent of four semesters of college coursework (not including AP classes in high school) by the time they begin an internship
Fluency in Spanish (with an emphasis on reading) preferred, Portuguese fluency a plus
STATA R work/internship experience is a plus
Excellent computer skills, including database experience, Microsoft Office Suite, and internet research skills
Strong research, proofreading, and editing skills
About CFR:

Founded in 1921, the Council on Foreign Relations (CFR) is a leading nonprofit membership organization, research center, and publisher, with headquarters in New York, an office in Washington, DC, and programs nationwide. It is dedicated to increasing America's understanding of the world and contributing ideas to U.S. foreign policy. CFR's 5,000+ members are leaders in international affairs and foreign policy. CFR also publishes Foreign Affairs, the preeminent magazine on global issues, and provides up-to-date information about the world and U.S. foreign policy on its award-winning website, CFR.org.
CFR’s Internship Program is made possible through the generous support of the Blavatnik Family Foundation, the Robina Foundation, CFR members, and the family and friends of Franklin Williams.
The Council on Foreign Relations is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Quality, diversity, and balance are the key objectives sought by the Council on Foreign Relations in the composition of its workforce.

JobTitle: Account Coordinator, Cities and Real Estate
Text:
ABOUT BERLINROSEN

Named one of America's best PR agencies by Forbes, BerlinRosen is a leading national public relations and strategic communications firm. BerlinRosen takes a message-first, results-focused approach to communications challenges, delivering high impact media, digital strategy and advertising to top organizations and companies across a variety of industries and sectors.

People of color, people with disabilities and women are strongly encouraged to apply. BerlinRosen is committed to building and maintaining a diverse staff, and recognizes that its continued success depends on hiring and retaining high-quality creative professionals with a variety of backgrounds and experiences. Opportunities for advancement exist, and we are committed to helping all staff develop and grow.

ABOUT THE CITIES AND REAL ESTATE TEAM

Our Cities & Real Estate practice helps visionary companies in real estate, infrastructure, affordable housing, hospitality, architecture and design who are shaping the future of cities.

We are working on some of the most notable development, transportation and infrastructure projects in NYC and around the country, including Wythe Hotel, One Vanderbilt, the World Trade Center complex, the Virginia Tech Innovation Campus and Domino Park and support some of the biggest names in the industry, including Brookfield, SL Green, Oxford Properties, Waterfront Alliance and New York Building Congress.

With a team of over 25 communications professionals, we bring a unique campaign-style approach to strategic communications, combining expert strategy and nimble execution with the creativity and speed of a startup.

We are news junkies, publicists, urbanites, former campaigners, journalists, government and policy pros, and expert communications professionals obsessed with developing the future of major cities.

Now, we are looking for an Account Coordinator to join our team.

ABOUT THIS ROLE

This position provides a unique opportunity to begin building a career with a talented and motivated team working on an exciting mix of projects and issues facing the future of New York and cities around the country. You will support a variety of strategic communications plans by owning media relations, project management and writing tasks. The position is ideal for candidates with internship or other relevant experience in strategic communications, journalism, real estate, or government. Excellent writing and organizational skills are a must.

Note: BerlinRosen's offices are currently closed and our teams are working from home. This role may require presence in New York, NY prior to our offices reopening, depending on client needs.

ACCOUNTABILITIES

As an Account Coordinator on the Cities & Real Estate team, you will...

Implement strategy and campaign planning for multiple high-profile accounts
Pitch and place media stories across local, regional and national outlets
Write and edit persuasive external and internal documents such as press releases, op-eds, fact sheets, talking points, editorial board memos, and communications plans
Oversee day-to-day communications with clients, including staffing weekly calls, developing press recaps and participating in crisis communications, as necessary
Manage work streams across multiple accounts and focus areas, including public affairs, corporate communications and hospitality / lifestyle

OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE HAS...

Internship or other relevant experience in strategic communications
Interest in PR around urbanism and cities, including for NYC Real Estate companies
Ability to communicate clearly and effectively, both orally and in writing
Attention to detail
Ability to handle multiple assignments at once, work quickly, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Ability to work with a team to meet group objectives
Excellent writing skills are a must
A sense of humor!

WORKING AT BERLINROSEN

BerlinRosen will make sure that you have what you need to excel in your role, including:

A positive and supportive team with opportunities for advancement committed to helping all staff develop and grow
A competitive salary based on leading market rates
100% coverage of Health, Dental, and Vision insurance monthly premiums
Company Sponsored Health Reimbursement Arrangement (HRA)
Flexible Spending Account (FSA)
401K with a 4% employer match with no vesting period
Generous paid time off in which we encourage staff to take sufficient time for self-care
10 paid bank holidays
Pre-tax commuter benefits via WageWorks
Mobile Phone Reimbursement
A stipend to support your work-from-home setup

Claims Related Roles - (Claims Examiner, Claims SME, Claims Auditor, Benefits Tester)Centivo is a new type of health plan for self-funded employers that is built to save 15 percent or more compared to traditional insurance carriers and is easy to use for employers and employees.Centivo’s mission is to bring lower cost, higher quality healthcare to the millions of working Americans who struggle to pay their healthcare bills. With Centivo, employers can offer their employees affordable and predictable costs, a high-tech member experience, exceptional service, and a range of benefit options including both traditional and proprietary networks. Centivo develops high-value networks in partnership with leading local healthcare providers and uses data analytics to refine the network and navigate members to the right providers. Members get a partner for all their healthcare needs through a primary care-centered model, as well as expanded access and fully integrated virtual care.With offices in New York City, Buffalo, NY and Stamford, CT, Centivo is backed by leading investors including B Capital Group, Bain Capital Ventures, Bessemer Venture Partners, Company Ventures, Define Ventures, F-Prime Capital, HarbourVest Partners, Ingleside Investors, Maverick Ventures, Nassau Street Ventures (an AVG fund), Oxeon Investments, and Rand Capital. Learn more at Centivo.com.Summary of Claims Related RolesWithin Centivo, we have multiple roles for those with experiences with health claims processing for our self-funded employer groups. Healthcare providers treat patients, then file medical claims to receive payment from the patient’s Benefit Plan.Focus Areas & Essential Duties: Benefits Testers ensure that the claims system is properly configured to process and adjudicate claims. Collaborating with the Subject Matter Expert (SME) on all aspects of functionality of the Javelina system. Assist with version and upgrade testing of Javelina and work with cross-functional teams to ensure quality of new releases. Ability to document and troubleshoot issues.Claim Examiners review, assess and adjudicate claims in assigned work queues based on Centivo’s written Policies and Procedures and the terms of Plan Documents for Centivo’s clients. ultimately remitting payment to the doctor on behalf of the Plan if a claim is covered by the patient’s Benefit Plan or generating correspondence to participants and providers if a claim is denied.Senior Claims Examiners review and assess complex claims, facilitate cost management review with external vendors for specialized claim needs. Manage claims appeals, overpayments, refunds, invoicing reconciliation with vendors, support and perform claims auditing as well as evaluating our auto-adjudication results for plan improvements. May also be called upon to coach and mentor less experienced staff.Claims Auditors quality review and auditing of pre-payment claims, post-payment random claims, targeted claims, high dollar claims, and any other claim or record that requires quality review to determine the claim accuracy. This includes handling all aspects of the Claims’ Quality Review program, as well as, providing the Claims’ department with technical and analytical support. Also responsible to partner with the training in development of policies and procedures.Claims SMEs review benefits grids of new clients against SPDs for accurate interpretation and application of benefits, serve as liaison for system testing needs for implementations and upgrades, assist in development of policies and procedures, support remediation of claim issues including supporting other departments with research and resolution. Also, responsible to manage the subrogation recovery process with Phia group, and work claims that stop for system exceptions for evaluation of auto adjudication improvements.All of the above roles need to be knowledgeable about health care claims, medical coding and rules applicable to Benefit Plans. Problem solving skills are essential.These roles all work closely with each other and across Operations to ensure that claims received by Centivo are adjudicated in a timely manner and accurately.Location: There is a preference for these roles to be geographically close to our Buffalo, NY office, with flexibility for work from home. Fully remote will also be considered for strong candidates.Candidate Qualifications: Education and Experience: Minimum 3 years of Claims Processing Experience with self-funded health care plans for Claims Examiner roles, with additional experience required for the other roles.Prior experience with the Javelina (Eldorado Computing Inc.) system or another highly automated and integrated claim adjudication platform.Experience in a fast-paced production environment with goals and deadlinesDemonstrated ability to handle multiple assignments competently, accurately, and efficientlyHigh School Diploma or GED required, associates or bachelor’s degree preferredKnowledge, Skills & Abilities: Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of benefit administration for self-funded healthcare plansStrong knowledge of benefit plans, policies, and procedures, understanding of medical terminologyStrong organizational and interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate effectively with others and can read and understand various forms, documentation, files, and information within the departmentAbility to work under limited supervision and provide guidance and coaching to othersAttention to details, organized, quality and productivity drivenThe above knowledge, skills and abilities are the minimum requirements for Claims Examiner roles, with additional experience required for the other roles.Candidates may be asked to complete a Knowledge Assessment during the interview process. If a Knowledge Assessment is required, candidates must successfully pass that Assessment to be considered.Job Type: Full-time

Overview:

All who are selected to participate in CFR’s Blavatnik Internship Program and Robina Franklin Williams Internship Program receive training in the field of foreign policy and international affairs as well as skills training in writing, research, program planning and much more.

Founded in 1921, the Council on Foreign Relations (CFR) is a leading nonprofit membership organization, research center, and publisher, with headquarters in New York, an office in Washington, DC, and programs nationwide. As a Strategic Program Manager here at Snappy, your job will be to coordinate people and processes to ensure that some of our most high-priority projects are delivered on time and produce the desired results. We're looking for an über organized and creative-thinking individual to manage our top strategic program across multiple teams while owning all client requests, reports, and projects. You'll also need to be a stellar communicator because you'll be working closely with leadership, including our CEO to deliver timely results on high visibility client projects. This is an exciting opportunity to take a central role in our largest and most strategic program here at Snappy!

You will:

Facilitate the planning of projects, define project tasks and resource requirements, and track the status of deliverables and any decisions made regarding scope changes and outstanding issues
Schedule and lead project-related meetings and calls with internal teams and clients
Own all communication across relevant stakeholders
Develop a detailed project plan to track progress
Measure project performance using appropriate systems, tools and techniques
Ensure that all projects are delivered on-time and within scope
Pull and analyze data to generate reports and insights on a weekly basis
Report and escalate to management as needed

You have:

2-5 years of experience working with clients and/or professional services
Top-notch excel skills including data interpretation, data analysis, gain insights, formulas, etc.
2-3 years of experience in process management
A solid technical background
Stellar written and verbal communication skills
Extraordinary organizational skills
A strong working knowledge of Google suite products
The ability to "influence without authority"

You are:

A team player
A top-notch problem-solver
Eloquent and efficient in your communication, both client-facing and internally
Fearless in the face of exciting challenges

Snappy is an award-winning all-in-one enterprise gifting platform. We're reinventing the way companies express appreciation to their employees by offering a fun and interactive digital experience that lets employees choose a gift they actually love. We specialize in building recognition programs for all sorts of businesses - Zoom, Salesforce, Microsoft, Uber, Deloitte and over 800 more. Plus, we're growing everyday - 400% YOY, if you want to get technical! We've seen firsthand that our experience boosts morale, improves performance, and (most importantly!) spreads joy.

Of course, we practice what we preach! Here at Snappy, we believe wholeheartedly in building a culture of appreciation, dedication, and fun! We offer all sorts of benefits and perks to our employees including but not limited to: Free healthcare including vision and dental and a generous 401k match, unlimited PTO and paid family leave, Snappy Summer Fridays (which we actually enjoy year around!), snacks and lunches delivered to your home while we're working remotely, and Snappy gifts galore!

About CFR:

Founded in 1921, the Council on Foreign Relations (CFR) is a leading nonprofit membership organization, research center, and publisher, with headquarters in New York, an office in Washington, DC, and programs nationwide. It is dedicated to increasing America's understanding of the world and contributing ideas to U.S. foreign policy. CFR's 5,000+ members are leaders in international affairs and foreign policy. CFR also publishes Foreign Affairs, the preeminent magazine on global issues, and provides up-to-date information about the world and U.S. foreign policy on its award-winning website, CFR.org.

Our Story
WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others. The organization also includes Xandr’s suite of advanced advertising solutions designed to help to improve advertising for brands, publishers, and consumers.
Xandr is a technology platform powering one of the largest global Advanced TV and Video advertising marketplaces in the industry. For more than a decade, our data insights, premium content, powerful technology, and scaled direct-to-consumer distribution have given us a competitive edge — leading us to improving advertising for all brands, publishers, and consumers.
How do we do this? With talented, passionate people like you! We bring together people from diverse backgrounds and give them an opportunity to bring their ideas to life.
The Job
Engineering is at the core of what we do at Xandr. Our Software Engineers play a pivotal role in developing, improving, and scaling our online advertising technology platform. Our software is complex, massively scaled, and built with a wide variety of languages and tools, lending itself to the most exciting and challenging technical problems.
We seek an intern with experience in software design and development who is looking to gain exciting real-world software engineering experience at a thriving company.
The Daily
This program will have our interns work side-by-side, virtually this year, with the team’s software engineers while we develop new features and functionality for our clients and business partners. They will be a contributing part of all our team’s daily status and weekly planning meetings, along with any design and problem-solving activities the team conducts.
We frequently work in small teams to solve problems, explore new technologies, and learn from one another. The ideal intern for this environment will be enthusiastic and collaborative and has a sincere desire for learning and growth.
The Essentials
You are a currently enrolled student with a BA/BS or Master’s degree expected in December 2021 or Spring 2022 in Computer Science, Math, Engineering or a related field
You are familiar with Computer Science fundamentals with regards to data structures, algorithms, and time complexity
You have foundational knowledge of programming languages (such as Python, and/or R, and/or SQL) and various operating systems (Linux, Mac, Windows)
You are passionate about a culture of learning and teaching. You love challenging yourself to constantly improve, and sharing your knowledge to empower others
You like to take risks when looking for novel solutions to complex problems. If faced with roadblocks, you continue to reach higher to make greatness happen
You care about solving big, systemic problems. You look beyond the surface to understand root causes so that you can build long-term solutions for the whole ecosystem
You believe in not only serving customers, but also empowering them by providing knowledge and tools
Internship Program
Students must apply by the application deadline on February 26.
Students must be currently enrolled in a college degree program for full duration of the internship
Summer 2021 program dates are June 7th - August 13th; must be available for full program duration
Must be able to accommodate full-time schedule (40 hours/week) for full program duration
Fully remote/virtual experience; company owned laptop provided for the duration of the internship program
Salary based on office location; relocation is not provided
The Perks
Hands-on work with passionate, talented team members in your field
Networking opportunities with industry-leading professionals
Engaging events including executive speakers sessions, professional development workshops, and more
Warner Media, LLC and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

Make an impact as an IT Support Technician at Union Square Hospitality Group!

Founded by CEO Danny Meyer with the opening of Union Square Cafe in 1985, Union Square Hospitality Group has created some of New York's most beloved restaurants, cafes, and bars such as Gramercy Tavern, Maialino, The Modern, Marta, and Porchlight to name a few!

The IT Technician positions will have responsibility for providing support to all home office and in-restaurant technology, including but not limited to, network troubleshooting, end user support, PC configuration, and new technology implementations. They will be aware of networking, firewall configurations, and restaurant technology troubleshooting. This is a “hands-on” position requiring solid technical skills, as well as excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
They will be expected to build strong relationships with the business staff and management while collaborating with other technology staff and groups to provide support and knowledge to users. This is a client-facing role, which will have daily interaction with USHG staff across all businesses including senior and executive management.

Responsibilities

Provide support in person and by phone, including software, hardware, printers, peripherals, audio visual, wired and wireless network troubleshooting.
Image, configure and deploy Windows and Apple workstations and laptops.
Configure and troubleshoot applications and equipment such as O365, Active Directory, VMs, VoIP phones, Remote Desktop services, iPhone and Android based cellphones and mobile devices.
Provide training and education for end users, including security best practices.

Education and Experience Qualifications

BS/BA degree in IT or related field preferred; equivalent experience may be substituted in lieu of education
3+ years of experience as a systems analyst in a complex technical environment, supporting retail and/or restaurant applications

Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Technical support on multiple HW platforms (HP, DELL, Apple, Lenovo)
Familiar with Microsoft Windows and Mac OS X
Experience using and troubleshooting end-user systems, hardware & software (Microsoft Office 365, Printers, laptops/desktops, Phone Systems, etc.)
Experience creating/disabling/updating user accounts in Active Directory
Experience creating email accounts/inboxes in Exchange/Office365.
Networking knowledge (TCP/IP) related to end user devices such as computers, printers, phones, etc.
Analysis and logical thinking ability
Ability to handle complex calls by analyzing problems and skillfully interacting with co-workers, managers and Executives
Ability to take initiative and work independently with minimum supervision
Detailed and thorough when creating and maintaining documentation
Ability to organize and plan work independently
Ability to work in a rapidly changing environment
All other related and/or additional responsibilities that may be required or assigned
Lift and carry computer equipment weighing up to 50 pounds and move equipment under desks

Qualifications: Google Analytics: 2 years (Preferred)Google AdWords: 3 years (Preferred)Managing a team: 1 year (Preferred)Digital marketing agency: 1 year (Preferred)
Text: WHAT YOU’LL DOCOACH | A manager at CTC is a coach to their direct reports. As PSeM, you are an extra set of eyes, ears, and hands across all accounts their Paid Search Buyer’s (PSeB) build and buy for. A sounding board for strategy and creativity, offering advice on when and how to scale. Moreover, how to scale effectively and efficiently. This means you are constantly looking for ways to make our PSeB's better. Testing new methods, challenging the status quo, and finding inspiration in building and buying to fuel our PSeB's drive.TRAIN | There is a general way of doing things and then there is the "CTC way." As the PSeM, we're depending on and trusting you to build up and bring out the knowledge, skills and abilities our PSeB’s will need to be successful here at CTC. This directly goes back to the PSeM being in service and support of the PSeBs. You cultivate an ecosystem of learning around creative testing, platform challenges, and workflow management. PSeMs train the PSeB’s to actively be part of the solution to their overall Growth Team's success, ADmission members and Expert Buyer clients.INNOVATE | The PSeM finds ways of expanding platform tools and features across all paid search channels as the driving force to keep CTC on the cutting edge. Search platforms are constantly evolving. That means that staying on top of updates and understanding root cause effects and chain reactions will become your middle name. Taking that one step further, it is your job to educate your PSeB’s (and the rest of CTC) on your keen understanding of cutting edge updates.WHAT SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE Success in Your Day to Day Looks LikeThe PSeM supplies the PSeB’s with the tools, training and insight to drive the best results. They are a consistent support to the buyers and come alongside them in the problems they face while at the same time challenging the PSeB’s to think outside the box and break “foam” walls.The PSeM fosters a culture of continuing growth and collaboration. They encourage the sharing of new learnings, tactics, and resources among the PSeBs and proudly celebrate the wins when they occur. The PSeM finds creative ways to keep the PSeB’s engaged and motivated in a remote environment.The PSeM is liaison between the various CTC departments and the Paid Search Buyers. They work with other department heads to implement company-wide strategies or systems. They are also the voice for the PSeB’s as they communicate with executive management on the challenges and opportunities that they see within the PSeB’s ecosystem.Success in Your First Three to Six Months Looks LikeThe PSeM brings learnings to the entire company and is the leader in paid search strategy. The PSeM is a public voice that not only shares learnings with the company but with other relevant communities helping maintain CTC’s position as a thought leader. The PSeM creates easily digestible learnings for people to share with clients and is always on the forefront of new tactics and strategies.The PSeM is always on the lookout to hire talented buyers and ensure that Growth Teams have buyers they need. They also assist in creating a smooth onboarding process for new PSeBs and set clear expectations of what success in the role looks like.WHAT YOU’LL BRING TO THE TABLE3 + years experience in building and buying Google Ads, preferred.1 + years experience working in a digital marketing agency, preferred.1 + years experience managing a team of talented, driven, and eager to learn individuals, preferred.Proven ability to influence teams and collaborate effectively.Competence in Asana, Google Docs, Google Sheets, Google Drive and Dropbox.Competence and/or experience in Google Analytics, preferred.Perception and understanding when it comes to navigating human relationships, especially when it comes to building trust and effectiveness across teams.Demonstrated ability to assess and resolve challenges independently through good judgement, deliberation, decisiveness, and ability to provide guidance to others.Must have a unique combination of humility (willing to do the dirty work) and ambition (vision for what your future holds).Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.Ability to organize, prioritize and manage multiple tasks with great attention to detail.Ability to complete short-term and long-term goals in a proper manner.An insatiable curiosity, and an inability to leave a problem alone until you’ve found one or many different potential solutions.A desire to take risks - but only after carefully examining the calculus and determining that your chosen course of action is most effective.ABOUT US*We’re storytellers, buyers, builders, designers, coaches, partners, leaders, entrepreneurs of our own lives, and in our hearts, we at the Common Thread Collective (CTC), are dreamers.With an untraditional take on marketing, CTC is an ecommerce growth agency helping entrepreneurs of all stripes achieve their dreams.A job is a job is a job. At CTC we don’t hire you for a job. We believe careers are a catalyst for your future self — because we’re not just interested in who you are, but in who you want to be. Come sell stuff online, tell stories, build websites, shape brands, create processes, scale accounts, and help fellow entrepreneurs turn their dreams into reality.We’ll come alongside you and care for you in your pursuits by offering full-time CTC entrepreneurs:Full health, dental, and vision benefits that fit your lifestyle and goals401k program with a 3% company match (post 90 days employment) to bring out the investor inside you4 weeks of paid time off on top of Holidays, your Birthday, and the week of Christmas paid. Go get your R&R on so when you’re at CTC you’re firing on all cylindersA wellness reimbursement program that inspires 360 degrees of health: mentally, physically, and spirituallyAccess to our Tell Me Your Dreams (TMYD) program where you explore life beyond what’s in front of you with a certified mental health coach. Maybe you’ll dream for the first time, we’re here for it. To top it off, if you opt in, we provide you with resources to realize your dreams through our Dream Fund**To be considered, please provide us with a cover letter on why you are interested in working at Common Thread Collective along with your resume*Job Type: Full-timeExperience:Google Analytics: 2 years (Preferred)Google AdWords: 3 years (Preferred)Managing a team: 1 year (Preferred)Digital marketing agency: 1 year (Preferred)

Text: Company Name:  Remote OwlWebsite:  www.remoteowls.comLocation:  Cairo, EgyptAbout Us: We have been around Since 2018, we are located in Cairo, Egypt.We have essentially been working with small to mid-size real estate businesses in USA Providing a variety of different services.And currently, we have about 80 Clients and have a staff of 320 Employees, a steady funnel of new Clients & Fresh Applicants Ready to JoinBut as of now, we are looking to expand our portfolio and branch out to different Industries. Because Prior to finding our success in The real-estate field we have worked in more than one industry such as Customer Service and Medical BillingAnd now what we are looking forward to Building a path for us to come back to Projects That we are not just good at executing but actually projects we are passionate about.That is our strongest Suit and that is why we started this opportunity.We are looking for someone that can see the value Proposition and see the extent of our expertise and services and Pitch for us. Help us get our foot in the door where we can have a Conversation with Prospects because we can Provide Corporate Level Services at less than the minimum wage Rate.but at this point, it’s a matter of Would this be something you are interested to be a part of?Job Description: You will be responsible for full lifecycle sales efforts, from Identifying potential clients to the initial call through contract execution. This role requires a background in the Healthcare industry and Revenue Cycle Management or B2B Sales.We are looking for someone with industry knowledge, strong communication skills, excellent problem-solving skills, as well as the ability to start, develop, and nurture relationships.Technical acumen is essential to the success of this role. This role can be located anywhere in the United States.Having a pre-existing and established network in the Healthcare industry is a BIG PLUS.Payout Structure: This is commission-based pay.Per client, you will receive a cut of the profit (after expenses) on monthly basis as long as the client’s account is active.After successfully signing the first 5 clients you receive an extra bonus of $2000.Afterward a $3000 bonus for every 10 clients.*This is would be a contract-based job*Key Strategic Objectives: Generate leads through professional networking and cold calling techniquesInitiate and build prospect relationshipsAbility to understand unique prospect needs within the context of the healthcare industry and effectively communicate the value propositionCoordinate and schedule online and onsite meetings of key decision-makers (If need be)Develop prospect account strategy and planTrack record demonstrating strong “closing” skills and revenue growthMonitor customer, market, and competitor activity and provide feedback to the company leadership team and other company functionsManage key customer relationships and participate in closing strategic opportunitiesTravel for in-person meetings with customers and partners and to develop key relationships (If need be)Experience Requirements: 1+ year B2B sales experience; proven ability to identify and develop new business with prospects and existing accounts, build/maintain relationships with the decision-makersExperience in selling platforms and services.Demonstrated record of success at both large, complex organizations and in mid-sized environments is a plus.Part-time hours: 20-40 per weekJob Types: Full-time, Part-time, CommissionSalary: From $2,000.00 per monthWork Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

Are you looking to use your skills for good? Ellevate Network is the leading community for professional women committed to helping each other succeed. This is a rare opportunity to gain broad experience at a tight-knit growing company that's passionate about social change.We are looking for a full-time Enterprise Account Associate to join our New York City team. We strongly value diverse perspectives and care deeply about building a positive work environment; each of our small teams operates with a high level of flexibility, autonomy, and ownership for our path forward.As an Enterprise Account Associate, you will be on the front-line, supporting our global community of professional women, you will be responsible for corporate partner retention, driving customer satisfaction, leading post-sales efforts including customer onboarding, driving user engagement and satisfaction, and identifying upsell opportunities.We’re looking for someone passionate about creating change in the world of business. You’re right for the position if you’re a problem-solver, a self-starter, collaborative, organized, and have strong communication skills. Experience in client relations or community management is a must.What to expect in this role: You’ll join a small, collaborative, tight-knit B Corp with a big mission: equality for all.You’ll have a high level of responsibility and ownership over impactful projects.You'll have direct access to our leadership team, with open lines of communication to discuss the role you play in our growing business.You’ll receive competitive benefits, like flexible work hours and locations, unlimited vacation time, 401(k) matching, generous parental leave, time off to volunteer, a wellness stipend, and more.You'll receive full access to Ellevate Network’s resources, speakers, events, and content.If working from the NYC area, you’ll attend and assist at all-hands-on-deck Ellevate events in NYC once live events resume after the pandemic. These happen a few times per quarter, after work on weekdays; we adjust our flexible hours on other days to account for these longer evenings.Your responsibilities will include: El(l)evate the overall client experience.Operate as the lead point of contact for any and all matters specific to assigned corporate partners.Drive engagement of the Ellevate partnership. You’re our champion. You’ll develop strong, long-lasting relationships as a trusted advisor.Oversee the onboarding experience and training for new clients, and then work with them to ensure they are leveraging the partnership effectively and using best practices.Liaise with Ellevate HQ and Global Chapters leaders.Track and report on client health, as well as proactively identifying engagement trends in order to uncover renewal risks and identify areas of upsell opportunities.Ensure all partnerships are meeting clients’ needs and objectives.Provide a world-class support experience by handling clients with grace and confidenceWorking interdepartmentally with our marketing, membership, product, and tech teams to communicate customer feedback and collaboratively improve our product and service.Invest heavily in the team, grow and find success in the job by learning from one another’s experiences, and actively work to improve.Who will be successful in this role?You're collaborative - able to work independently or on a team.You're quick on your feet - you know when to be scrappy and when to invest and stop cutting corners.You're an effective communicator with team members and external users. You enjoy working with a variety of different personalities and with people from different backgrounds-- from young professionals to C-suite executives.You’re flexible, patient, and able to adapt to a changing environment.You're persevering and excited to contribute to our mission.You can present in an effective, actionable, and confident manner.You strongly believe that diversity is an asset.You consider yourself energetic, self-motivated, detail-oriented, and enthusiastic, with strong interpersonal skills and high emotional intelligence.We’re looking for someone with: 2+ years in relationship building or a client facing role like Client Services or Account Management.High proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Powerpoint), Canva, and Keynote.Experience working with Salesforce, Zoho or other CRM and marketing software.Experience dealing with multiple issues at a time, excellent time management, and prioritization skills.Excellent written and oral communications skills.Solid organizational and time management skills, detail oriented.A patient and professional demeanor, positive attitude.Benefits of Working at Ellevate: Flexible Work Hours & Locations. While we are based in Manhattan and plan to return to our office there after the pandemic, we will hire remotely for the right candidate.Unlimited Vacation Time.Health, vision, and dental insurance.Parental leave policy.Retirement savings plan (401k).Time off to volunteer.Annual wellness reimbursement.Access to Ellevate’s resources, speakers, events, and content.At Ellevate Network we believe that there is power in diversity. We value different perspectives and recognize that they help us grow.Ellevate Network is an equal opportunity employer and as such recruits, trains, compensates and promotes regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.Job Type: Full-timeBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceDisability insuranceEmployee assistance programFlexible scheduleFlexible spending accountHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offParental leaveVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftDay shiftMonday to FridayCOVID-19 considerations:We are fully remote until vaccines are widely accessible, and will be thorough about following public health guidelines when we return to our office in Manhattan. Text: COMPANY OVERVIEW: Helping brands maximize their advertising results with a unique combination of mobile ads and technology. Movia installs tracking and Wi-Fi collecting devices onto trucks acting as moving billboards, offering real-time impression analytics and retargeting opportunities. Brands can view their real-time dashboard to see when where and who saw their message and track their ROI. They can then build relevant audiences and reach them again on their mobile devices, increasing overall effectiveness far beyond what traditional OOH can offer.ABOUT THE POSITION: The Business Development Representative (BDR) is an entry/mid-level role for those who want to get started in Media and Saas SalesReporting to the Director of Business Development, you will work closely with the entire Sales and Marketing teams and be responsible for generating and qualifying business with prospective clients. As the first point of contact for potential customers, your enthusiasm for the Movia and the ability to share relevant customer success stories is essential in every interaction you create. Focusing on a defined list of ideal customers, you will introduce Movia to prospective clients and identify high-quality sales opportunities.IF YOU ENJOY: Learning from the best. Our leaders support us, develop us and help us become our best. Our open door and transparent culture nurtures everyone to build their career and develop their skills.Working in a modern workplace. We are fast-paced, constantly evolving, and flexible to change. We love our work, but we also love our lives outside of work and Movia supports this balance.Collaborating. We believe our ideas are better together and we encourage trust, respect, and authenticity to support each other. Movia collectively celebrates successes and learns from each other to be even better.Being Bold. If you like to challenge convention and be tenacious in the face of uncertainty, Movia is the place to balance never giving up but respecting when to let go.Getting It Done. We work hard through perseverance and taking ownership, but because of our phenomenal positive attitude, we ALWAYS have fun along the way.YOU’LL BE SUCCESSFUL AT: Connecting with prospective clients, asking questions, understanding their needs and clearly communicating the Movia brand.Gaining a deep understanding of our customer base in order to share relevant success stories with prospective clients.Plunging headfirst into industry research to build relationships, generate awareness of Movia and engage with prospects.Gaining an excessive understanding of the Movia platform and our amazing client testimonies and use this information to engage prospective clients.Collaborating with our internal gurus, mentors and team members on marketing campaigns, such as trade shows, webinars, website visits, and referral inquiries.Using the latest sales and marketing tools and modern social media approaches to connect with strategically determined accounts.And of course, there will be other duties that support Movia and further build your skills.BECAUSE YOU BRING: University degree or College diploma (background in a business or related program is preferred).Experience in a sales environment or a desire to be exceptional at prospecting sales opportunities.Confidence to converse with senior decision-makers.A passion to learn Movia and target specific market segments.A ferocious appetite to meet daily activity targets with our Marketing and Sales teams.A natural ability to effectively communicate over the phone, email or other forums that demonstrate your positivity, creativity, and purpose.The desire to learn from others and independently solve problems with ambition and energy.A team spirit that wants to be part of something great!WHO WE ARE: We believe that a great attitude leads to great results, and are looking for people who are bold, tenacious, like to have fun and get it done. We’ve been recognized as a Great Place to Work and we’re proud of the numerous awards won for workplace culture and technology innovation.Application deadline: 2021-02-19Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $40,000.00 - $300,000.00 per yearBenefits:Flexible scheduleSchedule:Monday to FridayExperience:sales: 2 years (Preferred)customer service: 2 years (Preferred)Media Sales: 2 years (Preferred)Language:English (Required)Work Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

Overview:

All who are selected to participate in CFR’s Blavatnik Internship Program and Robina Franklin Williams Internship Program receive training in the field of foreign policy and international affairs as well as skills training in writing, research, program planning and much more.
Russia Studies team focuses on U.S.- Russian relations and current affairs across the former Soviet Union. The intern will deepen their understanding of the current and historical trends between the two countries. They will gain a strong skill set on policy-related research and editing skills.
CFR internships are paid, require a 14 - 18 hour commitment, and are filled on a rolling basis.
Spring semester internship opportunities are on a fully remote/virtual basis.
The major responsibilities of this position will include (but are not limited to)::
Perform data analysis and collecting archival materials on Russia
Conduct research and collecting archival documents for fellow's book project
Track weekly news report that are relevant to the assignment
Qualifications:
Undergraduate or graduate student studing international relations, Russia/ East European/ Eurasian area studies, or a related field
Students should have completed the equivalent of four semesters of college coursework (not including Ap classes in high school) by the time they begin an internship
Russian proficiency (reading)
Strong written, oral, and organizational skills
Microsoft Office and Internet research skills
About CFR:

Founded in 1921, the Council on Foreign Relations (CFR) is a leading nonprofit membership organization, research center, and publisher, with headquarters in New York, an office in Washington, DC, and programs nationwide. It is dedicated to increasing America's understanding of the world and contributing ideas to U.S. foreign policy. CFR's 5,000+ members are leaders in international affairs and foreign policy. CFR also publishes Foreign Affairs, the preeminent magazine on global issues, and provides up-to-date information about the world and U.S. foreign policy on its award-winning website, CFR.org.
CFR’s Internship Program is made possible through the generous support of the Blavatnik Family Foundation, the Robina Foundation, CFR members, and the family and friends of Franklin Williams.
The Council on Foreign Relations is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Quality, diversity, and balance are the key objectives sought by the Council on Foreign Relations in the composition of its workforce.

Overview:

All who are selected to participate in CFR’s Blavatnik Internship Program and Robina Franklin Williams Internship Program receive training in the field of foreign policy and international affairs as well as skills training in writing, research, program planning and much more.
The Council has an internship available in the Studies Department. The intern will assist the research associate and fellow with research, editing, and administrative tasks. The intern will gain firsthand experience with the tools scholars use to analyze U.S. foreign policy and its implications.
CFR internships are paid, require a 14 - 18 hour commitment, and are filled on a rolling basis.
Spring semester internship opportunities are on a fully remote/virtual basis.
The major responsibilities of this position will include (but are not limited to)::
Research issues related to current U.S. foreign policy, including world order, grand strategy, U.S.-Russia and U.S.-China relations, and geo-economics, contributing directly to the substance of study group meetings, as well as publications of the fellow
Assist with writing and editing content, including research memorandas and briefs as needed
Assist in logistical support as needed, including but not limited to coordination of study groups and meetings
Qualifications:
Undergraduate or graduate student with concentration in international relations or related field
Students should have completed the equivalent of four semester of college coursework (not including AP classes in high school) by the time they begin an internship
Strong research and writing skills
Excellent attention to detail
Strong Microsoft Office skills
Mandarin, Russian language proficiency preferred, but not required
About CFR:

Founded in 1921, the Council on Foreign Relations (CFR) is a leading nonprofit membership organization, research center, and publisher, with headquarters in New York, an office in Washington, DC, and programs nationwide. It is dedicated to increasing America's understanding of the world and contributing ideas to U.S. foreign policy. CFR's 5,000+ members are leaders in international affairs and foreign policy. CFR also publishes Foreign Affairs, the preeminent magazine on global issues, and provides up-to-date information about the world and U.S. foreign policy on its award-winning website, CFR.org.
CFR’s Internship Program is made possible through the generous support of the Blavatnik Family Foundation, the Robina Foundation, CFR members, and the family and friends of Franklin Williams.
The Council on Foreign Relations is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Quality, diversity, and balance are the key objectives sought by the Council on Foreign Relations in the composition of its workforce.

Sales Account Manager Urban Holiday is currently seeking a Retail Sales Account Manager to join our team. We are a year-round design and display firm with a strong focus on the Christmas season. Univision is seeking a talented Brand Strategist based remotely. The successful candidate must provide ideation and development of branded content sales solutions to better serve advertising clients and to support the growth of Univision Local Digital business, with particular focus in branded content and social media.
Job Responsibilities
Assist Creative Lead in ideation process: Kickoff and development of campaign concept, Playbook creation.
Work in conjunction with the Univision Editorial and Radio teams to identify 360 and digital first sales opportunities and package for sellers to take to market.
Assist Creative Lead in collaborating with Network DIG team, Partners Solutions Group and Local Sales Leaders to maximize the commercial value of tent poles and prime time tv programming for local audiences and clients.
Oversee production of video and graphic content, including: vetting and leading production team. Managing content creation and approvals process.
Work with Account Managers to project manage productions from beginning to end, ensuring timely delivery of content for client approval, and identifying opportunities for optimization in campaign.
Create meaningful visual communications that tell a compelling and concise story to help sell through client solutions and drive sales.
Analyze trends in social media, experiential, and emerging platforms and technologies, to make relevant recommendations to the management team.
Required Skills & Experience
Expert in social media platforms and keeping up with the latest updates and offerings.
Expert in ideation and concept development. Ability to lead the creative ideation process from pitch, all the way to production, and recap.
Ability to ideate in 360 – digital and social media heavy, intertwining TV and radio elements.
Experience managing productions and working with third party producers.
Experience with project management, including building timelines, overseeing production deliverables, managing client deadlines, and related tasks.
Must be willing to work on nights, weekends and holidays as needed.
Excellent in both written and oral English skills and Spanish skills
Desired Skills & Experience
Five (5) years minimum experience with strategic brainstorming, campaign development, creative brief development and creative execution.
Seven (7) years minimum of social media and digital content experience, including growing social media audiences and driving deep engagement.
Experience visually translating clients’ goals and objectives into actionable and measurable digital marketing programs that align with offerings.
Experience analyzing social media metrics and paid strategy effectively to drive results.
Spanish and English language fluency required, (must be native/business level), both written and oral.
Project management skills and understanding how to manage the priorities of multiple stakeholders in a complex environment and focus on the delivery of results in the form of engagement, leads and sales.
Ability to work effectively across functions (creative, operations, sales), display executive presence, and communicate recommendations clearly and persuasively.
Must have excellent and proven relationship-building, written and oral presentation skills.
Candidate must be motivated, disciplined, flexible, and be able to work both autonomously and as part of a team.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity
Proficiency in Power Point, Excel, etc.
Strong organizational, detail, problem-solving, follow-up skills.
Results-focused, with the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics.
Eligibility Requirements
Must be willing to work remotely.
Employment/education will be verified.
Must be willing to submit to a background investigation.
Must have unrestricted authorization to work in the United States.

As the only global provider of commercial solutions, IQVIA understands what it takes to deliver nationally and internationally. Our people help biopharma get their medicines to the people who need them. We help customers gain insight and access to their markets and ultimately demonstrate their product's value to payers, physicians and patients. A significant part of our business is acting as the biopharma's sales force to physicians or, providing therapy area educational input to physicians and patients. With the right experience, you can help deliver medical breakthroughs in the real world.
Virtual Sales Professional – Cardiology
IQVIA is looking for high performing, results-oriented sales professional with a track record of success to join our team as a Virtual Sales Professional. This role is responsible for selling Biopharmaceutical products directly to cardiologists and working collaboratively with a field-based sales team on behalf of our client, AstraZeneca.
The Virtual Sales Professional (VSP) engages health care professionals (HCPs) in virtual discussions to promote assigned client products, maximize the products’ selling potential and meet program and Client objectives. The VSP achieves this by developing and maintaining relationships with HCPs and educating them about product features, benefits, safety profile and approved indications to ensure appropriate patient use. The VSP utilizes approved tools and resources for product promotion and maintains a competent level of product, territory and customer activity knowledge.
Responsibilities:
Create and implement strategically sound business plans and tactical strategies within the assigned customer base to achieve individual and company goals for sales, market share, call metrics, appropriate sample distribution, etc.
Manage daily sales call activity according to defined expectations, with the purpose of influencing customers and increasing product sales:
On behalf of Client, promote Client's products via virtual interactions with assigned HCP targets, engaging them in in-depth program.
Profile and manage a list of HCP targets and provide value-added benefits to grow product volume.
Maintain call productivity and metrics that are required by program.
Manage promotional budget.
Maintain thorough knowledge of AstraZeneca’s products and programs.
Fully comply with all laws, regulations and Supplier Policies, Code of Conduct, all privacy and data guidelines, relevant state and federal laws and regulations, and terms and conditions prescribed in the Sample Administration Agreements and PDMA Guidelines.
Participate in teleconference and live National, regional and district meetings and training sessions and represent client at National and/or local conventions when requested.
Requirements:
Results-oriented with a track record of success.
Bachelor’s degree required.
1+ years sales experience required with:
Experience in inside sales/ contact center required
Pharma/biotech and/or B2B sales experience preferred
Demonstrated success in prior roles i.e. sales rankings, awards & achievements
Superior verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
Ability to clearly articulate via phone in a professional and grammatically proficient manner, with the ability to adapt tone, volume, and pace to most effectively communicate
Ability to travel to work related meetings and functions (including overnight and/or weekend).
Must be able to successfully complete client training and meet training expectations in order to proceed to servicing client’s customers within the parameters of the program.
Qualifications, Skills and Abilities:
Results-oriented with a track record of success.
Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills.
Clear, articulate and grammatically sound speech and professional appearance.
Strong rapport building skills and active listening skills.
Excellent selling, closing, persuasion and presentation skills.
Ability to learn, understand and communicate complex technical/medical terminology and to maintain the required technical expertise including competitive product knowledge.
Self-motivated and disciplined.
Good organizational and planning skills, strong attention to detail and accuracy.
Demonstrated technical aptitude with computer technology and devices (e.g. iPad, apps).
At IQVIA, we believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. The advanced analytics, technology solutions and contract research services we provide to the life sciences industry are made possible by our 67,000+ employees around the world who apply their insight, curiosity and intellectual courage every step of the way.
