INSTRUCTOR Role Description
Company Overview

At Bundle, we are disrupting the traditional care industry and transforming the employer funded care model. We are determined to provide personalized virtual care experiences that benefit employees and families every day.

Working parents and families are struggling at home during these unprecedented times, juggling parenting, homeschooling, work. Bundle hopes to provide these families a sense of joy and positivity by giving parents and caregivers a much-needed break!

We are looking for instructors who have experience speaking and/or teaching Spanish, Mandarin, and French!
Role Overview

Bundle is currently looking for personable, organized, and thoughtful instructors to join our diverse and inclusive instructor community. Our instructors will help make a difference by facilitating one-on-one fun and engaging virtual learning experiences to children 3 – 11 years old and elderly 65+. Our lesson topics range from science and technology to arts and culture. We compensate instructors for their time $14/session or they can receive school credit if applicable.

Role Requirements
Conduct Bundle Breaks over a video conferencing call to participants of all ages.
Based on your experience and comfort level, Bundle will match you with participants you feel most conformable working with!
Review and maintain a comprehensive understanding of all the content for each Bundle Break lesson plan.
Bundle does ALL the lesson planning and prep for you. All you do is review the plan before the start of your Bundle Break and Bundle will match you with a participant based on the lessons and topics you feel most confident facilitating!
Build excellent rapport with the participant and drive the conversation.
Engage with participants by maintaining enthusiasm, eye contact, and interest throughout the Bundle Break.
Check-in with the participant throughout the lesson to reinforce learnings.
Effectively manage the time and pace of the session to complete it in a timely manner.
Troubleshoot technical issues with participant and/or families as needed.

Required Skills
Fluent in Spanish, French, Mandarin or another foreign language.
2-5+ years of previous care experience working with children and/or the elderly, especially in an instructor capacity (ex. babysitting, teaching, tutoring, camps, nursing homes). 2 years of experience required; 3-5 years preferred.
Ability to manage conflict using active listening and empathy.
Excellent verbal communication skills.
Ability to handle multiple tasks with interruptions and able to problem-solve efficiently and effectively.
Technical competency. Experience with video conference calling, screen shares, launching videos, hyperlinks and PowerPoint Presentations.
College degree or currently completing preferred.
Ability to demonstrate patience and compassion.
Must provide at least 2 professional or educational references.
Must be able to pass a social media and background check.
Must have a functioning computer that can run the most updated web browsers and has video capabilities.
Must be fluent in English.
Must be 18 years of age or older.

Commitment Details
Generally available at least 6-10 hours per week.
Provides feedback to the Bundle Team after each Bundle Break.
Maintains excellent communication with the Bundle Team staff.
Provides Bundle with updated schedule every 1-2 weeks.

Job Description
The Account Executive (AE) in the Small Law Channel is responsible for retaining and growing their existing account base and acquiring new accounts within their area of responsibility. Their territory consists primarily of an existing client base of approximately 230 accounts in 1-10 attorney size firms. The AE position is field based, requiring excellent face to face, telephone and writing skills. The successful AE draws on their high level of initiative and ability to apply strong business acumen to conduct a thorough needs analysis within their accounts. The successful AE has the ability to develop trust, demonstrate their credibility with all account stakeholders through their knowledge of Thomson Reuters’ products, and services and acquired knowledge of the legal industry. The AE tailors their presentations to the unique needs of the individual account and articulates their proposals through ROI justification to shorten the sales cycle.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Networks and partners with customers both over the phone and in person in order to build confidence and develop win/win solutions; proactively stays on top of additional sales opportunities while navigating through customer organizations, balances frequency of contact with potential for new sales.
Effectively manages his/her territory via phone and in person by allocating appropriate time to prioritize goals, requirements, renewal opportunities and sales opportunities.
Demonstrates an excellent ability to meet the demands of selling to a large customer base by strategizing customer contact methods; operate with effectiveness and determination; acts promptly to take advantage of multiple opportunities; remains realistically positive in sales situations; persists to achieve sales goals despite barriers or difficulties by changing strategies, doubling efforts, or employing other techniques.
Uses appropriate interpersonal styles to consistently build trust and confidence with users, key contacts, managers and executives at Thomson Reuters’ customer sites; communicates and interacts effectively with internal team partners to achieve goals.
Exhibits a deep knowledge of Thomson Reuters products, as well as the legal profession and the legal publishing industry: Relishes on-going, self-initiated learning; assimilates new information quickly; welcomes feedback and applies knowledge to practical use on the job.
Responsibilities
Attains sales and renewal targets and quotas on a monthly basis by both in person customer visits and meetings over the phone.
Demonstrates the use of Small Law products to the customer
Obtains and provides territory information regarding market intelligence and penetration
Confers with and assists in customer-related issues, including collections and complaints, as needed to maintain good customer relations
Completes weekly sales performance reports and completes all Salesforce.com reporting in a timely and accurate manner
Attends sales meetings and conventions as required
Qualifications
Minimum 5 years successful sales experience (both over the phone and field sales); Legal industry preferred.
4 year college degree or equivalent experience, JD a plus
Software as a Service Sales (SAAS) Experience a plus
Working knowledge of sales concepts, methods and techniques
Ambitious self-starter with high energy and motivation
Excellent communication skills and closing skills
Effective time management skills
Able to work from home office and travel to customer locations
Proficient in MS Office/Internet
High level of competency with regard to internet, periodical and internal prospecting.
Proficient database management skills
Ideal Candidate Profile/Success factors:
JD, legal sales experience, or SAAS experience
Consultative sales skills, specifically working with clients on a series of small sales over an extended period of time
Demonstrated success in a sales positions requiring a high activity level
Strong listening skills and ability to ask probing questions
Proficiency with sales related tools, ex. CRM systems
High level of integrity and strong understanding of sales ethics
Continuous learner, flexible and open-minded
Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.
We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.
Accessibility
As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.
We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.
More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on thomsonreuters.com.

Text: Position: Outside Sales RepresentativeWho are we? We are UpdatePromise, an established software company within the automotive industry with more than 20,000 clients. We are continually expanding into additional segments and industries. Our company, just like the technology world, is always changing, evolving, and pushing the limits.Think of us as a toolbox for businesses, where we provide our partners with innovative technology tools to help create the best Consumer Experience Life-Cycle for their customers. We are the leader in improving Customer Satisfaction Scores, workflow efficiencies, and overall net promoters for our partners within the industry. We are looking to add one lucky “Outside Sales Representative” to help our team in impacting millions of consumers’ lives, one industry at a time.Who are you?You are a hunter who is motivated, confident, and loyal. You’re driven not just by sales, but by the opportunity to connect with your clients and foster lifelong relationships. You set goals and then strive to surpass them. Rejection doesn’t faze your resolve but strengthens it. You’re personable—and you understand the importance of face-to-face interaction with clients and teammates (you will travel!). You’re an agile written and verbal communicator who exercises good judgment and can pivot as the situation demands it. Coachable, adaptable, and “can do,” you turn constructive criticism into self-improvement. You truly believe you have the ability to positively impact our industry and our world.What exactly are we looking for? An Outside Sales Representative who has:1. A love for traveling! (you will be gone 3 weeks out of the month )2. The ability to follow sales processes.3. The ability to work independently and be accountable for sales goals.4. The confidence and ability to close sales daily, weekly, and monthly.5. Confidence in creating, facilitating, and controlling the direction of conversations.6. The ability to make spontaneous decisions, based on education and intuition.7. The ability to network, and harvest meaningful customer relationships.8. The will to continuously learn and be coached by those around you.9. The intuition to understand the difference between persistence and pushiness.10. Confidence when giving pitches in front of prospective clients.11. Experience and comfortability with cold calling.12. The diligence to properly document records and reports.13. Present sales data to managers on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis.What do we absolutely need from you? 1-2 years of Outside Sales, or Phone Sales Experience.A high school diploma.Must possess interpersonal skills, organizational skills, be a self-starter, detail oriented, and have ability to multitask and to communicate (verbal and written)Ability to work remotely in their territory daily.Proficiency in Microsoft Office.Must have a valid state driver’s license, and a clean driving record.What is an awesome plus that you might have?3+ years of Outside Sales Experience.An Associate’s or Bachelor’s degree.Experience in the automotive, or SaaS industry.What will your salary be?$60,000 - $80,000 per year, plus Closing and Residual commissions.What are some things that you will be doing? 1. Lead generation for prospective clients.2. Prospect, engage, and present to prospective clients, following the Sales Process Strategy.3. JobTitle: Competitive Technical Marketing Manager - End User Computing - Opportunity for Working Remotely New York, NY
Text:
Sr Competitive Technical Manager – End User Computing
VMware is the leader in virtualization and cloud infrastructure solutions that enable our more than 350,000 enterprise and SMB customers to thrive in the Digital Workspace Era. Our team of 20,000+ people working in 50+ locations worldwide is committed to building a community where great people want to work long term living our values of passion, innovation, execution, teamwork, active learning and giving back. If you are ready to accelerate, innovate and lead, join us as we challenge constraints and problem solve for tomorrow today. In End-User Computing at VMware, we are leading the transformational journey to the digital workspace, helping our customers deliver on the productivity and user-experience promise of the next-generation of workspace technologies.
Job Role and Responsibility
The End User Computing Competitive team is seeking a talented, results-driven technical marketing manager, technical account management, solutions architect, or product management professional with a good understanding of the Digital Workspace technology and market dynamics. You will work closely with our product management, product marketing, engineering, and field teams to build and communicate a clear view of our competitive market positioning. Your main responsibility will be to provide technical comparisons and create differentiated technical sales tools against the competition. You will deliver timely technical analysis of competitive products and announcements with recommendations for VMware responses and strategy. You will also design and craft high quality technical assets for use by customers, VMware field technical teams and partners. This is a dynamic role with rapidly moving boundaries that requires a deep understanding of the underlying technology elements. You will need to interact with our customers and global teams, which will require some travel.
In this role, you will work independently and as a member of a team to design and craft content that helps our field teams and partners communicate our market-leading capabilities to customers. You have the ability to work in a fast pace environment demonstrating autonomy in conforming to strategic intent while adhering to team values. The successful candidate is a person who can:Impact and influence othersCreate compelling value propositions that technically differentiate our offerings in the digital workspace, end user computing and enterprise mobility management marketsTranslate your understanding of the digital workspace market into compelling value propositions differentiating our solution in the marketCreate customer-facing materials including technical teardowns, web content, whitepapers, webinars and training materialsCollaborate with product management, product marketing, engineering, sales, and sales engineering teams to help drive competitive take-out strategiesCreate and deliver technical sales enablement contentSupport and report back on competitive events and conferencesThrive in a dynamic and fluid environmentTravel up to 10% of the time
Required Skills:5-10 years successfully supporting global field teams by providing compelling competitive product differentiatorsEngineering, computer science or other technical degree; MBA a plusExcellent people and communication skills, written and verbal (writing samples will be requested)Ability to provide an impartial technical evaluation of competitor’s products compared to VMware’sAbility to deliver concise communication assets that support others in detailed conversations with customers that accurately and positively describe VMware’s unique value propositionExperience developing product marketing and technical marketing content to support competitive positioning campaignsProven track record of working with customers and partners, and ability to influence their decisions with timely evaluationsDemonstration of an understanding of digital workspace technologies, including EMM/UEM, VDI/RDSH and Identity managementEstablished knowledge of the end-user computing market and the competitive landscape
Preferred Skills:
Our team looks for individuals who embody our values of humility, empathy, collaboration above isolationism, respectfulness, trustworthiness, and good-natured fun. Additionally, we would like you to have:Proven grasp of the challenges faced by customers in digital workspace transformationExperience of agile development environmentsDemonstrated ability to work successfully across business units and with high-level executives

Marketing Operations Manager
LOCATION: Chicago, IL, Charlotte, NC, or Remote
This position reports to: Director of Marketing Operations
This is an exciting opportunity for someone who loves to find creative solutions and lead change. Intapp is seeking a manager-level marketing operations professional who will oversee day-to-day operations, reporting, analysis and technology for a global team that spans multiple offices, industries and targeted personas.
The Marketing Operations Manager will champion and execute marketing accountability initiatives. The chosen candidate will work closely with key internal stakeholders to ensure that systems, processes and tools are in place that support funnel advancement, sales enablement, marketing performance measurement, strategic decision-making, and streamlined reporting.
In the short-term, the Marketing Operations Manager will help manage campaigns, build emails, and create lists within the CRM. In the long-term they will develop and execute new marketing automation strategies, maintain and improve the marketing tech stack, refine marketing processes, develop and deploy testing best practices, and develop reporting and analytics across all marketing channels.

5+ years of progressive career experience and hands-on execution in marketing automation/ operations/analytics
Advanced user of CRM and Marketing Automation systems such as Salesforce, Pardot, Eloqua, Marketo, Hubspot, or Responsys
High attention to detail, well organized, and able to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Experience in the use of business analytics, key performance indicators and dashboards
Deep understanding of marketing automation strategies and testing methodologies
Strong analytical skills and ability to translate complex data sets into concrete business recommendations for marketing and sales leadership, with the goal to optimize revenue-generating investments

Knowledge of HTML and CSS
Experience in Project Management a plus.

JobTitle: Manager, Competitive Intelligence - Opportunity for Working Remotely New York, NY
Text:
Business Summary:
VMware accelerates digital transformation through a software-defined approach to business and IT. The trusted platform provider of choice for more than 500,000 customers globally, VMware is the pioneer in virtualization and an innovator in cloud and business mobility. A proven leader, VMware allows customers to run, manage, connect and secure applications across clouds and devices in a common operating environment.
Our team of 20,000+ people working in 50+ locations worldwide is committed to building a community where great people want to work long term by living our values of passion, innovation, execution, teamwork, active learning and giving back. If you are ready to accelerate, innovate and lead, join us as we challenge constraints and problem solve for tomorrow today.
This individual will develop market and competitive intelligence, critical insights, and recommendations to positively influence strategic decisions with VMware’s executive team, senior leaders and key business stakeholders. The role reports to the Director, Corporate Intelligence.
Job Role and Responsibilities:
Develop competitive intelligence, critical insights, and recommendations to positively influence strategic decisions with VMware’s executive team and key business stakeholders.
Build in-depth studies analyzing top competitors (e.g. Microsoft, Cisco) and assess strategic, go-to-market, and technological gaps.
Compare and contrast VMware vs the competition in order to provide impact assessments and recommendations to improve VMware’s position in the market.
Develop market evolution hypotheses and anticipate competitive dynamics, including the identification of emerging competitive threats.
Evolve competitive program engagement model, with a focus on broadening internal customer base across VMware business units and increase frequency and depth of touch points throughout the year.
Forge strong relationships with business leaders to understand strategy and pain points, and ensure competitive content is strategically aligned and impactful.
Engage industry analysts to ascertain relevant research, scope custom projects, and build RFPs.
Become embedded in business unit strategy and planning processes, including long range planning, fiscal year planning, worldwide sales kickoff, and other strategic initiatives throughout the year.
Track major competitive announcements and proactively build awareness of key competitor moves (e.g. AWS shift toward distributed cloud model)
Develop detailed project plans, clear process for engagement with stakeholders, clarify intent and goals, establish strategic imperatives, etc.
Present competitive studies and key insights and align with VMware senior leaders on recommendations and areas of focus. Measure level of engagement and meaningful use of competitive content throughout the year.
Required Skills:
Executive level presentation skills. Capable of articulating recommendations clearly, handling objections, and switching between big picture thinking and detailed requirements.
Exceptional technical depth with competence to explain and debate at the architectural level. Consistent knowledge builder with an eye on leading edge technology and business models.
Ability to collaborate within a small team environment. Precision PowerPoint development required, with high attention to detail and format.
Self-starter with a bias for action and results orientation. Able to prioritize, focus, and execute through obstacles. Innovative thinker with analytical problem-solving skills.
Degrees in engineering, computer science and MBA preferred
This job requisition is not eligible for employment-based immigration sponsored by VMware.

Something Digital has recently joined forces with Rightpoint, a global experience leader and a Genpact company.
Genpact, a global professional services firm focused on delivering digital transformation, today announced the expansion of its experience business, Rightpoint, with the acquisition of Something Digital. The addition of Something Digital’s deep commerce expertise to Rightpoint’s customer experience leadership, will further enable the company’s ability to drive experience-led transformation at scale for clients across industries.
Something Digital is an interactive agency with offices around the US. We have spent close to 20 years developing customer software, eCommerce sites, intranets, and websites for diverse clients ranging from startups to Fortune 500 companies.
Something Digital is looking for Program Manager. Currently, this role is 100% remote.
We have offices in New York City (HQ), Los Angeles, CA and West Palm, FL.
 Intro:
The Program Manager will establish and lead over-arching program structure, processes, and procedures designed to achieve overall program objectives. T
In this instance, a Program shall be defined as a series of related projects, initiatives, and defined efforts connected to a single client or group of clients and managed by multiple teams within the organization.
 We’ll need you to:
 Program / Client Management
Ensure client and internal RP-SD stakeholder satisfaction through management of escalations and conflict, effective communication, appropriate expectation-setting, and achievement of agreed-upon program objectives
Produce accurate and timely reporting of program health and KPIs throughout its lifecycle for client and RP-SD stakeholders (utilizing tools such as Brightgauge, Jira, Smartsheet, Roadmunk, etc.)
Provide oversight of operations and performance of all program-related projects and initiatives
Identify and resolve program risks as they surface
Collaborate in leadership of program with Program Manager – Account Management & Delivery Executive
 Support program-related business development activities, including assessing initiative feasibility, budgeting, pitching, and resource planning
 Achieve program financial objectives by forecasting requirements, monitoring ongoing performance, analyzing variances, and initiating corrective actions
Process Management
Develop an evaluation method to assess program strengths and identify areas for improvement
Create new processes to align SD’s product delivery with client’s agile processes
Document and simplify SD’s delivery processes for client work
Own the setup/configuration/management of tools such as CW, Brightgauge, Jira, Smartsheet, Open Air etc., to support the team in their process and delivery performance
Lead internal onboarding processes for new team members
Create process for team transitions (members moving to other teams within the same program, to teams elsewhere within RP-SD, or entire existing teams moving from one product/service to another, e.g. Magento to New Web)
Modify and improve business operations through integration with RightPoint.
Team Management
 Directly manage Project Managers/Scrum Masters, who each lead their own delivery teams.
 Set the direction for the program’s governance and leadership structure within the Matrix
 Responsible for timesheet approvals, PTO requests, performance evaluation, training plans, onboarding, and employee satisfaction of direct reports
Focusing on the engagement with project leaders, project teams, technology and application / operational interfaces
Manage a team with a diverse array of talents and responsibilities, including assisting with recruiting, hiring, and retention efforts, and providing mentoring and coaching
Lead the prep and delivery of monthly reviews
 Weekly PM Meeting
 Bi-Weekly Internal Leadership Meetings
 Monthly Internal Full-team Meetings
 Participate in domestic and international travel as program circumstances dictate.
 Perform additional duties as they become necessary in support of the Program’s or RP-SD’s operation, to include standing in as a ScrumMaster when there is a need

You must have:

 Tools: Jira, Confluence, Smartsheet, Brightgauge, Roadmunk, etc.
 Knowledge and understanding of Scrum/Agile, with a strong background in planning, continuous improvement, and change management (particularly in the areas of process and operations)
 Expectation setting regarding process rollout (description, plan, and assignment of actions/ownership)
Apply if you:
Enjoy a challenge and are looking to grow
Want to work on diverse projects and platforms
Are excited to work on high profile brands with complex requirements
Are you looking for a company that places value on training and skills development!!

About Us
The New York Times is seeking inventive and motivated interns to join the Licensing Group. In this role, you will develop an understanding of real-world content marketing strategies and content licensing. You will hone your research skills and provide a competitive analysis of the financial industry that will be used by the sales team for business development. The intern will have the opportunity to shadow the marketing team and observe how the marketing function interacts with business development to drive growth. You will also learn about writing and design for marketing by crafting a deck as a final deliverable.
About our Team
NYTLicensing is the content licensing division of The New York Times Company. We empower companies to connect with their audiences, using world-class journalism and content curation to elevate experiences and engage customers. We help organizations of all sizes streamline communications, supplement existing marketing campaigns and drive growth. We traditionally served other media organizations with our licensed content. It is now our goal to generate awareness of the NYTLicensing brand and drive revenue growth in new markets.
As a Licensing Marketing intern, you will:
Conduct research on the latest marketing strategies by examining prominent financial companies online
Attend decision-making meetings with Creative Strategists, Marketing and Sales teams to gain real-world insights into how each of these functions interact and work together to accomplish business objectives
Analyze and synthesize information into reports and a presentation
About You
Basic proficiency in PowerPoint or Google Slides
A focus on marketing and understanding of content strategies being used by brands
Basic proficiency with social platforms and social analytics
About Our Summer Internships
Our internships are paid
They are 10 weeks long, starting on or around June 1, 2021
You will work remotely
Benefits and Perks:
Interning at The New York Times is a unique opportunity to work at an innovative and historic global media organization dedicated to enhancing society by creating, collecting and distributing high-quality news and information
You will be helping to power, distribute and expand what is possible for our award-winning journalism
We run a week-long maker event during the summer, where Design, Product, Project, Marketing and Technology come together to work on creative, cross-functional projects
We have frequent panel discussions and talks by a wide variety of newsmakers and industry leaders
NYT interns benefit from competitive pay, great perks and influential networking
The New York Times is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce, one that reflects the varied global community we serve. Our journalism and the products we build in the service of that journalism greatly benefit from a range of perspectives, which can only come from diversity of all types, across our ranks, at all levels of the organization. Achieving true diversity and inclusion is the right thing to do. It is also the smart thing for our business. So we strongly encourage women, veterans, people with disabilities, people of color and gender nonconforming candidates to apply.
The New York Times Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of an individual's sex, age, race, color, creed, national origin, alienage, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation or affectional preference, gender identity and expression, disability, genetic trait or predisposition, carrier status, citizenship, veteran or military status and other personal characteristics protected by law. All applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected characteristics. The New York Times Company will consider qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local "Fair Chance" laws.

Requisition no: 512799
Work type: Full Time
Location: Medical Center
School/Department: Research Postdoc Affairs Off
Grade: Grade 12
Categories: General Administration
Position Summary

Under the leadership of the Director, the Assistant Director manages several initiatives and provides support for the University-wide Office for Postdoctoral Affairs (OPA). OPA, which is within the Office of the Executive Vice President for Research, is responsible for numerous activities that involve education, training and support for all University postdoctoral researchers and scholars (postdocs). OPA also facilitates the recruitment and retention of outstanding postdocs through development of excellent programming. The Assistant Director works closely with the Director to carry out the scholarly mission of the Office.

Responsibilities

Career Development Tasks

Develops, coordinates and manages professional development programming and job opportunity lectures and events, such as career panels, professional skill development workshops, and career development series.
Provides career counseling services to the University’s postdocs through individual sessions as well as through leading small group workshops (e.g., resume development, interviewing workshops).
Collaborates with an array of University entities in the design, organization, and implementation of career and professional development programs and events.
Fosters and maintains relationships with postdoc alumni and external employers in order to coordinate professional networking opportunities and events for postdocs.

Program Management Tasks

Participates in the organization and execution of annual events such as the Postdoctoral Research Symposium and Postdoctoral Academic Application Bootcamp.
Creates and maintains weekly communication series highlighting important policy reminders, upcoming events, and other general information relevant to the postdoctoral community.
Develops and implements other programming as needed to address specific needs within the postdoctoral community.

Administrative Tasks

Advises postdocs with respect to job opportunities, career development, professional development opportunities, funding opportunities, international issues (visas and requirements for US employment, etc.) and University policies and practices, including referrals to other University agencies as appropriate.
Assists the Office Manager and Director with various communication tasks, including but not limited to, weekly emails and advertisements.
In collaboration with the Director, researches and evaluates current postdoctoral research policies and procedures affecting postdoctoral training. The incumbent advises the Director on policies and resources that would best support postdocs in their training and professional development.
Acts as a point of contact for counterparts at other institutions regarding the policies and procedures that govern Columbia’s postdoc community.
Acts as an institutional point of contact for external parties, as determined by the Director.
Attends local, regional and national meetings on postdoctoral affairs.
Investigates emerging trends pertaining to the needs of the postdoctoral community.
Investigates potential postdoctoral opportunities, such as funding opportunities and job openings.
Organizes local and regional meetings focused on exchanging information and discussing postdoctoral program policies with other institutions.

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor's degree
A minimum of 3-5 years related experience
Several years in a research area

Preferred Qualifications

Prior academic administrative experience
Career counseling experience in an academic setting
Doctorate degree with postdoc experience
Teaching/presentation experience

Other Requirements

The successful candidate should have a demonstrated ability to design, organize, and implement career and professional development programs and events; a strong interest in career counseling of advanced degree holders; excellent interpersonal skills and ability to deal effectively with individuals at all levels (faculty, staff, deans, etc.); ability to successfully manage difficult situations; self-motivation and ability to work independently; strong verbal and written skills and proficiency in computer applications such as Microsoft Office Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.

The candidate will be expected to oversee a few evening events per month and a few weekend events per year. Travel and participation in a few conferences and professional meetings per year is anticipated. Please note that this position serves postdoctoral researchers across the multiple Columbia campuses. As such, the incumbent’s time will be spent at both the main campus and the medical campus. Currently, this position is fully remote but will transition to in- person/on-campus once safely permitted by the University.

Please include a cover letter with your application.

Equal Opportunity Employer / Disability / Veteran
Columbia University is committed to the hiring of qualified local residents.
This position is not available for visa sponsorship.

Company Overview

WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.
The WarnerMedia Story
WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Now, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.

The Job
Develop video labeling models to identify objects, individuals and scene breaks of interest. Work with human annotators to develop a rigorous precision measure and quality assurance process.

The Daily
Working through our internal ContentAI platform, you’ll identify high quality, labelled video samples, train computer vision and/or NLP models and confirm the accuracy of their outputs

The Essentials
This role should be filled by someone finishing a degree in or having significant experience with Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence (particularly with a focus on Computer Vision)
This role requires programming competence sufficient to build these models without supervision using PyTorch, TensorFlow, etc

Full-time schedule (40 hours/week) designed to work around class schedule
Fully remote/virtual experience; company owned laptop provided for the duration of the internship program
Salary based on office location; relocation is not provided

Hands-on work with passionate, talented team members in your field
Networking opportunities with industry-leading professionals
Engaging events including executive speakers sessions, professional development workshops, and more
Opportunity to join the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands

About the role
As a customer support rep, you will work within the Customer Success team. The mission of the team is to help users get the most out of their Flick subscription, educate our community on basic marketing concepts, and answer our inbound support tickets.

As our first US Timezone Customer Advocate, your goal will be to help provide better support to our US customers.
The role is fully remote. However, applicants in US Timezones are preferred.

This role is initially part-time (the equivalent of 3 days a week) but will likely transition to full time within the next 12 months.

You will have the opportunity to meet many of Flick's wonderful community members, have meaningful conversations with them and feel fulfilled by helping them reach their goals.

At Flick, our community is at the heart of everything we do. We are looking for someone to clearly communicate our users' needs with the rest of the team to drive meaningful change in our product.

As a Customer Advocate you will:

Help users learn how to use Flick's platform by answering all inbound messages - we use Intercom and email.
Work with the product team to collect and document feedback from our users in order to make informed decisions on what features should be built.
Report and document bugs for the development team to fix.
Work with Product Marketing to write impactful content on new features being introduced.
Handle refunds and chargebacks within our payment processors.

Who we are looking for

You'll be a great fit if you:

Have excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Can show empathy, patience, and compassion with the ability to remain patient with less tech-savvy users.
Have very strong listening skills.
Are a self-starter who can pro-actively contribute to their team's long term success.

Bonus Points:

1-2 years experience in work which requires interacting with customers.
Has experience running their own Instagram profile.
Already uses Flick.

About us
At Flick, we want to strive to create great products, based on the needs of our current and potential new users. We place incredible value on our customers and so, we place great importance on customer success!

Core Behaviours at Flick

Customers come first
Build Quickly for the long term
Everyone's views are valued
Education encouraged

Why Customer Success?
Flick’s newest department; customer success, has enabled us to create new products, increase awareness of customers’ needs and create a stronger bond between Flick and our customers.

You'll be joining a team that is still growing and learning. Customer success at Flick is more than answering support tickets, you'll be a key insight into Flick's user base. Through your work, you will be able to impact every department and, in some cases, see your feature suggestions come to life. You’ll take an active role in developing the processes and functions of our growing Customer Success team.

We will endeavour to help you grow as an impactful member of the team and offer education and insights wherever we can to help you grow both personally and professionally.

If you share our values and enthusiasm for creating and serving, we’d love to review your application! We promise we do take the time and care to review every application we receive.

What you can expect from our hiring process
Step1: Getting to know your values and experience (a-sync only). You will receive a document to fill in your own time so we can learn more about the value you can bring to Flick.
Step 2: Getting to know your role. You will chat with Loic, our co-founder, and Josh, our Customer Success Manager, so that they can learn more about your experience, background and achievements.
Step 3: Test Project. Josh will assign you a small project where you'll be able to showcase your skills.
Step 4: Meet your potential team mates. You'll meet the team and have a chance to ask questions about what it's like working at Flick.

Our tentative hiring timeline
We are looking to hire someone to start work in mid February.

Our company:

At Spectrum Enterprise, our goal is to foster an engaging work environment that encourages our team members to reach their full potential. We promote a culture of excellence that celebrates diversity, innovative thinking and dedication to consistently exceeding client expectations.
Spectrum Enterprise, a part of Charter Communications, Inc., is a national provider of scalable, fiber technology solutions serving America’s largest businesses and communications service providers. Spectrum Enterprise’s industry-leading team of experts works closely with clients to achieve greater business success by providing solutions designed to meet their evolving needs. You have a developed ability to identify roadblocks and overcome obstacles to increase business while enhancing the client experience. You flourish in an office environment and travel frequently to capture accounts across an assigned footprint. You report directly to the Strategic Sales Management for goals, guidance and assistance.

Company funded retirement accumulation plan for an additional 3%.
Education assistance.
Pretax childcare spending account.

Employee discount on spectrum services where available.

Drive the sales process by identifying target markets, industries and contacts for the product portfolio.
Generate leads by building and maintaining relationships in the corporate and IT community.
Entice clients by creating informative and lucrative proposals that align with their business needs.
Build an extensive network through referrals, prospecting phone calls, industry events and peers.
Ensure a positive service implementation process by supervising all phases of the sales cycle.
Effectively close deals through conversations and negotiations with C-level executives.
Provide weekly reports on funnel, sales call activity and 30/60/90-day forecasts for senior leadership to leverage.
Perform additional duties related to the position as assigned.
Required keys for success:
Four or more years of B2B sales experience as a proven closer selling data, voice, cloud or video solutions to multi-location enterprise accounts.
Four or more years of experience selling to corporate executives in outside sales to enterprise, healthcare, state and local government or education.
Four or more years of experience negotiating master service agreements.
Repeated success exceeding revenue goals.
Telephony experience in selling trunking products, such as T1, primary rate interface (PRI) and session initiation protocol (SIP).
Understanding of business software and hardware, applications, intranets, network security, firewalls, transmission control protocol/internet protocol (TCP/IP) networking and telecommunications infrastructure and equipment.
Knowledge of the role of network facilities to support corporate tele-sales.
Ability to efficiently conduct a consultative analysis and provide recommendations.
Confident when presenting technical information to clients and key stakeholders.
Expert in network building, negotiation and issue resolution skills.
Deadline-driven with the ability to multi-task and manage change within a fast-paced environment.
Interpersonal communicator with the ability to work in a team environment.
Quick learner that can apply knowledge quickly.
Knowledgeable of sales level complex services.
Familiar with Salesforce, ICOMS, CSG or other billing systems.
Valid driver’s license, a safe driving record and the availability to travel frequently.
Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook and Visio.
Effective written and spoken English communication skills with all levels of an organization.
How you will stand out from the crowd:
Analytical thinker with the ability to manage and foster change.
Positive attitude and an inner drive to push yourself.
Coachable with an entrepreneurial spirit and an aptitude to learn the product suite and engage in the Spectrum Enterprise culture.
Expert in translating technical information to clients.
History of working well under pressure within a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
Experience selling to high-level management in various verticals.
Able to work independently and remotely to identify and cultivate market opportunities.
Your education:
High school diploma or equivalent (required).
Bachelor’s degree in a business-related field (preferred).

Finally, the candidate must learn to effectively evaluate the nature of any problem that arises in order to determine the correct course of action and which internal team member needs to be consulted in order to find a solution.

Assistance in special projects as needed
Occasional travel outside of office region will eventually be required
 Qualifications and Skills
Bachelor's degree or Associate degree and 5+ of experience required
2+ years of direct technical operations/project management experience
Strong communication (both written and verbal), organization and presentation skills
Ability to work remote, in the office, or on site
Capable of translating technical language to non-technical stakeholders

Preferred

Salesforce, SQL, and other business database software

JobTitle: Product Marketing Manager- Tanzu Labs - Opportunity for Working Remotely New York, NY
Text:
Product Marketing Manager - VMware Tanzu Labs
Marketing | San Francisco, CA, United States or Remote (North America)
VMware’s Modern Application Platforms Business Unit (MAPBU) has a bold mission—catalyze enterprise transformation through software. At the center of telling this narrative and empowering sales is product marketing.
Product marketing takes a unique combination of skills. To be a product marketer is to be savvy of technology industry dynamics and trends, a messaging expert, a constant collaborator with marketing and go-to-market teams, and a creative producer of content that cuts across product positioning to industry commentary.
Job Role and Responsibilities:
MAPBU is seeking a Product Marketer to run product marketing for a crucial area of our VMware Tanzu Labs business: the software consulting services that help our customers build, run and manage modern application platforms.
Organizations of all sizes are investing in Kubernetes and related technologies. The experts at VMware Tanzu Labs have unique capabilities to help these firms achieve better outcomes with K8s and the broader ecosystem of open-source projects. Tanzu Labs does this through custom engagements with IT leaders and practitioners looking to build and develop a modern app platform and establish modern operations practices for sustained success.
This Product Marketing role will play a critical part in our success—shaping our overarching platform services narrative, and establishing Tanzu Labs as the go-to partner for enterprises that want to adopt Kubernetes as their standard infrastructure API.
We count on Product Marketing to define messaging, drive sales enablement, understand and grow our platform services, feed campaigns, drive the agenda at industry conferences like VMworld and SpringOne, and collaborate across business units to amplify the Tanzu Labs value proposition.
This role also has the potential for greater company-wide impact, informing VMware’s perspective on business-aligned open source technology, subscription-based businesses, and engagement with new customer personas.
Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:
Product positioning. Define the core messaging framework for owned products, socialize across stakeholders, and apply to a core set of marketing materials.
Sales enablement. Ready our sales specialists to carry our message(s) to market with consistency and confidence through annual sales kick-off sessions and ongoing training. Drive the Tanzu Labs platform services journey message for the Tanzu Labs sales specialists, MAPBU field, core VMware field, channel partners, and the broader market.
Content creation. Create external-facing content (slide decks, briefs, blogs, papers, multimedia, reference architectures, etc.) aligned to campaigns, sales needs, and competitive threats.
Required Skills & Experience:
Product Marketing. At least five (5) years of product marketing or product management experience. You'll need to have seen the full cycle of product launches and transitions to be effective.
An intermediate understanding of cloud-native technologies and practices. You'll need to be familiar with popular open-source projects and modern DevOps practices. Familiarity with Kubernetes and other CNCF projects is preferred.
Student. You don’t need to be a certified Kubernetes admin, but you’ve got to have the desire to really dig in and understand the technology and its impact in enterprises.
Organizer & communicator. You’ll need to stay on top of multiple product threads, collaborate with different business units, marketing teams, and a globally distributed base of Tanzu Labs practitioners. Demands for collateral and messaging support will compete for your time; you’ll need to ruthlessly prioritize.
Storyteller and writer. This isn’t a behind-the-scenes role; you’ll need to collaborate with stakeholders across VMware and stay in close communication with/present frequently to sales reps and sales leadership. You need to have the ability to break down complex concepts into extremely simple and clear terms for sales. Strong written communication will serve you for internal and external content.
Presentation skills. The ability to deliver clear and concise training and webinars - supplemented by clean visual materials like slide decks - is critical for this role.
Preferred Skills:
Fluent in aspects of modern IT operations. Ideally, you’ve worked in and around the Cloud Native Computing Foundation ecosystem. Familiarity with containers and modern platform operational best practices will help you quickly get up to speed on the broader VMware Labs value proposition.
Data analysis. Experience using campaign data and sales data to determine enablement priorities and to measure the effectiveness of your efforts.
This job requisition is not eligible for employment-based immigration sponsored by VMware.
TeamTanzu

At Paradox, our mission is to share our passion for people, deliver magical talent experiences, and drive talent obsession in organizations around the world. We’re a Scottsdale-based startup revolutionizing recruiting through the power of assistive intelligence. Our flagship product, Olivia is the AI assistant helping companies to transform global talent acquisition and candidate experience.

Are you a client-centric sales professional who loves talent acquisition as much as we do? We’ve experienced triple-digit growth over the past year and we are looking for an Enterprise Account Executive to help expand our reach and impact on the Talent industry.

This sales professional will leverage their HR tech industry experience to build enterprise client relationships nationwide. They’ll work closely with our clients, business development, and solutions teams to understand client pain points and improvement opportunities, and to drive positive change in the TA/HR practices of these large, global enterprise organizations and Fortune500 companies.

Paradox's Enterprise Account Executives Love To:
Prioritize our clients' success over their own success - they know that when clients win we all win
Build and foster relationships with key players in the industry
Ask questions and draw from their industry experience to connect dots for our clients
Work closely with clients to gain a deep understanding of their business challenges
Present creative solutions through storytelling and consultative conversations
Collaborate with the Paradox team to deliver scalable recruiting technology to our clients

Requirements & Experience:
Experience calling on large enterprise companies with complex organizational structures and multiple decision-makers
7+ years experience in software sales
Must have experience selling or implementing HR tech solutions in an enterprise environment
Track record of success selling in a remote environment
The ability to travel ~75% of the time

Why You Should Work at Paradox:
Work side by side with passionate, purposeful people - Talent is our DNA and we pride ourselves on having the best!
Ability to make a big impact on a growing organization and drive your own career
The opportunity to build the next big thing in recruiting technology
Internal and external professional development, coaching, and continuous education opportunities
Comprehensive benefits package

Communications Intern
Homes for the Homeless, Inc. is seeking a Communications Intern for the spring 2021 semester. The Communications Intern will be an integral member of the team, helping to strategize, plan, and execute a variety of communication plans to advance HFH awareness and support programs in the field. Our ideal candidate has strong copywriting and copyediting skills, pays close attention to detail, is highly organized, and has a desire to gain hands-on experience in a communications role. This role will be part time with the candidate splitting hours between the office and working remote. Hours are flexible.
ABOUT HOMES FOR THE HOMELESS INC.
Homes for the Homeless, Inc. (HFH) is a non-profit social services organization operating family shelters throughout NYC that serve as a hub of opportunity for families both residing in shelter as well as those in the neighboring community. On-site programs range from childcare, early childhood education centers, afterschool clubs and programs, and youth recreation activities, such as sports teams, to housing assistance, case management, parenting workshops, career and job vocational training, support groups and substance abuse assistance, and family engagement and recreation events for the whole family. We invite you to visit our website, www.hfhnyc.org, to learn more about our facilities and programs.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Writing, editing, and copyediting (and designing, if applicable) for web, social media, and flyers
Interviewing and writing staff, client, volunteer, and partner profiles, and other content
Attending events virtually at shelters and other locations and reporting on events, including taking photographs and video content, as needed
Social media planning and posting social media content
Updating content to web sites (Word Press platform)
Assistance with invoicing, thank you letters, book orders, and other administrative tasks
Archiving (digital and hard copy) publications and materials
Compiling media lists
QUALIFICATIONS
Must be a current college student (undergraduate or graduate)
Understanding of basic communications approaches and strategies
Excellent writer and copy editor
Excellent interpersonal skills and professional demeanor in-person and virtually
Self-motivated problem solver capable of working as part of a team
Familiar with marketing via major social media platforms including Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram
Experience with WordPress
Experience with Adobe Illustrator and Adobe InDesign, knowledge of the full Adobe Suite a plus
Ability to work between the hours of 8:00am and 4:00pm
Required to be able to work a minimum of 14 hours a week, and a maximum of 21 hours a week
COMPENSATION/EEO
 In order to attract and retain a high-performance workforce, Homes for the Homeless offers a dynamic and rewarding work environment, with a focus on ensuring an appropriate work-life balance. This position will be paid an hourly wage, commensurate with experience. Opportunities to extend the internship to a Summer 2021 internship may be discussed based on performance and interest.
Homes for the Homeless is committed to promoting an inclusive organizational environment of dignity and respect. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO) committed to equal treatment, and prohibit any form of discrimination or harassment based on age, race, religion, creed, color, national origin, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions), gender (including gender identity and gender expression), disability, predisposing genetic characteristics, marital status, arrest or conviction, domestic violence victim status, familial status, or any other basis that would be in violation of any applicable federal, state, or local law.

Technical Sourcer (Forensic Sourcer) - Enterprise Software
Splunk is hiring a Technical Sourcer, with the major focus on inbound candidates, to identify and assess candidates and employee referrals. In this role, you will join our Talent Acquisition Team to source talent and build a world-class candidate pipeline.
We are seeking a Technical Sourcer who understands technology, is passionate about fueling a diverse pipeline of talent, and can partner with multiple recruiters.
You will:
Partner closely with recruiters and hiring managers to clearly understand the requirements of the role and scope and teams you are supporting
Source within our Applicant Tracking System to build a diverse pipeline of candidates for current and future roles.
Collaborate with the team to increase the diversity of our candidate pool through improving our job descriptions (i.e. ensuring use of textio to create gender neutral JDs), branding and outreach.
Partner with recruiter to provide hiring managers updates about the health of the pipeline
Route applicants to more suitable requisitions when appropriate
Partner with recruitment marketing to ensure qualified applicants are considered and reengaged for future opportunities.
Supporting internal branding of the TA team through marketing collateral
Provide a phenomenal candidate experience to referrals and applicants
Supporting the Employee referral program by following up with referrals
Identify passive talent for future roles
Approximately 70% of the role is focused on sourcing with about 30% on other activities (such as branding and diversity initiatives)
MinimumQualifications
You have:
2+ years of technical sourcing experience (enterprise software preferred) with an agency or in-house recruiting team
Solid understanding of technology along with the ability to read resumes and understand technical requirement
Expertise in sourcing diverse pools of candidates within a global environment
Has taken unconscious bias training and/or will take courses
Experience in communicating with hiring managers
An ability to be organized across multiple requisitions
Outstanding organizational skills, with experience responding to a high volume of candidates

Job Description: Regional Sales Manager, ARC Facilities
Location: Anywhere in the Midwest

We are looking for top-performing hunters ready to advance their career, disrupt an industry, and achieve tremendous success in an entrepreneurial, fast-growing enterprise app business targeting the under-served facilities and maintenance industry. Regional Sales Managers (RSMs) are the lifeblood of our organization. RSMs are individual contributor salespeople who leverage a combination of inside and field sales techniques to win new customers. Once a new customer is won, the RSM will expand our relationship with large expansion sales. RSMs are hunters/closers who can articulate the value of a modern enterprise mobile app to help customers achieve 10X ROI. Regional Sales Managers report to the Regional Sales Director.

Selling the award-winning ARC Facilities App
"Best Facility Software” 2019 & 2018, Facility Executive Magazine
“Top 10 Healthcare Compliance Solution Provider” 2018, Healthcare Tech Outlook
“Campus Safety Best Product Winner” 2018, Campus Safety Magazine

These are the exciting things you get to do:

Win NEW customers and achieve or exceed quota.
Hunt their own outbound opportunities as well as work inbound, marketing-generated leads.
Advise customers on the current best practices in the Facilities industry; understand their needs; and present the advantages of our solution.
Provide compelling product demos of our award-winning Facilities App
Identify decision-makers, project leaders and key influencers. Run an effective sales process to secure internal support and close deals.
Leverage inside sales techniques to cold-call, build pipeline, and conduct early-stage online demos to advance opportunities as well as on-site, in-person leadership of key meetings and relationship development to advance and close deals.
Accurately forecast revenue for your territory, leveraging a CRM tool, preferably Hubspot.
Be entrepreneurial. Identify new ways to succeed and drive growth.

This is what we are looking for:

 The ideal candidate will a proven track record as a top-performing inside sales and sales development rep, with successful experience hunting & closing. Candidates must understand how to sell mobile apps as solutions.
This will help you succeed:
3+ years of sales experience as a top-performing enterprise sales and sales development rep. selling SaaS solutions, preferably mobile apps.
Proven success calling on and selling to the CFO, handling objections, and selling value and ROI.
Comfortable working out of your home office environment.
Ability and willingness to Travel as appropriate for your territory.
A College degree in technology or business field is highly recommended.

We have Great Cultural Fit and are looking for similar:
We are one team, one company. We are blessed with an outstanding culture and maintaining this is something very important to all of us. The right candidate can succeed in a team environment.

This is what we have to Offer:
Excellent Company support and resources
Huge pipelines already developed for you
Excellent Company Reputation because we consistently receive 5-star customer reviews
Comprehensive Employee benefits that include full medical, dental, vision, and life insurance as well as a 401-K Plan with company matching
Employee Stock Purchase Plan giving you 15% money by allowing you to buy ARC stock on the NYSE at 15% BELOW street value
A management team that supports you and want to see you be successful
Tools that include a Laptop, iPad, and Smartphone
Culture of caring for our employees
A variety of products to take to market unrivaled in the industry.

To all recruitment agencies:

ARC does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our Careers alias or other ARC employees. ARC is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Our iconic portfolio of more than 77 brands are sold in over 150 countries around the world. We believe in beauty with a purpose and brands that inspire, no matter where they are in the world.We’re looking for a motivated intern to join the Luxury Global Media team. In this role you will work with various leaders on the team, assisting with day to day media tasks such as monitoring media performance, maintaining the media calendar and conducting competitive analysis of beauty competitors.THE ROLE In this role you will be responsible for:Supporting the global media planning process from strategy to activation for Coty Luxury brands including Calvin Klein, Marc Jacobs, Philosophy and Tiffany & Co.Reviewing media plans to ensure markets adhere to global media strategyUpdating and maintaining media plan presentations for licensed brandsManaging analytics and competitive reporting with agency partnersInternal benchmarking to provide insight for future brand campaignsWorking with media vendors (Google, Snapchat, Pinterest…) on opportunities and offeringsWHAT YOU’LL BRING We’d love to see candidates who have:Strong analytical and mathematical skills “good with numbers”Thrives in fast-paced and social work environment Eager to learn with a proactive spirit and can-do attitudePassion for luxury fragrances, fashion and the beauty industryEssential:Candidate must have one or more professional experiencesProficiency in Microsoft Office Suite; must have training and experience with ExcelTech savvy and ability to work onsite or remote with reliable internet connectionMust be able to work independently with strong project and time management skillsAbility to work under a deadline with attention to detailMust have strong communication skills, both oral and writtenMust have strong quantitative and analytical skills, with ability to perform business analysis WHAT WE OFFERThis is a dynamic role with the opportunity to learn the global media landscape within the beauty industry. A dynamic role that's committed to ensuring that our Customers realize value. You will establish a trusted relationship with multiple internal and external stakeholders including executives to end users. You will need to speak the language of the business while understanding the product. You will be responsible for the lifecycle of the customer and ensuring that their ever-changing desired outcomes are being met. You will be an advocate for the customer while finding a balance for the customer and the company in tackling issues or driving innovation. You will own the day to day management of the customer. You will be responsible for data-driven information to understand the health metrics and to help customer adoption.

Your Background – You have experience and interest in the privacy and security space. You follow the latest trends in cybersecurity and the threats that are impacting companies globally. You can engage in a conversation regarding the importance of security and the ways in which threats are occurring. You understand and can discuss networking topics in relation to enterprise deployment models and have an ability to collaborate with IT and Security specialists to enable secure collaboration inside and outside an organization. This includes an understanding of network architectures, IT & Security products and protocols.
Your Day to Day:
Engage with your customers through regular calls, business reviews and daily needs.
Monitor and manage adoption metrics to ensure customers are utilizing the full Wickr platform.
Create success plans or get-well plans for your customers and document customer progress toward established goals and results.
Manage escalations closely, acting as the quarterback for all critical issues and ensuring multiple internal teams are aligned.
Communicating major milestones and updates to Sr. Leadership on a regular basis.
Work closely with other teams to be the Voice of the Customer.
Develop a deep understanding of Security trends and risks to ensure proper implementation in every customer's environment.
Become the trusted advisor to your customer, ability to deliver on the Customer's definition of value.
Identify up-sell and cross sell opportunities.

5+ years working in a customer-facing role, working with DoD/Federal and/or Enterprise-level customers.
Ideal candidate will have experience working with Government, Military type organizations - both domestically and internationally.
Security or Cloud/Saas industry experience.
Strong project management skills with a proven system for tracking multiple customers requests, issues and strategic plans.
Demonstrated success in large scale deployments of a new technology.
A proven track record of driving change within large organizations.
Previous experience tracking product adoption and customer engagement through data-analysis tools.
Exceptional organizational, presentation, and communication skills.
Demostrated ability to deal with change and excel in high-stress situations with frequently changing priorities.

OVERVIEW:
Sportradar is the leading global provider of sports betting and sports entertainment products and services. Since 2001, we have occupied a unique position at the intersection of the sports, media and betting industries; providing sports federations, news media, consumer platforms and sports betting operators with a range of solutions to help grow their business.
O ur Ad:s team is a full-service data-driven marketing service helping sports betting operators differentiate themselves in a crowded and competitive market. From sponsorship consulting to SEO and SEA marketing, UI/UX consulting, digital traffic networks, programmatic advertising, pop-under ad networks, ad products and affiliate marketing, this team offers bookmakers a host of solutions to eliminate waste and streamline their business.
As a part of Sportradar's "Ad:s" team, your contribution will ensure the continuation of our hyper-growth by close collaboration with our supply partners and through the advancement of betting and sports advertisement technologies. This role is located either in New York or remotely.
THE CHALLENGE:
Enabling and optimizing programmatic partners such as SSPs, media networks, publishers, 3rd party data vendors, consent management platforms, etc
Servicing all supply/media partners to enhance betting & sports advertisement in general
Seeking new opportunities and technologies to improve performance for ad:s advertising clients and its marketing platform for betting operators and sports marketers
Creating reports and presentations for partners on a regular basis
Working closely with the product and programmatic buying team around integrations, activations, etc
Proactively communicating processes and results internally – especially during prolonged home-office times
Adapting to cultural peculiarities with active clients and partners in more than 25 countries
YOUR PROFILE:
3+ years of experience in digital/programmatic advertising
Knowledge of ad servers (e.g. Google Ad Manager), ad exchanges, RTB, DSPs, SSPs, and similar entities
Proven track record of building relationships with the media/advertising industry
Solid understanding of the technical ins-and-outs and operational requirements of programmatic projects and products.
Understanding and up to date with current digital advertising technologies
Self-driven and hands-on mentality
Fluent in English is a must, German a plus
OUR OFFER:
Become part of one of the fastest-growing businesses in the digital sports environment and help us scale our operations
Be part of a highly motivated, innovative, and dynamic team
Exciting job field with the opportunity for personal development
Remote working possibilities and flexible working hours
