About Guaranteed Rate:
Guaranteed Rate is the 5th largest retail mortgage lender in the U.S. By offering industry-leading tools, low-rate mortgages and unparalleled customer service, we’ve become the Home Purchase Experts®. At Guaranteed Rate, we think big—pushing beyond what most people believe is possible. We strive to work with the best of the best, building business with the best referral partners and hiring the best employees—allowing us to deliver world-class customer service. Our goal is to make sure every customer has a great experience. Headquartered in Chicago with 5,000+ employees in 300+ offices across the U.S. and licensed in all 50 states, we’ve helped thousands of homeowners with more than $37 billion in home purchase loans and refinances in just the past year alone.

What's the Role?

This position is responsible for managing the Guaranteed Rate Mortgage Conventional Underwriters in your dedicated region. This includes constant monitoring of the file flow and workloads in order to maintain acceptable turn times and the team’s customer service. The Regional Underwriting Manager (RUM) will monitor efficiencies and will continually look for ways to improve our processes, both in terms of procedures and use of systems to ensure continuous service and quality improvements and error reductions. Success in this position is demonstrated by building a cohesive team of Underwriters, effectively applying guidelines and sound underwriting practices, providing intelligent risk assessment and informed decisions while ensuring regulatory compliance.

Responsibilities

Create and maintain a highly efficient and productive environment/culture that values team members and rewards performance.

Ensure effective communication and team building atmosphere within all departments of Guaranteed Rate.

Manage the mortgage underwriting pipeline; being cognizant of service levels, quality, compliance and daily expectations.

Plan, coordinate, direct, review and supervise work of subordinates in the underwriting of mortgage loans.

Oversee Conventional underwriting to ensure adherence to all Agency, Investor and Guaranteed Rate guidelines.

Review and analyze file documentation related to the loan decision and properly mitigate and document policy exceptions.

Review a percentage of approved loans by underwriters in your region to ensure they are complete and accurate and provide feedback to the Divisional Underwriting Manager.

Ensure the integrity of loan data entered and maintained in Encompass LOS, AUS and all systems required throughout the underwriting process.

Ensure that loan conditions submitted to obtain clear-to-close are reviewed in a timely manner.

Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements including but not limited to QM, ATR, HMDA, Reg B, ECOA, Reg V, Fact Act, AIR, Safe Act, etc.

Monitor results of internal audits and suspensions for areas needing improvement and additional training opportunities.

Provide guidance, training, coaching and assistance to staff as needed.

Responsible for employee evaluations, disciplinary actions, salary adjustments and termination functions.

Work closely with varying levels of management both internally and externally.

Other various duties as required.

Qualifications

BS/BA in Finance, Operations or Management preferred, or equivalent work history.

Must have 7+ years’ experience in all aspects of residential mortgage origination for both conventional and government products.

Two or more years’ experience in a management role, with proven track record in management and supervision.

Strong knowledge of State and Federal laws pertaining to the mortgage banking industry: QM, ATR, RESPA, ECOA, AIR, etc.

Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook).

Strong verbal and written communication skills are necessary.

Excellent customer service skills with strong attention to detail.

Time Management skills and the ability to prioritize workload based on daily production.

Strong analytical skills required with a high degree of accuracy.

Ability to work flexible hours as needed.

Ability to multi-task in other areas of the units.

Positive attitude and team-oriented spirit.

Ability to function in an ever-changing environment.

Guaranteed Rate is an Equal Opportunity Employer that welcomes and encourages all applicants to apply regardless of age, race, sex, religion, color, national origin, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital or parental status, ancestry, citizenship status, pregnancy or other reason protected by law.

Hello potential future Oatly employee. It’s us, the original oatmilk company that started in Sweden back 25 or so years ago and has since expanded to the U.S. where we’ve continued growing at a rate such that we need more brilliant minds to come work with us to keep the momentum going and the oatmilk flowing.

Sustainability, health, and transparency are the core values that guide everything we do. Basically, we exist to make it easy for people to eat better and live healthier lives without recklessly taxing the planet’s resources in the process. If any of this resonates with you, then maybe you’d like work for Oatly, too. Now onto the formal stuff.

We are looking for a Supply Chain Systems Manager to join our team. The chief goals for this position are to implement, maintain, and support the US Supply Chain and inventory systems. This support will extend from our host ERP system, through applications and software such as EDI, TMS, planning software, etc. The Supply Chain Systems Manager will work with the business owners to ensure the systems support and enhance all processes throughout the supply chain.
Here are the things we want to hire you to do:
Manage the deployment, maintenance, and troubleshooting of our core business applications
Meet and coordinate with internal and external stakeholders to establish project scopes, system goals, and requirements
Work with IT department to represent the systems needs of the US Supply Chain, logistics and Inventory organization
Develop, analyze, prioritize, and organize requirement specifications, flowcharts for developers and testers to follow
Coordinate the set-up and configuration of systems, with appropriate business partners
Define and coordinate the execution of testing procedures and develop test cases to serve the overall quality assurance process
Provide documentation of all processes and training as needed
Implement best practices for scalability, supportability, ease of maintenance, and system performance
Here are the things we think you need:
Bachelor's degree in computer science or information technology, or equivalent experience
5-10 years’ experience working in a similar role as a systems analyst
Strong understanding of ERP systems, preferably Microsoft D365
Proven ability to assess business needs and translate them into relevant solutions
Experience installing, configuring, documenting, testing, training, and implementing new applications and systems
Experience with desktop/cloud applications to enhance functionality and reporting needs
Excellent analytical skills
Knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Access, Smartsheets, Jira, project management
Here is another list of qualities we think make a good Oatly team member:
You feel connected to our mission of encouraging health, sustainability, and transparency
You are a self-starter who doesn’t need direct supervision to motivate you for success – we believe strongly in building a culture of individual accountability and ownership. Oatly needs partners that can embrace that mentality and be able to exceed expectations while working independently
You are ready to make your mark in a smaller, growing brand leveraging your experience to deliver amazing results to continue building an outstanding company
You have entrepreneurial spirit; in that you are comfortable with ambiguity and are energized by the process of building something lasting from the ground up
You enjoy sharing your quirkiness and talents with your coworkers
Another bulleted list felt redundant, so we wrote this long sentence with all the ways we sweeten the deal to work with us, like providing flexible vacation for starters, really great benefits with 100% medical coverage, genuinely great coworkers who want to see the company and each other succeed, a start-up vibe with an established company history, and a fridge full of the best non-dairy alternative in the world for your enjoyment.
Oatly is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

JobTitle: Advertising Account Manager - Client Success - Channel Bakers **Remote Based Opportunity - US Only
Text:
Digital Advertising Account Manager - Client Success Team - Channel Bakers

**This role can be remote based

**So we can reach you and our emails aren't sent to spam, please whitelist @app.bamboohr.com

https://clean.email/how-to-whitelist-an-email

Account Managers at Channel Bakers are the beating hearts of our account teams. You are the glue that holds everything together as you oversee the day to day running of client accounts and ensure that all strategy is executed on time and to budget.

As a seasoned Account Manager, you will have the confidence and competence to support across a diverse range of clients from New to Market right through to the more strategic complex clients/brands.

You are a strong and effective communicator, taking the lead on day to day client interactions and seamlessly sharing information and data to the Strategic Account Executive and Advertising Specialists. With acute attention to detail, you oversee and track click credits, budget pacing, customer deliverables and take any ad hoc client requests in your stride. You are a guru on all things related to Search Strategy and Demand Side Platform (DSP) and utilize this knowledge to leverage optimum campaign outputs for our clients.

 As the right hand to the Account Executive, you support them with strategic client communication, quarterly business reviews, presentations and developing media plans. Supporting the Advertising Specialist, you ensure that they are set up for success with all of their daily tasks which include building & optimizing campaigns, key word development and developing Calls to Action. You clearly and comfortably delegate both routine and important tasks and provide help and direction as required.

You are able to communicate clearly and succinctly in a variety of communication settings and styles and can get messages across that have the desired effect. You make good decisions based on a combination of analysis, wisdom, experience and judgement and are often sought out by others for advice or solutions. You enjoy working hard, are action oriented and are full of energy for things you see as challenging. You value time and know how to use it effectively to optimize your own efficiency.

This position is based at our US HQ in Anaheim Hills, CA and reports to the Director of Strategic Accounts. It may require domestic travel, approximately 10% of the time.

Required Experience & Qualifications:


Minimum of 3 to 4+ years of Marketing or Advertising experience in a fast moving, client facing environment
Degree in Business, Public Relations, Marketing, Advertising, Communications or equivalent preferred
Experience of Amazon Search Advertising preferred and exposure to DSP (Demand Side Platform) a significant advantage
Experience of being part of a performing team
Strong analytical and qualitative skills are essential - data and numbers don't scare you!
Proven ability to cultivate and foster new relationships and depend existing ones
Proficient user of standard office software (MS Office etc). Intermediate or advanced Excel necessary
Proven track record of driving your own professional and personal development


Everyday Tasks:


Communicate regularly with clients via calls, email and in person meetings to update on campaigns and discuss campaign actions and activities.
Oversee budget pacing & management, click credits tracking, launching campaigns, optimizing rulesets and all DSP activity
Prepare reports and analyze data and insights
Carry out brand and product research
Support the Strategic Account Director or Executive with strategic client needs.
Support Advertising Specialist to ensure their tasks are completed accurately and on time.
Partner with the Advertising Operations Lead to identify process challenges and find solutions.
Communicate and collaborate cross-functionally within Channel Bakers with other key stakeholders including Finance, Engineering, Creative and People & Culture.


Working at Channel Bakers:

Working at Channel Bakers is a job like no other.

Our beautiful USHQ is situated in Anaheim Hills overlooking the spectacular views of Chino Hills State Park. We take pride in our inspirational office decor and offer a fun and engaging environment to help our employees bring their best selves to work every single day. Our kitchen is stocked with snacks and refreshments to keep us hydrated and energized all day long and we regularly take time to connect and have fun together as a team. We get to work alongside some incredibly talented co-workers and partner with some of the world’s most prolific and inspirational Brands. We are a truly global organization with offices located in Seattle, the Philippines and the UK and proud to have a very diverse team of Bakers not only from the US but also Germany, France, Brazil, Scotland and Mongolia to name a few!

Our core tenet is that we exist to help people and this is at the heart of all that we do.

We enjoy the challenge of new and unfamiliar tasks, change is our normal and we can shift gears comfortably. We love to exceed our goals, both work and personal and most importantly we are dedicated to exceeding the expectations or our clients. We value self-development, it helps us help others, better.

Job Perks:


Access to Medical Insurance (including Chiropractic and Acupuncture), Dental, Vision and Life Insurance.
Fully vested 401K with up to 4% employer match
Flexible Working
Paid Time Off (vacation, public holidays, birthday, sick, bereavement etc).
Paid volunteer time
Ergonomic workstations with standing/sitting desks
Regular team social events
Stocked kitchen with snacks and beverages
Free access to Financial Advisor support
 Access to Employee Assistance Program

Our Government Partnerships team is growing and we’re actively seeking a micromobiltiy evangelist with proposal writing and management expertise. If you have experience navigating procurement processes, a background in technical writing, project management, and deadline driven projects, we want to hear from you.
Superpedestrian is a company with a significant engineering pedigree and applicants work cross functionally with internal teams to determine proposal strategy and execution that reflects our thoughtful scooter and operations approach. Ideal candidates will have a working knowledge of the micromobility industry, urban planning, and/or transportation issues, or a strong desire to learn. The work is internal-facing, cross-functional, fast-paced, and deadline driven. As a small company, there is significant access to technical experts and plenty of opportunity for growth. We are looking for the right person to join our team. Is it you?
The Proposal Manager will report to the VP of Policy & Communications. NYC based candidates are preferred but we are open to remote applicants as well.
What you’ll do:
Coordinate and project manage proposal schedules, qualifications packages, and presentation materials, including editing
Create, maintain, and project manage a central library of updated content
Lead RFP content strategy and execution
Lead and project manage cross-functional team meetings to develop and deliver proposals
Work with cross-functionally to build and expand strategic programs that are both company SOPs and/or tailored to specific cities
Remain abreast of industry trends and collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure we present up to date content that remains competitive within our fast moving industry
Work with design teams to ensure final documents are styled and reflect our business
Design and iterate on a hand-off process between the proposal teams and implementation teams to ensure the highest degree of program execution.
Who you are:
3-5+ years of experience proposal writing/management and/or grant writing. Focus on micromobility, urban planning, municipal policy, or non-profit grant writing environment
Bachelor’s degree
Very strong written and spoken communication skills with a variety of audiences
Experience delivering deadline-oriented projects on time with a high degree of accuracy
Process-oriented with exceptional organizational skills and ability to define and manage multiple tasks simultaneously
Proficient in Google Suite, experience with Adobe InDesign and Photoshop preferred
Perks:
Competitive benefits with company subsidized medical, dental, vision & disability insurance and a 401k plan.
Generous time off policy.
On the job training with a leadership team that is committed to growth and development of all employees.
A team of awesome, like-minded, driven people that support each other, and mentors from across the top echelons of industry.
The chance to have your voice heard and help shape Superpedestrian’s future.
Equity in a fast growing company.
A commitment to an actively anti-racist environment.

Management Consultant - Medical Examination

Position Summary:
This management consultant position is to support independent entities with Medical Examination consultation expertise . As a medical consultant, you'll help improve the efficiency of physicians and healthcare facilities by solving some of their most complex business problems. This role will work directly with state and local government agencies to help provide independent medical reviews, recommendations, and support compliance efforts for grants and funding.
Position Details:
Reports to: Senior Consultant
Position Location: Remote
Position Type: On-Call
Compensation: Based on Experience
Essential Job Functions:
The candidate will perform the following essential functions:
This role will work independently on various Forensic Operations projects providing sound analysis and solutions
Must be able to facilitate medical emergency preparedness which includes continuity of operations planning and disaster recovery efforts
Must have a strong understanding of medical facility operations to assist clients in response to COVID-19 pandemic requirements for federal funds reimbursements
Must be able to apply appropriate analytical methodologies and summarize findings for eligibility of expenditures utilizing federal funds
Understand and apply project management concepts to support prioritization and implementation of programmatic activities and strategic initiatives
Creating policies, Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), and business process guidelines for use of federal funding received by State and local governments
Create performance metrics, collect performance data, apply appropriate analytical methodologies and visualization techniques to evaluate grant/program performance of State/Local government and associated subrecipients
Perform meeting management activities to include scheduling, coordinating administrative and logistical needs as well as the development of supporting materials, summary reports, action items, and meeting minutes
Develop tailored briefing materials and reports to communicate concepts, analysis results, and recommendations to a diverse group of stakeholders
Be comfortable presenting your work to a small audience conveying results or facilitating discussion to support a client decision
Identify opportunities for enhancing service offerings and developing business within a client organization or business area
Experience and Skill Requirements:
Certified Physician’s Assistant
Certified Medical Consultant
FEMA – Mass Fatality Incident Response
Strong proficiency with Microsoft Office (Word, SharePoint, Excel, PowerPoint)
Ability to distill information, develop insights, and work alongside clients to solve complex challenges
Ability to be a self-starter, team player, and leader in a fast-paced environment
Must be detail-oriented and able to handle multiple priorities concurrently
Must possess strong interpersonal communications and teamwork skills
Takes ownership of projects and can prioritize assignments based on client’s needs
Authorized to work in the US
Education Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree required
Work Schedule:
This position requires the following time and staffing commitment:
Regular work hours with potential for overtime

This position description incorporates the core responsibilities of the job. It recognizes that other related duties not specifically mentioned might also be performed, and that not all responsibilities may be carried out depending on operational needs.

Senior Project Manager – Fannie/Freddie Agency PCR Reviewer

Job Description
Senior Project Managers (SPMs) at Nova Group, GBC manage the project workflow and report preparation to both Nova and our Client standards and deadlines. SPMs engage in project setup and assignment with our scheduling team, communication with Field Managers on project requirements, progress, schedule, technical review and close out of the project (invoice, shipping, etc).
As technical reviewers, SPMs are responsible for the review and submittal of the PCNA report by the Field Manager, and resolution of outstanding report issues. They use their knowledge of Agency Guidelines to ensure proper report documentation. Ultimately, our SPMs are accountable for the technical merit of the Nova reports delivered to our Clients.
SPMs may also be asked to perform Property Condition Assessments (PCAs) as needed. Typical sites to be assessed would include commercial properties such as offices, warehouses, multi-family sites and hotels.
Our Senior Project Managers are a core member of our project delivery and client relationship teams working with our field teams, Account and Sales Managers to ensure the quality of our deliverables to our clients, exceeding their expectations along the way.
Required Experience and Skill Sets:
Bachelor’s degree in architecture, engineering, or construction-related field
5+ years’ experience conducting and/or managing PCNAs (preferably Agency scopes), and/or engineering and architectural consulting services
Thorough understanding of Agency Guidelines
Experience in the management/review of related due diligence projects
Knowledge of building components, systems and cost estimating
Strong technical writing skills and proven attention to detail
Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook
Current, valid state driver’s license (position requires a motor vehicle record background check)
Candidates with professional registrations preferred (PE, RA, etc.) Familiar with Agency PCR scope requirements
Ability to analyze assessor findings to ensure the PCR accurately reflects the Property
Ability to coach assessors, both employees and associates, to complete accurate and scope-compliant deliverables
Ability to analyze client-provided documents, such as Capital budgets, repairs and projections and incorporate in to the findings and reserve analysis
Ability and willingness to work effectively as a member of the Nova Deal Team to support the needs and goals of CMG Clients
Ability to strictly adhere to deadlines on multiple simultaneous projects

Click here to apply now!

Working for Nova Group, GBC
Nova Group, GBC (Nova) is a privately held multidisciplinary advisory firm incorporated in 1987. We have a global footprint headquartered in Chaska, Minnesota, but our team services clients throughout the United States and abroad. Nova provides services in the areas of environmental management, compliance investigation, corrective action activities, strategic energy services, and construction services. Our diverse portfolio of services creates a multitude of career possibilities, and we strive to bring on talent who want to learn and build their skills across multiple sectors of our business.

A General Benefit Corporation (GBC), often referred to as a B-Corp, means Nova is aligning our values with our business practices. We recognize our role goes beyond profitability, and we value our environment, our communities, and our people. Beyond our articles of incorporation, we are making a commitment to measure our impact in four key segments: our environment, our communities, our customers, and our employees.

In efforts to remain competitive and to differentiate ourselves from others in the industry, we continuously review our benefit programs. One way we accomplish this is with flexible and remote work arrangements, because we realize that personal demands don’t just happen after 5 p.m. The great majority of our staff work from remote offices that allow the ultimate balance of work and personal life. Different work environment options are available to you, from offices in larger cities to offices available on an as-needed basis. Whatever your work-environment needs, we will make an effort to accommodate them. At Nova this culture is successful because we trust our teams to be accountable to each other and to our clients.

In addition, Nova is committed to supporting your professional development through career ladders, training programs, and continuing education to support your certifications and licenses. We look for opportunities to build skills on the job in particular, shadowing mentors and senior staff, leveraging all they have to offer. We always want our employees to feel challenged and to strive to grow their skills and careers.
Click here to apply now!

Spring 2021 Media & Publicity Intern Unison Media is an award-winning, market-leading music communications agency based in New York City, with a new vision of how classical music, opera, and the performing arts can be promoted. Our work ranges from publicity and branding to websites, social media and digital marketing, with clients such as Gustavo Dudamel, Wynton Marsalis, Lawrence Brownlee, Jeremy Denk, Conrad Tao, the JACK Quartet, Warner Classics and many more. We also run a nonprofit concert series, Death of Classical, that has been featured everywhere from The New York Times to NPR to Vogue.We’re looking for a part-time intern (a few days a week; hours flexible) to assist with and gain expertise in all aspects of our work, from social media strategy and content creation to video editing, building websites, and researching and pitching media. We want someone who can help us tell the stories of our artists in a way that will catch the eyes of the internet.This internship is open to current college students and recent graduates, and offers credit and/or a small monthly stipend.What we’re looking for:- A passion for classical music:  you have a background in the classical music world and are hoping to gain experience in the music industry- Social media fluency:  you’re familiar with best practices for Facebook, Instagram,Twitter, and TikTok, and are interested in brainstorming and producing multimedia content across all platforms- An eye for web design:  you understand the basics of template-based web design and how to create a compelling user experience for visitors to a site; comfort with platforms such as Squarespace, Webflow, and Mailchimp is a plus- Graphic design and video/photo editing skills: you have an eye for visual design and experience with Canva, Adobe Photoshop, iMovie, etc.- Media savvy: you keep up with the news and are familiar with major publications, both digital and print, that cover the arts, social justice, and current events; prior PR experience and comfort with databases such as Cision is a plusJob Types: Part-time, InternshipPay: From $500.00 per monthSchedule:Monday to FridayEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Writing Skills: 1 year (Preferred)Marketing: 1 year (Preferred)Work Location:Fully RemoteInternship Compensation:College CreditThis Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneousDetail-oriented -- would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger pictureThis Company Describes Its Culture as:Detail-oriented -- quality and precision-focusedCompany's website:www.unison.mediaCompany's Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/UnisonMediaUS/COVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

Overview:

Deerfield Discovery and Development, LLC (3DC) is the drug discovery and development arm of Deerfield Management Company, L.P. (“Deerfield”), an investment firm dedicated to advancing healthcare, and is engaged in drug discovery research in collaboration with faculty from top universities across the United States. 3DC plays a critical role in identifying and progressing early-stage therapeutics from scientific discovery through clinical proof of concept, via rigorous due diligence of proposals, and design and execution of relevant experiments for approved projects. 3DC partners closely with principal investigators in Deerfield’s academic collaboration network, corporate and CRO partners to progress projects to value inflection points, and partners with Deerfield’s investment colleagues to execute the optimal monetization strategy for each project.

Title: Functional Lead Discovery Biology

3DC seeks an experienced Discovery Biology Functional Lead (FL) to support our small and large molecule therapeutic discovery and development programs. As a member of multiple project Core Teams, the primary responsibility of the Discovery Biology Functional Lead is to provide strategic insight and tactical guidance with respect to their function, and for their projects generally, and to ensure the efficient execution of the biology strategy primarily through leadership of CRO biologists located in India and Europe. The Discovery Biology FL may serve as the Program Leader for one or more discovery stage programs.

The successful candidate will be responsible for collaboration with colleagues from Medicinal Chemistry, Translational Sciences, DMPK, Safety Assessment, and Research Informatics to assess a wide array of preclinical in vitro and in vivo data, as well as structural data. The Discovery Biology FL must then coordinate with additional members of the project biology team to design, develop, and apply biochemical, biophysical and cellular assays to identify and characterize active compounds during lead discovery and optimization to test pharmacological hypotheses, and ultimately to identify outstanding candidates for clinical evaluation. The FL will also be accountable for the design and execution of exploratory studies intended to identify and confirm proximal and distal mechanistic and pharmacodynamic markers, and to partner with Translational Sciences and In Vivo Pharmacology on the development and confirmation of patient selection hypotheses and associated biomarkers. The functional lead will be further responsible for the generation of reports in support of stage-gate nominations, publications, patent filings, and IND submissions. The Functional Lead must exhibit an energetic and innovative approach to problem solving. Strong communication and interpersonal skills with a desire to work in a fast-paced, flexible and dynamic environment is required.
Responsibilities:

Key Responsibilities

Provide scientific leadership, strategic insight, and tactical guidance to drive multiple (2-4) therapeutic discovery projects from target validation through to clinical candidate selection across varied therapeutic areas, including selection of relevant diseases and specific patient populations, primarily executed through coordination of CRO biologists located in India and Europe.
Serve as a member and at times leader of project Core Teams, working collaboratively with colleagues from Medicinal Chemistry, Translational Sciences, DMPK, Safety Assessment, and Research Informatics to deliver key milestones and ultimately first-in-class and/or best-in-class clinical candidates.
Liaise with the principle investigators and their teams at the academic institutions to align on project deliverables and timelines, and ensure appropriate resources are allocated to meet these commitments.
Provide scientific direction and strategy to identify and implement emerging key technologies to expand service capabilities and fulfill customer needs in cutting-edge drug discoveries.
Invest ~30% of time mentoring and training Indian/European-based team members, both through frequent remote communications (video/voice calls, email) and in-person interactions ( when appropriate).
Maintain the highest level of scientific rigor and professionalism within our organization.
Qualifications:

Key Experiences

D. in biological sciences with at least 10+ years’ experience in a Pharma / Biotech as a biologist.
Experience in the design, validation and routine implementation of cellular and biochemical in vitro assays in the context of a screening cascade to support an integrated drug discovery program is essential
Experience in the design and execution of exploratory studies intended to identify and validate proximal and distal mechanistic and pharmacodynamic markers, as well as in the development and validation of patient selection hypotheses and associated biomarkers.
Experience in oncology and neuroscience therapeutic areas is a plus.
Demonstrated ability to lead a biology team driving projects from target validation through to clinical candidate nomination.
Demonstrated ability to manage timelines while advancing projects to successfully meet stage gate criteria.
Strong scientific reputation, as evidenced by publications, patents, and invited presentations.
Excellent understanding of fundamental principles for related disciplines, such as medicinal chemistry, DMPK, and safety assessment strong preferred.
Experience with IND preparation and submission.
Demonstrated ability to work in a matrix environment and experience working in a global environment is a plus.

Key Skills and Capabilities

Collaboration and relationship building - Works well with others, leveraging skills to deliver high overall team performance. Is open to diverse perspectives and will challenge their own thinking
Adaptability - Anticipates potential issues and quickly changes course to maintain high performance levels, reacts quickly and positively when presented with challenges or new direction
Strategic Thinking - Identifies the critical data insights without becoming entrenched in detail. Anticipates future scenarios and builds plans that harness critical data and external trends and insight
Results orientation and team performance - Builds robust plans and objectives with engagement of others, drives performance against timelines ensuring a focus on safety, integrity, compliance, quality and service.
Coaching - Identifies strengths and development needs of others to drive optimal performance levels. Devotes time to coaching and mentoring individuals to accelerate their development
Communication skills - Strong written, presentation and verbal communication skills are essential.

3DC provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to religion, race, creed, color, sex, sexual orientation, alienage or citizenship status, national origin, age, marital status, pregnancy, disability, veteran or military status, predisposing genetic characteristics or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law.

JobTitle: Global Market Development Manager - Biotech Loyalty
Text:
When you are a part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work to help make the world healthier cleaner and safer, like helping researchers find cures for cancer, protecting the environment or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have real-world impact, and support to help you achieve your long-term career goals.

How will you make an impact?

We are looking for a talented and results-driven Global Market Development Manager - Biotech Loyalty to join the Biosciences Division’s (BID) Integrated Marketing Programs team. This dynamic, strategic and creative individual will be responsible for retention and advocacy marketing focused primarily on the Biotech market. Their charter will be to develop multi-channel marketing programs that leverage an enticing customer loyalty program to drive increased product adoption, repeat demand, life-time value and incremental revenue primarily from the Biotech market for Thermo Fisher Scientific.
The appointed Marketing Manager will use their comprehensive marketing experience targeting or working in the Biotech market, scientific knowledge and customer-centricity to identify and execute against the most effective go-to-market strategies to gain new customers and grow share of wallet. This highly collaborative individual will need to work effectively across multiple marketing, sales and operations functions, leading and influencing cross-functional teams to drive results.
The successful individual will enjoy working with intensity, can drive strategy to action, have exceptional organization and communication skills with a diverse marketing skill set. A scientific education is a necessity with a background in cell, protein or molecular biology a plus, combined with solid business acumen to achieve goals on time.
Their ability to prioritize and manage multiple parallel projects and work comfortably in a highly matrixed environment will allow them to demonstrate that they are a keen team player while being able to complete projects independently that make a positive impact on the business and customers.

What will you do?
Develop and execute against tactical marketing plans to drive customer acquisition, retention and advocacy for primarily but not limited to BID consumable products
Create and deploy marketing content across multiple on and off-line channels for both acquisition and retention marketing
Utilize analytical tools and revenue reporting data to make sound marketing decisions to exceed financial and marketing performance objectives
Develop sales and marketing training material to excite and activate commercial and Business Unit teams to be successful in target segments
Lead, without direct authority, dynamic cross-functional project teams to complete tasks on time and within budget
Develop product and application workflows to drive cross-sell and up-sell activities within loyalty program
Interact with varying levels of leadership to report on progress and escalate challenges
May perform other related duties as required and/or assigned
What skills will lead to success?
Identifies problems, answers questions, gain cooperation of others and implement efficient solutions.
Exceptional project management skills, attention to detail, strong time management skills and deadline driven
Fast and self-starter learner, with ability to work in a dynamic team adapting quickly to a changing environment
Strong understanding and experience with digital media and how they influence customer behavior
Customer journey mapping
Analytical and able to make justifiable data-driven decisions to drive growth, maintain a designated budget and provide metrics to ensure strong return on investment
Ability to lead and provide functional area guidance and expertise to the broader team.
Provide regularly oral and written communication of metrics, successes, failures, best practices etc. to improve the overall operating efficiency of the team.
Must be willing to learn and take coaching from peers and supervisors/superiors, both in success and failure.
Must have a can-do attitude, as well as the ability to overcome failures to produce success with a “never give up” approach.
How will you get there?
6+ total years of marketing experience with a minimum of 3 years successfully and independently developing and implementing marketing plans
Experience in life sciences, biotech or related field required, with intimate knowledge of the North America market
Demonstrated knowledge and experience of retention and advocacy marketing, particularly through digital marketing channels
Collaborates easily and effectively with an ability to influence without direct authority
Minimum Education:
Bachelor's Degree

This position may be remote for the ideal candidate.

JobTitle: Remote Video Editor (Freelance to Full time)
Text:
As an Editor for Privcap Media, you will be joining a small but growing team of video professionals and storytellers serving a range of financial services clients. We are looking for a team player to join our Post Production team firstly on a one month freelance contract with the goal of bringing you on full-time.

This is a REMOTE position with salary and benefits. We work East Coast Hours

Essential Job Duties:
Edit fast-turnaround scripted presentation style videos with the subject in the upper corner of the screen and PowerPoint slide deck fullscreen

Edit traditional interview/b-roll style videos with guidance from our editorial staff

Keep footage and projects organized according to in-house procedures

Troubleshoot technical issues that arise from large projects w/ multiple assets and editors

Experience:
At least 2 years of experience as a video editor

Strong interpersonal skills; prior exposure to executive-level clients is a plus

Self-motivated, problem solver

Ability to excel within the dynamic demands of a rapidly growing company

Interest in the financial sector a plus

Technical Skills:

High-level proficiency in Adobe Premiere. As many of these edits will need to be same-day or next-day turnaround, we need someone who is very comfortable getting things done quickly and thoroughly.
Access to a high-end editing computer capable of quickly exporting videos
Access to a high speed internet connection (fiber preferred) to easily sync raw footage remotely via Dropbox and quickly upload edited videos
Ability to work from home/remotely and communicate efficiently via Google Chat
Basic proficiency in After Effects is preferred, to make tweaks to things like text/size, but not required

Company Description

Dailymotion is the leading video discovery destination & technology that learns about your tastes over time, constantly surfacing the best, most relevant content on the web. Our mission is to provide the best video user experience for consumers on the market, connecting publishers and advertisers to engaged viewers who turn to Dailymotion for their daily fix of the most compelling music, entertainment, news and sports content around.
Through partnerships with the world's leading publishers and content creators, France Télévisions, Le Monde, CBS, Bein Sports, CNN, GQ, Universal Music Group, VICE and more, Dailymotion commands 3 billion monthly pageviews across its mobile app, desktop and connected TV experiences. Dailymotion is owned by Vivendi, one of the largest mass-media corporations in the world.
At Dailymotion, we‘re storytellers. We build the best place for people to enjoy the videos that matter. We do this through utilizing and developing cutting-edge technology and pushing the envelope to bring discoverable stories to life through premium content from the world’s best publishers. We do this by helping these publishers grow their audiences and monetize their content, their way.
Dailymotion is proud to be an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer. We value inclusion and we want you to help us thrive for a more diverse community.

Job Description

We are looking for an Ad Operations Manager to join the Dailymotion Exchange (DMX) Ad-Operations Team.
Dailymotion has launched its private video ad exchange 2 years ago called Dailymotion Exchange (DMX) and we are now looking for an advertising operations expert to manage monetization with its main demand partners and to manage DMX video inventory locally.
Trafficking:

You will have to manage the execution and the technical deployment of both direct (creative assets and tags) and programmatic (deal IDs, ad-networks) video and display campaigns: Ad-serving, 3rd party tracking, trafficking, optimization, troubleshooting, etc.
Cross-device implementation (desktop, mobile, IPTV & gaming consoles) Saleshouse tags and operations maintenance

Analytics & Operations Strategy:

You will provide high-end monitoring and reporting of the US advertising activity: Monitoring revenues and key KPIs (VTR, CTR, inventory sources, etc.) on direct sales campaign on a daily basis
Monitoring and reporting ROI on content sales/traffic acquisition campaigns on a daily basis
Providing yield strategies and inventory optimization over the entire geographic zone (STR, CPM, global revenues, campaign priority, etc.)
Identifying new levers for operation optimization: Analyzing on-going activity with current partners and pointing risks but also short & mid-terms opportunities
Working on agency QBRs and campaign wrap summaries

Sales support:

You will pair and coordinate on a daily basis with the US sales leads in order to ensure the success of local commercial actions:
Interacting on a day to day basis with agencies’ ad-operations teams (direct & programmatic) to ensure campaigns prosperity
Supporting the Sales Leads during operational and business reviews and acting as a pivotal asset for any operational and technical discussion

Transversal role:

You will have to coordinate with Technical Operations Managers on a regular basis in order to support and assist advertising projects:
Escalating potential technical failures spotted within the operation perspective
Identifying and building specifications on potential market needs requiring some technical developments Supporting the deployment of product projects within a local perspective

Qualifications

Technical skills:
Minimum 3 years of working experience in an ad-ops or campaign manager role within the digital advertising area. Must have programmatic experiences.
Strong knowledge of technical market standards (VAST, VPAID, ad-serving, SSP, DSP, etc.). A good understanding of web standards such as HTML, JS / JSON, Flash etc. is a plus.
Strong analytical and structural problem-solving skills
 Experience with traffic acquisition is a plus
Soft skills:
You are able to interact with several teams and handle projects of different nature (sales, product, etc.)
You are adaptable within a fast changing “start-up” environment
You are able to multitask and prioritize several projects at a time and take initiatives
Additional Information

At Dailymotion, we empower candidates to take action. If this job sounds like a great opportunity for you, be confident in your skills, we are always happy to meet you! If needed, we can accommodate our recruitment process for your special abilities.
Location: NYC
Type of contract: Full-time
Start Date: ASAP
For the NYC Office
High-end Health Insurance (eligibility starting from the 1st day. 100% by Dailymotion)
️ Retirement: 401k eligibility after 90 Days of employment
️ Paid Time off and additional PTO
️ Living Employee Culture (Events / Trainings / Partys / All hands / Dailymotion tradition…)
 Career development support (training / internal mobility / compensation cycle / 360 quarter feedback review …)
Remote Work Policy
 Paternity leave or Co-parental leave extended
 Saving Plan Vivendi
 Public Transport refund
 Fitness Club membership

Hello potential future Oatly employee. It’s us, the original oatmilk company that started in Sweden back 25 or so years ago and has since expanded to the U.S. where we’ve continued growing at a rate such that we need more brilliant minds to come work with us to keep the momentum going and the oatmilk flowing.

Sustainability, health, and transparency are the core values that guide everything we do. Basically, we exist to make it easy for people to eat better and live healthier lives without recklessly taxing the planet’s resources in the process. If any of this resonates with you, then maybe you’d like work for Oatly, too. Now onto the formal stuff.
We are looking for a Global Trade & Compliance Analyst to join our team. This role will be responsible for providing operational excellence around all Import / Export transactions and activities between Oatly North America and our Global partners. This individual will establish and maintain strong customer relationships and serve as the single point of contact between freight forwarders, custom brokers, operators, and all International customers to ensure optimum customer service and deliver maximum advantage to the business in the most sustainable, efficient way possible. Additionally, you’ll be responsible for ensuring legal compliance within US Customs & Border Protection rules and regulations.
Here are the things we want to hire you to do:
Manage all import/export daily activities including, but not limited to, all global transaction trade & planning, import/export specific data entry, documentation tracking for all International shipments (air and ocean), including both import and export, maintain accurate import/export compliance record keeping in accordance with US Customs and Border Protection
Plan, quote, direct, and monitor all air and ocean shipments for Oatly import and export operations
Act as the liaison for Oatly North America and customs authorities - this involves research of contested issues, coming up with resolutions to potential customs assessments called out by customs authorities and ensuring timely and compliant filings with governmental authorities
Maintain knowledge of ocean freight tariffs, INCOTERMS, and contracts; as well as container/bunker fuel charges, etc. for successful negotiations with ocean carriers and service providers
Track and monitor entire process of cargo movement and keep customers up to date on movement details based on their expectations
Address any issues that delay the clearance of goods through the import/export entry process, in relation to import logistics in conjunction with the manager of Customs Compliance
Partner with US Customs Compliance to ensure that Warehouse service providers meet the Customs-Trade Partnership Against Terrorism (C-TPAT) minimum security criteria
Ensure all daily, weekly, and monthly Import/Export reports are completed accurately and on time
Maintain excellent cross functional relationships with Oatly corporate personnel, external vendor partners, carriers and internal Warehouse/D.C. team members and managers
Here are the things we think you need:
A solid understanding of Global Trade rules & regulations, Compliance, and Import/Export INCOTERMS
Experience with TMS systems, including prior experiences selecting a TMS supplier, implementing a TMS and maintaining a TMS system
An analytical mindset that can take data, extract meaningful and actionable information, and confidently present it to supply chain leadership
A working knowledge of ERP systems, ideally Microsoft Dynamics 365, and a Solid working proficiency with Excel
An ability to work cross functionally in order to provide accurate and timely Information to our Customer service & Supply Chain teams
A desire to grow within the logistics function and assume increasing levels of responsibility as we continue with our evolution
Here is another list of qualities we think make a good Oatly team member:
You feel connected to our mission of encouraging health, sustainability, and transparency
You are a self-starter who doesn’t need direct supervision to motivate you for success – we believe strongly in building a culture of individual accountability and ownership; Oatly needs partners that can embrace that mentality and be able to exceed expectations while working independently
You are ready to make your mark in a smaller, growing brand leveraging your experience to deliver amazing results to continue building an outstanding company
You have entrepreneurial spirit; in that you are comfortable with ambiguity and are energized by the process of building something lasting from the ground up
You enjoy sharing your quirkiness and talents with your coworkers
Another bulleted list felt redundant, so we wrote this long sentence with all the ways we sweeten the deal to work with us, like providing flexible vacation for starters, really great benefits with 100% medical coverage, genuinely great coworkers who want to see the company and each other succeed, a start-up vibe with an established company history, and being part of a story which changed the world.
Oatly is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

JobTitle: Engagement Manager (Service Delivery) - Remote options available
Text:
Company Description

Pitcher is a rapidly growing software company headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland that is continuing its expansion globally in the regions of EMEA, North America, Latin America and the Asia Pacific. The revolutionary Sales Enablement platform that Pitcher introduced in 2011 enables field sales representatives to execute their jobs more efficiently and thereby drive more sales. It is the super app for corporate salespeople. Across its focus verticals of Life Sciences, Consumer Goods, Manufacturing and Financial Services Pitcher empowers sales teams in over 136 countries to deliver best-in-class customer interactions whilst at the same time making the users' engagement with systems like CRM and ERP an enjoyable experience.
This is a unique opportunity to become part of an exciting journey with the possibility to impact the growth and development of a globally growing innovation company.

Job Description

Summary:
The Engagement Manager (EM) is responsible for the scoping, planning, product presentations, inflight Sales support and ownership of the successful transition of accounts into Service Delivery.
Successful scoping and planning phases are critical to ensure the successful implementation & strategy of our implementation programs. The EM is an integral part of the sales cycle, acting as a solution expert and coordinating closely with the Sales and Delivery Team.
Utilizing the experience and resources available the EM will structure the right implementation solution, set the right expectations, demonstrate the different products and define the appropriate effort (e.g. costs, project timeline, staffing). Delivery of Proposals and Statements of Work (SOW) are critical deliverables from the EM.
You will thrive here if:
You can operate in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
You can build partnerships that move our business forward.
You see feedback or failure as motivation to learn and to grow.
You believe data-driven decision making is the norm.
You relate to our core principles and want to work with like-minded sales enablement professionals.

In this role you will:
Define the right Implementation Proposals and Statement of Works according to the customer needs and Pitchers best practices.
Scoping & ownership of all sales demonstrations. Pre and post-sales environment.
Engage with prospects to understand their implementation needs and set expectations correctly with a focus on long-term success.
Work closely with the Services (delivery) Leads to manage the pipeline of opportunities and staffing needs accordingly.
Position other Pitcher Service offers (e.g., modules, support, training) that may be needed for a successful customer experience.

Qualifications

Requirements:
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
5+ years of experience delivering consulting services, including some level of involvement in selling services.
Experience working alongside Sales teams to successfully scope and sell relevant services, resulting in successful business outcomes.
Strong presentation skills - product discussions and sales experience required.
Excellent listening skills to fully understand the customer requirements and pain points.
Ability to engage audiences of varying perception levels (IT and Business).
Team player attitude.
Creative problem solver with keen instincts, organizational experience and the ability to resolve conflict.
4-year degree required.
Ability to travel.

Nice to have:
Some experience working within the Life Sciences, Consumer Goods, Manufacturing & Financial Services sectors.
Sales Enablement or SaaS experience.
Experience with Cloud-based solution deployment and Agile and Scrum methodologies.
Some Project Management experience.

Employment Type
Full-time
Additional Information
Fluency in English (written and spoken) is a must

Plan, develop, and implement comprehensive paid media strategies to increase brand visibility & recognition while driving new user acquisition via paid campaigns on Google, Bing & other platforms to ensure profitability.
Compile daily, weekly, monthly, and lifetime reports with key performance metrics (KPI's) to quantify results and communicate findings and insights within the team.

Strong communication skills and the ability to easily collaborate with a variety of colleagues remotely

Company Description

The Class (www.theclass.com) is a global wellness brand. Our core product is cathartic workout experience that guides you to strengthen the body and notice the mind to restore balance. The company is rooted in four primary lines of business: digital, in-studio, events, and retail.

Job Description

Are you a passionate, technically proficient, creative professional? Do you like seahorses? One of these things is very important to us. We’re looking for a modern-day renaissance design and creative content person to help us make things. Wonderful things. Wonderful creative things. It’s simple...and complicated. Let’s go deeper…
We need to present our business and our brand (to our customers, to ourselves, and to our partners) with visual and contextual polish and clarity. We do so in a thousand big and small ways (through the sign on the wall you see when you enter one of our studios, through the content you see on our social media channels and our website, through the jewelry we design and sell, through the decks we present to our business partners, etc.). We need your help in crafting all of those things. And I mean ALL of those things. Walk with me…

Qualifications

These are the things (we hope) you are made of:
Artisanal, organic, non-GMO, fair trade blueberry cinnamon maple syrup. If not though…that’s cool. No one’s perfect.
You are equal parts designer (technically proficient in both print and interactive design principles and best practices) and creative content manager (able to “handle” expressing a brand on social and other media). You can use Photoshop and Adobe Premier (or maybe iMovie/FinalCut). You know what a content calendar is. You are not afraid of writing words that appear in social posts and emails that will be viewed and revered) by hundreds of thousands of people around the world and know that your ability to proofread them is as important as your ability to move people with them.

You are a self-reliant and organized professional who can get shit done quickly without hand-holding. We’re a small company that is growing very fast. While we understand that highly creative people are not always highly organized people, we refuse to believe these two qualities can’t exist in the same bag of blood and bones. Hopefully you do too.

You are a social savant. Someone who hangs out in the niches of TikTok. You’re on the pulse when it comes to music and cultural trends.You know how to create engaging on-brand content for a world that's obsessed with cool transitions and Megan Thee Stallion.

You are a veritable Swiss army knife of creative skills and you like to stare down lots of different challenges. You may start the day knocking out a design for an event invite, slip into a mid-morning strategy session for how to promote our Digital Studio on IG Reels, slip out of your home office cocoon (and one day our physical office) to take The Class…for free…because well…that’s a fun job perk and we believe in keeping your body and mind healthy and happy, round out the day designing and organizing our social posts for the next few days, and be distracted from your end of day walk around the neighborhood dreaming up a different way for us to appeal to a new and important demographic of our audience. What am I trying to say? The job involves doing very, very big things and very, very little things. If you like that breadth and depth - this is your jam.

You have between 1 and 1MM years of experience.

You like and respect what comes from working on a diverse team of human beings, all of whom bring something different in their approach, personality, background, and experience. We embrace diversity in all things we do, so if that doesn’t feel like your jam, this is not the nest you seek.

You are a self-reliant and organized professional who can get things done without hand-holding. We’re a small company that is growing very fast. We value people who thrive in environments where autonomy and resourcefulness are the orders of the day.

You are not afraid of having conversations about (and interpreting) data and metrics but you also understand (and would like to work with people who believe) that “magic” and raw creative lightning in a bottle is an essential element of driving business forward.

You are (or can be) based in NYC.

You are human. We need and want people who are thoughtful, candid, and humble. It’s important in a “we’re not just saying it’s important because it sounds nice” way. Our mission is literally to help people feel better (in their bodies and their minds). It matters.

If you have worked on the front lines in any business where your role is primarily customer-facing, that’s a big plus. Our business is intensely focused on our community and customer service (and just knowing and understanding what it means to “have a customer”) is core to what we do.
Additional Information

To Apply:
If you are interested, please apply with a resume, a link or links to some of your work, and a note written by a human being (ostensibly you) to another human being (me).
I’m the Director of Marketing at this place but definitely not a member of an “HR department” so I encourage you to tell me who you are. I value candor, a direct expression of your experience, and clear ambitions. Write towards those attributes instead of telling me what you would think I would typically “need to hear” in a job application. Be yourself. The truth is the easiest thing to remember and I don’t have tons of time to weed through cover-letter-speak to find out who you really are. Just tell me.
The Class provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
Thanks for your time and hope to hear from you!

Company Description

Butterfly Network's mission is to democratize healthcare by enabling universal access to superior medical imaging. We reinvented ultrasound technology by creating the world's first handheld, single-probe whole-body ultrasound system: the Butterfly iQ. This breakthrough technology reduces the cost of the traditional ultrasound system by miniaturizing it onto a single semiconductor silicon chip.

Butterfly harnesses the advantages of AI and cloud computing to deliver advanced imaging that is easy-to-use and built for the digital era.The Butterfly iQ and next-generation Butterfly iQ+ have received CE Mark and FDA clearance, and are being sold in hospitals and clinics around the globe.

Joining Butterfly Network is the opportunity to redesign the future of healthcare through the power of technology. Embark on a journey with us to maximize global impact, motivated by the idea that our products will change the lives of millions along with the people you love.

Job Description

We are looking for a highly motivated Client Partner ready to make an immediate impact in healthcare delivery. Your undisputed sense of urgency, professionalism, and sharpness enables us to trust your interactions with customers of all levels and operate with minimal oversight. As a Client Partner and member of the Success team, you are responsible for developing customer relationships that promote retention, loyalty, and drive meaningful outcomes. Your portfolio will include Critical Access Hospitals, Community hospitals, and medical schools.

As part of our team, your core responsibilities will be:

Work with customers, guide them through their journey and foster a positive connection that drives adoption and value.
Act as a conduit for recommending and providing access to useful assets, resources and specific human expertise (ex. clinical, technical).
Illustrate business value by defining clear metrics and proof points for all customer engagements.
Provide product training & education, ensure successful onboarding, deployment, answer inbound questions, serve as a point of escalation for the support team and bring context to technical issues when appropriate.
Act as the 'voice of the customer' and provide internal feedback to maximize customer value and retention.
Qualifications

Baseline skills/experiences/attributes:

Bachelor's Degree
3+ years experience in healthcare services, (specifically for patient care delivery systems) in either a sales, on-boarding, account management or customer success role
Experience working with a variety of stakeholders including: Biomed, administration, IT, clinical, finance
Hands on, strong team player, and fully accountable for delivering agreed-upon performance metrics
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Self-driven and proactive nature with high EQ
Highly organized and able to multitask
Willing and able to travel

Ideally, you also have these skills/experiences/attributes (but it's ok if you don't!):

Point-of-care ultrasound industry experience
Ability to work East Coast hours or be based on the East Coast

You Deeply Identify with Core Butterfly Network Values:

Efficient & Speedy - you get work done in a fraction of the time as industry peers
Intellectually Curious - you are thoughtful & inquisitive; people enjoy working with you because they learn from you
Mission-Driven & Committed - you are passionate about the company's purpose and are immensely productive
Team Oriented - you celebrate and take joy in the success of others on the team
Additional Information

We offer great perks:

Fully covered medical insurance plan, and dental & vision coverage - as a health-tech company, we place great worth on our teams' well-being
Pre-tax commuter benefits - we make your commute more reasonable
Free onsite meals + kitchen stocked with snacks
401k plan - we facilitate your retirement goals
Flexible Paid Time Off - recharge and come back ready to make an impact
Ability to work from home as well as a beautiful office overlooking the Flatiron building in NYC and the ability to work remotely
Competitive salaried compensation - we value our employees and show it
Equity - we want every employee to be a stakeholder
The opportunity to build a revolutionary healthcare product and save millions of lives!

Butterfly network does not accept agency resumes.

Butterfly Network Inc. is an E-Verify Company and is an equal opportunity employer regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or Veteran status. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines..

Our team, which has grown steadily since our founding in 2016, is distributed, and based around New York, Boston, and Toronto. Our solutions and services are focused on the analytics of complex biomedical data, and the development of platform technologies for advanced, large-scale predictive analytics.Our company is made up of talented people who believe in teamwork and making a difference. Invoices policies, coordinate the servicing of new and renewal accounts from the time of binding according to Company guidelines and anticipate/prevent issues and problems as necessary. Provides high quality professional service to Agents and Companies.
Work location:
This is a fulltime telecommuting position. It can work remotely anywhere in the US.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time.
Pre-underwrite and plan renewal business with minimal supervision of an underwriter.
Accurately explain liability and other program coverages to clients and prospective clients.
Provide necessary instruction to Underwriting Clerks and Policy Typists.
Evaluate policies, endorsements, audits, cancellations, etc., resolve any discrepancies and make changes as needed.
Conduct Ratings for new and renewal business.
Manage all account documentation.
Review and process policy servicing requests (endorsement, audits, Company requests, Certificates, Premium Finance Notices and Cancellations, etc).
Invoice and process new business and renewal binders, premium bearing endorsements, and cancellations according to internal and Company guidelines.
Establish New Submissions in the clearance system and handle according to established procedures.
Produce cancellation and non-renewal notices according to statutory and contractual requirements.
Manage underwriting files on accounts in which policies are not issued and handle according to Company and internal established procedures.
Maintain pending/suspense system per established procedures.
Maintain account files in accordance with company policy.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Must have knowledge of commercial multi-line underwriting and rating
Must have ability to use company automation to include Windows, Delphi, Word, DocuCorp, Rackley ISO Rating Software
Ability to develop, foster, and maintain an excellent working relationship with clients
Ability to work in a team environment essential
Maintain current knowledge of the insurance industry
Good written and verbal skills

Desired Skills:
Normal office environment
Ability to work extended hours when necessary
No unusual physical demands

JobTitle: Virtual HBO Max Product Experience Intern – Summer 2021
Text:
Virtual HBO Max Product Experience Intern – Summer 2021
Location New York, New York
Business: Turner
Position Type: Intern
Job ID 180079BR
Virtual HBO Max Product Experience Intern – Summer 2021

The WarnerMedia Story
WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Now, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.

We won’t chase the market, we will define it. We will do it because no other company can deliver our brands to consumers the way we can. Join HBO Max and show us your best!

The Job
The Summer Intern on the Auth and Identity team will work with a cross-functional team of product managers, designers, marketers, and technologists to innovate the way TV and movie fans access our video content.

Our job is to build upon the HBO Max app and determine future capabilities, features & experiences that we should deliver to our users.

The Daily
Product Requirements
Help define and write product requirements and user stories for key capabilities on our product roadmap.
Learn how product managers and UX designers work with developers to bring a feature to market.
See how a product feature or capability gets pitched, evaluated, and ultimately prioritized for the roadmap.
Learn what goes into supporting and understanding why a product feature is needed for our customers.

Strategic Thinking
Use critical thinking, strategy, and a consumer-driven lens to address market opportunities with creative solutions.
Learn to make good trade off decisions and how that impacts the user journey.
Help solve pain points and identify opportunities to delight TV and movie fans.

Data-driven Decisions
Learn how data sets help derive insights to focus the team on initiatives.
Understand and analyze how to derive insight from usage data and other raw metrics and tell a story about a user's happy path.
Find opportunities to improve flows that increase engagement, and introduce features to solve authentication challenges.

The Essentials
General knowledge of product management a plus.
Must be a daily user of streaming video apps (Netflix, Hulu, Disney+, etc) across a variety of platforms such as tablets, phones, PCs, Connected TVs, and other devices.
Knowledge of agile development processes (Scrum, Kanban) a plus.
Must have high proficiency in PowerPoint, Excel, Word
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Strong data and analytical skills
Must be self-motivated and accountable.
Ability to adapt rapidly in a fast-moving environment with shifting priorities and the ability to react quickly, dynamically, and intelligently.
Must possess excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to understand and engage on highly complex projects.
Comfortable working in an environment that is ever-changing, with grey or uncertain areas; candidate must be able to create their own direction yet balance cross functional team needs.

The Ideal Candidate
Passionate about television, movies, entertainment, and technology
Capable of being a doer and ability to jump into something new and figure it out.
Thrives in a team that believes in working fast, being accountable, and learning from mistakes.
Comfortable in a small, lean team, that requires you to get in the trenches to drive work forward and have a high output.

Internship Program
Students must be currently enrolled in a college degree program for full duration of the internship.
Summer 2021 program dates are June 7th - August 13th; must be available for full program duration.
Full-time schedule (40 hours/week) designed to work around class schedule.
Fully remote/virtual experience; company owned laptop provided for the duration of the internship program.
Salary based on office location; relocation is not provided.
This position is targeted toward upperclassmen and graduate students.

The Perks
Hands-on work with passionate, talented team members in your field
Networking opportunities with industry-leading professionals
Engaging events including executive speakers sessions, professional development workshops, and more
Opportunity to join the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands
Warner Media, LLC and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.
