Company: Research Foundation of The City University of New York
Text:
General Description
Répertoire International de Littérature Musicale (RILM) is seeking to fill one position with either: 1) an Associate Editor who will be responsible for publications from Southeast Asia or 2) an Associate Editor who will be responsible for publications from Japan and Korea.

General description:

Répertoire International de Littérature Musicale (RILM) seeks to fill an Associate Editor position for its International Office in New York City. RILM publishes RILM abstracts of music literature (along with a suite of other resources), which is widely recognized as the world’s premiere abstracted bibliography on music and related disciplines. RILM was established in 1966 and operates under the joint sponsorship of the International Musicological Society, the International Association of Music Libraries, Archives, and Documentation Centres, and the International Council for Traditional Music.

RILM abstracts covers research on all types of music and related studies published in all document types (books, articles, reviews, collections, etc.) anywhere in the world and in any language. The database is fully searchable, with in-depth vocabulary-controlled indexing and detailed abstracts. The data are written, input, and edited to a high uniform standard by an international staff of specialists from all subject areas. The database contains over one million bibliographic records and is published online.

(1) The successful candidate responsible for countries of Southeast Asia will be required to establish RILM networks in Vietnam, Thailand, Laos, Cambodia, Myanmar, Malaysia, Singapore, Indonesia, and Philippines, making sure that music scholarship from these countries is fully and accurately represented in RILM abstracts.

(2) The successful candidate responsible for Japan and Korea, will be required to work in a collaboration with RILM’s national committees in these countries, making sure that music scholarship from these countries is fully and accurately represented in RILM abstracts.

The candidate will also work on bibliographic records related to other geographic areas, applying RILM’s editorial style as detailed in RILM’s editing and indexing style manuals, improving the prose, punctuation, and factual content of the material through research, and will engage professionally and culturally with music scholarship of the areas of responsibility.

The position is available either as part time or full time (35 hours). Comprehensive benefits become available for 20 hours per week or more.

Applicants should submit a cover letter, curriculum vitae, statement about his/her own scholarly and research interests, and a list of three references with contact information. The cover letter should address how the candidate has engaged in the past with the scholarly community of Southeast Asia or Japan or Korea. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Other Duties
Edit, index, translate, and when needed write abstracts of scholarly literature on music received from diverse sources and of varied quality and intelligibility, bringing them to a high standard of literacy and scholarship.
Develop RILM’s networks in the countries of his/her responsibility.
Work on development of indexing vocabularies specific to the countries of his/her responsibility.
Track the development of scholarship and publishing in the countries of his/her responsibility.
Advise the marketing/sales teams about academic networks in the countries of his/her responsibility.
Full-time is a minimum of 35 hours per week. After a lengthy training period, the schedule of when these hours are fulfilled can be flexible. Remote work is possible, but the successful candidate will need to spend some time in the office in New York City.
Qualifications
PhD/ABD in ethnomusicology or cultural studies with the focus on music is strongly preferred.
Experience in editing and the ability to organize data into logical concepts, with proven research and writing skills.
Superior written English skills and excellence in focused, detailed work.
In addition to English, native or near native fluency in one or more languages spoken in Southeast Asia; or in the Korean or Japanese language.
Willingness to engage in administrative and technological work.

OneDigital is proud of the tight-knit community we’ve built since the day we were founded. We’re picky about the people who work for us, because as much as we are a business, we’re also a family. Even through our rapid growth, we’ve managed to preserve our unique culture. We have a simple philosophy that if you take care of your employees, they will take care of customers and the bottom line takes care of itself.
With a distinctive culture, the best-in-class products and outstanding service, OneDigital has been recognized time and time again for our accomplishments within our industry as well as what we offer within our organization. Are you ready to join an already winning team and help us continue to grow for years to come?
Our Newest Opportunity:
Summary:
OneDigital Global Benefits team helps multinational clients establish and manage their employee benefit programs outside of the US. We provide day-to-day support as well as strategic consulting. We are fast-growing, entrepreneurial and technology-focused. Our work is fast-paced and challenging, but very rewarding.
The Global Benefits Consultant will be responsible for consulting with clients, engaging with prospects, and supporting other Global associates across OneDigital. A successful Global Consultant will have the following characteristics:
Intellectually curious: Excited to learn new things on a daily basis
Growth minded: Likes taking on new challenges
Client focused: Skilled at listening to the client’s objectives and delivering results that meet the client’s needs
Problem solver: Enjoys researching and applying new knowledge to complete a project
Focused on professional development: Passionate about developing consulting abilities
Ambitious: Seeks an environment where rapid advancement is possible
Flexible: Appreciates a work schedule that does not rigidly require being in the office 9-5; can accommodate irregular hours as needed to work with clients and partners in other time zones/continents
Essential Duties and Responsibilities (include but are not limited to):
Serves as main day-to-day contact with client
Works directly with client to identify needs and prioritize work
Oversees the work of more junior consulting staff to ensure client work is performed on time and at the highest level of quality
Actively participates in new business activity by assisting in presentations with prospects and reviewing proposals
Mentors more junior consulting staff
Works directly with clients and local broker partners to set up benefit programs
Coordinates local broker renewal activity and prepares renewal reports with recommendations for clients
Researches, drafts and presents global benefit benchmarking reports
Creates and maintains global benefit inventories for clients
Stays current on local employee benefits-related rules and regulations and advises clients on upcoming legislative changes
Assists in the development of global benefit philosophies and governance models
Works on a variety of ad-hoc projects and requests for clients as they arise
Qualifications, Skills and Requirements:
Positive attitude
Ability to thrive in fast-paced environment
Strong attention to detail
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment
Strong organizational skills
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to travel within assigned region and to corporate office
Strong presentation skills
Ability to establish and maintain collaborative working relationships with others of all levels
Ability to work with clients and partners at a strategic level
Enthusiastic about learning and professional development
Education, Training and Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree or Associate’s Degree, required
8+ years’ experience in insurance/group employee benefits, preferred
Current or prior position in global employee benefits, preferred
Other:
Location is flexible. Remote working is fully supported.
Life & Health License, preferred (if not currently licensed, must be willing to obtain license with OneDigital support)
Thank you for your interest in joining the OneDigital team!

Job Description
Are you curious, motivated, and forward-thinking? At FIS you’ll have the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging and relevant issues in financial services and technology. Our talented people empower us, and we believe in being part of a team that is open, collaborative, entrepreneurial, passionate and above all fun.
ABOUT THE TEAM
You will be leading a team of various levels of experienced sales executives who are eager to grow their careers while advancing the financial goals of FIS in the business community and helping the individual client to grow their business. As a sales leader, you will also be a part of a team of advanced leaders who are committed to ensuring the success of the Company and growing their respective team members to their highest potential.
WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING
You will manage the activities of a sales team selling products and services within an established territory with the support of assigned bank branches who are in an existing partnership with FIS, the world’s largest payments provider. As a remote employee, you will be in constant communication with each team member, ensuring they have the resources to succeed in their respective territories. This will include recruiting, hiring, coaching, mentoring, and when necessary performance improvement plans according to FIS standards. You will also:
Work with employees to implement goals and document progress, approve incentive compensation calculations, and work with Human Resources on employee related issues.
Lead activities involved in selling products and/or services, developing new accounts and/or expanding existing accounts
Develop sales plans, goals, strategies and objectives to achieve team goals and revenue objectives
Identify critical market segments through market research and competitor analyses and recommend sales strategies for improvement
Prepare sales production reports for senior management. in building, packaging and price setting with members of management to meet market needs
Ensure development and maintenance of long-term relationships with client base
Foster a belief in the Company's vision, mission and goals, and work to establish FIS as an industry expert and leader.
WHAT YOU BRING
Leadership of merchant sales teams is almost always required, and definitely preferred (5+ years). This experience should be coupled with an established bank relationship.
Strong and documented history of management, organizational, team building, coaching and mentoring skills
Solid and proven business skills, industry knowledge, financial management and planning skills, long-term vision and executive presence
General knowledge of financial and/or payment solutions technology including systems, applications and banking practices
Expert negotiation and communication skills, both written and verbal, including precise and professional presentation abilities
Solid decision-making and problem-solving skills
Precise analytical skills to determine client business needs and requirements
Ability to travel

.

JobTitle: 2021 RL Inspire Remote Summer Internship Program
Text:
Position Overview
Our compensated 10-week Remote Internship Program is designed to give rising senior undergraduate students a challenging, hands-on experience in the retail industry. Our internship will run from Monday, June 7th through Friday, August 6th.
Areas where interns may be placed include:
Accessories Design; Advertising/Advertising Operations; Apparel Design (Menswear, Womenswear, Childrenswear); Business Development / Strategy; Buying; Communications/PR; Concept Design; Creative Services; Digital Platform/eCommerce; Finance; Home Design; Hospitality; Information Technology; Innovation; Marketing/Social Media; Merchandising; People & Development (HR); Planning/Allocation; Procurement (Sourcing & Logistics); Production; Retail Operations; Sales/Account Management
Essential Duties & Responsibilities
PROGRAM OVERVIEW
As an RL Inspire intern, you will …
ONBOARD: Participate in a virtual Company orientation with the entire intern class
LEARN: Take part in weekly Zoom events and activities including our executive speaker series
DEVELOP: Receive coaching and on-going feedback from your supervisor
COLLABORATE: Work closely with fellow interns on a group corporate or individual creative project
GIVE BACK: Make a difference by volunteering as part of the Ralph Lauren Gives Back Program
HAVE FUN: Take advantage of remote social and networking activities
After successful completion of the program, full time entry-level offers may be extended to top candidates.
Experience, Skills & Knowledge
To be eligible for a US-based Ralph Lauren Corporate Internship position, applicants must:Attend college full-time in the United States and be entering their final semester or year of undergraduate studiesBe authorized to work in the United States Show a demonstrated interest in the retail industry and a passion for the Ralph Lauren brand Design applicants: include a link to your portfolio or website
This application will remain open until Friday, February 26th at 6pm EST

Reynolds and Reynolds is seeking a motivated and hard-working Outside Sales Representative Trainee to join our growing team. The goal of this position is to prepare you for your own sales territory in our Marketing and Business Solutions team. Reynolds provides over 5,000 different types of promotional, branded, and printed business solutions to the automotive dealership market.
Once you complete the training period and a territory becomes available, you will be required to relocate to the open territory and take over selling documents and promotional products to existing customers as the territory’s assigned Sales Representative. Relocation assistance to this new territory will be provided by the company. In this role, you will also develop and maintain new customers throughout your specified territory. You are eligible to receive a company car for both business and personal use. In addition, as a Sales Representative (and Trainee) you will have a home office and will be provided a company cell phone, laptop, and other office equipment.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
Must be a self-starter with the ability to schedule time effectively
Ability to create and maintain strong relationships
Must be willing to relocate upon completion of training
Training:
As a Trainee, you will enroll in our world class training that includes on-the-job training in your training territory as well as classroom style workshops. The workshops cover training on products, processes, sales skills, and automotive dealership operations. Through the on-the-job training, you will assist your mentor in all aspects of the sales cycle within various accounts and territories.

Company Description

On The Stage is an all-in-one online SaaS platform designed for school, community, and independent theatre makers by theatre professionals with real experience in the tech industry.
We make Broadway caliber technology tools to help live arts producers achieve their creative and financial goals. Our end-to-end SaaS platform includes a comprehensive online ticketing system, public-facing promotional portals, adaptable audience engagement features, live capture and streaming software, and best-in-class support. Our customers produce and manage live and virtual events, increase ticket sales, save time, and elevate the stature of their program with their audience and in the community. Over 900 venues have sold over 800,000 tickets via our platform.
We were founded a Tony Award winning producer and serial tech entrepreneurs with multiple $8 figure exits between them and funded by a group of angel investors experienced in both tech and the Arts who are focused on empowering theatre markers with great technology.
We believe:
Creativity thrives when artists and educators have the resources they need.
Live Art is most successful in a sustainable environment of mutual appreciation and exchange with its audience.
Everyone deserves access to the tools and support they need to bring their visions into the world.
We’re in the business of technology, but in service to the arts. For more information about On The Stage, visit: www.OnTheStage.com .

Job Description

This is an early stage opportunity with big upside opportunity to accelerate your career. The Account Executive position will be responsible for targeting, engaging and closing leads generated by our marketing and sales development team.
Responsibilities:
Learning and Adopting the On The Stage Sales Methodology and Process

Quota Attainment

Qualifying and creating opportunities from inbound leads and marketing initiatives

Prospecting and identifying opportunities to acquire new business – this is a “hunter" role

Cold-calling key decision-makers to set appointments

Gathering data and actively listening to prospective and existing clients by using consultative sales methods to fully understand their organization, uncover their problems, and identify impact areas

Thinking strategically to create and deliver complex, customized solutions that provide value to clientsʼ bottom line

Becoming an Industry Expert with researching trends and best practices, reading business publications, seeking out learning and development opportunities and utilizing internal training resources

Conducting tailored, web-based presentations over the phone to showcase On the Stage solutions

Driving revenue by effectively addressing the client's business needs, offering appropriate solutions, creating urgency, and closing accounts over the phone

Building and maintaining a healthy sales pipeline to achieve and exceed monthly sales quota

Qualifications

A bachelors degree or equivalent from an accredited university

1-2 Years Selling Experience

Strong ability to initiate, establish and nurture meaningful business relationships over the phone

Upbeat and positive demeanor

Ability to maintain a high level of activity, manage multiple competing priorities, and work effectively in a results-driven culture

Flexible and adaptive to change in a highly dynamic work environment

Outstanding written and verbal communication, presentation, and time management skills

Proficiency with Salesforce.com and Google Apps

Expertise with conceptual sales, solution selling, and value-based selling

Experience working on a performance-based compensation structure (base + commission)
Additional Information

This is a full time job with benefits. Compensation is competitive. Equity may be available. Remote work may be available for the right candidate. Must be authorized to work in the United States.

JobTitle: Full-Time REMOTE JR Account Mgr Role for Sales Development Outsourcing Company
Text:
Overview

At Superhuman Prospecting (SHP), our primary service is to provide outsourced, inside sales development, cold calling, appointment setting, and more to business across the nation and the globe. Our team of client SDRs make sales development calls on behalf of our clients. Your job as an account manager is extremely important because you are the strategic sales consultant working directly with clients to help manage campaign success and sell them on more opportunity to work with us.

Watch Video (00:48)

Job Description

While this is a manager level role, this position is designed for candidates with 1-3 years of customer service, professional sales, or operations management experience. The accounts that junior level account managers work with our small to mid size businesses and are typically pilot or small contract programs. The following lists tasks for performance expectations to be fulfilled and satisfied:

New Business

Generate new sales for Superhuman Prospecting in cold call, appointment setting, inside sales, and telemarketing lead generation offerings
Generate leads, hold presentations, and send proposals and invoices to Superhuman Prospecting prospects
Involvement in other new business tasks including but not limited to email marketing, networking, blogging or content writing, Superhuman Prospecting & client marketing list building, etc.

Account Management


Lead client call campaigns. This includes but is not limited to pre campaign communication, script writing, kick-off calls, campaign phone calls with client, lead & appointment deliveries, renewal sale meeting
Make cold call phone dials for Superhuman Prospecting client campaigns to set appointments or perform call-to-action tasks as listed in client agreement
Engage in all activities involving client campaigns including but not limited to client phone calls, meetings, emails, call tracking, reporting, and analysis

The goal of the junior account manager (AM) role is to onboard, retain, and renew SHP clients. As a junior AM, you will work with smaller accounts first to gain confidence and experience in the SHP process. Once you have found success retaining and renewing, there are larger mid-size to enterprise level accounts to grow into. This role is an amazing opportunity to become a dynamic communicator, salesperson, copywriter, and client success manager.

This is a REMOTE position currently but prefer to hire locally within the Philadelphia area with the hope to go back in-office at our headquarters in Norristown, PA sometime in the future.

Skills Required:

Google Sheets & Docs proficiency
College level writing skills
Articulate vocabulary
Emotional intelligence
Team player
Comfortable with managing technology and internet browsers

Social Work Care Manager

VillageCare is looking for a self-motivated and passionate Social Worker for our Full Time Care Manager position, who will provide telephonic and in-home assessments of member's status and needs. This position works with our patients to develop, implement, and monitor their care plan and ensure continuity of care while monitoring long term care needs. This is a work from home position with field visits. You must be able to do field visits within the greater NYC area.
Some of your daily activities will include providing all aspects of care management such as planning, coordination, and assessment of health, environmental, and psychosocial status of the members on an ongoing basis. You will Identify health, environmental, and psychosocial risks for assigned members and recommend appropriate interventions. You will provide an on-going assessment of the effectiveness of the Member's plan of care.
We would like to speak to those who Minimum formal education of Master's Degree and a current NYS LMSW license. Minimum of one (1) year job-related experience in MLTC preferred. Bilingual preferred.
There are many benefits to working for VillageCare. If you are someone who enjoys highly competitive compensation and benefits package, a 403(b) retirement plan and much more than we would love to speak with you! VillageCare offers a wide range of at-home and community-based services, as well as managed long-term care options that seek to match each individual's needs to help them attain and maintain the greatest level of independent living possible. We are committed to superior outcomes in quality health care.
VillageCare is a Drug-free workplace. Equal Opportunity Employer

JobTitle: Product Line Manager for Tanzu - Opportunity for Working Remotely New York, NY
Text:
VMware is looking for a Product Manager to join Tanzu Runtime product team in the Modern Applications Platform Business Unit (MAPBU). VMware customers are increasingly deploying containers as the foundation of their application modernization efforts. The MAPBU team delivers best-in-class enterprise cloud native solutions – supporting container frameworks such as Kubernetes and other CNCF ecosystem solutions.
This Tanzu team is a fast-paced, startup-like environment where you will have the opportunity to make meaningful contributions to the product roadmap while developing skills in cutting-edge technologies. You will be part of a team that has a culture of open communication, empowerment, innovation, teamwork, and customer success. We are looking for someone with a strong technical background to help define and evangelize the data protection, backup and recovery features of the Tanzu Kubernetes Grid portfolio.
Job Role and Responsibilities:
As a Product Line Manager, you are a senior member of the Product team and in charge of the product definition, roadmap, and direction of Tanzu products and open source tools. You will work cross-functionally between engineering, open source community, CNCF, and the Kubernetes community to create an innovative solution that builds on top of a healthy ecosystem of OSS tools.
You will oversee all Product Management aspects for the data protection, backup and recovery features of Tanzu Kubernetes Grid. This includes defining the product definition, maintaining a 6-month and yearly roadmaps, prioritizing features, and engaging with customers and partners
You will work closely with the Tanzu engineering team, providing input on and formal review of product functional specifications prior to development.
You will work cross-group to business align our open source investments with the needs of the Tanzu portfolio of products
You will work cross-functionally between the engineering, open source community, CNCF, and the Kubernetes community to ensure our OSS tools are executing on their vision, create a healthy ecosystem for our OSS tools to thrive and increase the adoption by users.
You will work cross-functionally between the engineering and marketing teams to create technical content and solutions for Tanzu and OSS projects, targeted to users, customers, sales engineers, and partners.
You will partner with users, customers, and account teams to facilitate successful customer proof of concept deployments.
You will research and test competitor and partner products with the objective of providing input to the product management team during the creation and review of product and solutions requirement documents (PRD & SRD).
You will present technical presentations to customers, partners, and the field, and also gather feedback to influence product and solution offerings.
You will work closely with sales to identify and build the most appropriate sales enablement tools, such as technical presentations, demo labs, competitive labs, solutions briefs, and tutorials.
You will be responsible for developing technical best practices including architectural designs, test plans, and integration guides for products, solutions, and reference architectures.
You will be the technical lead at conferences and customer/partner webinars.
You will also work closely with VMware technology partners on product integrations, best practices, and solutions.
You will be expected to establish yourself as the Subject Matter Expert in Tanzu and Kubernetes
Required Skills:
Experience in cloud native, CNCF, or Kubernetes-related technologies
Experience in working with Open Source technologies and Container frameworks
5+ years of experience as a systems engineer, product manager, technical product marketing, technical marketing or experience working in a customer environment as an architect or senior practitioner
Experience working with and understanding the needs of enterprise IT executives, CIOs, system administrators and cloud infrastructure providers
Good technical skills and comfortable in front of internal solutions architects, customers, and partners
Hands-on development experience with distributed application concepts and sysadmin/devops tools
Understanding of agile software development methodologies and tools
Ability and willingness to learn new technologies
Preferred Skills:
Ability to build detailed, technical collateral from scratch
Track record of developing & delivering formal and informal training material and technical presentations aimed at educating customers, partners, or sales teams
Startup experience desired. Self-starter with the ability to work across all functions of the company. Ability to get things done; must be resourceful, proactive, and aggressive
Highly entrepreneurial with a strong passion and drive to succeed
Willingness to travel approximately 10% of time
#TeamTanzu
This position is eligible for TanzuChallenge referral campaign

Acts as the focal point for all security event review, incident escalations, incident handling. Incumbent is responsible for ensuring security events rising to a defined threshold are escalated as security incidents and handled in accordance with Wolters Kluwer Incident Response Policy and Procedure. When applicable, the IT Security Incident Manager will involve other IT Security team members, IT Security Management and as directed, Senior WK Leadership.
Essential Duties and responsibilities
Wolters Kluwer Global Business Services (GBS) is designed to provide services to the business units in the areas of technology, sourcing, procurement, legal, finance, and human resources. These global centers promote team collaboration using best practices around a specific focus area to drive results and enhance operational efficiencies. There is a constant endeavor to benchmark against best-in-class industry standards to improve the quality of deliverables, increase cost savings, enhance productivity and reduce time to market for products and applications.
We have an amazing opportunity for an IT Security Manager (Incident Management), available within our Global Business Services division! This position has been created due to growth! The IT Security Manager (Incident Management) will be responsible for monitoring and response to all emerging security incidents in order to protect and enhance the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of Wolters Kluwer assets.
This position is remote.
As the IT Security Manager (Incident Management), you will lead information gathering efforts during investigation into suspected and confirmed security incidents to protect personal and confidential information at WK. In this role, you will be required to demonstrate proficiency in incident analysis, data gathering and information synthesis in every area of IT security management. Your role will also include interfacing with and responding to internal business unit IT representatives and stakeholders at all levels during emerging security incidents, real or simulated.
 Responsibilities:
Primarily responsible for the response to and recovery from emerging information security incidents, acting as the focal point leading response efforts and ensuring effective action to contain and remediate the situation
Supports the investigation of reported security breaches and, in coordination with WK global security operations, develop procedures to respond to security incidents and assist with investigations
Contributes to the analysis and delivery of findings to internal customers with impactful, comparative, interpretative security analysis in a clear, consistent, and factual manner.
Responsible for establishing communications bridges and meetings in support of response efforts
Responsible for maintaining proper group focus during investigation activities and redirecting efforts in support of timely recovery
Responsible for aggregating information relevant to the situation and synthesizing probable root cause
Responsible for developing and recommending best course of action based on solid security principles
Driving the incident response process from detection through containment and eradication.
Accountable for documenting all WK and partner activity, taken in response to emerging situations
Accountable for the day-to-day review and assessment of security events that may become or contribute to security incidents.
Ensures work is compliant with WK enterprise policies, procedures and the local business plan
Responsible for ensuring appropriate post-mortem and lessons-learned sessions are conducted, following incident restoration of service
Responsible for organizing and taking part in cross-functional incident exercise activities, ensuring that policy and procedure are followed
Responsible for ensuring knowledge of IT security and emerging threat scenarios is current
Responsible for ensuring knowledge of WK Global Information Security policies and standards
Responsible for reviewing threat intelligence sources is support of WK security situational awareness
Responsible for assisting in the development of vulnerability and threat related communications for potential dissemination to warn WK employees of an emerging situation
Responsible for ensuring information arising from incident response activities, that would result in configuration changes or other modifications to ensure WK security posture, is communicated to the proper operational contacts for execution.
Job Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science/MIS or equivalent experience
Minimum 7 years of total experience in Information Technology
Minimum 3 years of professional experience in an information security function, including analyzing and applying information security risk management, and privacy practices
Minimum 2 years in an information security incident handling role
Flexible working hours to support a global operation
Required Interpersonal Skills
Excellent oral and written communication ability
Ability to present complex technical issues and findings to diverse audiences in both technical and non-technical parlance, both orally and in writing
Diplomacy in working with customers and stakeholders
Ability to follow policy and procedure
Ability to work in a team and at times perform under stress
Demonstrate integrity in dealing with potentially sensitive data and restricted information
Exceptionally self-motivated with a superior analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving abilities
Ability to set and manage priorities judiciously
Required Technical Skills
Knowledge of basic security principles to include confidentiality, integrity, and availability; access control, authentication, and authorization; privacy and non-repudiation
Understanding of security vulnerabilities and exposures, and from where they arise
Familiarity with the Internet, its network protocols, and network applications and services
Knowledge of network security issues and host/system security issues
Understanding of malicious code of various types and various threat vectors
Experience with Risk Analysis and Risk Management
Basic understanding of programming and scripting, advanced knowledge a plus
Familiarity with OS and network forensics practices, traditional and cloud
Ability to perform log analysis at scale
Ability to curate, create and deploy detection signatures
Familiarity with hacking exploits and the ability to defend against them
Required Incident Handling Skills
Through good communication and documentation, presents a consistent front to customers and stakeholders
Ability to synthesize data from technical skills listed above to understand and identify intruder techniques
Ability to utilize interpersonal skills listed above to communicate with customers and stakeholders and bring quick resolution
Demonstrated ability to analyze ongoing situations for the potential of a security incident
Ability to maintain incident records in support of WK recovery, regulatory and legal requirements
Familiar with ITIL service management methodology.
Prior experience in a 24x7x365 operations environment.
Strong technical skills in security assessments of external service providers, providing security guidance, and participating in mock security breach exercises
Experience with GDPR and GDPR compliance implementations
Experience and/or SME knowledge of the ISO 27001, NIST 800-53, NIST CSF and PCI DSS.
Preferred certifications: CISSP, ITIL, GCIH, CERT/CC CSIH, GCTI
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by most people assigned to this job.
They re not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities and requirements.

JobTitle: Product Line Manager - Tanzu Mission Control, Data Services - Opportunity for Working Remotely New York, NY
Text:
The Elevator Pitch: Why will you enjoy this new opportunity?
The Tanzu Mission Control team at VMware is seeking a Product Manager to help define product strategy and advance our mission to make Kubernetes accessible to any enterprise. The Tanzu Mission Control team is focused on helping customers more easily manage Kubernetes and operate modern, containerized applications across multiple clouds and clusters. You will play a pivotal role defining compelling and competitively differentiated capabilities, communicating our roadmap to internal and external stakeholders, understanding our customers deeply, and collaborating with marketing and sales to bring Tanzu Mission Control to market. The team is a fast-paced, startup-like environment where you will have the opportunity to build a new business from the ground up while developing skills in cutting-edge technologies.
What is the primary need, technical challenge, and/or problem you will be responsible for?
In this role, you will be responsible for defining the product strategy to evolve Tanzu Mission Control into a rich, extensible data platform for the entire VMware Tanzu portfolio. Enterprise Kubernetes clusters are packed with data of interest to many stakeholders across the organization. The goal of the data platform is to make it easy for customers to discover and use the data streams they care about, aggregate and query data across fleets of Kubernetes clusters, and enable partners to integrate their own data sources and sinks to provide their unique value to VMware Tanzu customers. Your impact will enable powerful end-user experiences, more integrated experiences across the Tanzu portfolio, and provide the extensibility and pluggability for a robust ecosystem of partner and community integrations.
Success in the Role: What are the performance goals over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing?
Success in the first three months means charting new territory for Tanzu Mission Control and clearly articulating that vision to internal and external stakeholders
Success in the first six months means partnering with engineering to deliver an initial set of capabilities that enable VMware customers to experience an integrated product portfolio of data streams and insights.
Success in the first year means enabling our partners and community to extend Tanzu Mission Control by integrating their technologies and services, providing choice and seamless experiences to customers.
What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis?
You will own the short- and long-term strategy for an extensible data platform in Tanzu Mission Control based on a deep understanding of customer needs, market trends, and competition. Experience defining and prioritizing product features in a complex technical context will serve you well.
You will collaborate with other Tanzu teams, as well as partner and community developers, to plan and deliver integrated experiences across the portfolio. An ability to navigate complex decision making and effectively communicate across teams will be critical to success.
You will partner with engineering to drive successful product releases. You will be engineering’s connection to our customers and partners and will be responsible for bringing them along for the ride.
You will engage frequently with customers and partners to learn about their needs, and occasionally support the sales and partner channels along with key engagements in a pre- and post-sales capacity.
What is leadership like for this role? What is the structure and culture of the team like?
The hiring manager for this role is Scott Van Woudenberg, Group Product Line Manager, leading Tanzu Mission Control’s SaaS Platform product team. Scott joined VMware from Google, where he helped build Google Compute Engine from launch into a multi-billion dollar business. The Tanzu Mission Control product management team is made up of individuals with diverse backgrounds who are excited about delivering a new SaaS offering to enable Tanzu’s largest customers to build, run, and manage modern applications.
What are the benefits and perks of working at VMware?
You and your loved ones will be supported with a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. Below are some highlights, or you can view the complete benefits package by visiting www.benefits.vmware.com.
Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Medical Coverage, Retirement, and Parental Leave Plans for All Family Types
Generous Time Off Programs
40 hours of paid time to volunteer in your community
Rethink's Neurodiversity program to support parents raising children with learning or behavior challenges, or developmental disabilities
Financial contributions to your ongoing development (conference participation, trainings, course work, etc.)
#TeamTanzu

JobTitle: Behavioral Care Advocate Childrens Programs Watertown Jefferson County NY
Text:
You’re looking for something bigger for your career. How about inventing the future of health care? Optum is offering an innovative new standard for care management. We're going beyond counseling services and verified referrals to behavioral health programs integrated across the entire continuum of care. Our growth is fueling the need for highly qualified professionals to join our elite team. Bring your skills and talents to a role where you’ll have the opportunity to make an impact on a huge scale. Join us. Take this opportunity to start doing your life's best work.(sm)
***This is a field based: up to 80% of the time in the field work from home position. Schedule is Monday - Friday during normal business hours.
*** Must live in a commutable distance of Watertown and Jefferson County.
The overall purpose of the Field Based Care Advocate is to improve the enrollee's ability to remain stable in the community and out of the hospital. The role is to engage the person in the treatment process and then assist him/her to access the appropriate community services so they can pursue their treatment goals in the community and avoid institutionalization. This position requires field visits going into hospitals, clinical facilities and in the community. You will be in the field the majority of the time.

The Field Based Care Advocate position is also designed to be a direct clinical liaison between health plan staff and the clinical network. The program fosters a collegial and mutually beneficial relationship between the providers and payers of medical and behavioral health services.

If you are located near Jefferson county New York, you will have the flexibility to telecommute* as you take on some tough challenges.
Primary Responsibilities:
Identifies and provides community service linkage
Assists enrollees with aftercare appointments
Provides subsequent member follow-up as determined by individual member needs
Works with enrollees to identify gaps in care or obstacles to care and problem solves for successful connection to needed services
Reviews IP Census each day to determine which enrollees on the census are re-admits within the last 12 months
Goes to facility meetings with treatment team to develop a successful aftercare plan
Manages the aftercare follow-up of identified high risk enrollees (manages follow-up calls/outreach and documentation)
Meets with community providers/facilities as company liaison to foster good rapport and relationships and to identify new programs
You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested
Required Qualifications:
Must have one of the following: Master's degree in Behavioral Health related field, Associate's degree or greater in Nursing with ten years of Behavioral Health experience, or a Doctorate-degreed Psychologist
Must have an active, unrestricted State of New York professional license in at least one of the following:
Licensed Mental Health Counselor (LMHC)
Licensed Marriage & Family Therapist (LMFT)
Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW)
Licensed Psychologist
Registered Nurse with 2+ years of Behavioral Health experience
2+ years' experience in a related mental health environment
Proficient computer skills and good working knowledge of Excel spreadsheets
Must live in a commutable distance of Jefferson, Westchester County with ability to be in territory on a daily basis
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with foster care, first episode psychosis, HCBS, CFTSS providers in the local communities
Medical/Behavioral setting experience (i.e. hospital, managed care organization, or joint medical/behavioral outpatient practice)
Working knowledge of city and state agencies and practices to include APS, ACS, AOT, ACT, Health Home, Forensic and others
Dual diagnosis experience with mental health and substance abuse
Experience working with low-income populations
Experience working with the aged, blind or disabled
Case Management experience
Field based experience
Careers with Optum . Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make the health system work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)
*All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy
Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.
UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.
Job Keywords: Case Manager, Care Advocate, Behavioral Health, Mental Health, Community Health, Licensed Mental Health Counselor, LMHC, Licensed Marriage & Family Therapist, LMFT, Licensed Clinical Social Worker, LCSW, RN, Psychologist, Onongdaga, Utica Watertown, Ft Drum, Fort Drum, NY, New York, Carthage, Adams Center

JobTitle: Group Product Manager - Tanzu Mission Control - Opportunity for Working Remotely New York, NY
Text:
The Elevator Pitch: Why will you enjoy this new opportunity?
The Tanzu Mission Control team at VMware is seeking a Group Product Line Manager to lead a team of product managers to define product strategy and advance our mission to make Kubernetes accessible to any enterprise. The Tanzu Mission Control team is focused on helping customers more easily manage Kubernetes and operate modern, containerized applications across multiple clouds and clusters. You will play a pivotal role leading a team to define compelling and competitively differentiated capabilities, communicate our roadmap to internal and external stakeholders, understand our customers deeply, and collaborate with marketing and sales to bring Tanzu Mission Control to market. The team is a fast-paced, startup-like environment where you will have the opportunity to build a new business from the ground up while developing skills in cutting-edge technologies.

What is the primary need, technical challenge, and/or problem you will be responsible for?
Tanzu Mission Control is a critical element of the VMware Tanzu portfolio. Leading a group of product managers, you'll be responsible for driving the vision, strategy, and day to day execution of Tanzu Mission Control’s cluster management capabilities. Together with your team you will be identifying and addressing the needs of operations teams as they embrace Kubernetes and build cloud-native applications based on modern architectures, and operate at scale across distributed infrastructure.
Success in the Role: What are the performance goals over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing?
You’ll be responsible for delivering best in class Kubernetes cluster management capabilities that are highly integrated into the Tanzu portfolio.
You will be building a highly functional and self-sufficient team of product managers across time zones and countries (including US and India).
You’ll launch Kubernetes management capabilities that enable our customers to manage workloads consistently across 10s of thousands of clusters in on-premises and public cloud domains.
What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis?
You will be hiring and managing a distributed group of PMs, defining the group’s objectives and key results. You will be providing mentorship and guidance helping them be successful.
You will collaborate with other Tanzu teams to plan and deliver integrated experiences across the portfolio. An ability to navigate complex decision making and effectively communicate across teams will be critical to success.
You will own the short- and long-term strategy for cluster management in Tanzu Mission Control based on a deep understanding of customer needs, market trends, and competition. Experience defining and prioritizing product features in a complex technical context will serve you well.
You will lead the product line through various stages from inception to launch to continuous improvement.
You will partner with engineering to drive successful product releases. You will be engineering’s connection to our customers and will be responsible for bringing them along for the ride.
You will engage frequently with customers to learn about their needs, and support the sales channel and key customers in a pre- and post-sales capacity.
You’ll create solutions that scale to meet the needs of the world’s biggest enterprises.
What is leadership like for this role? What is the structure and culture of the team like?
The hiring manager for this role is Eryn Muetzel, Director of Product Management leading the Tanzu Mission Control product team. Eryn joined VMware as part of the Heptio acquisition in 2018. The Tanzu Mission Control product management team is made up of individuals with diverse backgrounds who are excited about delivering a new SaaS offering to enable Tanzu’s largest customers to build, run, and manage modern applications.

What are the benefits and perks of working at VMware?
You and your loved ones will be supported with a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. Below are some highlights, or you can view the complete benefits package by visiting www.benefits.vmware.com.
Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Medical Coverage, Retirement, and Parental Leave Plans for All Family Types
Generous Time Off Programs
40 hours of paid time to volunteer in your community

Text: KrossKast - is a music service for businesses.Successful applications, please read 1 through 8 below.1. What we are looking for:  We are looking for a competent Account Executive experience in B2B, to find business opportunities and manage customer relationships. You’ll be directly responsible for the preservation and expansion of our customer base. The ideal candidate will have talent in sales and experience in customer service. We expect you to be a reliable professional able to achieve balance between customer orientation and a results-driven approach.2. What you'll be Selling:  You will be selling in-store music, on-hold music, custom messaging and streaming devices to either small companies or large corporations around the world. The goal is to find opportunities and turn them in long-term profitable relationships based on trust and mutual satisfaction that you will make a percent commission on.3. About us:  KrossKast is a business-to-business music streaming service company based outside of NYC, we partnered with Google in 2019. Our music streaming service software and products can be sold and distributed on global level. Although we are based in NY, you do not need to live in NY to apply. We have many team members that currently work remote for us.4. What to expect during our interviews: If an interview is scheduled, we expect that you have done the research on our company - this is very important to us and speaks volumes about your level of detail, interest in our industry and work ethics. We will ask you detailed questions about our company, our line of work, what we do, your experience working in the B2B world, your relationships, resources and what you have to offer us as an Account Executive. If you're not prepared with answering questions our company, our line of work, or what we do, then the interview will end immediately after the 1st question, (candidates that mass apply to sales jobs on Indeed please do not waste your time applying here - you won't make it past the first question in our interview). If a second interview is scheduled, during the interview our interviewer will ask you to role play and perform a "mock sales presentation" showcasing how you would sell our products and services to the interviewer. We have a multiple interview policy. This means if we feel that you are a fit, then additional interviews will be scheduled, (no applicant will be hired after the first interview). We will not waste your time, so please don't waste ours - we will take the time to go through your submitted resume in detail, so please take the time to learn everything about us and what we do, www.krosskast.com/in-store.5. Things were looking for:  B2B relationships and experience are a plus. Prior B2B relationships will give you a competitive advantage to earn percent-commission right away.6. Position Type:  This is a commission only sales position - and the salary mentioned above is a placeholder only. There is no base salary, no health benefits and you will be 1099 at the end of the year. A minimum of 4 years previous sales experience is a must.7. ResponsibilitiesCreate detailed business plans to facilitate the attainment of goals and quotasManage the entire sales cycle from finding a client to securing a dealUnearth new sales opportunities through networking and turn them into long term partnershipsPresent our products and services to prospective clientsProvide professional after-sales support to enhance the customers’ dedicationRemain in frequent contact with the clients in your responsibility to understand their needsRespond to complaints and resolve issues aiming to customer contentment and the preservation of the company’s reputationNegotiate agreements and keep records of sales and data8. SkillsMust have a remote work space/office to perform your work; with a computer, reliable internet, and telephone, (this includes preventing your children, dogs, cats and other at home distractions from meeting our clients and other co-workers).Must have the understanding and knowledge of taking a GoogleHangouts, and/or Zoom call from you computerProven experience as an a B2B Account Executive, or in other sales/customer service roleKnowledge of market research, sales and negotiating principlesOutstanding knowledge of MS Office; knowledge of CRM software (eg. Salesforce, Pipedrive) is a plusExcellent communication/presentation skills and ability to build relationshipsOrganizational and time-management skillsA business acumenEnthusiastic and passionateBSc or BA in business administration, sales or marketingIf interested please attach your resume. We look forward to hearing from you.KrossKast HR Team!Job Types: Full-time, Part-timePay: $1.00 - $100,000.00 per yearSchedule:Monday to FridaySupplemental Pay:Commission payEducation:Associate (Required)Experience:Sales Experience: 4 years (Required)Language:English (Required)License/Certification:Driver's License (Required)Work Location:Multiple locationsPaid Training:NoManagement:Ops ManagerTypical start time:9AMTypical end time:5PMCompany's website:www.KrossKast.comWork Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview process

In the last three years our sales have grown by 56% and our work was recognised with the Queen’s award for Enterprise in International Trade in 2019.Whilst the candidate’s experience is paramount, the right candidate must also display a positive, professional and can-do attitude, as well as a willingness to go that extra mile to deliver a high-quality service to our end clients.Salary: Competitive, based on experienceRole: As Project Manager you will provide a variety of language services to our US Market Research clients, ensuring we remain the preferred leader in market research translation services worldwide and contributing to the growth in the sector. HOMER has an opportunity for a Product Manager to join our growing team! This role will focus on driving member retention by finding meaningful ways to engage parents; and it can either report into our NYC office (currently remote) or be located remotely in select US locations, but operate on EST.

Reporting into our VP, Product, the Product Manager is responsible for our HOMER's Parent Activation squad. The role will ensure we're building best-in-class membership tools for grown-ups, and communicating the value of HOMER membership. You'll work at the intersection of product, design, marketing, and content, driving the strategies that ensure our members are getting the most out of their HOMER experience, inspiring them to fuel word-of-mouth growth.

HOMER, a BEGiN brand, is the proven early learning program that provides the best educational start possible. We offer personalized, fun, and proven learning products for kids ages 2-8 to help build confidence, mastery, and a love of learning. We are deeply committed to our members and to their children, and we are building a creative and strategic team to develop a portfolio of early learning products that support learning everywhere.

What you'll do:

Work with cross-functional leaders of marketing, design, content, engineering and data to effectively drive strategy and roadmap for multiple projects geared towards member retention
Create best in class membership tools and customer support for grown-ups
Inspire members to fuel word-of-mouth
Collaborate on a parent communications strategy to communicate the value of a membership
Ideate, develop, and validate new features with a focus and obsession on understanding and creating a high quality member experience
Lead web + mobile development
Help define and develop a rigorous data culture using quantitative and qualitative measures that tie to company objectives
Understand the competitive landscape, and use it to shape the product strategy and tactics.
Oversee multiple projects and align them with business priorities & deadlines
Rigorously prioritize the backlog to make the greatest impact

Must Haves:

3-5 years of experience in Product Management (consumer role, subscription product experience is ideal)
Fluency in data analysis, and problem-solving skills
Experience building products on both web and mobile platforms
Experience with CRM
Experience building an effective messaging strategy
Excellent written, communication, analytical skills, and attention to detail, with an ability to effectively present to executive staff and key stakeholders
Demonstrated experience executing and coordinating product initiatives across cross-functional teams
Demonstrated experience creating engaging and high-quality experiences
Ability to produce documentation at various levels of fidelity
Experience sending status updates/communications at regular intervals

Nice to haves:

Experience in education, media, and products for kids/parents a plus.
Experience building/defining referral strategies

HOMER is a proud equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.At HOMER, we are committed to building a diverse team of talented people who are passionate about creating educational content kids love. We believe in fostering a culture where productivity can flourish, one that is empathetic, respectful, and inclusive.

At HOMER, we know that diversity, equity, and inclusion aren't just an idea, a one-time initiative, or phrases to throw into a job post: they're a daily practice and an ongoing conversation. We survey our team about inclusivity, run trainings on DEI topics, and have a committee to ensure we are all continuing to learn and grow.

Overview:

This position can be remote anywhere within the United States.

Precisely is a global leader in data integrity, providing accuracy and consistency in data for 12,000 customers in more than 100 countries, including 90 percent of the Fortune 100. Precisely’s data integration, data quality, location intelligence, and data enrichment products power better business decisions to create better outcomes. We are looking for talented individuals with the experience and motivation to join our innovative team.

We have an outstanding career opportunity for a successful Sales Executive. This is an excellent opportunity with a very competitive compensation and benefits package, perfect for a results-focused, high-energy, sales professional who will identify and bring to closure direct sales engagements, upgrade and expand existing accounts and work closely with regional partners. Precisely helps thousands of customers with award winning Data Quality and Integration solutions for big data, Hadoop, Spark, Cloud, Splunk and more!
Responsibilities:

The Sales Executive has overall responsibility for direct sales, partner alliances, and customer satisfaction. This person will develop and implement a comprehensive strategy that maximizes opportunities for Precisely Big Data division products and services.

Other responsibilities include:
Utilizes and follows integrated sales process and CRM system
Effectively manage pipeline of opportunities
New Customer and Business Identification, Qualification & Development
Working with strategic resellers and alliance partners
Strategic Account Planning
Contract Negotiations
Work closely with team members such as Pre-Sales Engineering
Qualifications:
Minimum of 5 years enterprise software sales experience, with at least 3 in a solution selling environment in the financial services industry
Track record in generating new business - we are only interested in speaking with individuals that can demonstrate self-sufficient success and the ability to find, manage and close high-value deals
Experience in AML/Compliance/PEP-Sanctions/Transaction Monitoring added benefit
Passionate self-starter that is self-directed and able to execute independently
Strong team spirit and able to work effectively in collaboration with others
Keen commercial instinct to determine which opportunities to prioritize
Excellent communication, negotiation skills and consultative approach to close business
Salesforce.com CRM Experience
Ability to travel 25% including overnight travel

Want to help tell the story of New York City to the world?At NYC & Company, New York City’s official tourism organization, that’s both our pleasure and our responsibility. We are a team of proud New Yorkers and New Yorkers at heart who love representing the five boroughs to the globe. Our digital marketing and social media team produces inspiring work that reflects New York City’s energy and diversity. That work can be seen in a range of digital and social channels, including the Webby Award–winning nycgo.com; across key programs like NYC Restaurant Week®; and through partnerships with leading tourism and hospitality organizations at home and worldwide. We champion collaboration, and we are looking for a like-minded team player to join us.Our mission has always been to help build prosperity and to share the positive image of New York City with the world. Now, in the wake of 2020’s paradigm shifts, that mission has become more urgent than ever. As the City continues the reopening process, we at NYC & Company are charged with helping to ensure that all New Yorkers benefit from a renewed economy, in particular those in BIPOC communities who have been disproportionately affected by the pandemic. In pursuit of that goal, we are committed more than ever to featuring diverse voices in our channels who speak to NYC’s many cultures.We are seeking applicants for a 3-6 month contract position to assist us in this mission and coordinate our influencer marketing efforts.This position will be responsible for developing influencer marketing strategies to support NYC & Company initiatives, identifying and vetting influencers to partner with, and coordinating influencer activities including developing itineraries, establishing deliverables, ensuring flawless execution, and reporting results to stakeholders.The successful candidate will have experience working with influencers and knowledge of managing social media business accounts. They will have existing influencer contacts in travel, lifestyle, food, fashion, entertainment, etc. The ideal candidate performs well under pressure and have excellent time-management skills; be a team player, willing to collaborate; and be able to consistently deliver high-quality work on tight deadlines.Responsibilities include but are not limited to: Collaborating with team members on influencer marketing strategies supporting company marketing initiatives.Recruiting a network of diverse influencers who can represent the NYC brand and support key programs including Tourism Campaigns, NYC Restaurant Week, NYC Broadway Week, etc.Vetting influencers for fit within the NYCgo brand.Negotiating deliverables for each influencer, finalizing agreements, and ensuring compliance with our rights & clearances standards.Establishing influencer itineraries and coordinating influencer visits to tourism and hospitality businesses throughout the City.Collecting results from influencers and reporting campaign results to stakeholders.Qualifications: 2-3 years of influencer marketing experience.Established influencer contacts in the travel, lifestyle, culinary, entertainment industries.Self-starter who can work directly with influencers to establish deliverables, timelines and coordinate their coverage of NYC.In depth knowledge of social media industry including Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, Twitter, and Facebook. Familiarity with Weibo, WeChat, Snapchat, Pinterest, and LinkedIn a plus.Impeccable verbal and written communication skills.Well organized with great time management skills.Outstanding project management skills.The ability to remain calm under pressureExcellent interpersonal and relationship building skills.BA degree or higherPassion for the five boroughs and a commitment to contributing to the City’s recoveryApply with:  Cover letter explaining your interest in the position, a resume, and two relevant examples of past influencer campaigns that you worked on.Job Types: Full-time, ContractPay: $37,134.00 - $53,000.00 per yearSchedule:8 hour shiftEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Marketing: 1 year (Preferred)Contract Renewal:PossibleFull Time Opportunity:YesWork Location:Fully RemoteCompany's website:www.nycgo.comBenefit Conditions:Only full-time employees eligibleCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview process

Company Description

At Publicis Health, we are united around one purpose: to create a world where people are equipped and motivated to take control of their health. We transform healthcare marketing and communications into healthcare engagement.
We believe healthcare marketing is healthcare, fostering healthy conversations, healthy behaviors and healthy people. Publicis Health is a Dynamic Health Engagement Platform, an organizing principle that seamlessly connects data, content and technology; is driven by marketing and business transformation; and offers our clients fluid access to world-class talent and game-changing capabilities.
With 40 offices and 11 brands across the globe, Publicis Health’s worldwide staff is comprised of more than 3,000 healthcare professionals who are experts in advertising and branding, data and analytics, strategic planning, service design, digital media and technology, science, and medicine. Publicis Health companies include Digitas Health, Heartbeat, insync, Langland, Payer Sciences, PlowShare Group, Publicis Health France, Publicis Health Media, Razorfish Health, Saatchi & Saatchi Wellness, and Verilogue. For more information, visit us at www.publicishealth.com.
We know the power of interning with purpose….from home. This Summer 2021, start your marketing career in healthcare and intern with purpose! Don’t miss the opportunity to gain relevant industry experience from the safety of your own home.
For two consecutive years, Publicis Health’s award-winning internship program was recognized by WayUp as one of the top 100 internship programs in the United States. As part of our virtual internship program, our 60+ interns gain valuable hands-on healthcare marketing and communications experience from the comfort and safety of their homes. Interns participate in weekly virtual learning sessions and gain exposure to senior leaders across the Publicis Health network, as well as expand their network with other PH interns across the U.S. By the conclusion of our 9-week virtual program, our interns learn what it means to intern with purpose.

Job Description

One of the key components to an advertising plan is knowing your audience and knowing their story. Our Strategic Account Planning team is responsible for unearthing consumer insights and evaluating digital behaviors to build competitive advantages for our clients. This can be a deep look into a single campaign insight or a broader look that identifies and evaluates all of the opportunities available to make sound business and marketing decisions.
As an intern, you will help the team in collecting and synthesizing campaign data through digital tools, evaluating competitive activities, and identifying digital trends in the healthcare space. Additionally, you will work to help identify key customer insights from existing client/agency data and translate them into relevant marketing program implications.
We are looking for an intern with a strong work ethic, outstanding analytical skills, and a knack for converting insights into creative, impactful recommendations for our clients. Creativity and teamwork is key!
Additional deliverables you will assist with include:
Creative Briefs and Strategic Project Briefs development
Personas Development
Research Recommendations
Agency-led Research Results Readout
POV’s on Client-led Research Efforts
Ideation Sessions (co-creation sessions, BrandFit workshops, Wargames, etc.)
Synthesis of Insights from All Sources (research, social, secondary literature, etc.)
The “Insight” section of Marketing Plans
Brand Planning Tactical Recommendations

Qualifications

Full-time rising junior or rising senior, currently enrolled at an accredited 4-year College or University
Enrolled in an undergraduate degree program which aligns with the position such as Advertising, Marketing, Communications or Business
Legally authorized to work in the US
Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

We're looking for a Revenue Operations Analyst to help us build a foundation for excellence by reinforcing revenue strategy with metrics, infrastructure, business processes, and best practices. You will help the Customer Success, Sales and Marketing team to maximize their attainment and efficiency through analytics, reporting, data streams and KPIs. You will be the partner of Customer Success management in forecasting, and daily operations as well as their business review cadence, you will also support the Sales team with daily operations under the supervision of the Revenue Operations Manager. You are the trusted partner of the CS team and will make supporting recommendations on ways to improve the productivity and scale of the organization.

Note: This position may sit in NYC or can be remote for a strong fit candidate.

Key ResponsibilitiesFind, document and implement highly creative solutions to problems using a wide range of technologies and applications - you derive joy from clarity, simplification and effective processes.Understand and utilize best practices during design, development and release processes (Gathering Business requirements, design documents, approval criteria, flowcharting and documentation)Champion the use of technology, tools, and processes to maintain the source(s) of truth of our sales, marketing and customer success dataProactively search for areas to improve, and streamline process, using data, technology and common sense - lead and initiate projects in the Revenue Operations groupCollaborate with end users (Internal customers) and stakeholders to understand the details of a business problem, it’s impact on the business and the desired outcome the team wishes to achieve - and then don’t let go until you solve the problemBe the business partner to the Customer Success leader, and support other individuals in the Revenue team, while following and building best practicesWork across a mix of proactive projects and reactive support for business stakeholders in Marketing, Sales, and Customer SuccessBe detailed in managing work with best practices in project and time management (Familiarity with Agile, Kanban and modern Project management tools)
Requirements:

Over 2 years’ experience in sales or Customer Success operations in SaaS software - startup experience strongly preferredClarity of thought and structured thinking, ability to state assumptions and think through outcomes and causality with a business perspectiveStrong interpersonal and relationship skills as well as strong Communication skillsAbility to work across cultures and time-zonesSFDC experience is strongly preferred; Salesforce Administrator certification is preferred
A strong willingness to grow and understand the magic of fast growth SaaS businesses
