Job Purpose:
The Commercial Operations Manager reports directly into the Director, Commercial Operations North America (NA) SW and provides business and sales support for assigned product category and region. The main purpose of the position is to support and guide the sales and service function within assigned product category and region in the selling of Surgical Workflows solutions in order to achieve yearly order intake, sales and gross profit targets. Development of overall strategy and long-term plans for the specific markets to achieve company goals and key initiatives. This role includes assisting the Director, Commercial Operations NA SW to deploy the commercial strategy defined by the Vice President Commercial Operations ensuring sales and service functions align accordingly. This position will support the Sterilization business.

Job Functions:The following are the main responsibilities :
In close cooperation with commercialization activities enable sales and align local marketing strategies with global commercial operations and business area defined strategy.
Enable, support and maximize sales functions to grow market share in selecting potential Surgical Workflows end customers in their respective area (includes supporting indirect sales channel).
Support sales functions and distributors through customer visits – including product and business presentations to current and target customers.
Collaborate with commercialization function to share voice of customer (VOC) feedback and report/inform market requirements, important trends and competitive information.
Support sales and distributors at customer meetings, exhibitions, seminars, and conferences. Including: product support, trials, demonstrations, and presentations.
Per assigned product category and region, analyze sales volumes to identify initiatives to enhance sales capacity and sales effectiveness via sales tools, improved training content, as well as specific initiatives such as promotional campaigns, GPO group buys/promotions, and special payment incentive for fast sales (SPIFFS) programs.
Sales and operating forecast for assigned product line and region
Sales support for large projects; enhance product category tools such as in-service, value add training content
Support sales in preparing system specifications, preparing system quotes, comprehensive specific packages to enhance net sales, order entry, and other relevant materials. This includes tactical pricing.
Develop, manage and update market plans and market status for each assigned product category and region.
Assist in relevant initiatives to deploy specific marketing and training activities.
Coordinate projects with after sales and be responsible for the project brief handover from the markets.

Minimum Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Advanced degree preferred.
Key Account Management, sales management or marketing management with at least 8 years’ experience in capital medical sales
Solid background and experience in Surgical Workplaces, Infection Control technologies or Integrated /digital OR in US market
Minimum 8 years’ experience in a similar sales management position.
The role requires travel approximately 50 % of the time, sometimes internationally

Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Computer literacy; familiarity with information technology concepts, integrated business systems, personal computers, Microsoft Windows operating system and Microsoft Office applications.
Developed ability to present and sell products and services in the business to business area
Exceptional verbal and written skills - Communicate technical information/details to end customers/sales companies in a straightforward and understandable way. Must be able to communicate benefits of Getinge capacity being a total solution provider (for instance: products and services benefits to end customers.)
Business acumen - Implement and follow through on sales and marketing strategies in the selected product category and regions.
Outgoing personality and influential to be able to communicate to and with people at all levels in an organization
Structured and result oriented.


This position is remote and can be located anywhere in the United States.

Getinge is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, genetic information, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

New Yorkers For Children Paid Service Opportunities NYFC Program VISTA, 2021-2022 AmeriCorps VISTA Overview Volunteers in Service to America (VISTA) is a national service program created in 1964 that places volunteers throughout the United States to help fight poverty through community partnerships; operated by TheCorporation of National and Community Service (CNCS), now known as AmeriCorps.AmeriCorps VISTA members serve as a catalyst for change by living and working alongside community members to meet our nation’s most pressing challenges and advance local solutions.NYFC Overview Since 1996, New Yorkers For Children (NYFC) has worked to fill in the gaps within New York City’s child welfare system as partner to the NYC Administration for Children’s Services (ACS). Working alongside ACS and the city’s 26 foster care agencies, NYFC’s mission is to protect, promote, and ensure the safety and wellbeing of our city’s children and families, with a focus on youth in foster care. NYFC serves about 1,000 youth annually - ages 18 to 26 - through our direct scholarships, innovative pilots, wraparound supports such as academic coaching and mental health support, emergency funding, and youth development events. We aim to enroll youth in college, support them through graduation, and help them gain the skills needed to enter the workforce with the ultimate goal of breaking the cycle of poverty.Program VISTA Position Description The Program VISTA project goal will focus on expanding the organization’s data capabilities, enabling us to better understand the impact of our programs, in addition to more accurately provide data requests to grant funders; and support youth programming events as needed. The Program VISTA will report to the Director of Programs regarding their data-related work, and to the Youth Academic Advisor regarding their program-support duties, and engage in the following activities which include but are not limited to:-Building out NYFC’s program participant data entry, collection, tracking, reporting, and analyzing capabilities; working with our client management system, Salesforce, which they will be trained to use.Assist in 2019 and 2020 data collection and synthesis, comparing program data year over year to identify trends and outcomes.Pulling specific data as needed for funding reports and the Annual Report or other campaigns.Collect and analyze qualitative data such as testimonials and direct feedback from youth, which could also include assisting in administering and tracking pre- and post-program participant surveys.-Provide support as needed to program staff at youth events – such as virtual Youth Advisory Board and Peer MentoringMeetings - in order to perform outreach and collect feedback and strengthen the services provided.Program Benefits & Additional Information Length of Service: 12 monthsApproximate start date: February 2021Benefits provided through CNCS and AmeriCorps VISTA include:  a biweekly living stipend of $829.36; a health coverage allowance; childcare assistance, if eligible; relocation allowance (if moving 50+ miles); an end of service education award of $6,195 paid upon successful completion; and federal loan forbearance or deferment.Benefits provided by NYFC include:  As the VISTA will start their year of service virtually due to the pandemic, NYFC will ensure that the selected candidates have computer and Internet Access, as well as access to the NYFC database.Additionally, while we are remote, the VISTA will also be reimbursed for use of their cell phones (up to $75 per month), and once we resume working in the office, the VISTA will be provided with a designated desk space, desktop computer and a landline phone.Once we return to the office, the VISTA will also receive monthly transportation stipends/Metro Cards so they can get to and from the office. NYFC will also provide opportunities for additional professional development and coaching.*As we do not yet know when we are able to return to the office, priority may be given to local applicants so that it will be an easier transition when we are allowed to resume working in the office. Key Qualifications Former experience in the foster care system a plus;Must have graduated from college/university;Ability to engage young people and work from a strength-based, trauma-informed lens;Strong leadership and communication skills;Strong organizational, attention to detail, time management, and administrative skills;Ideal for someone interested in pursuing a career in public administration, social work, advocacy;Motivated, self-starter who can follow directions but also create and lead new initiatives;Preference will be given to candidates who have experience or an interest in working with data.*_ _To Apply All applicants must submit the application here for consideration: https://my.americorps.gov/mp/listing/viewListing.do?fromSearch=true&id=100371.Applicants who do not apply through the AmeriCorps portal will not be considered. Job Type: Full-timePay: $1,658.72 per monthBenefits:Dental insuranceHealth insurancePaid time offProfessional development assistanceRelocation assistanceTuition reimbursementVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridayCompany's website:www.newyorkersforchildren.orgWork Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processPersonal protective equipment provided or requiredVirtual meetingsSanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

JobTitle: Technical Digital Applications Specialist - US Remote
Text:
Company InformationAbout Thermo Fisher Scientific

Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO) is the world leader in serving science, with revenues of $17 billion and 70,000 employees in 50 countries. Our mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. We help our customers accelerate life sciences research, solve complex analytical challenges, improve patient diagnostics and increase laboratory productivity. Through our premier brands – Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific and Unity Lab Services, we offer an unmatched combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and comprehensive support. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com.
Job DescriptionJob Title: Technical Digital Applications Specialist

Reports To: Senior Operations Manager

Group/Division: Instrument Enterprise services
Position Location: Remote US
FLSA Status: Exempt
As part of the IES global operations, the Technical Digital Applications Specialist is responsible for providing onsite and digital remote support for internal and external customers on Thermo Scientific Liquid/Ion Chromatography and Mass Spectrometers. The Technical Digital Applications Specialist will partner within IES and drive digital, remote applications support and the One Thermo Solution. This candidate will be responsible for IES Digital Hardware & Applications to collectively and remotely deliver services utilizing digital training, augmented reality, virtual integration, thus improving the customer experience. The ideal candidate will possess technical expertise in driving the overall One Thermo Solution.

Key Responsibilities:
Uses technical expertise, digital tools to guide FSEs and customers in resolving instrument issues.
Support of the One Thermo system Solution with hardware and applications support in delivering the workflow solutions to Thermo customers. Working with multiple Business units in driving work streams for faster, easier service deliverables.
Partner in delivery of digital training within IES Specialists teams globally.
Transitioning from onsite FSE support to content, digital, augmented reality support of applications.
Virtual Integration with Product Support Engineering enhancing services within IES global field service.
Support of the One Thermo system Solution with hardware and applications support in delivering the workflow solutions for our customers.
Working with multiple Business Units in driving work streams for faster, easier service deliverables.
Uses technical expertise, digital tools to guide FSEs and customers in resolving instrument issues.
Works in collaboration with the factories and Knowledge Base administrators to create knowledge articles and troubleshooting guides based on current field service experiences and instrument issues.
Partner with colleagues’ divisions in driving digital work stream solutions and system integration.
Brings issues and recommendations from the field to the Service Integration Group (SIG), Quality/Product Support/Manufacturing Engineering groups.
Partner with the team in driving digital application and hardware solutions.
Works with the IES Training Department, collaborating on material with the factories, service integration and the IES specialists’ teams to conduct virtual training.
Minimum Education and Experience Requirements
Bachelor of Science degree: Science related, technical or other relevant degree, or equivalent experience
Minimum of 5-10 years of technical experience in service operations and/or commercial environment
Non-Negotiable Hiring Criteria:
Proven ability to recognize and understand problems on sophisticated electronic, mechanical, and optical instrumentation maintained in a laboratory environment
Ability to manage deadlines accurately, effectively, and efficiently.
Ability to work independently.
Capable of influencing peer group to deliver required changes.
Demonstrate Thermo Fisher Scientific values – Integrity, Intensity, Innovation and Involvement.
Self-starter, with a high level of motivation and strong interpersonal skills.
Great sense of urgency and an ability to inspire others.
Solid communication skills, oral and written, and an ability to listen and process information.
Basic instructional abilities (training).

Revenue Operations Analyst at Cutover

At Cutover, we’re focused on helping Enterprise teams move quickly with confidence. We’ve come a long way in a short space of time: doubling our global team to 100 people, bringing on board multiple top-tier Enterprise clients (including some of the world’s largest Financial Services institutions), and having Index Ventures lead our recent $17m Series A round all in the past 12 months. What’s even more exciting to us, is that our Cutover journey is just getting started...

We’re thrilled to be scaling our Revenue Operations team in early 2021 and have opened up the search for a talented RevOps Analyst to come join us ahead of our biggest year to date. Our RevOps Analyst will work closely with (and report into) our Director of RevOps and have a core focus on enabling us to build and scale Cutover’s commercial engine as we grow from 100 to 250 employees over the coming couple of years. It’ll be a diverse, fast-paced, and exciting role for someone who loves getting their hands dirty in the building-phase of a project and understands the power that comes from bringing world-class process, tooling, training and a data-driven focus into an early stage commercial organization (rather than trying to reverse engineer stuff when it’s too late!).


What we’d like you to bring to the table for this role...

You’ll ideally have 3-5 years of experience in Operations/Analytics (in Finance, Marketing, Sales, etc - and will likely have some sales and/or account management experience in your background, too); this experience range is more of a guide than a mandate, so if you feel you’re a great fit for this role and have more/less experience than outlined, we’d still love to hear from you.
1+ year of experience in Revenue Operations (we’d like you to have some RevOps fundamentals under your belt, so we’re prioritizing those who have already started their RevOps journey at this time).
Experience working in a fast-paced environment (ideally at start-up/scale-up software companies); delivering at pace and managing broad responsibilities is something we think will set you up well here.
Admin-level ability in the standard tech stack (Salesforce.com, Hubspot, MixMax, Sales Navigator, Gong, etc; experience in some - or all - of these would be highly preferable)
Excel/Sheets power user and to be highly confident analysing complex data.
Experience managing the end-to-end sales commissions calculation process - you’ll be familiar with supporting leadership ensuring that data is correct and calculations occur in a timely and accurate manner.
You have next-level time management and prioritization skills - juggling multiple work streams comes naturally to you.
You’ll be patient and willing to teach: training others on tools and processes will be a key part of this role, so having a great ‘bedside manner’ and an excitement to help others learn and succeed is important..
You are mature, accurate, and credible in your written and verbal communication style; you’re able to build relationships with more senior folks internally (commercial leadership and the broader Executive Team).
Confidence executing Apex for automation purposes would be a cherry on top of the cake (although not mandatory).


The opportunities you’ll have to learn and grow as our RevOps Analyst at Cutover...

You’ll be an early member of a scaling commercial organization and the second person in our Global RevOps function: you have the opportunity to set the benchmark and progress quickly. We see this role developing into a Manager-level position over time and we’d love to support you on your route to getting there.
You’ll get to work cross functionally with members Sales, CS, Account Management, Delivery, and Marketing - building an awesome network and learning (“staying curious” is one of our core guiding principles).
You will become the guardian of data for our commercial functions: ensuring processes and reporting is accurate and consistent will be a large part of what you’ll do. With this will come the opportunity to develop and improve the status quo: if you see something’s broken, we want to empower you to fix it.
You’ll be given a motivating compensation and plan to reward you for your stellar work and you'll be allocated share options in a Series A business backed by a truly world-class investment team at Index Ventures (we’re all co-owners and are genuinely invested in Cutover’s future success).
You'll have a strong benefits plan: 20 days of PTO (+ NY Public Holidays), top-tier private health insurance package, upcoming 401k contribution plan, work-from-home stipends (we're going to continue as a remote-first team for the foreseeable), and all the company swag you could ever need.

Overview:

Our company is seeking an Asset Management Loan Administrator, who will support the head of asset administration. This position will assist in portfolio management including, but not limited to, reporting, loan onboarding and resolutions, loan draws and advances, borrower and third-party communication. Position is fully remote.
Responsibilities:
Reporting: Financial Tracking, Distribution and Retention of loan data. Tracking payments, maturities and other loan covenant tests.
Creating and distributing Cash Flow reports to Warehouse, CLO, and Repo Lenders
Managing Asset Management files with necessary data for Accounting to prepare quarterly reporting including K, Q, Board and CECL reports
Managing the Loan Advance and Draw process including receiving borrower requests, processing the draw packages, and obtaining comments, and proper approvals.
Assisting with MISC Data Requests and IT initiatives
Serving as a liaison with third-party servicers as necessary
Assisting with Special Servicing Reporting and Compliance
Assisting with Payoff requests/processing
Maintaining accuracy of asset management database and portfolio metrics
Assisting with implementation of internal asset management system development/enhancements
Qualifications:
2-5 years post undergrad experience in loan servicing, preferably from a loan servicer or lender
Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, economics or related from a top tier University with a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher
Task oriented person with motivation to maintain a high level of productivity
Independent thinker, high level of initiative and strong work ethic. Ability to work well with little direction or as part of a collaborative team
Strong attention to detail with the ability to multi-task and prioritize
Flexible with a positive attitude and willingness to work additional hours and weekends to complete projects when necessary
Expertise in Excel, Word, Yardi, PowerPoint, Anaplan, and Tableau preferred

Position is fully remote.

JobTitle: Field Sales Specialist, Security Business Unit - Opportunity for Working Remotely New York, NY
Text:
Are you a proven high-tech sales professional looking to grow your career in the exciting multi-billion-dollar cybersecurity industry?

VMware’s Carbon Black Security Business Unit is hiring experienced field solution sales professionals who have successfully sold in a SaaS / high tech quota-driven environment. In this role, you’ll identify, develop, negotiate, close business and expand revenue with our large and emerging commercial customer base.

We’re passionate about helping our people succeed. You’ll be supported with the best tech stack around, including Salesforce, ZoomInfo, DiscoverOrg, LinkedIn Navigator, and more. Working alongside a dedicated team of sales development representatives, sales engineers, Core sales teams, partners, and customer success managers, you’ll be surrounded by teammates and leaders who can show you the ropes so you can become a true cybersecurity specialist and grow your career.

What You’ll Do
Run a full sales desk, including prospecting, discovery, pricing, quoting, negotiating, and closing the deal
Drive all sales motions for whitespace and existing accounts for Carbon Black Cloud and on-premise software
Exceed booking, revenue, and pipeline quota targets
Work closely with Channel partners to qualify, understand prospect security priorities, and provide compelling presentations of CB security solutions
Manage product demonstrations with the help of the Sales Engineering team
What You’ll Bring
Experience in a full-cycle field sales position
Territory management experience
Track record of success in a quota-driven environment
Channel exposure is a plus
High Tech/SaaS industry experience is a plus
Cybersecurity solutions experience is a plus
Why you should join us

Carbon Black Security Business Unit is a leading provider of next-generation endpoint security, leveraging breakthrough prevention technology to instantly see and stop cyberattacks before they execute. With millions endpoints under management, and thousands of customers—including one-third of the Fortune 100—the opportunities are massive and exciting. If you join the sales team here at Carbon Black, you’ll receive the best-of-the-best tools for collaboration from anywhere, now is an ideal time to become part of the Cb Team and look to help grow our commercial customer base in 2021.

Category : Sales
Subcategory: Field Sales

Full Time/ Part Time: Full Time

We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.

Detailed Description and Job Requirements

Sells a subset of product or services directly or via partners to a large number of named accounts/non-named accounts/geographical territory (mainly Tier 3 accounts).

Primary job duty is to sell business applications software/solutions and related services to prospective and existing customers. Manage sales through forecasting, account resource allocation, account strategy, and planning. Develop solution proposals encompassing all aspects of the application. Participate in the development, presentation and sales of a value proposition. Negotiate pricing and contractual agreement to close the sale. Identify and develop strategic alignment with key third party influencers.

Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. 8 years applicable experience including 7 years of sales experience. Successful sales track record. Ability to penetrate accounts, meet with stakeholders within accounts. Oracle knowledge and/or knowledge of Oracle's competitors. Interaction with C level players. Team player with strong interpersonal /communication skills. Excellent communication/negotiating/closing skills with prospects/customers. Travel may be needed. Bachelor degree or equivalent.

This is a remote/office based position which may be performed anywhere in the United States except for within the state of Colorado.

Oracle is an Affirmative Action-Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veterans status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

JobTitle: Product Specialty Sales Executive (Data and Analytics)
Text:
Ready for a new challenge? Join Guidewire as a Product Specialty Sales Executive! We would love to see your background! The primary purpose of this role is to proactively sell the Company’s data and analytics software, to achieve revenue, sales and profit targets. This includes approaching new clients and the ongoing relationship management of existing clients for the generation of new sales.
One of the products you would be representing is Guidewire’s Cyence Risk Analytics software which helps insurers and other financial institutions to model new and evolving risks such as cyber. By combining internet-scale data listening, adaptive machine learning, and insurance risk modeling, Cyence insights help P&C customers face new risks, take advantage of new opportunities and develop new products. We also have many other products under data and analytics including a Predictive Analytics product and workers compensation risk platform
Note: work remotely from MidWest to East Coast is preferred for this role
Also, Post Covid, Approximately 50% overnight travel for customer meetings nationwide within the US can be expected, with week to week variance. Guidewire promotes flexible working practices to strive for a work-life balance
Key activities for this role include:
Proactive development of existing and new business customers in assigned region.
Build and maintain relationships with key prospects and decision makers.
Maintain accurate records of contacts and prospects utilizing the Company’s systems and procedures.
Lead post-sale client relationships to improve product extension sales to existing customers.
Lead and personally undertake sales activities from initial contact until sale closure while also working closely and collaboratively with Core Sellers to identify new data and analytics revenue opportunities. This will include contacting new and existing clients face-to-face as well as via telephone and electronically.
Arrange and participate in technical and sales presentations to clients.
Maintain a solid knowledge of the Company’s underlying technology, the range of existing products and consulting services.
Sell solutions based on business-based outcome benefits.
Analyze competitor products and activities and provide feedback into marketing strategies and product development.
Prepare detailed quotations and proposals that meet client expectations, as well as minimizing risk to the company. Follow Company procedures for quotation review and accept responsibility for the scope, accuracy, and winning of these proposals.
Present regular detailed reports to Management regarding Sales and Marketing activities and success rates.
Represent the Company at trade shows, conferences, industry meetings and other avenues to initiate sales of the Company’s products.
Required skills/experience include:
Over 5 years of proven experience with enterprise software sales.
Experience selling data and analytics tools and packages also a huge plus!
Extensive experience and knowledge of the P&C Insurance industry strongly preferred.
Detailed understanding of the enterprise sales cycle and ability to show a methodical approach to moving opportunities through this cycle.
Well-developed verbal communication, liaison and representation skills.
Well-developed writing skills and the ability to proofread own material and that of others.
Ability to analyze market trends and business data to identify new market potential.

About Guidewire
Guidewire is the platform P&C insurers trust to engage, innovate, and grow efficiently.
Guidewire combines core, data, digital, analytics, and AI to deliver our platform as a cloud service. 380 insurers, including the largest and most complex in the world, run on Guidewire.
As a partner to our customers, we continually evolve to enable their success. We are proud of our unparalleled implementation track record with 700+ successful projects, supported by the largest R&D team and partner ecosystem in the industry. Our marketplace provides hundreds of add-ons that accelerate integration, localization, and innovation.
Guidewire Software, Inc. is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We are committed to an inclusive workplace, and believe that a diversity of perspectives, abilities, and cultures is a key to our success. Disability Accommodations and Guidewire’s Appeals Process. Guidewire provides accommodations to the hiring process to create a fair opportunity for candidates with disabilities to contend for open positions. Accommodation requests should be directed to (650) 356-4940 or Accommodations@guidewire.com. If things do not go as hoped, we invite you to use our appeals process. Guidewire promises to independently review any denied accommodation and any decision not to offer you the position. The appeals process is the same in either case. Within five business days of receiving a notice of denial of an accommodation, or receiving a notice of your non-selection for a vacancy, call (650) 356-4940 or e-mail Accommodations@guidewire.com to make an appeal. Guidewire will assign a new decision-maker to review the request and/or hiring decision, who will then notify you in writing of a decision within 10 business days.

Join Us
Bright Power works with forward-thinking real estate owners and developers to identify, design, and implement custom energy and water solutions on a wide variety of systems. Our team is comprised of a diverse, talented, and hard-working group of individuals committed to making a positive impact on the environment.
Bright Power has been a transformative player in clean energy and sustainable housing for 15 years. Our clients include affordable housing owners and developers, Fortune 1000 financial and real estate investors, privately held firms, and some of the nation's largest property managers.
We are passionate about reducing energy and water usage by implementing energy efficiency and renewable energy technologies. Our goal is to improve our client's buildings' health, comfort, and value while cultivating a sustainable future. We believe deeply in doing well by doing good and come to work every day seeking to change the world.
Job Overview
Title: Analysis Intern
Location: New York, NY or Remote
Bright Power is seeking an Intern to join the National Analysis team who will assist the team’s Energy Analysts with managing day-to-day project work.
The ideal candidate will have interest in supporting process and system improvements for the team, as well as supporting energy analysis through detailed data review, investigation, client outreach, and reporting. This role is only open to individuals who are current or recent graduates of a NY State University or have graduated within the last year and are current NY residents.
The Role
Collaborating with Energy Analysts and utility companies to gain access to required data needed for annual reporting.
Organizing and maintaining server folders, wiki pages, and resources.
Investigating and correcting issues with utility data flow into our EnergyScoreCards tool, including testing utility provider logins, reviewing utility bill images, referencing information from SQL queries, and outreach to clients for information.
Assisting Energy Analysts with reviews of properties in EnergyScoreCards and assembling information for deliverables to clients.
Other tasks as assigned.
Qualifications
Excellent attention to detail.
Critical thinking, logic-based reasoning, and problems solving abilities.
Strong organizational and time management skills.
Strong work ethic and able to work independently.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Familiarity with, and/or ability to quickly learn Salesforce or other CRM tool, including associations between objects and data design.
Familiarity with mySQL databases and queries preferred.
Interest in learning about data analysis, utility data, and how real estate companies understand and manage energy and water across diverse portfolios.
Interest in process improvement, operational optimization, and workflow design.
Graduated college or university in the last year
A New York State resident OR graduate of a school in New York State
EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES

Bright Power provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Bright Power complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
Bright Power expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of Bright Power’s employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.

JobTitle: Workplace Strategy Change Manager /Client StrategyConslt - Remote (Greater NYC area)
Text:
WHAT THIS ROLE IS

We are seeking an experienced workplace change manager to join our on the ground transition team for a key strategic client. This role will be responsible for designing, developing, and executing change management strategies in the implementation of medium to large scale activity based workplace projects that result in significant change to the organization. The activities include but are not limited to:
Providing thought leadership and developing customized change management strategies
Identifying risks and challenges and work with leadership, managers, and impacted stakeholders to mitigate risks, identify change barriers, and develop strategies to remediate change resistance
Employing proven methodologies and best practices to ensure consistent and repeatable change management approaches are embedded in program(s) and project(s)
Creating detailed communications strategies and plans
Creating presentations, tools, and other client-facing materials
Developing relationships with sponsors, business leaders, project managers, change champions, and others impacted by the change
Leading a team to successfully deliver client-facing projects
Coaching and developing junior team members
Conducting research and ensuring accuracy of quantitative and qualitative data analysis
Developing strategic recommendations and building consensus with senior leaders
Understanding and adapting to the client culture, standards, and acumen in project delivery and materials

Other duties may be assigned.


SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

May provide formal supervision to individual employees within single functional or operational area. Recommends staff recruitment, selection, promotion, advancement, corrective action and termination. Plans and monitors appropriate staffing levels and utilization of labor, including overtime. Prepares and delivers performance appraisal for staff. Mentors and coaches team members to further develop competencies. Leads by example and models behaviors that are consistent with the company's values.

QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
WHO YOU ARE
You are experienced in the ins and outs of workplace strategy development and change management implementation. You want to work for an entrepreneurial, global company that is focused on creating world class outcomes. You are a creative and motivated individual who likes to roll up their sleeves and deliver value to client.

EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE
8+ years of credible, related work experience in the field of real estate, design, program management or consulting
Undergraduate degree (graduate degree preferred)
In-depth knowledge of the field of change management theory and practical application
Leadership capabilities including conflict management and strong interpersonal skills
Strong client-service oriented work ethic driven by a desire to act
Passion for strategic and creative problem solving
Strong quantitative/analytical skills and attention to detail
Comfort in translating large data sets into compelling findings
Ability to present and articulate ideas and analyses
Superior interpersonal, listening, written and oral communication skills
Intellectual curiosity and comfort with ambiguity and complex challenges
Ability to work in multi-disciplinary and distributed teams
Highly proficient in MS Office Suite of Products
Experience working with other software preferred (e.g., Adobe Creative Cloud)

CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES



COMMUNICATION SKILLS

Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information. Ability to respond effectively to sensitive issues.


FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE

Requires advanced knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and commissions. Conducts advanced financial analysis.


REASONING ABILITY

Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret complex documents. Ability to solve problems involving several options in situations. Requires advanced analytical and quantitative skills.


OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES

Proficient use of Microsoft Office Suite Products. Knowledge of real estate-specific software solutions like Tririga, Manhattan CenterStone, Siterra Plus, or Argus is a plus.

Demonstrated leadership/management skills

Proven record of providing excellent internal and external customer service


SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY

Decisions made with thorough understanding of procedures, company policies, and business practices to achieve general results and deadlines. Responsible for setting work unit and/or project deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to department.

We have a great opportunity for a technically minded biotechnology specialist to join our company. If you are interested in helping clients to resolve technical issues, improve their processes and use our products in the best way, then this is a job for you. You will already be familiar with Cell Culture and Process Development (cGMP Bio-processing environment) with focus on media and buffers for Bio-therapeutic proteins or Cell-Based Protein productions.
We have a great opportunity for a technically minded biotechnology specialist to join our company. If you are interested in helping clients to resolve technical issues, improve their processes and use our products in the best way, then this is a job for you. You will already be familiar with Cell Culture and Process Development (cGMP Bio-processing environment) with focus on media and buffers for Bio-therapeutic proteins or Cell-Based Protein productions.
Your primary role will be to act as technical expert and support the development of our media and buffers business through the development of strong technical relationships with both external and internal stakeholders. You will be working very closely with the Technical Sales Teams and Operations.
You will be working either from home office (within commutable distance from an international airport) or will be located within a Sartorius office and travelling to visit clients, with national and international travel.
This position reports to the Global Head of Application Specialists for Cell Line, Media and Testing Solutions (CMTS). The role will require up to 50% travel.
Main Responsibilities and Tasks:Offering product expertise, application knowledge and technical support to new customers with focus on launched productsPresentation of our media and buffer product offering during customer visits and specialist eventsProvision of technical advice to clients. Becoming the technical contact person for customers and the sales team to support technical inquiries from the first contact to the order. You will also provide the aftersales technical support, where required. You will be responsible for addressing customer's technical questions and providing technical expertise during face to face meetings as well as conference calls.Media Trails – set up, experimental design, technical support, data analysis and follow upSupport client efforts in Media selection and optimizationRecommend modifications and optimization possibilities to clients, and support additional studies to validate recommendationsMedia optimization projects for launched productsSupport Customer in data interpretation and guide selection process. Remove or reduce technical barriers perceived by clientProvision of recommendation and guidance to prospective clients in media selectionSupport Sales Department with technical expertise during proposal/quote preparation, if and when requiredTraining and Development – Use expertise and Knowledge to support the training and development of CMTS and Bioprocessing personnel, if and when requiredConduct technical talks at Conferences and congresses in assigned geographic regions, if and when requiredWork with internal R&D and Technical Consultants in order to build a centralized data base of technical information with regards to our media portfolio.
Qualifications and Skills:Degree in life sciences with focus on cell culture; masters or PhD are beneficial10+ years of hands on life sciences experience and demonstrates a high level of technical expertise particularly in Cell Culture Media and Buffers
5 + years of experience in Cell Culture and Process Development (cGMP Bio-processing environment) - Bio-therapeutic proteins or Cell-Based Protein productionCustomer DrivenExcellent communication and presentation skillsFlexible attitude, proactivity and commitment to delivering resultsCapable of working independently and as a part of a teamAble to work with people internationally and as a part of a global team
Why work for us:Genuine career development within a leading, progressive, international businessSupportive working environmentCompetitive salary with a benefits package

Earning sales revenue of more than 1.6 billion euros in 2018 our people come from over 75 nations at 60 sites in 33 countries. Follow up continuously on priority tasks.Support the financial closing process -- track due diligence tracking, review documents, provide administrative support.Financing Track predevelopment expenses fundingAssist with capital funding applicationsMaintain financial underwriting modelsEvaluate financing terms from city, state, federal, and private-sector lendersQualifications: Previous work experience in real estate development, real estate finance, project managementProficiency with MS Office and financial modeling in MS Excel and OutlookPreferred: graduate degree in related field, familiarity with NYC and NYS affordable housingIndividual should have--Clear communication skills, inter-personal and writtenAbility to work independently and under the Principal’s directionClient service orientationStrong organizational skills and keen attention to detailAbility to manage multiple tasks/projects simultaneouslyInterested candidates should submit resume, cover letter, and a sample financial model for a real estate transaction.Job Type: Part-timePay: $3,000.00 - $5,000.00 per monthSchedule:Day shiftCOVID-19 considerations:All job responsibilities and meetings will be performed remotely.Experience:real estate development or finance: 1 year (Required)Work Location:Fully RemoteHours per week:10-19This Company Describes Its Culture as:Detail-oriented -- quality and precision-focusedOutcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance cultureBenefit Conditions:Only full-time employees eligibleCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

What is Confetti?www.withconfetti.com*We are a young, well-funded startup helping people create memorable, easy-to-plan events that inspire dynamic workplaces, encourage healthier offices, and motivate happier, more holistic teams.**Our platform allows companies to seamlessly book fully-customizable, multi-vendor gatherings for their employees in just a few clicks. From smoothie stations to happy hours, team-building exercises to the annual holiday party, our catalog contains over 1300 interesting, unique experiences to support our customers’ desire for fresh and fun ideas. COVID required us to be agile and adaptable, while our smart, resourceful, and versatile team pivoted successfully into the virtual events world. With a vaccine now on the horizon, we are looking forward to the future of events, working towards ONE SINGLE PLATFORM FOR IN-PERSON, HYBRID, AND VIRTUAL EVENTS.**We currently work with thousands of companies in NYC such as Google, Facebook, Spotify, and many other startups, firms and agencies. We are looking to put together an A-team of incredible individuals who are -- firstly and foremostly -- great, kind humans, in addition to being quick learners, team players, and talented collaborators.**Even before COVID, we dreamed of having a remote team and many remote employees. All positions currently listed are fully virtual, and will continue to be so even once this pandemic is over. With that being said, we’re looking for applicants who are hard-working, self-motivated, skilled with computers and technology, and eager for the chance to learn and grow alongside our company.**If this sounds like you, read on for the job description and apply today!---Who is the ideal Vendor Relations candidate?We're looking for a Vendor Relations professional with strong experience in the areas of operations and relationship management, specifically pertaining to small businesses and independent service providers. This position will require you to own outreach, negotiations, and onboarding for new third-party vendors, in addition to maintaining strong communication and relationships with each vendor for the duration of their partnership with Confetti. You will be working directly with the CEO & CTO of Confetti, in addition to our growing team. You’re the right candidate if you are extremely proactive and self-motivated, have a strong drive for developing relationships and improving operational efficiencies, and work well in collaborative environments.What does Vendor Relations do?Develop and maintain our vendor network.Be the kind, charismatic, and energetic face of Confetti while speaking with vendor partners via phone, email, and videoconference. We want someone who is compassionate and cooperative, but who can also take charge and hold firm when the situation requires it!Develop, document, and define SOP’s for vendor relations, including operational checklists, SLAs, and vendor limitations as needed.Conduct market research to identify areas of opportunity, including event or partnership opportunities, opportunities for growth and development, marketing or potential cross-promotional opportunities, etc.Contact, pitch, and negotiate with new suppliers aligned with Confetti’s mission, quality standards, current event offerings, and future event needs.Manage vendor contracts, discounts, and expectations.Share client feedback on vendor performance to maintain quality standards and ensure Confetti’s vendor network remains in good standing.Communicate operational inefficiencies and product suggestions to management and tech team. For example: New features, UX adjustment, vendor requests, etc.Proactively communicate opportunities for improvement within the company -- we are constantly changing and evolving, and as a member of our startup, your creativity will impact the long-term success of the organization!Plan and execute future growth strategies with CEO & CTO.What you’ll bring to the table: 3-5 years in a dynamic, fast-paced role in sales, partnerships, or business development (events background preferred, but not required.)2+ years of professional experience in project management and operational development, with a passion for solving problems and developing SOP’s.Experience supporting third-party vendor relationships preferred.Superior skills in the areas of organization, time management, and attention to detail, with a high level of comfort working under pressure to reach deadlines.Excellent computer skills, including but not limited to an innate understanding of Google Suite, Microsoft Office, and Excel and Google Sheets. Additional experience with videoconferencing programs and organizational, database, and task management platforms a plus.Superb communication and relationship building abilities. This person should be personable and friendly, care about other people’s happiness and satisfaction, and possess excellent problem-solving abilities and a knack for diplomacy.Experience wrangling people and managing a bunch of moving parts. This position requires someone who is firm but nice, who knows how to get things done and is a pro at closing last-minute deals!Interest in joining an evolving, growing startup. This role is ideal for someone who is comfortable with a little bit of chaos and ambiguity, who loves building things from the ground up and scaling them to suit a rapidly expanding company!Authenticity -- no need to be formal. Come as you are!*Job Type: Full-timeBenefits:Dental insuranceFlexible scheduleHealth insurancePaid time offVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftExperience:Sales: 3 years (Required)Work Location:Fully RemotePaid Training:YesCompany's website:www.withconfetti.com

ABFE is a membership-based philanthropic organization that advocates for responsive and transformative investments in Black communities. Partnering with foundations, nonprofits, and individuals, ABFE provides its members with professional development and technical assistance resources that further the philanthropic sector's connection and responsiveness to issues of equality, diversity, and inclusion. Established in 1971 as the Association of Black Foundation Executives, the all-volunteer organization instituted many of philanthropy's early gains in racial diversity. ABFE has since evolved into a fully staffed, influential network. In 2013, the organization shed its descriptor and adopted the simpler ABFE to reflect its broadening membership better. www.abfe.orgPosition SummaryProvides critical administrative support to the Programs & Philanthropic Advising services and their various duties involving logistics, meeting scheduling, technology, financial administration, programmatic initiatives.Essential Duties and Responsibilities· Provide high-level support to the team, particularly the Director and Vice president, by proactively managing internal and external schedules, travel arrangements, meeting/event logistics, and report updates. Support to the full P/PAS team will vary.· Responsible for administrative functions, including recording meeting notes, drafting documents, and developing methods to maintain files and records as assigned.· Support establishment & execution of evaluation vehicles for on-going assessment of programs.· Coordinates meetings and sets up necessary support technologies, reservations, etc.· Process invoices, receipts and general expense items for programs (Director; Fellows; contractors; etc.), in partnership with Finance Department.· Serve as liaison with communications and other departments as needed.· Lead and support special projects or other departmental activities as assigned.· Supports tracking of prospective client and active client deliverables.· Support communications/social media activitiesSkills/Qualifications· Strong Commitment to ABFE's vision and mission.· Excellent writing and verbal communication skills.· Strong organizational skills.· Results-oriented with proven ability to manage multiple projects· Strategic thinker dedicated to achieving positive outcomes· Ability to multitask· Creative problem-solving skills· Periodic travel as neededEducation/Experience Requirements· A Bachelor's Degree, or 5 to 7 years of experience supporting Teams and Senior Management in a nonprofit setting.· Strong database and proficient Microsoft skills· Familiarization with database management· Intermediate – advanced social media skillsJob Type: Full-timePay: $47,000.00 - $52,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceDisability insuranceEmployee assistance programFlexible spending accountHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offParental leaveVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridayEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Nonprofit: 5 years (Required)supporting Sr. Management: 5 years (Required)Microsoft Office: 5 years (Preferred)Social Media: 5 years (Preferred)Willingness To Travel:25% (Preferred)Work Location:Fully RemoteThis Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneousPeople-oriented -- enjoys interacting with people and working on group projectsAdaptable/flexible -- enjoys doing work that requires frequent shifts in directionDetail-oriented -- would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger pictureCompany's website:https://www.abfe.org/Benefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyOnly full-time employees eligibleCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview process

Full Job DescriptionBridgetown Garden Tools is currently looking for an energetic, motivated, and talented sales professional to work as an Independent Sales Representative for our company. Experience in the Lawn and Garden industry is preferred. We are open to both full time and part time applicants.Who We AreBridgetown Garden Tools is a garden tool supplier located in Portland, Oregon founded in 2015. We focus on high quality and dependable garden tools for the backyard gardener. We carefully design and test all products in our own gardens to put the best tools in your hands. Our focus is to create the highest quality and innovative tools in the industry. We've been told we're doing a pretty good job.Some Straight TalkYou will work the entire sales cycle including prospecting, cultivating relationships, conducting in-store presentations, closing sales, and follow-up with all prospects. You are expected to self-generate leads through referrals and networking. Candidates should be highly motivated closers with an entrepreneurial spirit, outgoing personality, and exceptional work ethic. We will provide you an initial prospect and call list and ongoing support from our home office.RequirementsAbility to work between 8 AM - 5 PM PST Monday-Friday (you pick the hours)Minimum commitment of 15 hours weekly cold calling potential clientsMeet or exceed monthly sales goals consistentlyQuiet home office to make professional calls to clientsHigh Speed Internet ConnectionHigh quality phone line to make and receive callsRequired Qualifications, Skills, & AbilitiesClearly reads, writes, speaks and understands EnglishHas a clearly defined sales process, or is able to learnMust possess some general product knowledgeGeneral experience using Microsoft Excel, Sales Force or internal CRM softwareExperience using mobile apps and iPadsMinimum of 3 years of face-to-face sales and lead managementReliable transportation and current driver’s licenseOK working as a subcontractor as a 1099Ethical, transparent and honestAvailable a minimum 5 days a week; some weekends required for trade shows and exhibitsFlexible working scheduleCompensationThis is a 1099 contract position that pays 100% straight commission based on personal performance. Earnings are paid to you monthly. In addition, because you work as an independent contractor you may reap additional tax benefits and write offs.BenefitsNot entitled to standard employee benefits as independent contractor, however, you may be able to write off certain business expenses on your taxes related to your home office. See your tax advisor.Job Types: Full-time, Part-timePay: Up to $100,000.00 per year

Latham & Watkins, a global law firm consistently ranked among the top firms in the world, is currently seeking a Billing Coordinator to join our winning team, located in New York. The success of our firm is largely determined by our commitment to hire and develop the very best and brightest, creating a team that provides our clients with the highest quality of work and service. We are driven by our core values: respect, innovation and collaboration.

As the global outbreak of COVID-19 continues to unfold, Latham has taken precautions to help protect our people, clients, and the communities where we live and work. This includes a temporary shift to remote working for the majority of our lawyers and staff. This role will likely start remotely while the firm continues to evaluate the situation.

The Billing Coordinator will receive a generous total compensation package. Bonuses are awarded in recognition of individual and firm performance. Eligible employees can participate in Latham's comprehensive benefit program including healthcare, life and disability insurance, flexible spending accounts, a 401k plan, and more! In addition, employees receive 10 paid holidays per year, and a PTO program that accrues 23 days during the first year of employment and grows with tenure.

As a Billing Coordinator at Latham, you will be responsible for coordinating the activities of the billing process and performing complex billing duties while accomplishing these and other critical functions:

Acting as liaison between billing attorneys and billing secretaries, legal attorneys, clients, and the billing staff; responding to internal and external inquiries in a timely manner
Preparing and analyzing complex client billing
Communicating with customers to ensure their request from the billing staff is being met; updating customers on status of tasks and/or projects
Providing accurate and timely completion of assignments and inquiry responses; ensuring that all tasks and duties completed are done within the firm’s set guidelines and policies
Generating and reviewing Proformas from 3E (pre-existing or generating new charges)
Following up on unsent invoices and running reports
Providing administrative support to the billing attorneys’ AFA initiatives including matter budgets and fixed fee agreements
Providing project analyses as directed; utilizing 3E system for various analytical reports
Utilizing computerized billing and payable software modules to complete the billing process
Assisting with obtaining information required for e-billing and liaising with e-billing coordinators on outstanding items
Assisting with year-end closing and reporting as required
Assisting with special projects on various issues as needed
Promoting effective work practices and working as a team member

As a Billing Coordinator, you will be expected to apply your organizational and communication skills while displaying a positive, high-energy attitude. The successful Billing Coordinator must have knowledge and proficiency in PC Applications, including spreadsheet software and operations. Knowledge of 3E is a plus. Thorough knowledge of bookkeeping procedures such as posting, balancing, debits and credits, and journal entries is required, as well as knowledge of basic accounting principles. The ideal candidate must display the ability to comprehend and accurately perform mathematical functions.

A Bachelor's degree in Accounting or a related field is preferred. A minimum of four (4) years of experience in general accounting practices is desired, as well as a minimum of three (3) years of experience in area involving billing processes and practices. Prior experience with Elite is preferred.

Qualified candidates are encouraged to apply by clicking the ‘Apply Now’ link.

Latham & Watkins is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our commitment to diversity, equal opportunity and sustainability enables Latham & Watkins to draw from a remarkable wealth of talent to create one of the world's leading law firms.

Overview:
Responsible for the coordination and administrative execution of all Store Environment managed/delegated capital in accordance with the Corporate Capital Administration Manual and other applicable corporate policies. Generates, coordinates and administers the financial commitments for all assigned Project Managers (PMs). Works directly with approved vendors to properly set their companies up in Macy’s Inc. (including Macy’s & Bloomingdale’s) Capital Control Systems, issues capital financial commitments, and ensures all required paperwork is properly prepared, processed and digitally filed. Responsible for accurate tracking of all projects and works with both the PMs and Corporate Capital Control to ensure all Store Environment projects are properly reconciled for year-end financial closing. Perform other duties as assigned.


Essential Functions:
Generate and distribute wide variety of capital contracts, purchase orders and change orders in accordance with the Capital Administration Manual and corporate policies. Review vendor proposals for cost breakdown and scopes of work to ensure proper financial accounting through Trade Codes and adherence to all appropriate tax regulations. Work with Vendors and Store Environment Merchandising Teams on Letters of Agreement (LOAs) and resulting financial obligations between Macy’s Inc and third party vendors.
Generate Non-Operational Expense commitments in Oracle system as needed. Ensure commitments are coordinated with outside suppliers and requesting Store Environment business units.
Coordinate all financial, administrative and legal documentation requirements of assigned projects in support of Store Environment Project Managers. Track adherence to Corporate Bid Policies by Macy’s Project Managers and Legal Terms and Conditions of contracts by outside vendors in execution of capital contracts, prepare any needed policy exceptions.
Maintain capital commitment logs accurately and timely to reflect pending and completed commitments. Reconcile Capital records with on-line Capital Budget Tracking & Reporting (BTR) to identify over budget situations requiring notification.
Effectively communicate issues requiring corrections/adjustments to both Project Managers and third party vendors. Communicate with third party vendors to initiate new vendor set ups and resolve potential conflicts (i.e. missing documentation, invoicing). Assist in training PMs and field personnel on proper submission of quotes/estimates. Act as liaison between project team, vendor and Corporate Capital Control on all capital administration issues related to contract language, terms and conditions, applicable taxes, liens, bids and any other documentation requirements.
Manage workload and prioritize tasks. Become well versed on all project systems and maintain all paperwork/documentation as outlined in the company document retention program.
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality. Also must be able to work independently and remotely.
Qualifications:


Education/Experience:
College degree (preferred) or prior experience in Capital Administration and Project Coordination.
Communication Skills:
Ability to read, write, and interpret instructional documents and policy and procedure manuals.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to interact with and work well with Management, other Macy’s employees, contractors, suppliers.
Mathematical Skills:
Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.
Strong analytical skills.
Reasoning Ability:
Must be able to work independently with minimal supervision.
Strong problem solving and customer service skills.
Sound planning, follow-through, organizational and project management skills.
Physical Demands:
This position requires regular walking, standing, hearing, and talking.
May occasionally be required to stoop, kneel, or crouch.
Vision abilities include close vision, color vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.
Other Skills:
Basic knowledge of facilities maintenance practices and operations of building equipment.
Basic knowledge of budgets, accounting and attention to detail.
Advanced computer skills, ability to use Microsoft office products and other computer applications.
Work Hours:
Ability to work a flexible schedule based on department and store/company needs.
This job overview is not all inclusive. In addition, Macy’s, Inc. reserves the right to amend this job overview at any time. Macy’s is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment. Macy’s, Inc. – including Macy’s and Bloomingdale’s – will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal convictions in a manner consistent with SFPC Art. 49 and LA MC ch.XVIII Art. 9.

JobTitle: Crypsis, North America Sales Manager - Law Firm Channel
Text:
Company Description

At Palo Alto Networks everything starts and ends with our mission: Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life. We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better.
We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we are looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.

Job Description

The Crypsis Group is seeking an experienced cybersecurity executive in the position of North America Sales Manager - Law Firm Channel. This role will be responsible for expanding our current and prospective Law Firm Channel for incident response, risk management, and digital forensic services. You will work hand-in-hand with the industry’s leading law firms on a day-to-day basis. Candidates should have a proven performance history of building professional executive relationships and growing business through servicing commercial clients from a national standpoint. The North America Sales Manager- Law Firm Channel will report directly into the Vice President of Sales and will have a demonstrated track record of success in consistently exceeding sales goals.
This position is full-time and can be remote.
 Your Impact
The North America Sales Manager- Law Firm Channel will be responsible for establishing and managing the growth of cyber risk assessments, data breach response and digital forensic investigations within the law firm channel.
Develop key growth sales strategies, approach and action plans. Successful execution of these strategies is essential for success.
Direct interface with senior law firm partners and attorneys as well as their clients.
Achievement of annual targets, building relationships and understanding emerging customer trends within cybersecurity, cyber Insurance and the core services Crypsis provides in the marketplace.
Work in collaboration with Crypsis executives and leadership teams to establish professional relationships and new business opportunities.
Responsible for proposal creation, executive and key stake-holder presentations, pricing strategy, and negotiations.
Establish new law firm relationships with key attorneys to increase awareness of our capabilities and introduce Crypsis subject matter experts.
Attend industry conferences and events to present and demonstrate Crypsis value and experience.
Understand current regulatory environment and judicial precedent as it relates to data breach response and privileged investigations.
This position requires handling multiple urgent opportunities simultaneously and ensuring our law firm partners are receiving the support they and their clients need when initially responding to a data breach.

Qualifications

Substantial professional experience in cybersecurity advisory and consultative sales
Experience working with law firms and in-house counsel supporting incident response, risk management and digital forensic services engagements.
Experience in working collaboratively to represent a portfolio of services to stakeholders within a law firm and law firm clientele.
Demonstrated success in developing and implementing go-to-market strategies, standards, sales enablement and performance metrics.
Highly developed interpersonal skills and ability to effectively sell, foster client relationships and successfully negotiate mutual benefit on behalf of Crypsis and clients.
Ability to effectively communicate with a wide range of information security professionals and legal teams.
Law Degree preferred.
Ability to travel up to 30%
Additional Information

The Team
Our sales team members work hand-in-hand with large organizations around the world to keep their digital environments protected. We educate, inspire, and empower our potential clients in their journey to security.
As part of our sales team, you are empowered with unmatched systems and tools, constantly updated research and sales libraries, and a team built on joint success. You won’t find someone at Palo Alto Networks that isn’t committed to your success – with everyone pitching in to assist when it comes to solutions selling, learning, and development. As a member of our sales team, you are motivated by a solutions-focused sales environment and find fulfillment in working with clients to resolve incredibly complex cyber threats.
Our Commitment
We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating together.
We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.
Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.
n will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

JobTitle: Retail Edge Activation Manager- North Atlantic Region
Text:
Retail Edge Activation Manager- North Atlantic Region

Location: 123 Anywhere, , New York 99999
Department: Marketing

Description
Job Summary:

Develop and direct the company's efforts to affect positive change in marketing, merchandising, training, and instore experience (Retail Edge) to improve overall business growth and expand relationships with customers while developing a strategic plan to continue development and implementation of the Retail Edge program. Mentor and collaborate with sales representatives in the field while supporting the Regional Sales Director (RSD) they are assigned. This is a remote role and can reside from any location in the region.


Essential Duties, Responsibilities, and Key Results Area:

Conduct internal Retail Edge trainings with the objective to elevate Regional Sales team proficiency in a measurable way:

Set Retail Edge competencies goals with FSM, RSD, and Retail Edge Activation Director (READ).

Lead training and implementing Retail Edge certification within the Region .

Collaborate with brand management, consumer marketing, and sales to ensure alignment of brand objectives.
