Our industry-leading Gateway platform connects customer loan offer requests to relevant third-party loan offers in real-time. We have deep integrations with some of the world’s largest tech-enabled lenders who use our marketplace platform to present loan offers and also to monetize declined applications. About PWNHealth:PWNHealth is a national clinician network working to improve early detection and prevention of disease using advanced diagnostics and telehealth in all 50 states and Puerto Rico. Our model enables safe and easy access to diagnostic testing, ensuring clinical validity, utility, quality consumer education, access to clinicians, and the ability to implement national programs seamlessly. Through integration with more than 80 CLIA-certified labs and support of over 3,000 test types, we are shaping a new paradigm in healthcare. We believe that empowering people with convenient access to clinically actionable information has the power to change lives, improve outcomes, and create a healthier world. PWNHealth is backed by leading growth equity firms Spectrum Equity and the Blue Venture Fund (BVF). We are a mission-driven, positive culture made up of the best and brightest in the industry. We are passionate about health and wellness and are looking for like-minded people to join our team.About the Business Development Department:The business development team is responsible for building and driving the PWNHealth network of partners across several different healthcare sectors. The BD team secures high value and impactful contracts that ultimately increase revenue for PWNHealth. BD team members successfully identify sales leads, communicate the PWN value proposition, create proposals, and build lasting relationships within the target community. The BD team works collaboratively with the rest of the organization to deliver an exceptional experience for PWNHealth partners.General Position Summary:The Sales Support Associate will join a rapidly growing team, reporting directly to the SVP, Business Development. You will be responsible for supporting the sales leadership team, in order to keep the department running efficiently and effectively. You will do this by screening leads that come in, communicating directly with clients and triaging leads to the appropriate sales associate. In this role, you will use HubSpot to analyze metrics; create standard communication templates; conduct research and screen inbound leads.Specific Job Functions:The Sales Support Associate should be able to successfully manage multiple responsibilities and communicate professionally, both internally and externally. This person will be responsible for 5 main areas:- Track and screen inbound leads- Work with marketing and sales leadership to develop communication templates (emails, checklists, decks, etc)- Work with sales leadership to improve and maintain sales tools (FAQs, Reports, HubSpot, Competitive Intelligence Spreadsheet)- Oversee vendor qualification process – work with appropriate teams to gather input needed to completed vendor qualification requests regarding development processes, security, privacy, etc- Internal coverage for tracking down items from cross-functional teams as needed (especially during PTO)Skills and ExperienceRequired:Bachelors DegreeLocated in PA, CT, NJ or NY2 - 5 years experience in a marketing or sales support role, sales operations or inside sales roleTremendous aptitude to learnExcellent communication skillsHighly motivated and target driven, with a proven track record in salesPrioritization, time management and organizational skillsRelationship management skills and openness to feedbackPreferred:Experience with CRM systems like Salesforce or HubSpot is a plusSales or Marketing Degree a plusInterested candidates please apply by visiting - https://boards.greenhouse.io/pwnhealth/jobs/4347578003Job Type: Full-timePay: From $50,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)Dental insuranceFlexible scheduleHealth insurancePaid time offReferral programVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftSupplemental Pay:Bonus payAbility to Commute/Relocate:New York, NY 10011 (Preferred)Education:Bachelor's (Required)Experience:Sales: 3 years (Required)Work Location:Fully RemoteThis Company Describes Its Culture as:Innovative -- innovative and risk-takingAggressive -- competitive and growth-orientedOutcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance cultureCompany's website:https://www.pwnhealth.com/

The Contracts Manager is responsible for drafting new agreements and amendments to current contracts, facilitating contract negotiations, and tracking contract finalization and administration. This is a temporary role for approximately 5 months; the position will work remotely.
Essential Functions
Draft agreements and amendments (author, agency, licensor, packager, co-edition, artist, illustrator) using Sterling boilerplates based on submitted deal memos or other specifications supplied, primarily for Sterling editorial groups and the art department.Update existing contract templates as needed, liaising with BN legal and publisher.Consult with Sterling employees as needed to facilitate negotiations and contract finalization; advise internal personnel and third parties on contract detail queries; review redlined contracts with Sterling employees; and further negotiate with contracted parties as needed for nonbusiness terms.Review previous contracts done with other parties (i.e., agency or co-edition pre-existing templates) and determine whether new contract(s) will require updates.Draft, log, and communicate amendments, changes, and expiration of contracts to applicable parties inside and outside of the organization.Track contract finalization process: shepherding signed contracts from finalizing with digital signature fields; countersigning; uploading countersigned, executed contracts to archives; and interfacing with royalty, publishing operations and finance departments as needed.Assist with template work-for-hire contracts as needed.Detail orientated and awareness of legal issues, risk management, and accounting processes; maintain industry knowledge on the terms of publishing agreements including with authors, illustrators, photographers and other types of contributors.
Qualifications
College degree requiredPrior experience in the contracts department of a book publisher a plus; legal background a plusStrong verbal, communication, and negotiating skills; a people personStrong MS Office and Acrobat skillsExcellent attention to detailExceptional organizational abilityAble to work independently and set priorities under pressure; ability to think strategically and execute efficiently and in a timely manner

Who is Square One Prep?We are a boutique MBA Admissions Consultancy. Launched in 2009, we love helping folks realize their business school aspirations. We’re seeking a Chief of Staff/Project Manager to join our team in an independent contract capacity. You’ll work both remotely and at the office in New York, NY. Thus, you must reside in/near New York City so you can train at the office and maintain strong communication with the company founder.Our work cycle is June-January, with light work Feb-May. In the busy months (June-January), you’ll work 40-60 hours/week, in the slow months (Feb-May), you may work 10-15 hours/week. We do not have set hours. If you embrace working odd hours, this could be a great role for you. You will be answering emails/facilitating calls sporadically throughout the day/evening, all while doing several other critical things concurrently. If you love momentum, and being a truly integral part of a company that is helping people change their lives, this could be a great role for you!To learn more about us, visit www.squareoneprep.com. There you’ll find our mission, track record, services, and how those who have partnered with us feel about us. We’re particularly proud of the testimonials, as they tell the story about how invested we are in our clients’ success. A big part of that investment is about ensuring that we function effectively as a team and employ our process judiciously with clients. Part of your role will be focused on ensuring our team of advisors is following the process with their clients and are well trained to do just that.In fact, let's get to the nuts and bolts of the job:- Tech-Based Schedule Creation /Advisor Bio Selection – create/send prospective clients schedules and a collection of advisor bios so they can see what their lives would look like if they partner with us as well as who their advisor options are. You will manage the process of scheduling intro calls between advisor/clients and follow-up. Creating schedules takes strategic thoughtfulness – we train you on this, but you should excel at analyzing and conveying data visually. You will define what advisor bios to send a prospect and follow up with advisors, as necessary, to ensure they are best prepared to represent Square One on client calls.- Client Schedule Management – ensure advisors stay on track with their client schedules. This is not a reactive task. You must stay ahead of partnerships - know where each is in their process and why.- File Flow Management between Partnerships and Leadership - ensure teams stay on schedule and follow up as necessary to help them stay on pace. Update ‘weekly file flow’ spreadsheet to help Leadership understand what’s coming their way.- Advisor and Career Narrative Expert Management – serve as daily resource for all advisor and career narrative expert related matters. You will need to get on calls with advisors, with clients, and with both advisors/clients. You must want to do this. You must want to see matters in a holistic way and solve issues in a holistic way – before they require escalation to the company founder. You must want to solve issues quickly, as teams are often working against the clock. You will need to get to know partnerships and their dynamics well. If the founder asks you how one is doing, you should be able to answer in detail with ease.- Onboarding/Training of all advisors to ensure they know how to do their role well and how to utilize the resources and our tech-based portal. We have great training materials. But perhaps you will see ways to improve them. You must want to learn the job of the advisor so well that you could do it yourself as that is the only way you will be able to train advisors. This requires social skill, patience, and strong communication.- Strategy – assess how processes can be further automated and/or integrated into our proprietary tech portal to enable more efficient/effective operations/project management.- Tech Portal/Website/Technology Management – handle portal or website related issues, all of which are typically time sensitive as they impact clients’ access to materials/their schedule. Manage the relationship with the company’s outsourced tech company and website designer. Oversee G-Suite.- Research – quickly get answers to questions clients and founder have about anything and everything regarding schools and the application process. This is done with the aid of the Business Manager.- Oversight of Business Manager (part-time), whose tasks are:- Fee/Revenue File Management - pay advisors, manage client billing, track client payments- Proposal Creation - create/send new client proposals and follow up with clients re payments- Essay and Letter of Recommendation Questions Mining and Creation - create for each school as online applications are released- Deadlines/Interview/Decision deadline File Management - create and keep advisors informed of upcoming deadlines and decision dates so they alert their clients at the appropriate times- File Management – ensure advisors upload final partnership files correctly and promptly into the client’s folder in the tech portal upon completing the written application work with clients. Also, upload completed files into library- Testimonial Management – secure client testimonials and create testimonial blog on website.- Year-End Tax File Management – create all necessary files for tax advisor.Your annual payout will be $80K-$110K, negotiable based on your qualifications. You’ll be paid monthly. In the first year, the pay structure will be $X February-April, $2X in May, and $3X June-December. There will be a bonus, based on your and the business performance. This role offers a lot of room to grow and take on more responsibility.The right person for this role has:- a proactive, scrappy, emotionally intelligent mindset- a focus on strategizing, not just executing- an interest in intimately understanding the MBA application landscape- an ability to work weekends, nights and holidays (remotely)- an ability to think strategically and graphically/visually- an ability to be very responsive to client/advisor emails. We reply within minutes, sometimes hours.- an eye for creating operational and team efficiencies- phone presence and social skill as well as empathy to support staff and clients- a sense of urgency: for example, you do not like to have bold-faced emails in your in-box- grammar skills as you will correspond with clients and advisors- patience and social grace as you will get asked a lot of questions by 40-55 advisors and 150-200 clients regarding how to guide clients (what to do next, how to do X, where to find Y), or school related questions- the capacity to handle candor as the founder is direct with her guidance. She must give a great deal of emotional energy to clients each day. When sending emails internally to the team, she is abbreviated.- foresight – the ability to see problems before they occur and mitigate them- a sense of humor; the ability to have perspective- Last but not least, an unyielding interest in growing and being a meaningful part of a team that is helping clients change their lives.Thanks. We look forward to hearing from you!Job Type: Full-timePay: $80,000.00 - $110,000.00 per yearSupplemental Pay:Bonus payEducation:Bachelor's (Required)Experience:professional work: 3 years (Preferred)Work Location:One locationWork Remotely:Yes

WHO WE AREZinc Educational Services is a New York City-based tutoring and test prep company serving clients all over the world.For 20 years, Zinc tutors have raised scores and transformed lives using our secret weapon: REAL Learning. Our tutors improve Reading comprehension, cultivate persistent Effort, confirm or expand facility with Arithmetic and Algebra, and foster a Love for learning. By teaching students to harness the way our brains actually process information, Zinc empowers students to grow not only as learners and test-takers, but as problem-solvers across all areas of their lives.Zinc also partners with schools and organizations to offer test prep classes. Some of our partners include Trinity School, the Packer Collegiate Institute, Friends Seminary, St Ann’s School, and APEX for Youth.WHO WE ARE LOOKING FORAn energetic, highly competent, detail-oriented problem-solver committed to providing our tutors and clients with a positive and streamlined testing experience.Responsibilities:Manage all aspects of Zinc’s practice testing, including scheduling and managing a team of proctors and grading testsMonitor email account on work days and ensure on-time and courteous communication with families, students, and teachers/tutorsBe on call Saturday and Sunday mornings (8:30-noon) for occasional problem solving phone calls/emails in case of emergenciesOne weekend per month proctoring practice tests either online or in person (when it is deemed safe to do so)Coordinate with Client Services Manager to create yearly testing calendar, organize logistics, and ensure smooth weekly implementation of testingQualifications:Bachelor's degree1-2 years of experience working with children and/or teens in a leadership role such as mentor, camp counselor, teacher, afterschool program, etc. (volunteer experience is okay)1-2 years experience in any or all of the following fields strongly preferred:Office administrationEducationClient services, customer serviceExperience with:Excel and other Microsoft products (required)The Google Suite of Applications, particularly Google Drive, Sheets and Docs (required)NYC-based preferred, as we will return to in-person testing when it is deemed safe to do soWHAT WE ARE OFFERING15-20 hours a week, Thursday - MondayCompetitive hourly wageAfter 6 months of employment, you may also elect to participate in a 401(k) plan, where Zinc will match 100% of contributions on the first 3% deferred, then 50% of contributions from 3% to 5%.All work is currently remote, but when it is deemed safe to be in person, we are located at an amazing location, right on Union Square Park and near dozens of popular food and shopping destinationsA great crew of co-workers who are striving to help students improve reading and test-taking skillsAll employees are eligible to apply for Zinc’s semi-annual grant to win up to $2000 for personal passion projectsRoom to grow. There are plenty of ways for talented, committed people to grow at Zinc!Please submit a cover letter and resume. Candidates that do not submit both a cover letter and resume will not be considered. *When you submit your application, please also share a sentence or two about your favorite book!*Job Type: Part-timePay: $15.00 - $20.00 per hourBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingEducation:Bachelor's (Required)Language:English (Required)Work Location:Fully RemoteCompany's website:zinc.nycBenefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview process

Are you a wordsmith with stellar time-management skills and a knack for numbers? Blue Balloon is looking for an organized, detail-oriented team member to help our management team coordinate lessons, cultivate relationships with new families, and take on other administrative duties. This is a full time, mostly remote position (even post-covid!)The Company:Hi! I’m Rachel Lipson, the founder and Executive Director of Blue Balloon Songwriting (founded in 2010). My company offers high-end, highly-creative, in-home and virtual instrument lessons through songwriting to kids and adults in NYC, The Hamptons and Nashville using methods I created. I help the most discerning parents find the most exceptional, engaging and exciting musical experience for their children. My unparalleled team of teaching artists make learning music through songwriting a joyful experience that has often been characterized as a defining experience of their children's education. A team of about 50+ teachers teach 400+ lessons per week.We have been featured in The NY Times, InStyle Magazine, and Time Out Kids among others; and New York Magazine featured Blue Balloon as one of the “Best online classes for kids” in 2020!The Position:The position is full-time, off-site, remote work with weekly in-person meetings (in non-covid times!) and occasional events in the NYC area. Our lessons are 7 days a week so you may also need to be available on weekends at times. You will be joining a client relations team so the ability to delegate and communicate clearly and efficiently with others will be a big part of your job.Hours:Monday -Thursday 12:00 - 8:00pm, Fridays 10:30 - 6:30pm. Please note that some flexibility around regular hours may be necessary.The Responsibilities Include:Correspond with families and teachers to help schedule lessons, makeups and subsAct as point of contact for all questions and escalate issues as appropriateEnsure both the company and clients adhere to contract termsCreate and implement plans to address clients’ and teachers’ needsBuild and maintain long term relationships with clients and teachersAssist with billing, invoicing and other day to day operationsTroubleshoot tech issues for virtual lessonsMonitor our social media accounts and post new contentWho We're Looking For:You should be so organized that your friends think you are ridiculous. You should be so detail oriented that you border on perfectionism, but are also smart and aware enough to also get things done quickly and efficiently all while being friendly, fun, upbeat and positive. You should be someone who actually LIKES logistics and schedules and the tetris puzzle of fitting everything in! Your writing style is friendly, upbeat and flawless and you feel comfortable and excited about forging new relationships over text, slack and email.Requirements:Efficient at multi-tasking in a fast paced environmentA self-starter who takes initiative, always finds work to do and likes staying busy!An interest in children, families, music and our creative, unique woman-owned small business!Experience as a Client Relations or Relationship Manager (an interest in education and/or music is a plus!)A customer-oriented attitudeExcellent communication and negotiation skillsExperience tracking relevant KPIs (e.g. customer satisfaction)Problem-solving aptitudeTech-savinessExcellent time management skillsWillingness to be responsive during off hours (email/text)A keen attention to detailA friendly, positive, personable, eloquent writing styleAn adaptable, flexible and collaborative approachCompensation: Salary 35 - 40K based on experience.How To Apply:To apply, please send an introductory email to jobs @blueballoonschool.com with a little bit about yourself, your background and why you think you’d be a good fit for this position. Please be sure to spend some time on the website to familiarize yourself with the company before contacting us. We look forward to hearing from you!Blue Balloon is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, ethnicity, age, disability, marital status, veteran status (United States positions), or any other characteristic protected by law.Job Type: Full-timePay: $35,000.00 - $40,000.00 per yearWork Location:Multiple locationsCompany's website:https://www.blueballoonschool.com/Work Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview process

JobTitle: Account Executive - Digital Supply Chain, Northeast
Text:
Requisition ID: 271561
Work Area: Sales
Expected Travel: 0 - 50%
Career Status: Professional
Employment Type: Regular Full Time

COMPANY DESCRIPTION
SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

Purpose and Objective of Job:
SAP has an opportunity for an Account Executive (AE) to focus on a revenue target for our Digital Supply Chain (DSC) solutions. This is a new and exciting opportunity for someone to leverage their enterprise business application and industry sales experience.
The primary purpose of the Account Executive position is to achieve their overall revenue goal of Cloud and On-Premise solutions. The AE is responsible to identify and qualify opportunities, develop and drive strategy. The AE will develop strategic account plans containing the value proposition for SAP's DSC Solutions to the customers and prospects in their territory. It is expected that the AE be adept at creating and nurturing Executive relationships on their own while positioning the SAP executive team to assist.

Expectations and Tasks of Job:
Fundamental understanding of DSC solutions & concepts and their value in customer/prospect business processes.
Directly interact with customers and prospects to position the value of SAP's DSC solution as supported by ROI, business case development, references, and supporting analyst data.
Assemble, prepare, and manage the Virtual Account Team consisting of Solution & Value Engineers, Center of Excellence experts, Strategic Partners and other relevant roles so that SAP's solutions are well positioned in the account.
Prospect new companies as potential customers of SAP's DSC Solutions utilizing the SAP's Telemarketing group and submission of RFP’s and RFI’s as appropriate.
Execute end to end complex software sales cycles
Pursue professional and personal development to ensure adequate knowledge of the markets and industries SAP serves as well as the products and services SAP provides.
In order to achieve this goal, the AE must create a complete territory business plan that generates 4x their quota in pipeline opportunity.
MS Office and mobile sales professional skills

Qualifications, Skills and Competencies:
Requires 7 + years’ experience in enterprise application software sales
Demonstrated history of achieving $5M+ annually in application software revenue
Deep Subject Matter expertise in the business processes associated with SAP’s DSC Solutions – including but not limited to Supply Chain, Manufacturing, Product Lifecycle Management, Operations and Environmental Health & Safety.
Deep subject matter expertise on SAP’s specific DSC solutions strongly desirable.

Education and Skills:
Bachelor’s degree required
Technical degree preferred
Strong oral and written communication skills
Willingness to travel as required (20%–50%)
Location:
Anywhere in the Northeast
WHAT YOU GET FROM US
Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own.
A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.
SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.
SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team. (Americas:Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com). Requests for reasonable accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis.
EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:
Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability.

Additional Locations: Virtual - USA

CLASS TITLE: District Sales Manager

LOCATION: Remote Position (Metro NJ, Metro NY and Long Island Territory)

Who We Are:
Planmeca is one of the largest privately-held dental equipment companies in the industry. Our technology-driven product line includes digital, dental imaging (x-ray) equipment, dental CAD/CAM systems, dental units, and cabinetry. We provide imaging and software solutions for all dental specialties and partner with dental schools, government, universities, and dental service organizations. In the U.S., our products are available through authorized dealers and distribution partnerships.

What We Offer:
We offer a professional work environment, training, growth and advancement. Competitive compensation and a benefits package including a medical, dental, and vision plan, voluntary benefits including life, short-term and long-term disability, 401(k) savings plan with company match, holiday pay.

Come Join our Planmeca USA Team!
You will be able to plan and carry out all sales activities on assigned accounts or areas of responsibility. You will promote complete line of Planmeca Imaging product sales through effective interaction with dental health professionals and organizations to increase the awareness and use of the company's products. As the District Sales Manager you will achieve maximum sales profitability, growth, and account penetration, within an assigned territory. As well as personally contact and secure new business accounts and customers.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES:
Generates diagnostic imaging sales, core equipment, and casework sales as well as well as order volumes at the target prices in assigned accounts/territory
Prospects for new customers and business in addition to growing and maintaining the existing customer portfolio, as well as qualifying new leads to maintain identified business and support a balanced sales funnel for future sales
Attends tradeshows and participate in education and training conferences on selling and marketing programs
Coordinates and assists in leading sales meetings and peer to peer events to include site selection and agenda preparation
Assists dealer’s representatives in preparation of sales quotations, plan customer meetings, and demonstrate equipment and software capabilities on assigned products in assigned territory
Executes sales negotiation and deal closure at with the customer, interfacing with all key buying influencers including direct users of the product and distribution partners
Develops and maintains a high level of product knowledge of Planmeca and competitive products
Builds relationships, develop a business strategy, and maximize business opportunities for all Planmeca products and services within allocated accounts/territory
Represents Planmeca and act as a primary customer point of contact in the allocated accounts/territory
Provides ongoing feedback to management, product teams, services and marketing
Develops and maintains a high level of customer satisfaction through consistent high-quality interactions
Lead and leverage as product sales specialists
Coordinates service and support teams on assigned accounts in order to deliver solutions that meet or exceed customer expectations
Complies with all applicable Planmeca policies, procedures and operating mechanisms
Participates in company initiatives depending on organizational needs and as directed by management

Company Description

At Publicis Health, we are united around one purpose: to create a world where people are equipped and motivated to take control of their health. We transform healthcare marketing and communications into healthcare engagement.
We believe healthcare marketing is healthcare, fostering healthy conversations, healthy behaviors and healthy people. Publicis Health is a Dynamic Health Engagement Platform, an organizing principle that seamlessly connects data, content and technology; is driven by marketing and business transformation; and offers our clients fluid access to world-class talent and game-changing capabilities.
With 40 offices and 11 brands across the globe, Publicis Health’s worldwide staff is comprised of more than 3,000 healthcare professionals who are experts in advertising and branding, data and analytics, strategic planning, service design, digital media and technology, science, and medicine. Publicis Health companies include Digitas Health, Heartbeat, insync, Langland, Payer Sciences, PlowShare Group, Publicis Health France, Publicis Health Media, Razorfish Health, Saatchi & Saatchi Wellness, and Verilogue. For more information, visit us at www.publicishealth.com.
We know the power of interning with purpose….from home. This Summer 2021, start your marketing career in healthcare and intern with purpose! Don’t miss the opportunity to gain relevant industry experience from the safety of your own home.
For two consecutive years, Publicis Health’s award-winning internship program was recognized by WayUp as one of the top 100 internship programs in the United States. As part of our virtual internship program, our 60+ interns gain valuable hands-on healthcare marketing and communications experience from the comfort and safety of their homes. Interns participate in weekly virtual learning sessions and gain exposure to senior leaders across the Publicis Health network, as well as expand their network with other PH interns across the U.S. By the conclusion of our 9-week virtual program, our interns learn what it means to intern with purpose.

Job Description

Photoshop aficionado? Have a passion for InDesign? Then do we have the internship for you!
We are looking for an Art Direction intern who creates work that will make an impact in the health and wellness space. You will collaborate on a team with other creatives to make your art come to life by crafting purposeful art that follows an overall brand strategy. You’ll be able to diversify your skills by designing for various types of media, including wearable technology!
We want to give you the opportunity to actually make things, not just think about them. You will be successful at this internship if you have strong attention to detail, you obsess over the way the things you make look, and you're passionate about using emerging platforms for your craft.

Qualifications

Full-time rising junior or rising senior, currently enrolled at an accredited 4-year College or University
Enrolled in an undergraduate degree program which aligns with the position such as Advertising, Design, or Graphic Design
Legally authorized to work in the US
Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Job Description

MEDIA – PAID SEARCH INTERN
Position Overview
Have you ever Googled something and wondered why some results are sponsored ads? That’s called paid search! As the intern on this team, you will act as a key support resource to the paid search team. You will assist the team with campaign set up, execution, category research and success reporting. We will show you the basic search principles and how to handle a client’s online search campaigns. You will acquire valuable experience in a channel that has become a foundational tactic of digital media. Learn how paid search fits in to a brand’s greater marketing strategy and how insights from paid search can influence that strategy!

Qualifications

Intern Requirements
Full-time rising junior or rising senior, currently enrolled at an accredited 4-year College or University
Enrolled in an undergraduate degree program which aligns with the position such as Advertising, Marketing or Analytics
Legally authorized to work in the US
Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Description
WE ARE A TRANSFORMATIONAL PARTNER
We marry design and engineering language in ways that produce impactful and memorable experience journeys. We partner all the way to continuously improve our clients’ digital maturity. Our Studio network brings the optimal combination of skill, scale, and cost for each stage of the product development lifecycle. And to do this we need great transformational people that want to impact the projects and organizations that they work with.
We are looking for an exceptional System Administrator - Remote to work with our cross-functional team and join our world-class community of talented experts. Core to this need are expertise in:
Daisy Systems Management
Monitor system performance
Incident management and tracking using the internal ticketing system
Follow security procedures as outlined in the company SDLC and other policies
Responsible for documenting and knowledge transfer of system configurations development and revisions.
Analyze system logs and troubleshoot any reported problems
Manage load configurations and provide recommendations for improving performance
Perform routine audits of systems and software
Perform application backups
Apply operating system updates, patches, and configuration changes
Install and configure new hardware and software including VM set up and maintenance
Add, remove, or update user account information, reset passwords, etc.
Answer technical queries and assisting users
Configure, Add, Delete various file systems.
Quickly arrange repair for hardware in occasion of hardware failure
Setup host-based security policies. The candidate must have a strong grasp of host based security technologies.
Password and identity management
Work with Storage technologies (NAS, SAN), Load Balancers from the system perspective
Introduce and integrate new technologies
Support and launch site build projects
Required Skills:
Excellent problem-solving skills
5+ years of Linux admin experience (Red Hat Enterprise Linux preferred)
High proficiency with Unix command line utilities and operations
Experience with AWS Cloud environments
General understanding of PHP/Perl and the Drupal framework Knowledge of efficient shell scripting practices
Perl or Python scripting experience recommended
Experience with Ansible for configuration management
Apache + modperl setup and maintenance experience, ideally in an environment with multiple sites
Strong interpersonal communication skills; the ability to effectively assist others with the use and application of our systems when necessary.
Forward thinking and technology curious a huge plus
Nice to Have Skills:
CDN experience (Akamai)
Direct PHP/Drupal experience a plus
MYSQL, Jenkins, Alfresco, and Tomcat
Virtualization: VMWare, RedHat, Citrix, etc.
Use of Git or other distributed version control system in development or automation
Experience with RedHat Satellite
Management of releases and staging/production versioning automation
Mail server setup and administration
NetScaler or other load-balancing experience
We are a thriving Community of top technology talent that is globally connected. We Engage, Make, Run, and Evolve the technology that makes many brands that you know and love. So let’s take this journey together. No matter where you are on your digital career roadmap, we can help you grow and have fun doing it.
You must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future.
Benefits
Great globally diverse culture
Flexible work-life balance
Ongoing career development
Relocation opportunities
Competitive Salary

Job Description

ANALYTICS AND DATA SCIENCE

Analytics is the backbone to everything we do in the creative marketing space. As a summer intern on this ever growing team, you will be responsible for the assisting with the development of outstanding marketing analytics deliverables, dashboards, and reports. You should have a mix of technical and non-technical (communication) skills: we are looking for an individual that is not only passionate about and comfortable with working with large sets of data – but also someone who is passionate about finding meaning within that data to optimally transform our client’s business and marketing challenges. Additionally, there will be opportunities for you to gain exposure and contribution to data automation and predictive analytics projects.
Responsibilities:
Assist analytics team across the delivery cycle of ongoing analytics deliverables, including integrated marketing dashboards
Help handle and integrate data from a wide variety of sources
Work closely with internal (Analytics/Account/Engagement Strategy/UX) and external (Media Agency, 3rd Party vendors) partners to develop disruptive customer insights and recommendations based on information from the data.
Learn/assist with full process of predictive analytics offerings and deliverables
Use SQL to store and query data utilized for client needs
Contribute to ad-hoc analytics projects, including predictive analytics utilizing tools such as R and Python

Qualifications

Intern Requirements
Full-time rising junior or rising senior, currently enrolled at an accredited 4-year College or University.
Enrolled in an undergraduate degree program which aligns with the position such as Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Analytics, Economics
Desire for exposure to relational databases (SQL), data visualization software (Tableau), and machine learning techniques
Exposure to programming languages, object-oriented or procedural, a plus
Legally authorized to work in the US
Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Text: **While this position will work remotely, we are looking for candidates who reside in: New Orleans, Boston, Washington DC, or New York City**Genuine Foods was founded to improve the lives and livelihoods of people and communities, so that their most vulnerable members can flourish.We do that through creating fresh, scratch-made, nutritious food service programs for K-12 schools, higher education facilities, emergency feeding programs, and more.DescriptionProposal Writers compose informative documents in order to help companies secure a new client’s business or maintain existing business. The proposal generally outlines the services a company offers and why it is uniquely qualified to provide those services, usually following a specific format issued by the client.The Proposal Writer is responsible for copywriting, visual layout, and all administrative aspects of proposal development under all industry segments (K-12, Higher Education, Healthcare, and Emergency Food Services)—ensuring the integrity of all proposal documentation, coordinating internal flow and review of all proposal sections, ensuring compliance, coordinating schedules, and directing submission of the final proposal files to production. The Proposal Writer works closely individual Business Development Directors (BDDs), as well as the Marketing Department to create proposals, and reports to the Director of Partnerships.1. Professionally reviews and breaks down the RFI, RFP, and RFQ customer documents. Establish a strategic plan with specific timelines for the team.2. Gains a detailed understanding of the customer from sales and/or operations and takes the lead in writing and responding to complex Requests for Proposal (RFPs) for prospective customer.3. Create proposals for new and existing clients, by:Collecting existing content and customizing to comply with current RFPCreating descriptive and persuasive custom content as neededInterviewing internal department leads to create missing content as neededFollowing proposal writing standards for readability, and toneFollowing brand guidelines for maintaining visual consistencyEstablishing and ensuring compliance with production schedule for each proposalCoordinating draft reviews by team members and integrating their revisionsProofreading proposal thoroughly before it goes to productionEnsuring accurate and timely proposal production and deliveryDevelop strong relationships with internal customers (BDDs).4. Field Sales Specialist-Commercial Small Business-MAR0001FF
Description

From our humble beginnings over 100 years ago to our position of leadership in the insurance industry today, CNA continues to build on a long, proud tradition. Our history is a rich story of service, growth, financial strength and stability. For more than a century we have built strong relationships with business partners and customers creating a legacy of innovation and service.
CNA has an excellent opportunity for a Field Sales Specialist to join our team for the New York City territory. The position will be in the field 3.5-4 days per week, and will be considered work from home/home office, along with company car
 .
The Commercial Small Business Field Sales Specialist will focus on sales execution and business development for the commercial small business segment. Under technical direction, provides marketing, technology and underwriting support, as required, to targeted agency (e.g., local or small business) distribution plant. Drives business production and develops profitable growth opportunities with current and new distribution partners.
Essential Duties & Responsibilities

1. Establishes and achieves production and profitability goals within the local territory for small business by identifying key agents, new business opportunities, and new agency appointments. Additionally, identifies emerging channels - aggregators, brokers, eBusiness, banks, etc.
2. Promotes the use of CNA Sales & Service Center as a distribution option.
3. Promotes and sells CNA business technology. Acts as local agency advocate for CNA communications, customer feedback, and technology issues.
4. Responsible for the profitability of assigned small commercial agency plant.
5. Performs the following distribution management duties to include: New distributor prospecting, appointing, contract execution, and onboarding. Recommend and communicate corrective action including distributor termination.
6. Performs all or some of the following underwriting duties, as required: Reviews applications and financial requirements for risk selection. Determines acceptability of risk within their letter of underwriting authority.
7. Gathers and relays competitive market intelligence and conducts rate review analysis, as required.
8. Responsible for auditing agents that have underwriting and pricing authority to ensure compliance to company policy.
May perform additional duties as assigned.
Skills, Knowledge & Abilities

1. Strong technical expertise, sophistication, and independent judgment to manage business relationships with distributors and individual business units.

2. Solid insurance industry knowledge as it applies to business development and determining business opportunity.

3. Strong verbal, written and presentation skills with the ability to effectively interact with internal and external business partners.

4. Creativity in resolving issues and problems.

5. Results-oriented with the ability to develop tactical strategies and business plans which support organizational vision and goals.

6. Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite as well as other business-related software.

7. Ability to travel.

8. Ability to work independently and remotely in the assigned territory to achieve results with limited supervision.

Education & Experience

1. Bachelor's degree or equivalent.
2. Typically a minimum of two to five years’ experience in insurance sales or marketing. Prior experience multi-line P&C commercial underwriting experience a plus.
3. Requires a basic understanding of P&C commercial lines risk qualification with an insurance carrier or agency.

Job Marketing

Other LocationsUnited States-New York-New York
Organization Field Operations East

JobTitle: Virtual HBO Promotion Strategy & Planning Intern, Summer 2021
Text:
Virtual HBO Promotion Strategy & Planning Intern, Summer 2021
Location New York, New York
Business: HBO
Position Type: Intern
Job ID 180224BR
Company Overview

WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.

HBO is one of the most respected and innovative entertainment brands in the world, serving iconic, award-winning programming to 140 million subscribers globally. A subsidiary of WarnerMedia, HBO is the world’s most successful pay TV service with an extensive array of programming that includes some of the most notable titles to be on television, including drama series Succession®, Watchmen®, Westworld®, Big Little Lies®, Game of Thrones®, The Sopranos®, Band of Brothers® and The Wire®, as well as comedy series Barry®, Insecure® and Sex and the City®. HBO is committed to retaining and recruiting skilled and motivated employees, placing a priority on qualified team players who contribute to the diversity of their workforce. HBO offers competitive benefits to include medical, dental, vision, a matched 401(k) plan, flexible spending, a commuter benefit program and tuition reimbursement.
The Job
This position is fully virtual and reporting to the Manager, Promotion Strategy & Planning. H/She will work on the team responsible for scheduling all promotional and short-form content across all nonlinear services (HBO Max, HBO GO, HBO NOW and On Demand). H/She will work closely with our internal planning team and various external partner teams.

The Daily
Coordinate the scheduling of promotion on HBO Max, HBO GO, HBO NOW and HBO On Demand.
Work closely with the internal planning team to ensure promotional content is aligned.
Liason with various partner teams (Marketing Ops, Editorial, etc.).
Pre-screen promo assets scheduled on HBO Max prior to start and Maintain all promotional tracking documents.

The Essentials
Strong passion for television content and pop culture
Detail oriented
Excellent organizational and communication skills
Familiarity with Microsoft Outlook, Excel, and Google Suite
Internship Program
Students must be currently enrolled in a college degree program for full duration of the internship.
Summer 2021 program dates are June 7th - August 13th; must be available for full program duration.
Full-time schedule (40 hours/week) designed to work around class schedule.

Company Description

At Publicis Health, we are united around one purpose: to create a world where people are equipped and motivated to take control of their health. We transform healthcare marketing and communications into healthcare engagement.
We believe healthcare marketing is healthcare, fostering healthy conversations, healthy behaviors and healthy people. Publicis Health is a Dynamic Health Engagement Platform, an organizing principle that seamlessly connects data, content and technology; is driven by marketing and business transformation; and offers our clients fluid access to world-class talent and game-changing capabilities.
With 40 offices and 11 brands across the globe, Publicis Health’s worldwide staff is comprised of more than 3,000 healthcare professionals who are experts in advertising and branding, data and analytics, strategic planning, service design, digital media and technology, science, and medicine. Publicis Health companies include Digitas Health, Heartbeat, insync, Langland, Payer Sciences, PlowShare Group, Publicis Health France, Publicis Health Media, Razorfish Health, Saatchi & Saatchi Wellness, and Verilogue. For more information, visit us at www.publicishealth.com.
We know the power of interning with purpose….from home. This Summer 2021, start your marketing career in healthcare and intern with purpose! Don’t miss the opportunity to gain relevant industry experience from the safety of your own home.
For two consecutive years, Publicis Health’s award-winning internship program was recognized by WayUp as one of the top 100 internship programs in the United States. As part of our virtual internship program, our 60+ interns gain valuable hands-on healthcare marketing and communications experience from the comfort and safety of their homes. Interns participate in weekly virtual learning sessions and gain exposure to senior leaders across the Publicis Health network, as well as expand their network with other PH interns across the U.S. By the conclusion of our 9-week virtual program, our interns learn what it means to intern with purpose.

MEDIA TECHNOLOGY

Our Mission:

Healthcare is too hard. At Zocdoc, we strive every day to make it easier for patients to get the care they need. Founded with a mission to give power to the patient, Zocdoc enables the seamless healthcare experience patients expect and deserve. Every day, we hear from patients who tell us about the very real difference we've made in their lives. You can hear some of their stories here.

The safety and health of our employees is our top priority. As such we will not require our teams to return to the offices until Labor Day 2021. Click here to read more about this decision from Zocdoc's founder and CEO, Oliver Kharraz.


This posting will expire on 2/28/2021

Zinternship will run from Monday, June 7 2021 - Friday, August 20 2021 and will be fully remote!


Your Impact on our Mission:

Zocdoc is living our value of Together not Alone as we host our second virtual Zintern Software Engineering Program. Our Zinternship is a longstanding program where we provide emerging technologists with mentorship, real project work, and the opportunity to give power back to the patient! Some of our best employees are former Zinterns, and you'll have the opportunity to learn and work alongside them.

Passionate about the intersection of technology and healthcare? Apply today!


What to Expect...

Before you start you'll be linked up for an intro call with members of the Zintnership committee, our recruiting team, and your fellow Zinterns. We want you coming in comfortable and excited!
You'll kick off your summer by virtually attending ZocU. ZocU is a week long immersive engineering class where you will be introduced to commonly used technologies and Zocdoc's internal tooling
You'll learn software engineering best practices like how to write clean, readable code, push code on a daily basis in a CI environment, and ensure code reliability using industry standard testing frameworks
You'll begin to become fluent in our tech stack, from languages like Scala, C# and NodeJS to modern libraries like React and cloud computing services like AWS
In addition to working in a real production environment, you'll also be assigned a project to work on. This project will be both something that benefits Zocdoc and gives you a hands-on immersive education
You'll be building products or features that have real-world impact and are directly suited to your interests (think optimizing the workflow for iOS/Android mobile experiences or driving our microservice architecture forward in Scala)
You'll cap off your Zinternship by presenting your summer project to our entire technology and leadership team at the end of your internship (when your internship is sadly wrapping up)

You'll be successful in this role if you have…

A sound understanding of computer science fundamentals like data structures and algorithms, and the ability to implement these concepts in everyday engineering
Experience writing clean code in an object oriented or functional programming language of your choice (it's true, we don't care which you use!)
An eagerness to immerse yourself in Zocdoc tech, problem solve on a daily basis and be challenged to grow everyday
Excellent communication skills and can effectively discuss even the smallest nuance of your code with your scrum team
An infectious commitment to engineering and an enthusiasm about working on a product that is revolutionizing healthcare

What you'll receive from us...

A mentor who will help you hone your engineering skills, provide you with constructive feedback and guide you to optimizing your internship
A competitive compensation package
Applicable reading materials & a package of custom Zocdoc branded swag
Engaging and fun team events where you will build relationships with your peers
Potential for full time employment post-graduation based on excellent internship performance

About Us:

Zocdoc is the country's leading digital health marketplace that helps patients easily find and book the care they need. Each month, millions of patients use our free service to find nearby, in-network providers, compare choices based on verified patient reviews, and instantly book in-person or video visits online. Providers participate in Zocdoc's Marketplace to reach new patients to grow their practice, fill their last-minute openings, and deliver a better healthcare experience. Founded in 2007 with a mission to give power to the patient, our work each day in pursuit of that mission is guided by our six core values. Zocdoc is a private company backed by some of the world's leading investors, and we believe we're still only scratching the surface of what we plan to accomplish.

Zocdoc is a mission-driven organization dedicated to building teams as diverse as the patients and providers we aim to serve. In the spirit of one of our core values - Together, Not Alone, we are a company that prides itself on being highly collaborative, and we believe that diverse perspectives, experiences and contributors make our community and our platform better. We're an equal opportunity employer committed to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. Applicants are considered for employment regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, national origin, gender, sex, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or parental status, disability, veteran status, or any other class protected by applicable laws.

Overview:

Be Here! Be Great! Working for a leader in the insurance industry means a great opportunity for you. Great American Insurance Group, a member of American Financial Group, is a Fortune 500 company consistently recognized as a top place to work. We combine a "small company" culture where your ideas will be heard with "big company" expertise to help you succeed. With over 30 specialty property and casualty operations and a variety of financial services, there are always opportunities here to learn and grow.

The Loss Control Department is currently seeking a Loss Control Consultant(s) who will provide technically competent loss control services and conduct onsite activities to help acquire and retain profitable business in accordance with the company and business teams' policies and objectives.

The person hired will work from their home and will travel within their territory, mainly in and around Metropolitan New York, the 5 boroughs, West Chester County, and northern NJ. There is approximately 30-40% travel, including some overnights on occasion. A company car will be provided, requiring a good driving record.
Responsibilities:
Surveys and services commercial risks of any size and/or complexity for all lines of coverage.
Plans and coordinates all service account scheduling and activities for your assigned territory. Meets or exceeds all service standards.
Accomplishes risk improvement by providing management consultation services and submitting recommendations for hazard control.
Provides value-added customer services to insureds, agents, and company underwriting teams.
Maintains good communications at all levels.
Conducts professional activities in customer visits to help acquire and retain desirable customers.
Participates in team selling efforts for large accounts. Assists assigned business teams with partnering with agency force.
Assists in training commercial lines underwriters.
Maintains specialized state of the art professional capabilities in LP support for one or more commercial lines products.
Assists product development teams.
Performs other duties as needed.
Qualifications:
Qualified candidates must have a Bachelor's degree and a minimum of 5 years loss control experience while working for an insurance carrier/company.
Strong property and casualty loss control knowledge is required, including and the ability to evaluate commercial sprinkler systems for adequacy.
Must have the following degrees of knowledge: 1.) Expert knowledge of underwriting and product management skills, 2.) Expert knowledge of Loss Control and marketing requirements for a least one commercial lines product, 3.) Broad knowledge of commercial lines of insurance coverage, engineering principles and Loss control concepts, Safety standards and codes (i.e. OSHA, DOT, EPA, CPSC, NFPA, etc.).
Maintenance of at least one of the following designations is given strong consideration when deciding to promote an individual to this position: 1.) Associate in Risk Management, 2.) Certified Fire Protection Specialist, 3.) Associate Safety Professional, 4.) Certified Safety Professional, 5.) Professional Engineer. A Master's degree in Safety and Health may be substituted for one of the professional designations.
Must have conducted training programs and have extensively used computer programs to support functional activities.
Excellent communication skills.
Physical requirements:
Requires continuous and prolonged walking and standing.
Requires frequent lifting, carrying, pushing and pulling of objects up to 50 lbs.

Requires frequent climbing, bending, twisting, stooping, kneeling and crawling.

Requires overhead reaching and grabbing.

Requires regular and predictable attendance.

Requires ability to conduct visual inspections.

Requires work outdoors, in inclement weather conditions.

Requires frequent travel.

Requires ability to operate a motor vehicle.

Our company:
At Spectrum Enterprise, our goal is to foster an engaging work environment that encourages our team members to reach their full potential. We promote a culture of excellence that celebrates diversity, innovative thinking and dedication to consistently exceeding client expectations.

Spectrum Enterprise, a part of Charter Communications, Inc., is a national provider of scalable, fiber technology solutions serving America’s largest businesses and communications service providers. The broad Spectrum Enterprise portfolio includes networking and managed services solutions: Internet access, Ethernet access and networks, Voice and TV solutions. Spectrum Enterprise’s industry-leading team of experts works closely with clients to achieve greater business success by providing solutions designed to meet their evolving needs. You influence the right people both inside and outside of Spectrum Enterprise to provide exceptional service and create long-term relationships with large enterprise accounts. JobTitle: Educational Nonprofit Research and Writing Intern- UNPAID
Qualifications: Experience:Typing, 1 year (Preferred)Computer Skills, 1 year (Preferred)Location:New York, NY (Preferred)Work authorization:United States (Preferred)
Text: READ THIS BEFORE PROCEEDING: This is an UNPAID internshipYou MUST include a cover letter with your resume!!!!!!Cover letters that are clearly cut-and-paste will be rejectedTell us what semester/date range you expect to be available in your cover letterHealthy Relationships Breakout Worldwide!Sound like the impossible dream? Perhaps it's not too far off. Do you have a burning desire to be a part of social change? If so, read on and find out how the Trauma-Informed Schools approach and an extraordinary communication skill set called Nonviolent Communication (NVC) can transform any school's culture especially in this period of the health crisis and the long overdue reckoning with systemic racism. Our work directly addresses this paradigm shift.We ask this important question:We spend 12 years in school preparing for a career.How much time do we spend preparing for a relationship?Any relationship?Have you been asking this question along with the rest of the population? With the increase in youth suicides, bullying, social cruelty, self-harm, uncensored media, and now partial/full isolation from schools and colleges, offering Relationship Education that focuses on respectful communication is ever more necessary.The Relationship Foundation is seeking interns for:researchcurriculum developmentsocial mediawebsite developmentgrant researchnewsletter and blog contentpresentations and webinarsInterns are needed now (fall and winter), and into the spring/summer. This is currently an unpaid internship, but that could soon change as our program gains more acceptance in schools and organizations. We've given eight remote trainings for over 400 schools. We have also been asked to give trainings for mental health workers and psychologists who work with First Nations populations (aka American Indians) in the west and in North Dakota. We are also working with the Mt. Sinai Hospital system in New York to develop a curriculum for medical students and residents. And finally, we are working with an organization that supports individuals on parole.If you are a college student, a graduate, or even if you've been out in the world a while, this internship will give you a sense of purpose and you will learn relationship skills you may never have imagined were possible to embrace.Here is what we do and who we are:The Relationship Foundation (TRF), a 501(c)3 non-profit has been teaching its "Healthy Relationships 101" program in high schools in New York City and in cities in several other states for over twelve years. We instruct students and teachers on how to sustain healthy, thriving, meaningful, and fulfilling relationships with everyone in their lives. (and now how to have these during limited social access)One of the most effective things we do is support students and teachers to articulate their needs and feelings without blame and judgment and to listen empathically; everything we wish we had learned growing up. Given how disconnected (or over-connected) our society is today, learning this work can make all the difference both in and out of school.The communication skill set we teach is based on Marshall Rosenberg's "Nonviolent Communication (NVC)," and the results from this approach have been extraordinary. See our website for details. Equally as important is introducing the Trauma-Informed Schools approach to help schools' staff to understand that so called problem students are actually kids with toxic stress in their brain chemistry due to abuse, neglect, and unstable home lives (or homeless lives). Understanding this changes how kids are treated and the positive outcomes are phenomenal. The Trauma-Informed approach with a disruptive student is not what's wrong with you, but what's going on with you? We also go into detail about the neuroscience of trauma and how decreased neural networks can be regenerated.One administrator called our work, "CPR for the Soul."We have a book, a curriculum for schools, and a guidebook for organizations that are available on our website. Our guidebook for facilitators is being used by women's organizations and has been requested by other social service organizations, domestic violence prevention groups, mental health clinics, prison counselors, and therapists.Candidates will be selected for the skills they bring to the organization and their commitment to the organization's mission. A motivated self-starter with a keen sense of organization is a must.Excellent typing and computer skills are also required.As an intern, you will become a valued staff member and learn the history of the project, gain new insights, and help to focus on opportunities to maximize their potential.This is an extraordinary opportunity for someone who dreams big, wants to join a non-profit on the brink of wider recognition, and desires to make a difference in the world. We're closing in on grants and an increase in paid services so the internship could lead to initial compensation and eventually a paid position. Course credit can be given.http://www.trf.netSubmit a PERSONALIZED cover letter and resume that includes:What area(s) of work you are most interested in (from the bulleted list above).Include something catchy in the first paragraph of your cover letter.Using the Executive Director's name in the salutation will gain more attention!Please review our website www.trf.net to make sure this is the right fit for you. Watch my Google Talk on the home page, some of the short videos, and listen to a radio interview (Nash FM) on the media page for added insight into the essentials of the work we are advocating. Tell us something about what you read or heard.Thank you!Michael Jascz, Executive DirectorThe Relationship FoundationJob Type: InternshipCOVID-19 considerations:To maintain social distancing we all work remotelyExperience:Typing: 1 year (Preferred)Computer Skills: 1 year (Preferred)Location:New York, NY (Preferred)Work authorization:United States (Preferred)Work Location:Fully RemoteInternship Compensation:College CreditCompany's website:www.trf.netCompany's Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/TheRelationshipFoundationWork Remotely:Yes

About Us:
Create a New Asset Class. Feed the Planet. Fight Climate Change.
Recognizing that farming is the single most vital industry on our planet, we want to drive sustainable and prosperous food systems that work for everyone in our globally connected world.
We are creating a technology-driven investment and trading platform for a brand new asset class - a $10 trillion global farmland market, previously only accessible to the largest institutional investors. This is a unique opportunity to join at the very beginning of this exciting journey and help grow a truly innovative financial product while also having an active role in battling climate change and creating food systems of the future.
The founding and executive teams have decades of institutional experience in ag, farmland, and food investing, having previously deployed over $1B into this asset class. We also have deep financial and tech expertise that allows us to build investment products for the future. We’ve raised several million dollars in VC and angel funding to date, have thousands of investors on our platform, and have deployed millions of dollars into farmland deals across the United States.
Our backers include Blue Seed Collective, Franklin Templeton ($1.5T global asset manager), Richie Prager (a former key executive at BlackRock, the largest asset manager in the world), founders of Grammarly, founder of Pillpack, former CEO of Fonterra (largest dairy exporter in the world) and many other prominent financial, agricultural and tech professionals.
Our vision is to provide all investors with access to farmland investments, and farmers and farmland owners with access to flexible and creative capital.

About You:
First and foremost we want to hear from you if:

You are passionate about one more of these: agriculture, climate, farming, investing or finance.

You are a hustler.

You have a “no task too-big or too-small mentality”

You are a self-driver that can take a project and run with it.

You are a doer. We are looking for actions and results first and foremost.

You are data-driven and analytical by nature.

You learn fast.

You are looking for a long-term remote culture.

You will succeed in this role if:

You are able to prioritize and balance multiple competing priorities & projects at once

Have strong analytical and problem-solving abilities

Have a finance background / understanding of investing

Have great interpersonal, presentation and communication skills; you are social by nature and enjoy talking to people on the phone

Are able to build strong, lasting professional relationships

Have a hunger to learn and take on new challenges/roles outside of the main job description

Responsibilities:
We are seeking a Controller to build (from scratch) and manage a team responsible for the accounting operations, tax and treasury functions for our investment vehicles and our corporate management entities. Today, FarmTogether manages over a dozen investment vehicles with thousands of investors raised through SEC-registered Reg D 506-c offerings. Today, this work is managed through two in-house employees as well as outside firms. Over time, we want to bring these functions in-house for quality and cost-savings.

We are seeking an experienced, adaptable, high-performing individual who is familiar with corporate and investment company (ASC 946) accounting principals, processes, and operations with SEC registrants. The ideal candidate has experience in building accounting organizations and operations, together with the ability to be nimble and hands-on in a fast-paced, growing company. The role would be a senior member of the Operations Team and would report to our Chief Operations Officer.
Investment Entities - Accounting Operations:

Own the accounting standards and stay abreast of relevant updates

Lead transition to in-house book-keeping

Maintain all records in Quickbooks (Day 1) and evaluate ERP transition options

Compile GAAP financial statements and support Operations Team in drafting SEC-filed annual and semi-annual reports

Assist in reviewing SEC offering statements

Coordinate annual audit process and tax return preparation for investment SPVs

Assist with fair valuation process and calculation of distribution payouts

Manage and monitor entity bank accounts and treasury functions

Bring tax preparation in-house, including automating partnership returns and K-1 preparation and standard investor registry reports to be used for tax reporting

Corporate Management Entities - Accounting Operations

Own the accounting standards and stay abreast of relevant updates

Lead transition to in-house book-keeping

Maintain all records in Quickbooks (Day 1) and evaluate ERP transition options

Produce timely monthly financial reporting packages

Manage accounts payable and employee expense reports

Manage payroll function

Manage treasury functions

General Accounting Operations

Develop operational efficiencies for on-going bookkeeping by implementing automation and API-based workflows and leverage various internal datasources

Develop operational efficiencies for the processing of distributions to investors

Develop, document and maintain system of internal financial controls and processes

Requirements:

7-10 years+ experience in accounting, finance and/or operations leadership role

Must have an active CPA license (Illinois or California preferred)

Demonstrated experience managing financial audits and working with external auditors; managing financial and managerial reporting, accounts payable and receivable, general ledger, cash flow, and payroll

Experience in building and managing an accounting operation in-house

Experience with SEC registrants

Ability to learn, develop and implement new systems and technologies with ease

Rigorous in producing quality work product and analysis, foster internal collaboration and mentorship, and embrace accountability to outcomes

Growth mindset, with the ability to adapt to a dynamic, fast-paced environment

Bonus Points:

A Master’s degree in accounting, finance or an MBA is preferred

Experience with investment company accounting (ASC 946) a plus

Big 4 experience a plus

Partnership tax experience a plus

Experience working with international investors (familiarity with W8-BEN/W8-BEN-E processing)

Experience with multiple ERP systems (Great Plains, Oracle, SAP, etc)

We are a G Suite environment. Deep familiarity with Google Sheets, Docs, Drive, AppScripts a plus

Perks:
We provide medical, dental and vision insurance for US team members and a $250/month stipend to use towards healthcare for international team members.
Fully remote work!
One-time stipend for home office setup.
Professional development expenses covered (courses, conferences, books, trainings, etc)
401K and HSA
No-fee investment into our farmland products.

This is a remote position.

As the leading independent modern media company, Vox Media ignites conversations and influences culture. Across digital, podcasts, TV, streaming, live events, and print, we tell stories that affect our audience's daily lives and entertain as much as they inform.

Our portfolio features influential and respected editorial properties including Vox, New York Magazine, The Verge, The Cut, Eater, Vulture, The Strategist, Polygon, SB Nation, Intelligencer, Curbed, Grub Street and Recode. Off-platform, the Vox Media Podcast Network offers one of the largest collections of popular podcasts, and Vox Media Studios produces and distributes the award-winning nonfiction shows. Powered by innovative technology that scales quality, the Chorus publishing platform and Concert advertising marketplace answer the always-changing needs of modern audiences, creators and marketers.

Vox Media has been named one of Fast Company's "Most Innovative Companies in Media," an Inc. "Company of the Year," Digiday's "Best Company for Parents," and one of the Best Places to Work for LGBTQ Equality by the Human Rights Campaign.

Vox Media's SB Nation is the fastest-growing online sports media brand and the largest network of more than 300 individual fan-centric sports communities, including SBNation.com, our national flagship property. Our network is powered by the most respected web-native sports journalists. One part of our network needs a new steady hand, and that's where you come in.

College Crosse, the SB Nation blog covering NCAA Lacrosse, is looking for a new site manager.

What you'll do:

Making sure that the site is publishing every day, and at a volume high enough for the site to continue to grow.
Manage the site's Facebook and Twitter accounts, and help them continue to grow.
Recruit, train and manage a staff of contributors that cover NCAA lacrosse news on the site.
Regular communication with SB Nation management regarding site goals, traffic, and progress.
Moderating and maintaining a vibrant, welcoming site community.

What you'll bring:

Have a passion for lacrosse
Already enjoy reading, commenting, and participating in the College Crosse community.
Understand how to use popular social media networks, like Twitter and Facebook, and be willing to adapt to new best practices.
Be able to produce and edit clean copy.
Have the organizational skills to manage a staff of multiple people.
Be a self-starter and comfortable working in a remote environment.

This is a remote, part-time contractor position that pays a monthly stipend. Some daytime availability is preferred. If your background and experience don't perfectly align with every single thing we're looking for, but you believe you have the potential to thrive in this role, we encourage you to apply. To apply, please submit a resume, cover letter, and a writing sample.

About working at Vox Media:

Vox Media is committed to building an inclusive environment for people of all backgrounds and everyone is encouraged to apply. Vox Media is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, disability, national origin, protected veteran status, age, or any other status protected by applicable national, federal, state, or local law.

We are recruiting clinicians (LMSW) for full- and part-time (minimum 15 hours/week) fee for service and full-time salaried positions. Our clinicians use Valera Health’s proprietary telehealth platform to deliver comprehensive, accessible, and high-quality behavioral health care. Our health coach team will assist with patient engagement and logistical support, streamlining everyday tasks so you can focus on delivering the best clinical care for patients.

Join the Valera Community:

Be part of a compassionate care team dedicated to taking care of patients. Our health coaches, therapists, nurse practitioners, and psychiatrists have a wide range of expertise and work collaboratively to meet patients’ needs.
Focus on clinical work. Valera provides malpractice insurance and the technology and EMR systems you need to deliver care efficiently and effectively.
Receive supervision towards advanced licensure from a licensed supervisor.

Work from home with flexible hours.

Strong engagement and assessment skills to work with a diverse range of patients
Reliable self-starter who is able to work independently and also as part of a team
