LMSW licensure
Actively seeking clinicians fluent in Spanish, Mandarin, and Cantonese

Compensation commensurate with experience.

Full-time salaried positions

JobTitle: Regional Escalation Manager (End User Computing) - Opportunity for Working Remotely New York, NY
Text:
Regional Escalation Manager (End User Computing)
VMware End-User Computing is empowering the digital workspace. In the age of mobile and cloud, consumer devices and application experiences are shaping how businesses drive digital transformation. Consumer experience is changing employee expectations, creating new application demands and forging new opportunities to change business processes.
As a member of the VMware EUC Global Escalation Management team you will act as VMware’s ambassador to the customer and as the customer’s advocate within VMware. As a seasoned swiss-army knife and firefighter you will provide thought leadership resolve our crisis situations as soon as possible.
Job Roles Responsibilities
Spearhead escalated incidents through timely coordination of cross-functional teams and tasks, including drafting executive communications, providing technical guidance and troubleshooting; developing, monitoring and executing cross functional action plans
Engage with clients and internal teams at many levels (CxO’s, VPs, Directors of IT, and Architects/Engineers); building relationships, evangelizing VMware solutions, and providing domain expertise to assist in resolving complex problems
Improve business workflows, products and/or documentation by identifying and analyzing escalation trends and problems.
Seek deep understanding and champion the customer’s business objectives and needs throughout escalation lifecycle
Facilitate ‘follow-the sun’ escalations through global team collaboration, process alignment, and resource delegation

Required Skills and Technical Experience:
You have experience managing and troubleshooting Virtual Desktop environments and/or Unified Endpoint Management solutions (VMware Horizon, Workspace ONE)
Ability to understand deep technical issues and translate them based on your audience
You are effective in working independently with minimal supervision in a collaborative team setting, where you build relationships with various cross-functional departments
You are a self-starter and work well with minimal supervision, have strong interpersonal skills and possess excellent time management
You have the ability to work flexible hours depending on the needs of our customers and the business as well as travel domestically and/or internationally when needed (<10%)
BA/BS degree or higher, or equivalent job-related experience.
Experience troubleshooting and debugging enterprise level IT issues related to UEM and VDI Infrastructure:
Databases
Examples: Mongo DB, SQL Server, Postgres, Tempdb, max degrees of parallelism, trace flags, or other relevant experience
Application/Infrastructure issues
Examples: Web Application Firewalls, Proxies, High Availability/Load Balancing, Storage, or other relevant experience
Networking and routing issues
Examples: Routing, TCP/UDP, SSL/Certificates, HTTP, DNS, NAS, Virtual IP’s and Network Address Translation, packet captures, analysis of low-level network issues with an understanding of software accelerated networking devices, or other relevant experience
Directory Services and Authentication Methods
Examples: LDAP, Active Directory, VDS, SAML, Kerberos, RSA, Okta, SSL, or other relevant experience
IIS and related services including CAPI2, MSMQ, Application Pools, Group Policy, or other relevant experience
Experience working directly with developers and software engineers to resolve software problems and have exposure with object-oriented programming
You are effective working independently with minimal supervision in a collaborative team setting, working with diverse groups in various cross-functional departments
The ability to work flexible hours depending on the needs of our customers and the business as well as travel domestically and/or internationally when needed (<10%)
BA/BS degree or higher, or equivalent job-related experience.
This job requisition is not eligible for employment-based immigration sponsored by Vmware

Category : Services and Consulting
Subcategory: Technical Account Management
Experience: Manager and Professional
Full Time/ Part Time: Full Time
Posted Date: 2021-02-01

We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.

JobTitle: Virtual HBO Max Social & Platform Analytics Intern – Summer 2021
Text:
Virtual HBO Max Social & Platform Analytics Intern – Summer 2021
Location New York, New York
Business: Turner
Position Type: Intern
Job ID 180080BR
The WarnerMedia Story
WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others. The organization also includes Xandr’s suite of advanced advertising solutions designed to help to improve advertising for brands, publishers, and consumers.

The Job
HBO Max is seeking an Analytics Intern to join their Consumer Marketing team, focused on HBO and HBO Max Originals. In this role you will learn about marketing analytics with a focus on social media and be given a chance to pursue projects lasting the length of the internship as well as contributing to the success of individual series and film releases.

The key to success in this role will be to build out and collaborate with Marketing leaders to enhance social, research and platform insights to drive data driven decisions.

Application Deadline: Friday, February 19th


The Daily
Social Analytics (80%)
Responsible for social media measurement (social measurement, audience development, and brand affinity) and formulating actionable recommendations that can be used to shape and optimize marketing campaigns.
Work with Social and Marketing managers to build technical requirements that translate to business needs.
Assist in the preparation of weekly executive analysis, detailing the performance of organic and paid social campaigns for Brand and Original series. Help present analysis to add context, answer questions, and provide recommendations.
Conduct in-depth evaluation of marketing programs to help derive insights and recommendations for future initiatives in a clear and easily digestible manner.
Evaluate social analytics vendors and tools to ensure the team can leverage cutting edge social data and reporting capabilities.
Stay informed on emerging social platforms, new technologies, and entertainment industry trends, and be able to utilize this knowledge to improve capabilities and recommendations.
Platform Analytics (20%)
Utilize Google Analytics and other web reporting tools to provide analysis and recommendations on how to optimize and improve customer journeys.
Query and analyze viewership and subscription performance data, and link website visits to audiences to understand behavior of different audiences online.
Serve as .Com Test Analytics Lead, ensuring tests achieve statistical significance and reporting on the learnings from site test to a cross-functional team of internal stakeholders, including executives.
Other Ad hoc asks as needed to report on trends on the different platforms.

The Essentials
Experience working with social measurement and social listening tools (eg. Listenfirst, Affinio, Crimson, Nielsen Social etc).
Experience using Google Analytics and/or Omniture.
Experience with building dashboards in Google Data Studio, Looker, or other data viz software.
Experience with AB and multivariate testing tools like Optimizely.
Strong communication and presentation skills a must.
Able to translate complex analytical findings into actionable business recommendations.
Solid understanding of awareness trackers and qualitative research.
Experience in enhancing social insights through 3rd party tools.
Experience with streaming services and linear TV a plus.
Bachelors degree in a quantitative discipline. Masters level degree well regarded.
Exceptionally strong analytical skills, with an ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Proficiency in query languages such as SQL, data mining tools a plus.
Experience working with digital/social advertising environments.
Deep understanding of the end-to-end data supply chain.
Solid project management and organizations skills.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced marketing environment.

Internship Program
Students must be currently enrolled in a college degree program for full duration of the internship.
Summer 2021 program dates are June 7th - August 13th; must be available for full program duration.
Must be able to accommodate full-time schedule (40 hours/week) for full program duratin.
Fully remote/virtual experience; company owned laptop provided for the duration of the internship program.
Salary based on office location; relocation is not provided.
This position is targeted toward upperclassmen and graduate students.

The Perks
Hands-on work with passionate, talented team members in your field
Networking opportunities with industry-leading professionals
Engaging events including executive speakers sessions, professional development workshops, and more
Opportunity to join the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands
Warner Media, LLC and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

At Northwestern Mutual, we are strong, innovative and growing. We invest in our people. We care and make a positive difference.
This role can be performed remotely anywhere in the US
Our Mission:
Northwestern Mutual has 160 years of history providing financial security to millions of people. Continuing that tradition means changing to meet the needs of our clients and financial advisors. We are a strong, innovative, and growing company that invests in people who care and make a positive impact. The Design Team leads the way by creating human, simple, and engaging products to help people plan, track, and protect their financial goals.
What's the role?
A Lead Experience Designer in the design team is a pivot al leadership role. The person in this role, takes a holistic view of a program of features within a larger portfolio of products across a journey segment of our customers and partners. Through mentoring, coaching, and facilitation they help advance their teammate’s work. By working with peers and their leadership, they help understand the broader context of the portfolio and work with their teammates to make sure their program’s work fits into that greater context. All of their work advocates our partners & customers' needs and balances those needs, goals, & motivations with our partners’ goals, team OKRs, and the overall business.
What you’ll be doing:
Working with our research team to create insight development plans.
Facilitate the development of initiat ives based on interpretations of insights.
Work with program management team, to build resourcing plans and schedules
Collaborate with the design system team to contribute new components based on emergent needs discovered through application designs
Facili tate design workshops
Help drive all work through to completion for your own projects and those of the rest of your design team.
Drive usability, accessibility, responsiveness and other properties through design execution.
You will be encouraged to provide mentorship and coaching to more less experienced designers and non-designers on the team. A Lead can be called upon to supervise up to 4 designers.
Bring Your Best! What this role needs:
You have experience working on a diverse set of complex , highly tran sactional, data intensive digital products & services.
Demonstrate a well-rounded set of digital design skills with primary emphasis on interaction design and information architecture with secondary abilities in graphic/visual design and research.
Demonstr ate an advanced understanding of relevant psychological and other social science topics and their application to product design.
You have worked with applying design systems across a complex array of products and services.
You are an advocate for design pr ocess and methods, and have experience teaching non-designers how they can make use of them and gain value from their practice for themselves.
You are strategic and outcome oriented and present your work based on a critical eye to the business.
You have a detailed design process that is responsive to common heuristics and critical principles.
You are not only proficient in relevant tools of the trade but explore tools & tooling to always be ready to switch to the next outstanding tool.
You use your communic ations and social skills to influence collaborators, as well as to clearly communicate requirements, requests, and responses.
Preferred qualifications:
Experience in a regulated industry like financial/banking, insurance, &/or healthcare
#LI-Post
This job is not covered by the existing Collective Bargaining Agreement.
Required Certifications:
Grow your career with a best-in-class company that puts our client’s interests at the center of all we do. Get started now!
We are an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or status as a protected veteran, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Latham & Watkins, a global law firm consistently ranked among the top firms in the world, is currently seeking a Design Assistant – Real Estate to join our winning team, located in New York. The success of our firm is largely determined by our commitment to hire and develop the very best and brightest, creating a team that provides our clients with the highest quality of work and service. We are driven by our core values: respect, innovation and collaboration.


As the global outbreak of COVID-19 continues to unfold, Latham has taken precautions to help protect our people, clients, and the communities where we live and work. This includes a shift to remote working for the majority of our lawyers and staff. The Design Assistant will likely start remotely while the firm continues to evaluate the situation.


The Design Assistant will receive a generous total compensation package. Bonuses are awarded in recognition of individual and firm performance. Eligible employees can participate in Latham's comprehensive benefit program including healthcare, life and disability insurance, flexible spending accounts, a 401k plan, and more! In addition, employees receive 10 paid holidays per year, and a PTO program that accrues 23 days during the first year of employment and grows with tenure.


As a Design Assistant at Latham, you will be responsible for assisting the Real Estate team with developing materials and analysis to support the strategy, design, implementation of the Firm’s global capital projects. You will present and make recommendations to senior management regarding communication materials, standard reports and analytical findings. The responsibilities of the Design Assistant also include:


Designing and developing communication materials for both internal and external reports and presentations
Designing templates for reporting and analysis documents for team use
Working on all design features of various projects from conception, design, production, and implementation
Researching strategies to portray the appropriate layout and artistic concept desired
Preparing project analyses for various reports
Performing and presenting, including but not limited to, design expenditure fees, headcount analyses and forecasting, space statistics (utilization rates, space per attorney, space type ratios, etc.)
Developing and maintaining monthly reports measuring key metrics
Making recommendations to senior management based on results of analyses and suggesting potential additional analysis based on the problems / questions of firm managers
Working with managers firm-wide to provide additional analysis or presentations as requested
Assisting with special projects on various issues as needed
Promoting effective work practices, works as a team member, and shows respect for co-workers


As a Design Assistant, you will be expected to apply your organizational and communication skills while displaying a positive, high-energy attitude. The successful Design Assistant must have the artistic ability and creative thinking needed to design eye-catching and effective graphics, the ability to create visual images that engage, attract, and sell, knowledge and proficiency with the latest versions of Microsoft Office and Adobe CS (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign), and the ability to integrate charts and graphs to illustrate trends and highlight variances. The ideal candidate will have well-developed and professional interpersonal skills, the ability to interact effectively with people at all organizational levels of the Firm, the ability to work in a team environment with a customer service focus, as well as strong communication skills, both written and verbal, and strong analytical skills needed for all primary duties of position, including comprehending and communicating data. The successful Design Assistant must have strong project management skills including the ability to establish an appropriate timeline and manage to deadlines, the ability to handle confidential and sensitive information with the appropriate discretion, a willingness to complete all tasks and learn new skills, the organizational skills / project management skills needed to manage time well, prioritize effectively, and handle multiple deadlines, along with strong attention to detail and quality assurance processes.


Education or experience in architecture, interior design, illustration, graphic design is required, and education or experience in accounting, business administration, real estate, or finance is a plus. Experience in a professional services organization, corporate real estate, or portfolio management environment is preferred. Experience with HTML editing software, Flash, Dreamweaver and other animation software is preferred.


Qualified candidates are encouraged to apply by clicking the ‘Apply Now’ link.
Job Location
New York, New York, United States
Department
Global Real Estate
Position Type
Full-Time/Regular

JobTitle: Part time faculty | Civil Rights Law | JFK School of Law
Text:
What We Are Looking For
The School of Law at Northcentral University seeks applications for a non-tenure track, Adjunct Professor in Civil Rights Law for our online JD program.
Adjunct Professors may teach JD courses as assigned. Primary responsibility is to engage students, offer excellent feedback, and inspire students to achieve course and program outcomes relevant to the JD program. This position works closely with other faculty teaching in the discipline, Assistant Dean and Dean.

Essential Functions
The role of Adjunct Professor may include teaching courses within the JD Program.

Demonstrates a commitment to Northcentral’s vision, mission, and goals and those of the School of Law.
Promotes a graduate culture of scholarship, teaching, service, and practice.
Demonstrates commitment to and capacity for Teaching through Engagement teaching model.
Teaches courses in the JD Program.
Participates in initial and ongoing training.
Contributes to developing training materials and provides input on improving training, courses, and processes.
Participates in trial use of new technologies and integrates new technologies into their teaching.
Participates in faculty and staff meetings.
Maintains contact with students via phone, video conferencing, and email through their courses.
Works collaboratively with Academic Advisors to ensure student engagement and success.
Exercises academic freedom in teaching course content and achieving learning outcomes in accordance with University policy, procedures, and curricula.
Participates in program and student assessment procedures, program review, and accreditation efforts.
Performs all educational services in accordance with NCU policies and procedures, the Family Education Rights to Privacy Act, Northcentral University’s Code of Conduct and all other state and federal laws.
Complete all required professional development activities as defined in the Faculty Handbook.
Tasks and projects as assigned by the Dean, or NCU administrators.
Reasonable and consistent attendance to fulfill requirements of the position.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Experience in legal doctrine and practice, as well as in teaching legal courses.
Skilled in verbal and written communication.
Skill in operating equipment, such as personal computer, fax, copier, phone systems.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
A desire to mentor students through the course.
Excellent organizational and communication skills, with a proven ability to provide timely feedback to students.
Proficient with Microsoft Word and other application in the Microsoft Office suite.

Education and Experience
Juris Doctor degree in law or a related field from a regionally accredited institution
Online teaching experience preferred.
Curriculum development experience preferred.
Experience with the online delivery of education and the systems that support it.
Proficiency in the use of technology in the delivery of education.
Experience in Higher Education preferred.
Experience working in a technology-driven enterprise preferred.
All skills, abilities and education will be considered for minimum qualifications.

Working Conditions
This position operates in a remote, home office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, printers, and phones.

NCU will not sponsor applicants for work visas.
Who We Are
Northcentral University (NCU) is a private, nonprofit, online University and a proud affiliate of the National University System with its headquarters in California. We are a graduate university, and a global leader in providing access to regionally-accredited higher education.
NCU offers doctoral, master’s and bachelor’s degrees in business, education, law, and psychology, as well as doctoral and master’s degrees in technology, health sciences and marriage and family therapy. Our collective goal at Northcentral University is to improve the human condition through the provision of high-quality online degree programs.
NCU was founded in 1996 to provide working professionals around the world with access to a richly- engaging, professionally-relevant, and academically-rigorous educational programs. Today, we continue to serve that mission. Many students at NCU are first-generation graduate students seeking to contribute to their communities through their pursuit of academic growth, research, and practice.
Though we support faculty and student research, NCU is a teaching university. Our faculty dedicate themselves to serving students through a pedagogical model of Teaching through Engagement (TTE). The goal is for all NCU students, faculty and team members to be actively engaged within the University community. Engagement is more than just grading and giving feedback, it is an active relationship between faculty and student, a give and take of ideas and information.
At NCU, we are widening access to education and reducing educational divides. We are proud of the educational opportunities that we provide, and we recognize that providing this kind of access to all students takes work and collaborative effort. We value diversity of people, thoughts, and ideas. Our global reach affords us the opportunity to teach and learn the significance of diversity – and the power it brings to our endeavors.
Take advantage of this exciting opportunity to join a growing team of passionate individuals.
Apply today!

Requisition ID: req12136
Job Title: Gender Equality Technical Advisor
Sector: Gender
Employment Category: Regular
Employment Type: Full-Time
Open to Expatriates: No
Location: New York, NY HQ USA
Job Description
The Gender Equality Technical Advisor will play a critical function to advise and support IRC’s technical units, contribute to the design of gender transformative interventions and support gender and power analysis and learning at a country program level. The role will engage with other Technical Excellence staff and country program teams to support new feminist, inclusive and transformational programming frameworks, tools and approaches. This will leverage and build from the extensive expertise and program footprint of the Women’s Protection and Empowerment team within the Violence Prevention and Response Unit. The role will work with the IRC’s Research and Innovation team to draw from the best available evidence on what works to transform unequal gender norms in programming, as well as to advice on the generation of new evidence on gender norms change in the humanitarian field.
Major Responsibilities:
Advise and Support Technical Excellence
o Contribute to identifying strategic technical priorities, in collaboration with Education, Health, Economic Empowerment, Violence Prevention & Response and Governance.
O Support advancement of knowledge and understanding of available evidence and learning pertaining to transformative intervention effectiveness in prioritized areas. This may include creating and socializing evidence frameworks and reviews including the IRC’s revised Outcome and Evidence Framework.

O Create and support the implementation of training and capacity strengthening efforts.
O Convene and facilitate a community of practice for Technical Excellence and country program and to share knowledge, experience and learning.
Develop Transformative Interventions that promote Gender and Social Norms Change
O Actively engage and support Technical Excellence focal points to design new intervention models in identified priority areas. This may include behavior change strategies, mass communication, leadership and advocacy skills building and systems level engagement.
O Design new or modify existing tools and practices that will enable program teams to use more feminist, inclusive and transformative approaches
O Collaborate with Technical Excellence gender focal points to modify and adjust existing intervention models to include components that identify and raise awareness of harmful gender and other social norms
O Partner with the Women’s Protection and Empowerment team (part of the Violence Prevention and Response Unit) to leverage their experience and collaborate on design and modification strategies.
O Support business development for new gender transformative interventions and learning areas
O Engage with relevant local partner agencies for cross sharing and learning.
Test and Learn
O Ensure strong monitoring and evaluation approaches to capture robust learning, in partnership technical unit focal points and monitoring & evaluation advisors and specialists.
O Monitor progress and uptake in country programs of transformative approaches and provide support in partnership with sectoral Technical Advisors
O Collaborate with the Research & Innovation unit to develop new or revise existing evidence reviews and advise on new research strategies to generate evidence on gender norms change in humanitarian contexts.
O Maintain up to date knowledge about available evidence on norms change and intervention effectiveness in humanitarian settings.
Key Working Relationships:
Position Reports to: Senior Director, Gender Equality Unit
Internal:
Technical Excellence staff
Country Program Technical and Monitoring Staff
Gender Equality Regional Advisors
Measurement Unit
Research and Innovation Unit
External:
As needed
Qualifications
Work Experience: minimum of 5 years of experience in the humanitarian or development sector with proven track record of integrating intersectional feminist outcomes in humanitarian programs.
Field Experience: At least 2 years field experience in humanitarian settings.
Demonstrated Skills and Competencies:
Demonstrated expertise in designing and implementing interventions with norms change and transformation objectives
Demonstrated experience on the development and implementation of research and/or monitoring & evaluation frameworks for transformative interventions.
Effectiveness in bridging practical guidance and conceptual frameworks
Experience in developing and administering gender trainings, ability to communicate technical expertise and standards, and implement best practice approaches
Excellent interpersonal skills and communication skills with a demonstrated ability to develop insight and well-supported opinions based on varying feedback from wide range of stakeholders and independent research
Experience interacting and communicating effectively with members of a complex organization at multiple levels
Ability to work independently and with multi-cultural and multi-disciplinary teams
Good verbal and written communication skills (i.e. day-to-day discussions, team meetings, presentations, written status updates, etc.), as well as an overall ability to be clear and concise in all communications
High level of comfort with MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint
Working Environment:
Remote, home-based position
25% travel to countries of operation, as COVID restrictions permit
The IRC and IRC workers must adhere to the values and principles outlined in IRC Way - Standards for Professional Conduct. These are Integrity, Equality, Service, and Accountability. In accordance with these values, the IRC operates and enforces policies on Beneficiary Protection from Exploitation and Abuse, Child Safeguarding, Anti Workplace Harassment, Fiscal Integrity, and Anti-Retaliation.
IRC et les employés de IRC doivent adhérer aux valeurs et principes contenus dans le IRC WAY (normes de conduite professionnelle). Ce sont l’Intégrité, Egalite, le Service, et la Responsabilité. En conformité avec ces valeurs, IRC opère et fait respecter les politiques sur la protection des bénéficiaires contre l’exploitation et les abus, la protection de l’enfant, le harcèlement sur les lieux de travail, l’intégrité financière, et les représailles.

Atlanta, GA or Austin, TX or Dallas, TX or Fort Worth, TX or New York, NY or Remote

PMG is looking for an experienced Search Engine Marketing (SEM) Lead to oversee large Retail industry strategies and campaigns, working in partnership with our awesome clients to deliver successful and high impact outcomes!

General Description
Managing a team of SEM leads, managers and coordinators, their day-to-day work and their overall professional development
Overseeing the day-to-day operations of SEM campaigns including bid management, optimization and analysis of weekly performance and trends
Communicating strategy and campaign updates to clients via weekly calls, emails and in-person meetings
Helping to develop the overarching SEM strategy and ensuring day-to-day projects drive towards it
Overseeing the performance of campaigns, recommending changes in spend or budget allocation, troubleshooting issues as they arise
Identifying growth opportunities and implementing initiatives to ensure client’s goals are met while executing daily campaign management tactics
Contributing to high impact projects
Developing relationships with senior level client contacts
Identifying growth opportunities and implementing initiatives to ensure client’s goals are met
Skills & Experience
7+ years of related work experience, plus 2-5 years of supervisory experience
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience
Strong interpersonal and training skills
High level of emotional intelligence
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong team player
Strong analytical skills with proficiency in Microsoft Excel or SQL

About PMG

Opportunity Overview
The WarnerMedia Story
WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others. The organization also includes Xandr’s suite of advanced advertising solutions designed to help to improve advertising for brands, publishers, and consumers.

The Job
The Media Supply Chain’s Media Workflows team is responsible for developing the applications and systems that are the “front door” for all of the media that is delivered to WarnerMedia for use on our linear networks such as HBO, TNT and TBS along with our streaming platform HBO Max. Our workflows verify the content that comes from our partners, provides the ability for our quality control team to verify that it meets our standards, and provides the content to our internal teams to prepare it for delivery to our networks and platforms.

We seek an intern with experience in software design and development who is looking to gain exciting real-world software engineering experience at a thriving company. This program will have our interns work side-by-side, virtually this year, with the team’s software engineers while we develop new features and functionality for our users and business partners. They will be a contributing part of all of our team’s daily status and weekly planning meetings, along with any design and problem-solving activities the team conducts.

We frequently work in small teams to solve problems, explore new technologies, and learn from one another. The ideal intern for this environment will be enthusiastic and collaborative and has a sincere desire for learning and growth.

Capable of working in a collaborative team environment
Can critically evaluate code as a method of learning, and knows when and how to safely refactor code/artifact

Currently enrolled in a degree program in a Computer Science/Network Engineering, Engineering, or Mathematics
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to work in a small team environment
Ability to work in a remote environment
Experience programming in Java, NodeJS and Javascript/HTML/CSS
Looking for energetic and “go-getter” personalities

Must be able to accommodate full-time schedule (40 hours/week) for full program duration.

TRC is a global consulting firm providing environmentally advanced and technology-powered solutions for the oil and gas, power and infrastructure industry.

We are seeking a Digital Solutions Project Manager with software delivery /implementation experience to join our Digital Solutions team. PMP and electric utility industry experience is highly desired. This role is fully remote or could sit in any of our 140 + offices nationwide.

The Project Manager (PM) manages projects and proposals of software implementations within the utility industry. The PM manages assigned projects from the proposal stage through project completion. The PM will ensure appropriate resources are assigned to the project and manage resources through the completion and issue of client deliverables on time and on budget as dictated by project scope and schedule. The PM is responsible for managing project budget and schedule via the change management process and keeping the project accounting system current with project contract value and estimate at completion values. The Project Manager will maintain a high degree of external and internal customer service via clear and timely communication and project reporting.

Project Manager must take full ownership responsibility over the project and ensure that there are no surprises to the Project Management Office (PMO). The PM will act as the primary project advocate and single point of communication.

Duties and Skills

Be intimate with and adhere to the TRC Software Implementation Delivery Methodology
Lead and manage the members of the project implementation team in daily support of the execution of delivery of software and services to our customers
Plan, execute, and manage the activities of the team and indirect support resources to produce deliverables according to contract / customer requirements.
Ensure the project's budgeted costs and profits are met or improved
Ability to strategize and implement methodology to increase project margins
Ensure timely and comprehensive change order management
Establishment of and maintenance of project cash flows
Facilitate efficient project billing, working within company's accounting practices
Able to implement earned value tracking and reporting
Project schedule management including the development and upkeep of project schedules
Ensure appropriate time, resources and schedule milestones are included in project planning and adherence during project execution
Project administration including the proper capture and filing off all project documentation including, contracts documents, invoices, meeting minutes, project reports and communications
Effectively communicate to the client, project team and TRC management including timely accurate internal and external reporting, executing effective efficient project meetings and ensuring communication between all project disciplines
Lead development of delivery SOWs and provide support and delivery expertise for RFP responses
Conduct periodic performance reviews of the project with the PMO
Project safety, demonstrating safety is a priority via safety leadership, adherence to TRC and client safety policies.
Support and adhere to Company's Code of Conduct and Ethics Policy.

Requirements
Education

Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Engineering, Business or similar degree from an accredited school or University is desired
Certification as a Project Management Professional (PMP) is desired

Required Experience:
A minimum of 5 years of software delivery experience is required, 8 is years is preferred. Utility industry background is desired.
Demonstrated strong written and verbal communication skills to deal with internal and external clients.
Experience with appropriate software tools (Microsoft Office, MS Project, Vision).
A combination of education and experience may be considered.
Knowledge of, and experience with: Project Management, Project Controls, and Software Development and Implementation

Location

This role is fully remote or could sit in any of our 140 + offices nationwide.

Travel

50%-75% travel throughout North America

Join our growing Digital Team and advance your career by learning from industry proven experts. Our team core values include: Safety, Teamwork, Quality, and Reliability.

TRC offers advancement potential and a competitive compensation and benefits package including a 401k plan with a company match. For more information please visit our website at: https://www.trccompanies.com/

TRC Digital Overview
In a world where energy supply and consumption are becoming increasingly more dynamic, bidirectional, and complex, energy providers are challenged with maintaining a standard of safe, reliable and resilient power. Distributed energy resource (DER) technologies and associated go to market adoption models are proliferating at a staggering rate, amongst a backdrop where traditional utility customers are transitioning from consumers to prosumers, becoming more sophisticated and more insistent on a reduced carbon footprint. These changes are occurring in an environment where, in order to support the penetration of DERs, the grid infrastructure requires more intense and targeted maintenance, and the shift of previously centralized decision making to new devices that sit at the very edge of the grid.

To address the challenges and seize the opportunities provided by this new energy landscape, TRC Digital offers an array of expertise to provide to our client partners. Our experts have delivered fully integrated software solutions to well over 30 North American utilities. TRC Digital is an expert services and solutions integration team, focused specifically on implementing partner led software technologies that will bridge today's realities with tomorrow's possibilities. TRC Digital has partnered with a true best of breed collection of software providers that address critical needs in the areas of DERs, DER Planning & Validation, DER Optimization & Dispatch, customer engagement, and new grid infrastructure. Our team members become deeply engaged with each of our partners, providing both deep utility and vendor specific domain expertise, ensuring we provide our clients with holistic solutions that scale with our partner operations and customer expectations. We draw upon our experience delivering these solutions for the past decade and enhance them with the expanse of experience and capability of TRC.

Our team of experts have an average of 15 years of experience in their relative disciplines and have played an integral part in the evolution of both the technologies and the market acceptance of such.

We are focused - our integration and delivery approaches ensure we are driving the most value/highest ROI from the installation of OT systems into the utility IT landscape. Our aim is to deliver cost effective technology that solves today's challenges while enabling future opportunities for utilities and their customers.

We are committed - our track record combined with the half-century of TRC's execution accomplishments ensures our clients receive a reliable, scalable, and fully useable solution, and more importantly, one our client can trust, leverage, and build on, in the years ahead.

We partner with our clients - we listen to our clients to understand their business processes and help weave our software partner solutions into the very fabric of the client business, and in some cases that of end customers. Our clients' view us as the "go to" team as they face this emerging landscape and embrace the new energy future.

The Primary Prevention Advisor is a parental leave cover role that will be responsible for a body of work on violence against women and girls and co-occurring family violence. Currently this includes the EMAP Plus and Safe at Home projects with the potential for expansion based on business development opportunities over the period. The Advisor will lead business development and manage all technical components of this body of work.

Job Description

PROJECT MANAGEMENT
Position Overview
Do you rise to the challenge of keeping projects on time? Then project management may be the role for you!
The Project Management team gains tremendous insight into the agency by working with every department. As the Project Management team, we are critical to keeping a campaign on time, on budget, and on concept to deliver outstanding work for our clients. Project Managers keep things moving. As a project management intern, you will gain hands-on experience working to support the team's projects. To be a successful project manager, you will need to be organized, detail oriented and succeed with collaborating with others. From project approach and plan to delivering the project on time, within budget, and to Publicis Health’s high quality standards, you will get to see the full picture of a project lifecycle!
PLEASE NOTE: we will have numerous project management opportunities across our businesses.

Qualifications

Intern Requirements
Full-time rising junior or rising senior, currently enrolled at an accredited 4-year College or University
Enrolled in an undergraduate degree program which aligns with the position such as Advertising, Marketing, Communications or Business Management
Legally authorized to work in the US
Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

ROLE SUMMARY
Healthcare is at a point of unprecedented change. The need to respond to rising costs while delivering improved outcomes is pushing healthcare systems globally to evolve from a volume-based healthcare system to one that is focused on delivering value. This evolution requires Pfizer to identify, develop, and confidently adopt novel solutions that transform the way it engages the healthcare market, securing affordable and equitable patient access to its medicines, and enhancing the patient experience. A critical success factor for Pfizer to thrive in this emerging value-based healthcare marketplace is the ability to co-create shared value across the healthcare ecosystem.
The Healthcare Innovation Center (HIC) is tasked with exploring innovative methods such as value-based agreements and novel partnerships to transform the way Pfizer brings medicines and vaccines to market. The global team aims to design and deliver solutions that enhance the patient experience, optimize access and affordability, and catalyze a move to value-based care. To reimagine the current healthcare system for patients and go “beyond the lab,” we’re approaching partnerships in innovative ways through the co-development of novel access and financing models, application of real-world evidence, and deployment of digital health tools.
Within the Healthcare Innovation Center, the HEOR Methods Innovation Lead will be tasked with enabling Pfizer to be recognized as an industry leader in novel agreements that improve equitable and affordable access (i.e. Bold Move / Big Ideas 3.1 and 3.2), and leading the conversation on innovative valuation externally (Bold Move / Big Idea 5.2)
Formulating value frameworks fit-for-purpose to novel value-based agreements that address affordable and equitable access challenges globally
Providing HEOR expert input to VBA design including but not limited to clinical, economic and humanistic metrics
Partnering with the PHI BU teams and other colleagues on proactive and reactive communications with Health Technology Assessment agencies
The optimal candidate will have a demonstrated record of success in advancing health economics and outcomes research methods, strategic problem solving, and innovative engagement with customers. A deep understanding of health technology agencies and emerging value frameworks will be critical. This leader will be required to build effective cross functional teams designed to ensure access models are aligned to Commercial, Policy, Legal, and Digital requirements. In order to move Pfizer to a leadership role in access innovation, this leader will be required to engage externally with senior leaders from existing customers and other healthcare stakeholders while maintaining a thorough understanding of competitive market activity in the value-based healthcare space.
ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES
This individual will be required to work closely with cross-functional leaders across Pfizer to:
Define and develop HEOR methods innovation principles to be applied to value-based healthcare initiatives pursued by the HIC (Bold Moves 3.1, 3.2 and 5.2)
Work closely with HIC lead to collaborate with key HEOR experts, academics and organizations externally, and provide technical expertise to support the development of partnerships and facilitate the application of new methods and value frameworks to Pfizer’s pipeline and inline assets.
Identify and manage the development of new value measurement concepts through collaborative efforts with colleagues, customers, and thought leaders to support the scaling of VBHC initiatives.
Serve as an HEOR innovation liaison to the business.
Lead above brand initiatives and studies to develop / support innovative HEOR methods.
Provide technical inputs to support internal strategy and alignment on Pfizer’s position when engaging with key stakeholders (US and Ex-US) including ICER, NPC, HTA bodies etc.
Lead the FDAMA S114 technical review committee (TRC) and contribute to the RWE in promotion TRC, collaborating with HEOR SMEs to identify gaps and opportunities for synergies across BUs.
Coordinate HEOR capabilities, processes, and methodologies to maximize the value of our medicines and vaccines throughout the life cycle, while fostering a culture of sharing, learning, and innovation.
Create proactive value framework communications that underpin the goal of improving access for Pfizer assets while reducing the cost of administration and adjudication.
Collaborate closely with key functions internally to foster a culture of sharing best practice (e.g. RWE CoE, global pricing, PCA, pipeline leads, HEOR SMEs, ITLs etc.).
Present recommendations to senior leaders across the organization designed to influence change that will enable Pfizer to thrive in a value-based healthcare market and lead the industry in innovative partnerships.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Candidate demonstrates a breadth of diverse leadership experiences and capabilities including: the ability to influence and collaborate with peers, develop and coach others, oversee and guide the work of other colleagues to achieve meaningful outcomes and create business impact.
Doctoral degree (PhD, DrPH, PharmD, ScD) or MSc/MPH in health economics, health services research, health policy, health care financing, public health or significant work experience in health economics, health services research, health policy, health care financing, public health, or market access is required.
Minimum of 10 years of experience in the pharmaceutical or payer industry, or minimum of 8 years with an advanced degree. 8+ years of relevant HEOR experience strongly desired.
Understands trends in healthcare and pharmaceuticals, aware of competitor strategies, knowledge of healthcare dynamics in the US and/or major global regions / markets, and a well-developed understanding of healthcare pricing, access, and reimbursement processes.
Ability to influence key stakeholders at senior levels of the organization (Global Presidents, Regional and Market Leaders, Department leaders, and Functional counterparts).
Demonstration of strong strategic thinking skills, as evidenced by the ability to identify alternative scenarios, resulting implications, and development of pragmatic recommendations for direction or action
Ability to understand and translate market and competitive dynamics into strategic implications for Pfizer's business.
Understanding of experimentation or pilot processes, with ability to demonstrate impact and drive rapid, fact-based decision making based on results
Ability to network and build partnerships/collaborations with external parties
Ability to work effectively in a matrix organization and lead with indirect authority
Strong presentation skills sufficient to address Global BU Leadership, and external audiences
Excellent written and oral communication skills with demonstrated ability to translate scientific and technical outcomes into meaningful business impact.
Other Job Details:
Last Date to Apply for Job: February 15th, 2021
Additional Location Information: New York, NY; Collegeville, PA; US - Remote; Walton Oaks, UK; Europe - Remote
#LI-PFE
Sunshine Act
Pfizer reports payments and other transfers of value to health care providers as required by federal and state transparency laws and implementing regulations. These laws and regulations require Pfizer to provide government agencies with information such as a health care provider’s name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. If you have questions regarding this matter, please do not hesitate to contact your Talent Acquisition representative.
EEO & Employment Eligibility
Pfizer is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Pfizer also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act and IRCA. Pfizer is an E-Verify employer.

About NolafriqueNolafrique is a cultural lifestyle brand that builds a bridge between Africa and the Global community. Our brand consist of a e-commerce artisan shop, a languge school, a travel company and a wholesale retail store.Our e-commerce store is an online boutique that sources 100% authentic clothing and accessories directly from the continent of Africa. Nolafrique specifically targets and continue to connect with local artist on the continent who lack access to a greater demand for their products outside of everyday tourist. Eighty percent of the merchants that we work with are women who travel to the inner city to sell their goods and then travel back to their villages. JobTitle: CIB Back Office Trade and Lending Specialist Consultant
Text:
We are looking for Consultants with an outstanding skills in banking operations and CIB knowledge for Back Office Trading and Lending operation´s lifecycle. Our team is developing solutions towards to improve efficiency and bottom-line results. We welcome talented candidates that celebrated the diversity in an Agile culture. With the maturity of managing successfully implementations and achieving both agility and efficiency that requires a managerial mindset, new structures, a shift in the nature of work, and continued adoption of tech and automation.

If this is your call, apply NOW!!

Location: Midtown Manhattan in NYC

Responsibilities:

Perform and review the daily operations of the Trade and Lending department in an efficient and effective manner
Responsible for ensuring the proper booking of transactions in operational systems.
Responsible for the aging and resolution of invoices.
Responsible for maintaining and tracking of volumes of transactions.
Responsible for preparing Management Activity reports including CIB cash Flow reports and other metrics as assigned
Responsible for Audit confirmations
Responsible for the efficient and accurate processing of Standby Letter of Credit aligned with the Uniform Customs and Practice for Documentary Credits (2007 Revision (UCP600) or International Standby Practices(ISP98) , as well as with the Bank Policy and Procedures
Perform and review reconciliations and related accounts
Examination of documents (SBLC and Commercial Letters of Credits)
Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements
Monitoring SBLCs’ with automatic extension clause (Evergreen LCs’) that needs an approval for extension of Expiry date, as well as confirmation from the clients
Review of SBLC Invoices. Monitoring receipt of funds and instructing back office on the application of funds received.

Specialized Knowledge:

Minimum 3 Years college degree in business or financial accounting
Work Experience: Minimum 3 - 6 Years
Banking operations experience with knowledge of SBLC and commercial letter of credit processing and Loans / lending activities (preferred).
Knowledge of Cash Management and customer service related experience (optional).
System Knowledge of SWIFT, Trade Innovation, LoanIQ and Equation

Other qualifications:

Knowledge MS Access, Excel and word.
Organized and detail oriented self-starter.
Knowledge of Financial Accounting and banking operations.
Knowledge of Standby Letter of Credits, uniform Customs and Practice for Documentary Credits (2007 Revision (UCP600) or international Standby Practices (ISP98) helpful but not required.
Knowledge of Responsible Standby Letter of Credit aligned and Uniform Customs and Practice for Documentary Credits (2007 Revision (UCP600) or International Standby Practices(ISP98)
Knowledge of Loans, bilateral and syndicated loan lending.
Ability to communicate (verbal and written).
Bi-lingual preferred (English/Spanish or Portuguese)
Rigorous attention to detail with a control oriented mindset
Strong organizational and analytical skills and ability to multi-task with minimal follow-up
Strong quantitative skills proficient in data management and production of management reports and executive summaries


Employment details:

Fulltime position

Salary: Upon candidate background plus competitive perks.

Travel: 60% of the time. Now with Covid19, remote work.

The selection process:

Case interview approach including tests to calibrate Tech skills and Management skills.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity /expression, national origin, disability, or any other characteristic. VACANCY ANNOUNCEMENT

POSITION: Program Coordinator
DEPARTMENT: Youth and Community Development Services
LOCATION: Marcus Garvey Apartments
REPORTS TO: Brooklyn Deputy Director
RATE: Part-Time, $20 hour / 25 hours a week
DATE: January 2021
SCHEDULE: School-Year: Monday-Friday, 1 p.m. - 6:00 p.m. or 12 p.m. – 5 p.m.
Summer: Monday-Friday, 8:00 a.m. - 6:00p.m.
JOB SUMMARY: Grand Street Settlement Program Coordinators are responsible for assisting in the overall development and implementation of the program. In addition, there is an expectation of high quality, innovative programming for our elementary participants.

EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND SKILL REQUIREMENTS:
Must have Bachelor’s Degree preferred or 3 years youth experience
Must have youth program management experience and working with a staff of 3 or more
Knowledge of working with inner city youth
High level of proficiency in administrative work
Capacity to thrive under pressure while working on multiple tasks and projects
Knowledge of the public education system and positive youth development best practices
Strong public speaking, writing and organizational skills
A team player with demonstrated commitment to working with urban youth and young adults from an asset-based perspective
A background in partnering with the Department of Education and local community based organizations to support programs
Have skills in experiential learning and group facilitation with youth
Must be an outstanding strategic thinker
Must be flexible, cooperative and willing to work in a team environment
Proficiency in Microsoft office suite
Proficiency in a variety of internet research and communication functions
Experienced in DYCD programming regulations and DYCD online
Must obtain NYC Dept. of Health fingerprint clearance and State Central Registry (SCR) clearance ($25 fee)
Must have NYS Food Handler’s Certificate
Must be CPR and Advanced First Aid Certified
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Designs program outcomes that reflect the three core components.
Assists in the overall management and operations of the elementary and summer camp programs.
Ensure that attendance is taken and documented.
Tracks attendance and rate of participation.
Collects and organizes records, attendance, and educational assessments.
Responsible for the enrollment/registration process for all program participants: registration form must have a medical form filled if participants are 13 & younger, ensure that forms must be filled completely and correctly
Recruits participants in order to ensure enrollment and registration targets are met.
Serve as task-supervisor for staff and ensure that they provide engaging activities to ensure that the academic component is met.
Facilitate live and pre-recorded activities
Use web based platforms to engage youth: zoom, google classrooms, etc.
Monitor participant engagement and safety while on live sessions remotely
Facilitate wellness checks/calls to families
Follow remote working plan, policies & procedures as highlighted by supervisor
Maintain remote/virtual attendance logs & records
Ensure any remote links, videos, content are age appropriate, clean and non-offensive to anyone's identity
Ensures that the goals and objectives of the program are met by the deadlines
Conducts periodic assessments and evaluations and assists in curricula and programmatic refinement (i.e. pre/post surveys/tests).
Have parent orientations and parent meetings
Attend trainings and meetings to bring needed resources to enhance program and support families.
Coordinates schedules and trips
Remains in regular contact with all local school’s faculty, staff, and participants’ parents
Maintains external partnerships with community based organizations in proximity of the center.
Develops educational materials and prepares and facilitates workshops in youth relevant topic areas
Ensures documentation and tracking as needed and submits required reports in a timely manner
Performs other programmatic/administrative duties as assigned
Attains two new partnerships that are in line with the core components and maximizes program outcomes.

HOW TO APPLY:
Submit a resume and thoughtful cover letter, outlining how your skills & experience meet the position you are applying for.
 Also, provide us with three professional references that we can contact (at least one should be from a former supervisor) with the subject header "Program Coordinator" to klopez@grandsettlement.org. No phone calls, please.
 *Please be advised that job offers can only be made once your clearances come through clear*
EOE

Our mission

In 2019, immigrants worldwide sent over $550 billion home to family and friends, dwarfing foreign governmental aid. In the age of cheap, quick transfers through services like Paypal and Venmo, these people are trekking to stores to pay fees averaging over 7% for transfers that typically take 24 hours or more.


Sendwave's mission is to change that by making sending money anywhere in the world easy and affordable. Since 2014, our app has allowed diaspora members from several African nations - and more recently Bangladesh and Sri Lanka, saving our users over 70% relative to Western Union and MoneyGram.


We are looking to rapidly expand around the world in the next year. That's where you come in...

How you'll help us achieve it

This role sits at the intersection of Product, Marketing, and Engineering. It's a new role for us, but one we are excited about!


In this role you'll take ownership for day-to-day operations and long-term roadmap of our growing set of growth-oriented CRM and analytics tools to increase conversion, retention and other key product metrics. Day-to-day you'll work with our Growth and Engagement engineering team, and the PM, PMM, and Designer on the teams to dig into data to understand patterns of behavior, user segments, our conversion funnel and retention metrics, launch new growth-oriented in-app experiments, iterate on messaging and onboarding flows, propose and evaluate new feature ideas and more. You'll work with the rest of the Product team to ensure that your roadmap is aligned with the overall goals of the company and product. You'll work with the Marketing team to ensure that your messaging is on point and you'll collaborate with our Market Launchers to help run market-specific experiments.


In your first few months, you'll

Get up-to-speed on our current set of growth/analytics tools and systems, our data model, our product roadmap. You'll need to quickly understand how our product works, capabilities we have, the nuances of how users onboard, how transactions are processed, delivered, and how throughout the entire process we provide support to our users. You'll want to spend time getting to know the engineering team, as well as our marketing team.

Requirements
You have multiple years of experience driving growth and performing growth-oriented analytics including user segmentation, conversion funnel analysis, engagement/retention analysis in the context of iOS and Android apps. You are able to follow up on your analyses with clear "so-whats": digging deeper, proposing and testing actions we can take with to improve the experience for our users and our growth metrics.
You know how to develop, clearly communicate and then drive implementation of a new experiments by prioritizing ruthlessly and making complex tradeoffs thoughtfully and collaboratively together with Engineering, Marketing, Operations and other stakeholders. You have experience with CRM tools such as Braze.
You have a strong technical background and broad set of analytics skills. You have experience with user/event analytic tools such as Heap. You are not afraid to learn or use new tools, write SQL, dig through tickets in Zendesk, fire up a Jupyter notebook, dig into some python code or do what ever else it takes for you to frame questions and get data quickly so you and your teams can better understand a problem and prioritize solutions.
You are excited about working remotely and have the skills and self discipline to do so effectively.
You have a willingness to travel four weeks / year to meet with your team and the rest of the company. In addition you would be excited to spend a couple of additional weeks a year traveling to collaborate in-person with our delivery partners worldwide.
You might be a good fit if you
Are a creative and flexible problem solver, and interested in finding the best solutions for our particular needs
Like getting in the weeds and making projects happen
Are excited about multiple kinds of work and want to help out where it's needed
Are comfortable defaulting to over-communication and overreaching when it comes to coordination.
Adjust quickly to changing priorities and conditions and cope effectively with complexity and change.
Bonus points if you
Have a background in engineering or other technical field
Have experience specifically with Heap and Braze
Key details
Location: Our company is 100% remote. You can be based anywhere in the the United States, Canada, United Kingdom, Germany, France, Belgium, Senegal, Ivory Coast, Nigeria, Ghana, and Kenya.
This is a permanent position and reports to the Head of Product
Major benefits:
Subsidized health insurance and retirement contribution matching (both vary from country-to-country)
26 weeks fully paid parental leave and subsidized fertility assistance
Unlimited vacation with a 20-day minimum requirement
$10,000 annual charitable donation matching
Our team
Our team of over 200 employees are fully distributed across the world— working from coffee shops, homes, and coworking spaces — making us one of the larger fully distributed growth-stage startups in the world.
We play in bands, teach dance classes, run Vipassana retreats, played semi-pro basketball, and built tools to help Doctors Without Borders respond to the Ebola crisis.
We collectively speak over twenty languages, including Akuapem, Amharic, Bengali, Ewe, Fante, Ga, Igbo, Kalenjin, Luganda, Oromo, Somali, Swahili and Wolof.
We're backed by world-class investors including Khosla Ventures, Founders Fund, Y Combinator and the cofounders of PayPal.

Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. If interested, please submit your resume & cover letter describing your interest in Sendwave below. Please also indicate the countries in which you have work authorization.


Confidence can sometimes hold us back from applying for a job. But we'll let you in on a secret: there's no such thing as a 'perfect' candidate. Sendwave is a place where everyone can thrive. So however you identify and whatever background you bring with you, please apply if this is a role that would make you excited to wake up everyday.

Hello potential future Oatly employee. It’s us, the original oatmilk company that started in Sweden back 25 or so years ago and has since expanded to the U.S. where we’ve continued growing at a rate such that we need more brilliant minds to come work with us to keep the momentum going and the oatmilk flowing.

Sustainability, health, and transparency are the core values that guide everything we do. Basically, we exist to make it easy for people to eat better and live healthier lives without recklessly taxing the planet’s resources in the process. If any of this resonates with you, then maybe you’d like work for Oatly, too. Now onto the formal stuff.

We are looking for a Manager Supply Chain Finance to join our team. This role will be responsible assisting financial closing, financial reporting, forecasting and analysis covering all supply chain activities such as freight, warehousing, standard costing as well as tracking capital program. This is an exciting opportunity to join Supply Chain Finance team while company is going through period of a rapid growth. Ideal candidate is a finance professional with experience working with supply chain, with knowledge of costing, inventory and logistics processes.
Here are the things we want to hire you to do:
Support monthly closing process with analyzing freight, warehousing and capital expenditures
Partner with supply chain to understand business drivers
Prepare monthly financial forecast and annual budget
Oversee standard cost preparation while analyzing for any changes vs plan
Lead development of dashboards for key supply chain KPIs, to monitor operational improvements vs latest forecast and plan
Understand order to invoice, procure to pay and inventory processes, and monitor key controls through BI, ERP reports or transactions
Partner with Global IT, Global Finance and Supply Chain tea,s to implement new processes or tools
Here are the things we think you need:
Degree in Accounting or Finance, MBA a plus!
4-7 years of experience in finance, including 3+ years of experience in supply chain finance, CPG industry experience preferred
Comfortable with ERP transactions to research root cause driving actual results
Strong knowledge and understanding of general accounting principles and cost accounting in areas of Factory costing, Contract Manufacturing, Logistics, Inventory and CAPEX
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills with attention to detail
Able to identify, take action and implement ideas that drivers continues improvement
Present concepts, recommendations, and analyses to senior management in a clear, concise and actionable manner
Able to manage competing priorities in a cross-functional environment
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Work independently with limited supervision. A Self-starter, with passion to take action while focusing on delivering results
Working knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics 365, Power BI and other dashboarding tools is a plus
And here’s another list of qualities we think make a good Oatly team member:
You feel connected to our mission of encouraging health, sustainability, and transparency
You are a self-starter who doesn’t need direct supervision to motivate you for success – we believe strongly in building a culture of individual accountability and ownership and need partners that can embrace that mentality
You are ready to make your mark in a smaller, growing brand leveraging your experience to deliver amazing results and build an outstanding company
You have entrepreneurial spirit in that you’re comfortable with ambiguity and are energized by the process of building something lasting from the ground up
You enjoy sharing your quirkiness and talents with your coworkers
Another bulleted list felt redundant, so we wrote this long sentence with all the ways we sweeten the deal to work with us, like providing flexible vacation for starters, really great benefits with 100% medical coverage, genuinely great coworkers who want to see the company and each other succeed, a start-up vibe with an established company history, and a fridge full of the best non-dairy alternative in the world for your enjoyment.

Oatly is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

The Prince George is located in the heart of the Flat Iron district of Midtown - Manhattan on 28th street. We are a part of a larger Non-Profit, Social Services agency called The Center for Urban Community Services (CUCS). We primarily offer housing for low income individuals as well as supportive housing to formerly homeless individuals who have suffered various forms of traumas in their past, generally leading to mental illnesses, and substance abuse.The Prince George has 415 units of supportive housing in one building with a staff of 24 dedicated on-site clinicians. We provide Evidence Based, Person Centered, Recovery oriented services to our clients in order to help them live as full and satisfying lives as possible. Company Description

At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission: Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.
We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.

The education team inspires cybersecurity professionals around the world. They drive awareness, in-depth understanding, and adoption through our customers. You motivate audiences around the world through our suite of products to promote the full adoption of our services to protect digital environments. It's a meaningful career path, one that requires constant learning and evolution.

Job Description

This is a remote-based position in the US. Location anywhere in the US.
Your Career
The Psychometric Manager is responsible for managing the integrity, validity and reliability of technical examinations as well as the overall health and security of all examinations. This is not limited to item performance, form equating, standard settings, beta exam releases and exam security plan and executions. This position ensures that the certification exams are industry leading and meet the highest quality standards.

The Psychometric manager works collaboratively with volunteers, external vendors and the test development team focusing on supporting the growth and evolvement of the Palo Alto Networks credentialing portfolio across the entire landscape of Palo Alto Networks technology.
You will be interacting across the enablement team and the psychometric Subject Matter Experts (SME) to maintain best-in-class credential programs across Enterprise and Cloud platforms.
Your Impact
Manage the integrity, validity and reliability of technical examinations as well as the overall health of all technical examinations but not limited to:
Designs and conducts job analysis studies, including surveys and focus groups, and develops exam specifications.
Designs and guides assembly of credentialing examinations to meet psychometric criteria for validity, reliability and fairness.
Performs standard setting studies and guides SME’s in the establishment of a passing standard (cut score).
Conducts statistical analysis of test items and assessments.
Designs and implements pre-administration and post-administration equating and linking designs to ensure measurement equivalence of alternate forms of examinations.
Design and develop performance-based assessments and examinations with alternative item types.
Managing exams form development, QA and publishing team.
Participating actively in the review of all draft test forms (Beta) for designated programs and rescoring.
Understand expectations, meet deadlines and deliver high quality performance
Create efficiencies in internal psychometric and security processes and initiatives.
Create reports and present outcomes and deliverables to colleagues and stakeholders, including technical and non-technical audiences.
Contributing to annual planning and goal-setting activities.
Work closely with testing and psychometric vendors.
Participates in industry testing conferences .
Other duties as assigned.
Approximately 25% travel.

Qualifications

Your Experience
Ph.D. in Educational Measurement, Quantitative Research Methods.
A minimum of 5 years of experience in IT test development and psychometric methods.
Psychometrics, advanced statistical methods, research methods, measurement theory, and test development.
Experience in providing credentialing and psychometrics technical guidance to non-technical audiences.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Proficiency with Google Suite statistical software (e.g., SPSS, SAS, or R).
Experience with IRT measurement models and applications (e.g., Winsteps, Parscale, BILOG) strongly preferred.
Experience with project management processes and applications strongly preferred.
Experience with NCCA and ISO-IEC 17024 accreditation standards.
#li-JM1
Additional Information

Our Commitment
We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.
We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.
Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
