Job Description :
Can be remote! HQ is located in New York
6 to 12 month Contract Assignment
News Corp is embarking on a journey of transformation. We are looking for an organization design transformation specialist whose primary focus is helping our HR and Functional Leaders identify and map out our operational model and its impact to people across our business units. The Organization design specialist will report into Global HR.
Location:
Flexible on location within North America. News Corp headquarters is located in New York, NY.
Job Responsibilities:
Support large scale change efforts in the areas of organization effectiveness, including organization diagnostics and transformation and organization design.
Analyze current state and future organization communication requirements to produce change management deliverables that drive stakeholders towards adoption and culture change.
Partner with HR Business Partners to see opportunities to conduct organization diagnosis, improve organizational effectiveness and provide consultation to appropriate parties including divisional leadership.
Apply leading edge frameworks, methods, practices and tools to improve enterprise organizational effectiveness.
Provide guidance on large scale projects and programs for News Corp’s divisions and regions that directly impact the effectiveness of the organization.
Support HRBPs and the business on change management challenges. Work with the business to develop an understanding of the critical processes for change, build commitment to those processes, and ensure that change occurs as intended.
Apply your track record for developing strong internal working relationships at a senior leadership level, and influence without formal direct authority.
Qualifications:
Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of training and experience. Advanced degree is preferred.
A minimum of five years progressive experience in one or more of the following specialties: organizational design and large-scale project transformation. Management consulting experience is a plus.
Understanding of organizational change models and ability to identify/recommend best fit given the specific situation.
At least five years of experience in organizational analysis and strategic planning
Excellent organizational and written communication skills; capability to clearly and succinctly define problems and outline solutions.
Experience in scoping and shaping project engagements.
Experience with organizational effectiveness engagements including diagnostics and transformation, design, and change management.
Experience in the development and implementation of initiatives from strategy through to execution.
Experience managing and working with teams across locations.
Experience working in a global organization preferred.
Excellent consultative, relationship management, influencing and facilitation skills.
Superb problem solving skills; logical and analytical thinker.
Strong executive presence.
Excellent oral and written communication skills, including the ability to organize and present information in a clear and concise way to a variety of audiences.
About News Corp:
News Corp is a global diversified media and information services company focused on creating and distributing authoritative and engaging content to consumers and businesses throughout the world. The company comprises businesses across a range of media, including: news and information services, book publishing, digital real estate services, cable network programming in Australia and pay-TV distribution in Australia.

Aura is hiring an E-Commerce Manager to lead, optimize, and operate our auraframes.com and Amazon storefronts.

You will join our growing commerce team in delivering great shopping experiences for a product that customers truly love. You'll collaborate with our marketing team to optimize conversion rates of new customers, while delighting families in the existing Aura network who buy frames for more family members each year. With support from commerce team design and engineering, you'll architect and analyze A/B tests and longitudinal analytics to optimize our customers' journey.
Responsibilities:

Lead auraframes.com and Amazon optimization
Facilitate further international expansion
Own E-Commerce operations across our Shopify and Amazon platforms
Work with commerce engineers to automate, analyze, and forecast all aspects of E-Commerce from product listings to promotions, inventory, and fulfillment
Optimize order value and attachment of bundles/upsells at checkout
Collaborate with our marketing team to reduce CPA by optimizing conversion at the bottom of the funnel
Collaborate with our customer experience team to monitor and respond to pre and post-purchase questions, feedback, and order support requests

An ideally qualified candidate will have many or all of the following:

Customer focused and results-oriented
Solid analytical skills
Ready to work at a small startup in a fast-paced environment
Experience either in-house or at an agency owning Amazon and D2C storefronts for a consumer brand
Deep experience with Amazon optimization and operations
Must have strong strategic capabilities as well as ability to be hands-on and detail-oriented to manage tactical execution

Talent Acquisition Manager
Overview
Job ID: 16401
Country: United States of America
Location: New York
Job Type: Employee
Employment Type: Full-Time
Functional Area: Operations

Job Description
Job Description Summary
Who Are We?
We are AMS. AMS is a global total workforce solutions firm founded in 1996. We enable organizations to thrive in an age of constant change by building, reshaping, and optimizing workforces. We do this through talent acquisition and contingent workforce management, internal mobility and skills development, and talent and technology advisory services. Our solutions are delivered by our 4500+ experts who live our passionate, bold, and authentic values. The ultimate aim is to help clients around the world, including 100+ blue-chip companies, create workforces that are fluid, resilient, diverse, and differentiated. We call this true workforce dexterity—and we’re here to help you achieve it.
Role Summary:
As a Talent Acquisition Manager, your role will be leading the delivery of a large-scale model opportunity within one of our current Tier 1 Investment Banking clients.
You’ll take full responsibility for delivery and development of the on-site effectiveness of your entire team. That means overseeing a number of resourcing managers or team leaders, each with their own group of recruiters to manage. At the same time, you’ll handle client relationships at senior level and actively promote options for service improvement.
Based on site in New York city, the Talent Acquisition Manager will be responsible for a complex large-scale onsite and offshore delivery model.
What you will do:
Principal Accountabilities:
Take responsibility for the account development of targets, budgets and SLAs
Lead and monitor the teams’ delivery of the best practice operating model for the account
Drive account management to ensure customer satisfaction at all times, through accurate data and MI
Liaise with senior contacts within the client to develop and maintain business plans
Share responsibility for P&L
Identify process improvements through regular reviews and feedback with business stakeholders and campus management teams
Committed to the development of campus recruitment specialists
Day to day responsibility for service delivery, operational performance and management of issues and query resolution
Responsible for ensuring the team achieve all of our contracted responsibilities
Responsible for delivery of cost savings initiatives or special projects
Position Requirements
What we need from you:
Proven track-record managing a Recruitment team ideally within Financial Service
Experience of presenting to senior client stakeholders (eg., resourcing managers) and gained agreement to course of action
Experience of developing and delivering recruitment strategies and processes to improve outcomes (i.e. decreased time to hire, increased quality of hire)
Experience working to tight deadlines in a fast-moving environment
Ability to liaise with and influence all levels of management to agree a change of direction or new process
Undertaken senior recruitment or search functions at an agency or in-house recruitment center and placed executives or senior staff
Experience in optimizing and leading other in the use of in-house recruitment technology and use of reporting functionality
Experience working to and achieving demanding targets, ratios and SLAs and working to tight deadlines in a fast-moving environment
Experienced at producing business orientated management information and interpreting this to draw conclusions / make recommendations
Market intelligence and knowledge of global and subject matter expertise of local recruitment practices and employment market trends
Degree caliber or commensurate experience
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

JobTitle: Account Manager - Water Treatment - New York City
Text:
Overview:

We are hiring for a Chemical and Equipment Water Treatment Technical Sales Representative located in New York City.

You will be primarily responsible for revenue and profit growth of our programs, services and products in targeted accounts within your assigned region. You will be required to take a consultative sales approach with a strong emphasis on converting strategic competitive accounts. In addition, you will be required to build long-term relationships with an existing customer base by understanding their key business drivers, executing programs, and selling new technologies.

Territory/Location Information: This position is based out of a home office and will cover the New York City area
Responsibilities:

Maintain existing customer base in accordance with current service level agreements.
Work with management team to establish selling strategies and tactics which result in new account business generation.
Execute sales goals in assigned competitively-held accounts.
Provide technical support to customers; identifying and resolving customer complaints, escalating as required.
Analyze perspective customer needs and meet those needs via proposals, negotiations and business contracts.
Qualifications:
Technical Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience
5+ years of successful technical sales or outside sales experience
Prefer water treatment or specialty chemical industry experience
Prefer working knowledge of boilers, cooling towers, and wastewater treatment systems
Professional history of meeting goals and overcoming obstacles Prior experience that required excellent communication skills
Prior experience that required excellent organizational skills
Prior experience that demonstrates a strong work ethic
Must have a valid Driver's License and acceptable Motor Vehicle Record
No immigration sponsorship offered for this role
The qualified candidate will be subjected to pre-employment background check and drug screen

Leadership position for a non-profit-focused start up agency.
We’re seeking an account director to lead a group of high-profile cause/non-profit clients. As one of the first hires of the agency, this is a unique opportunity to influence and direct the growth of an organization built to power change. Our goal is to build a diverse team of individuals who bring a range of experiences and passions to this work.
Our office is located in midtown Manhattan, but we are open to remote candidates who are easily able to attend periodic in-person meetings (no earlier than spring 2021) in the Northeast Corridor (primarily NYC and Washington DC).

What You’ll Do:
In this role, you’ll be the strategic driver of accounts. You will build relationships with clients that evolve into deep partnerships. You will understand the client’s business, challenges, and opportunities. You will also understand the agency’s business, challenges, and opportunities. Ultimately, you will grow the client relationship and oversee our services to ensure the delivery of quality work in an efficient and profitable manner.

Day-to-day responsibilities include:
Oversee
Drive strategic direction in close collaboration with agency experts to craft holistic solutions to client problems related to messaging/creative, media strategy and technology.
Manage budgets to ensure the client’s dollars are used responsibly and agency resources are used efficiently.
Lead
Drive the cross-discipline client team ensuring the group is effectively and efficiently achieving client goals.
Serve as a cheerleader for the client - maintaining excitement both on the client side and internally.
Stay on top of industry trends and news and be an active participant by attending conferences, seeking speaking engagements (with agency support) and publishing thought pieces.
Build
Nurture strong client relationships built on trust and substance - proactively seeking opportunities to align the agency’s strengths to the client’s needs.
Grow and develop 2-3 direct reports.
Who You Are:
Passionate about non-profit organizations and mission-based brands
At least 6-10 years of experience working at an agency on cause/non-profit focused clients
Agency experience preferred but client-side will be considered
Strong communicator with expert presentation skills and public speaking experience
Digitally focused with a strong knowledge of digital media and analytics
Experience managing a client team as well as directly managing staff
Expert knowledge and hands-on experience developing campaigns that span the entire supporter journey from awareness to advocacy to fundraising and through ongoing support
Demonstrated experience to identify and cultivate new business opportunities
Comfortable navigating the ambiguity of a startup environment

Who We Are:
Our mission is to power change.
We harness the power of digital technology to build community and transform organizations for a digital world.
We are a startup that is backed by an established agency with over 20 years in business.
We believe in kindness, discourse and imagination.
Our clients are high-profile non-profits, and we’re seeking to grow by working with any organization that is looking to change the world for the better.
Our goal is to build a diverse team of individuals who bring a range of experiences and passions to this work.

Text:
Position Overview
Eyeota seeks a talented and resourceful Agency Sales Executive to join our rapidly growing Programmatic Audience Data business in the US. We are looking for someone who is interested in the world of Programmatic Advertising and Big Data, along with continuing to grow and sharpen their sales skills. The goal of this position is to nurture existing accounts and build revenue. Successful candidates will have solid written and verbal communication skills and be proactive team players that embody the entrepreneurial spirit of Eyeota.
Your primary focus will be on expanding existing accounts within agency relationships and supporting the overall global sales team. This position will work closely with both sales and marketing, as the two functions are closely aligned. Employees at Eyeota have opportunity for career growth and embody a sense of pride to work for an amazing company that has shown incredible success over the years.
What Will You Do?
Stay on top of industry and market trends to understand the advertising ecosystem and the market factors that drive decision making.
Work closely with sales leaders to define opportunities and focus on growing existing accounts.
Identify buying trends and key prospects.
Analyze various data points, such as client level data, agency data and brand account activity, to make informed recommendations and decisions.
Work with the audience specialist team to prepare recommendations and key insights for clients.
Identify new business opportunities ( new advertisers and agencies) that may be interested in accessing Eyeota data, through research, attending industry events and other relevant meetings.
Collaborate and consult with clients as needed, including: helping to prepare QBRs, building presentations for meetings, and assisting in research.
Work collaboratively with sales, operations, product, and marketing teams globally to ensure we are meeting client and agency needs in a unified and timely manner.
Evangelize Eyeota’s message, products and best practices to our customers and our industry.
Work with sales and marketing to identify opportunities to develop relevant case studies of successful campaigns in effort to share insights, successes and best practices with customers.
Who Are You?
2+ yrs Sales/Account Management Audience Data Experience.
BA degree or equivalent practical experience.
Proficient with MS Office, strong technical aptitude.
Problem solver, self starter.
Able to coordinate across multiple departments internally and externally.
Able to work within a complex ecosystem and deal with ambiguity.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Exceptional organizational and analytical skills.
Self-motivated.
High standards of professionalism.
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to develop solid working relationships.
Interest in understanding media agency business models, online media business, audience targeting, programmatic buying and real-time bidding.
Desire to grow into a larger role within the organization.
Comfortable working across multiple time zones. In the future, there may be in person travel required.
Comfortable working from home / in a remote working environment.
Benefits
People. Work with diverse, talented, collaborative, and friendly people who love what they do.
Fun. We’ve gotten creative with our social events and host a variety of options on a regular basis to ensure engagement across the company.
Work/Life Harmony.
Medical and savings options.
Equity. Be a stakeholder in our future.

About Eyeota
Eyeota empowers brands with the solutions they need to confidently identify, reach, and engage their best audiences. By combining privacy-safe and qualified technologies with data expertise, we help businesses to understand the potential of their data assets to transform their marketing initiatives, customer programs, and business revenues. We are a trusted global partner to our customers providing data onboarding, first-party data enrichment, identity resolution and audience engagement solutions that help to connect consumers with the right brands and products in omnichannel environments.
Eyeota provides a fast-paced, dynamic and fun workplace filled with curious, inventive and problem-solving individuals. We have a truly global footprint, with our headquarters in Singapore and offices in Australia, Germany, the United States, United Kingdom and India. We are committed to investing in our people, products and infrastructure to deliver diverse, cutting-edge data solutions that remain flexible and addressable for our customers.

Eyeota is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Kognito (www.kognito.com) is a health simulation company based in NYC. We develop role-play simulations where users engage in conversations with virtual humans and learn how to lead similar conversations in real-life that result in improved social, emotional, and physical health. We work with more than 300 health, education, and gov’t organizations in and outside of the U.S. To date, more than 1 million people have completed a Kognito simulation. Our team of 80+ people includes learning scientists, psychologists, software engineers, graphic artists, writers, and operation specialists.

Kognito is a unit of Ascend Learning; LLC (www.ascendlearning.com). Ascend Learning is a national leader in data driven, online educational solutions for learners, educators and employers in high-growth, licensure-driven professions spanning healthcare, fitness and wellness, skilled trades, insurance and financial services. We are passionate about accelerating learning while impacting job readiness, employment success and employee retention with the belief that our work changes lives.

Our culture is intentionally results-driven and selfless with a relentless focus on our customers. We believe in trust, transparency, freedom and responsibility with a commitment to meritocracy, inclusion and diversity of thought. Continual investment in our over 1400 employees is also a core principal realized through ongoing professional development and providing opportunities to grow, develop and lead. Ascend Learning is headquartered in Burlington, MA with additional office locations and remote workers in cities across the U.S. and in the U.K.

JobTitle: Channel Account Manager - North East US
Text:
Imagicle designs and develops software applications that complete the Unified Communications & Collaboration solutions of the most important vendors in the world, such as Cisco, Microsoft and Avaya.


While we focus on developing excellent solutions, our channel partners support our clients who need help with the services related to the integration of our UC Suite in their environments. That’s why we develop long term relationships with them, providing continuous innovation and a team of professionals, who also like the informality, spontaneity and never tired of helping them. So we all win. First of all our customers.


It 's magical time to start working in Imagicle. We celebrated 11 years history with excellent financial results, a double-digit growth in recent years and even better outlook for the next years.

We opened the US subsidiary in Miami in July 2017 to focus and grow in the North and Central America market; with an active set of channel partners and customers already working with us and new terrific opportunities we want to address the fastest and smartest possible.


That's why we want to expand our team for sales, services and technical support.

Today we are looking for a passionate of Sales to join our Channel Sales Team with the chance to work from home. The Imagicle Sales team is a critical part of our future success, and we are looking for absolutely and only the best people out there.


Are you up for the challenge? So Imagicle is the right place for you!


What you will do in Imagicle

Identifying, developing and expanding Imagicle Sales Channel. Develop and maintain deep and productive relationships with partners, distributors and resellers.
Sourcing new sales opportunities through inbound lead follow-up and outbound calls, emails and web tools
Understanding customer needs and requirements
Performing effective online demos to partners, reseller and vendors
Helping partners to make quotations and proposals
Performing online/live presentations and sales training to partners and customers
Closing sales and achieving quarterly quotas


Required skills

4 years of sales experience in the UC/ICT Market
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.
Self-starting with a strong work ethic and ability to work both autonomously and in a multinational team
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
Strong listening and presentation skills
Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively
Excellent relationship building skills


What we offer:

Base Salary
Incentive plan (paid every three months) up to 50% of the base salary
Full benefits (Health, Vision, Dental) effective day one covered at 100%
10 vacation days, 10 National Holidays days, 5 personal/sick days
Flexible PTO plan


What you will find

An informal environment, where you live in harmony and where we count on you to make it better, because "It's always a matter of happy people"
Working with outstanding colleagues, competent and always ready to give a hand
Innovative working Cloud tools, to collaborate everywhere
The search for a continuous improvement of working methods
Opportunities that accompany a high growth organization
Long-term commitment


You are required to operate during the United States working week.

You will be part of Imagicle Inc.


Do you enjoy selling? Are you a passionate for happy customers? Do you believe in performance rewards for exceeding your sales goals? Apply today to work with us!


Imagicle takes care of people regardless of their national origin, race, sex, religion, etc. We love diversity and inclusion and every applicant will receive the same consideration for the position.

Transfix, named to Forbes’ “Next Billion-Dollar Startups” list, is the leading transportation solutions provider whose digital brokerage marketplace and logistics software offerings are helping transform the $800 billion trucking industry. Since its founding in 2013, Transfix has been driven by a mission to deliver simple, smart, and sustainable solutions for shippers and carriers, powered by people and technology.
By combining deep industry expertise and a best in class carrier network with cutting-edge technology, Transfix is reimagining the world of transportation. Fortune 500 companies such as Staples, Unilever, Target and Wayfair rely on Transfix to handle their most important FTL freight needs. With instant pricing, algorithmic matching, superior service, and unmatched intelligence, Transfix is optimizing the supply chain from start to finish. Come leave a positive impact on the environment as we help reduce the carbon footprint caused by the 65 billion wasted miles on the road.
The problems we solve everyday are real and require creativity, grit, and determination. Recognized as one of Built In’s Best Places to Work 2021, Transfix is building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. We’re hiring team members who are passionate and are energized by the vision to simplify and transform one of the largest and most complex industries through technology, data and a strong commitment to customers.
If you’re excited about transforming an industry, being part of an innovative culture, and making a positive impact on the environment, send us your resume.
What You'll Do:
Search for new companies that will benefit from leveraging our TrueView TMS technology
Build a robust pipeline of engaged, qualified prospects that understand our value by developing a keen sense of their pain points and current state work flow with curiosity for how our clients manage their supply chain.
Develop a mastery of our proprietary platform and offerings - have a strong ability to demonstrate the benefits and abilities of both.
Close deals through their entirety, with minimal assistance required
Ensure wildly successful transition with new clients to partnering orgs
Understand and support the policies and procedures of Transfix
About You:
5+ years of Enterprise Sales experience
3+ years experience selling Transportation services with demonstrable track record of excellence, preferably SaaS related
You have worked with SMB, MM, and Enterprise companies
You are an outside the box thinker and possess a highly competitive nature
A passion for problem solving and are comfortable with ambiguity
You hustle and always want to go the extra mile. You are driven by numbers and aren’t afraid of aggressive goals.
Team player with a burning desire to consistently win clients from competitors
You have a history of establishing powerful, long lasting relationships with key decision makers across all levels of organizations
Strong written and verbal communication skills
You have a Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent work exp.)
To all recruitment agencies: Transfix does not accept unsolicited agency resumes and will not be held responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Company Overview:

Riverbed enables organizations to maximize performance and visibility for networks and applications, so they can overcome complexity and fully capitalize on their digital and cloud investments. The Riverbed Network and Application Performance Platform enables organizations to visualize, optimize, remediate and accelerate the performance of any network for any application. The platform addresses performance and visibility holistically with best-in-class WAN optimization, network performance management (NPM), application acceleration (including Office 365, SaaS, client and cloud acceleration), and enterprise-grade SD-WAN. Riverbed’s 30,000+ customers include 99% of the Fortune 100.
About this Position:

Title: Enterprise Sales Executive
Location: remote office - New York Metro, Connecticut, New Jersey

Who we are:
Riverbed is a place where hundreds of different personalities have the same customer obsession. We seek builders from all backgrounds to join Riverbed and encourage employees to use their voices and chart their career paths. We are looking for talented sales-driven professionals to be a part of an organization driving Riverbed's advanced technologies in today's hyper-growth digital world.

Do you have the business savvy to work with a cross-functional team that includes, Solution Engineers, and Product and Partner/Channel teams to deliver business growth for our customers? Riverbed is seeking an experienced Strategic Sales Executive to lead and expand our growing business with current and future customers.

The Opportunity:
The Enterprise Sales Executive is responsible for selling at the most senior level (C-level) within larger accounts and implementing a broad strategy for earning customer acceptance and implementation. The Strategic Sales Executive works collaboratively with all appropriate Riverbed resources (Executives, partners, support, and solution engineers) to support customer interests. They will also understand how to advocate for customers and balance that advocacy with Riverbed's business needs. This includes dotted-line responsibility for partnership and technical collaboration.

Responsibilities include but not limited to:
Owning account relationships and driving overall customer successDeveloping relationships and alignment at multiple levels – C level executive sponsors, influencers, and decision makersMaximizing sales into enterprise accounts and being part of the customers’ overall business solutionParticipating in cross sell and up sell opportunities. Penetrating additional buyers within the accounts, identifying their needs and then configuring an appropriate offering from our portfolio to meet those needsLeading large scale enterprise agreements to close large-scale, multi-year subscription-based dealsPreparing accurate forecasts, building a funnel to cover bookings target, documenting activities in Salesforce, and performing other tasks necessary to drive revenue and communicate activities to sales managementUsing disciplined account planning to maintain client relationships, enhance customer satisfaction, and increase account penetrationLeading a complex sales cycle; orchestrating and leveraging additional resources – i.e. partners, inside sales, Solutions (Presales) Engineers, Sales Management, and Executive Leadership – when needed

Requirements:
The candidate must meet the following requirements:
Minimum of seven years of quota-carrying sales experience, as the lead account owner of an enterprise customer, at a technology companyA strong understanding of technology, (Cloud/SaaS/On-demand/on premise), network performance management/visibility, application acceleration, software-defined WAN, and WAN optimizationHigh emotional intelligence and expertise in influencing technology decisions in collaboration with othersAble to establish credibility with C-level executivesExtensive complex deal negotiations with a successful track recordExperience with channel alignment and partner sales modelsClosing new, multi-year and subscription-based SaaS dealsTrack record of driving results faster with a sense of urgencyDemonstrated ability to understand how to run business and growth model (including, but not limited to, account territory management, P&L ownership, business planning and pipelining)Cultivating relationships with a strategic customer base and advising on industry insights, best practices, and strategyBA or BS degree preferred

About Riverbed:

Riverbed offers a rewarding experience of working with the best minds in the industry, delivering exceptional network performance and visibility for any application. We are proud of our great culture that continuously fosters innovation, collaboration, and diverse work environments. We remain committed to attracting, developing, and retaining the most diverse group of talent to better serve our customers.

Riverbed is an equal employment opportunity/Affirmative Action (EEO/AA) employer and provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, physical disability (including HIV and AIDS), mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy or child birth (including breast feeding), sexual orientation, genetics, genetic information, marital status, veteran status or any other basis protected by and in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.

Check us out on:
www.riverbed.com
@LifeAtRiverbedLI-ER1

We’re hiring an Account Executive with successful experience selling to large retailers.

In this role, you’ll build strong, trusting, long-lasting professional relationships with key stakeholders at the largest retailers in the world.

To thrive in this role, you’ll be exceptionally intelligent, trustworthy, reliable, resourceful, have an energetic, positive attitude and be willing to work hard.

This is a full-time position in New York, Austin, Los Angeles or Remote (US or Canada only). Travel, typically within the US, will be required.

ROLE


Generate awareness, educate and build interest in Granify at the largest retailers in the world.
Build and maintain strong, trusting, long-lasting relationships with key stakeholders at these retailers.
Stay up to date on each of your stakeholders' businesses and objectives so you’re able to identify opportunities for us to help them now and in the future.
Stay up to date on our product and how it will evolve in the future so you’re able to determine opportunities for your stakeholders to utilize Granify to achieve their business objectives.
Leverage the strong, trusting relationships you’ve built and the fantastic results your clients see using Granify to generate referrals for new business.


ABOUT YOU


3 years experience selling to enterprise retailers
Proven ability to create and grow trusting, lasting professional relationships with key stakeholders at large enterprise clients
Naturally consultative with exceptional ability to teach complex concepts in a simple way
Exceptional problem solver
Exceptional presentation skills
Excellent time management skills
Energetic and positive
Extremely driven and hard working
Balance your high intelligence with a high level of humility
Unafraid of taking on new responsibilities
Strong professional written and verbal communication
Have a take control and get things done mindset, and activity that reflects such
Familiar with foundational online marketing practices in SEO, Paid Search, Affiliate, Display Advertising, Email Marketing, Conversion Optimization, A/B Testing
Bachelor’s degree in business, commerce, marketing, computer science, engineering or equivalent experience


ABOUT GRANIFY

With our unique culture and How We Work at Granify framework, you’ll develop core skills that will change how you work, how you think and how you live for the rest of your life. We have a clear system in place to help you grow as a person and as a professional and we take it very seriously.


You’ll work closely with an incredible group of the smartest, most interesting, genuinely good people around. You’ll work hard, learn quickly, and have plenty of excitement. You’ll also get a first hand view into the rapidly evolving, exciting intersection of e-commerce, machine intelligence and psychology.

Did you know? Granify is backed by early investors in Facebook, SpaceX, Tesla, Uber, Twitter, Airbnb, Paypal, Pinterest, Palantir and Yelp. Wouldn’t it have been great to get in at one of those companies as they were taking off...

Open to considering remote candidates in the US and Canada.
Interested in helping us change the world of finance and payments forever? The Stellar Development Foundation (SDF) is looking for a talented and experienced Business Development Manager to join our team. In this role, you'll be engaging directly with global fintech companies and financial institutions as a primary point of contact for the SDF. You’ll be providing support on helping them understand the Stellar network, how they can serve as an on and off ramp to the network, and make use of it to offer financial services to their customer base. Most importantly, you will be growing the world of blockchain and supporting SDF’s mission of creating equitable access to the global financial system.
You Will:
Source, qualify, and close large transformational partnerships for cross border payments and access to financial services.
Serve as an internal leader to drive initiatives and advocate for these partners.
Work with the grants, community and marketing teams to support the launch and execution of new programs and initiatives for engaging with our global partners
Propose new ways in which the Foundation can provide systemic support and opportunities for this ecosystem and their clients.
Be a thought leader and spokesperson for the Stellar network to key stakeholders and constituents
Set geographical priorities based on local activities, opportunities and regulations.
Qualifications:
You have 3+ years of experience working in business development and / or growing a business as a founder, especially in highly technical industries.
You have a deep understanding and experience in closing large complex enterprise-scale deals in the finance and/or fintech space internationally, ideally in emerging markets.
You’re willing to travel 25% of the time (of course, once it is safe to do so).
You have significant experience working with internal and external stakeholders within this ecosystem and/or in a reseller capacity to execute projects and/or business negotiations.
You thrive in an environment where you’re an active participant in cross-functional projects
You don’t shy away from doing the hard thing. You love doing the hard thing.
You see projects through and over communicate outcomes.
You’re an exceptional writer and have excellent verbal communication skills.
You have a strong interest in cryptocurrency, blockchain, financial inclusion, and the Stellar network.
You thrive in a collaborative team environment with multiple stakeholders while having a high degree of accountability and autonomy.
You're flexible and comfortable working in a fast paced and dynamic environment.
You have an engineering background and/or a strong technical grasp of blockchain technology
You're curious and tenacious, with an infectiously positive attitude and an unwavering commitment to being successful.
Bonus points if:
You’ve lived or worked abroad at some point in your career
You can speak more than one language fluently
About Stellar
Stellar is a decentralized, fast, scalable, and uniquely sustainable network for financial products and services. It is both a cross-currency transaction system and a platform for digital asset issuance, designed to connect the world’s financial infrastructure. Dozens of financial institutions worldwide issue assets and settle payments on the Stellar network, which has grown to over 4 million accounts.
About the Stellar Development Foundation
The Stellar Development Foundation (SDF) is a non-profit organization that supports the development and growth of Stellar, an open-source network that connects the world’s financial infrastructure. Founded in 2014, the Foundation helps maintain Stellar’s codebase, supports the technical and business communities building on the network, and serves as a voice to regulators and institutions. The Foundation seeks to create equitable access to the global financial system, using the Stellar network to unlock the world’s economic potential through blockchain technology.

Text: Job DescriptionDo you want to work for a company that provides flexible schedules, residual incomes, freedom to work how you want, a generous compensation package for your efforts, and the ability to control virtually every aspect of your daily routine? Jolie Musique is a digital music conservatory that is seeking to hire several new Business Development agents to help us grow!As a Business Development specialist for Jolie Musique, you can expect:Instant payouts: When we get paid – so do you!Weekly Gift Card Contests:  If you can sell, you can qualify for weekly prizes of $25, $50, or $100 Gift Cards to add an awesome and fun boost to your earnings!High-Volume Sales, In-Demand Service:  Jolie Musique offers high-quality service with some of the nation’s best teachers, a great price point, and an ideal selling environment with limited competition from non-sales oriented competitors.Easy Referrals:  More than half of our business comes from referrals from existing clients. You'll find growing business from existing clients is easy and lucrative.Serious compensation: Three deals per week = $77k/yr. Four a week = about $105k for your first year. If you’re prepared to do the work, the money will be there.Residual Earnings:  When students sign up for more lessons, you continue to earn as long as they remain with the school (likely for years), which will boost your pay 10-15% annually.Total Control over your schedule:  We don't treat our team like children or factory workers. You want to make money, right? So you'll work the schedule that works for you. Work part-time or full-time. Earn as much as you want.NO COLD CALLING. With our simple-yet-effective marketing strategy, you will only be selling to people who are actively looking for our service!100% Remote:  Work from anywhere.Support for New Reps:  We provide instruction, tips, insights, and genuine help so you can grow as we grow. After all, when you succeed, so do we! Our development modules are highly effective at relating critical concepts, without forcing you to sit through hours of trainings and videos and quizzes. We distill years of experience and training in sales, marketing, and music lesson knowledge into a few easy modules to listen to and watch.REQUIREMENTS: - Bachelor’s degree in music business, business, communications, or similar preferred.- Must be highly motivated and comfortable seeking new leads. You are well-paid for this skill!- 2-3 years of digital or phone-based sales experience.- Personal background in music or familiarity with taking music lessons highly valued.- 1+ years of social media marketing required.- 2 years of experience building a referral pipeline.- Excellent written/verbal communication skills a essential. Much of this work is Instant Messaging, sending texts, and Email.- Minimum of 1 year of experience with Excel & Salesforce CRM(or a similar) a must. You should be comfortable making notes on each client interaction or piece of marketing used.- 1+ years of customer service or similar experience a plus.- Deep understanding of the use of various social media platforms.- Happy to work with customers in off-hours on occasion. May need to address customer questions/bookings at odd hours sometimes.- Organized. Self-starters who enjoy working under minimal supervision will do very well here.- Must have a computer and cell. We'll provide software, company email, etc.- The person who succeeds best in this position is one who enjoys building relationships with people, who loves making others happy, and knows that no one sale is worth more than a relationship that leads to many others!ADDITIONAL INFORMATION (For those who want it!)About Jolie Musique School of the Arts: Formed in 2017 as a local in-home music school in Monmouth County NJ, we have responded boldly to the recent impact current events have had on our business. We did so by adopting a new business model, which capitalizes not just on the current needs of students around the country, but a growing trend over the last decade in demand for online education. Our new model has helped our business explode in growth - even in the midst of everything that's going on. This means we need new agents and team players who are eager and excited to help people learn - and make great money doing it!Our team will have access to a unique system and environment in which to sell, and an incredible opportunity to profit in a territory with abundant clients and almost non-existent competition.Our values are such that we want to do right by our agents. We want to help you learn the work, and are generous in making sure we all succeed together. Weekly meetings and other company events will be made available for those who want to continue to learn and be a part of the team.We also believe in giving back, which is why we donate a portion of our annual earnings to charitable causes such as scholarships for students, environmental concerns, and other issues we value. In a world of high-competition sales, Jolie Musique provides a warmer, friendlier culture of consultative sales, no competing with your co-workers, and territories that are large enough for you to grow as much as you want.If this sounds like the job for you, let us know. Betterment for Business is an award winning 401(k) solution that works as hard for your money as you work to earn it. We are seeking a motivated Sales Development Representative (Outbound) to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for generating outbound interest from a list of prospects, helping set our sales team up for success. You are an early stage professional who is interested in learning more about sales and is passionate about financial wellness and employee benefits. This position will be a key element of the sales process and supports the future growth of our business.

This role is remote eligible. We are hiring in all states except CO.

A Day in the Life:
Prospect a list of companies through email, phone, and LinkedIn
Overcome objections to convince employers to evaluate a Betterment 401(k)
Collaborate with sales team members
Effective use of internal sales tools- Intercom, Outreach, and Salesforce
What We're Looking For:
A collaborative professional who has some experience in a customer facing role
A team member who is curious about the retirement and financial wellness space with a desire to learn about how B2B Sales is organized
A motivated worker who can prioritize their time effectively
An effective communicator who can be persuasive and persistent
Familiarity with Salesforce is a plus
What Being at Betterment Means for You:

Joining Betterment means joining a community of folks passionate about change, being on a team that cares for your health and well-being, and being on a journey of non-stop growth and evolution.

You’ll join a Community:
Betterment is a place to bring your best self. We welcome families (and pets) for all our activities such as lunches, company retreats, and celebrations.
Make meaningful connections with your peers through interest groups, sports clubs, social events, meetups, and regular knowledge sharing.

You’ll stay Happy and Healthy:
Regardless of where you are, we will ensure you're well set up and cared for, through gym reimbursements, a customizable workstation, enrollment in our 401(k) service, flexible parental leave, and a whole suite of thoughtful benefits.
You’ll have unlimited paid personal and vacation days, and a team that cares about your whole life, not just what you’re working on.
You’ll Learn & Grow:
Enhance your skills and abilities through Betterment University courses and additional spending for outside learning.
Contribute to our knowledge and transparent workspace through mentoring and career coaching programs, weekly company meetings, and show & tells.

Please note that Betterment is dedicated to providing accommodations to candidates with disabilities. If you need accommodations at any point throughout the interview process, please reach out to interview.accommodations@betterment.com
About Betterment

Betterment is the largest independent online financial advisor with more than $22 billion in assets under management. The service is designed to help increase customers’ long-term returns and lower taxes for retirement planning, building wealth, and other financial goals. Betterment takes advanced investment strategies and uses technology to deliver them to more than 500,000 customers across its three business lines: direct-to-consumer, Betterment for Advisors, and Betterment for Business. Title: Account Manager

Location: New York City (Remote)

Reporting into: Director, Customer Success

Are you excited by the idea of growing a book of business and solving complex problems? Are you passionate about building relationships and using world-class journalism to help brands reach their audiences? Then keep reading!

The Account Strategist/Manager is responsible for the editorial and commercial success of Contently's customers. This role works in alignment with the Sales, Services, and Product teams to maintain and expand relationships across client organizations with a particular focus on new lines of business expansion. Through managing stakeholders, day to day activities, the overall business relationship, and revenue growth of assigned accounts, this role directly shapes and influences the content that some of the largest companies in the world publish. The Account Strategist/Manager works directly with the customer and Contently's Managing Editors to bring content to life while meeting outlined objectives and targets.

In many ways, the Customer Success team, of which the Account Strategist/Manager is a part of, is the heart of Contently. We grow customer relationships, advise on business and content decisions, spearhead solutions for our partners, and collaborate with all internal teams to reach the best possible outcome. We are a small and mighty team that is looking for a customer-obsessed individual who is flexible, is motivated by revenue growth, champions a growth-mindset, and above all has the willingness to learn at every turn.

We are suckers for superior writing skills and a friendly, considerate, and value-driven communication style. As a team, we value acute attention to detail, empathy, quick turnaround times, and positivity. We like to cross off to do lists while delivering enormous value. We don't just get stuff done, we get the right stuff done.

What you'll do:

Grow assigned accounts through upsell and expansion opportunities; every member of the CS team is responsible for adding revenue to the business
Manage renewal cycles, forecasting, commercial activities, and revenue alignment
Obsessively develop and deepen new and existing relationships
Execution of commercial activities to include legal and contractual
Proactively identify and penetrate new lines of business
Serve as the main customer point of contact for assigned accounts
Manage, coordinate, and lead all account planning activities and deliverables, including QBRs, scheduled reporting, commercial aspects, on-boarding, training, and service recommendations
Schedule and lead regular calls with assigned accounts to ensure content program is moving forward, budgets are on track, and content deadlines are met
Feed customer feedback into the organization and promote product and service solutions at every stage of the customer lifecycle
Proactively provide strategic account alignment, direction, and oversight and develop new and existing relationships to help further adoption

Who you are:

Minimum 3 years of selling directly to customers or growing existing business experience (extra points for experience within B2B SaaS / marketing technology / creative agency)
A hustler, who is motivated by growing business and making money; demonstrated success against ambitious quotas and targets
An enthusiastic person who is constantly thinking about penetrating organizations deeper and higher up. You should have a sales funnel thought bubble floating over your head at all times! Your character and personality is hungry, entrepreneurial, and solution-oriented. You want to manage people one day and this is your shot at showing you have what it takes to lead from a place of empathy and positivity.
Passionate about content marketing and audience-centric editorial strategy; the most successful people in this role are ones who are passionate about their customers' content and advising them on best practices!
Motivated by revenue goals and hitting ambitious targets
Consultative approach to managing complex client relationships; content marketing requires consistent partnership and advisement
Data-driven, results-oriented, and attention to detail (this is not the job for you if you don't thrive with competing priorities!)
Team player who demonstrates a hunger to succeed collectively and individually
Entrepreneurial spirit: professionally ambitious, embraces challenges, embodies resilience, passionate problem-solver, and desire to explore new ways of thinking
Strong business acumen, sound decision making, analytical, and organizational skills
Motivated by start-up culture and fast-paced environments

About the Company

Contently powers the content marketing programs of the world's most valuable brands through its complete content marketing solution: expert content strategy, an industry-leading content marketing platform, and the highest-rated creative network on earth.

Working at Contently means that you will be collaborating with extremely intelligent, creative, and diverse problem-solvers who love a good story and many laughs. Contently employees receive the best perks out there – great benefits including equity, a 401k plan to Friday lunches and a flexible vacation policy.

Contently is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, genetic information, national origin, ancestry, medical condition, disability, marital status, caregiver status, pregnancy, citizenship, age, military or veteran status, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Schrödinger, a leader in computational chemistry software and services for preclinical drug discovery, is seeking an ambitious, highly driven, and goal-oriented Internal Sales Representative.

As a member of the Sales team, you'll identify, qualify, and develop new software and services business within the pharmaceutical and biotechnology industries. Your customer base will include scientists, departmental management, and senior pharma/biotech executives. Additionally, you'll interact closely with Schrödinger's applications scientists, product managers, members of the senior management team, and other account managers.

Who will love this job:

A team-oriented salesperson, or aspiring salesperson, with a science background
Someone familiar with drug discovery processes
An effective sales strategist who's excited about communicating opportunities with colleagues and developing a growing sales pipeline
A customer-oriented problem-solver who can handle negotiation, terms, procurement, and solution implementation
An excellent presenter and communicator of scientifically-sophisticated solutions to complex research problems
A self-motivated multi-tasker with fantastic organizational skills who can perform well under pressure
What you'll do:

Manage all team engagements with assigned accounts to ensure objectives are met
Develop and maintain exceptional account relationships through effective communication, education, reporting and problem-solving
Provide feedback from clients to the internal Product Managers and Support teams
Support Account Management team with prospecting, lead qualification and quote generation
Use Salesforce CRM to track account activities and progress
Work with marketing to implement and coordinate prospecting campaigns
What you should have:

Bachelor's degree in Chemistry, Biology, or a related science
One to two years of relevant work experience, software sales experience preferred
Pay and perks:

Schrödinger understands it's people that make a company great. Because of this, we're prepared to offer a competitive salary, stock options, and a wide range of benefits that include healthcare (with dental and vision), a 401k, pre-tax commuter benefits, a flexible work schedule, and a parental leave program. We have catered meals in the office every day, a company culture that is relaxed but engaged, and over a month of paid vacation time. Our Administrative and Human Resources departments also plan a myriad of fun company-wide events. New York is home to our largest office, but we have teams all over the world. Schrödinger is honored to have been selected as one of Crain's New York Best Places to Work in 2018 and 2019.

We've been working remotely from across the world over the past few months because the health and safety of our employees is paramount. Nonetheless, we have kept Schrödinger's outstanding culture going through a series of online fitness classes, trivia nights, happy hours, and so much more.


Sound exciting? Apply today and join us!

As an equal opportunity employer, Schrödinger hires outstanding individuals into every position in the company. People who work with us have a high degree of engagement, a commitment to working effectively in teams, and a passion for the company's mission. We place the highest value on creating a safe environment where our employees can grow and contribute, and refuse to discriminate on the basis of race, color, religious belief, sex, age, disability, national origin, alienage or citizenship status, marital status, partnership status, caregiver status, sexual and reproductive health decisions, gender identity or expression, or sexual orientation. To us, "diversity" isn't just a buzzword, but an important element of our core principles and key business practices. We believe that diverse companies innovate better and think more creatively than homogenous ones because they take into account a wide range of viewpoints. For us, greater diversity doesn't mean better headlines or public images - it means increased adaptability and profitability.

JobTitle: Jr. Sales Rep - Fast-Growing FinTech Startup - $70K-170K (Remote)
Text: Please Read Carefully: Position: Junior Sales ManagerCompensation: $70-$170KCompany & Context: Enhancify is a fast-growing fintech startup with a clear mission: to help home improvement contractors (roofers, general contractors, remodelers, etc) build the American dream for themselves, their teams, and their communities.Specifically, we are disrupting the home improvement lending industry through an innovative point-of-sale tech platform that helps contractors seamlessly turn expensive projects into low monthly payments, while giving homeowners the ability to complete their dream projects and build value in their homes.The problem we solve is dealer fees. Traditionally, today’s old-school financing companies require contractors to pay a percentage of their project in exchange for financing. This results in an average loss of 20-40% of the profit margin, while rejecting many homeowners who don’t have excellent credit.We’ve built a software solution that empowers contractors to win more jobs by offering attractive payment options to homeowners, without paying dealer fees, and while being able to serve a large community of customers.Performance to Date: We launched about 30 months ago and are profitable. We have 1,500+ paying customers (unlike most startups) and are completely bootstrapped. We’ve built partnerships with top lending networks of America (Goldman Sachs, LendingClub, SoFi, etc.) as well as banks and credit unions and are currently sitting on ~$30B in capital to deploy through our platform.Our lean but scrappy team consists of experienced industry veterans in the digital credit, B2B SaaS, and enterprise-software spaces, as well as folks who are from the trades/home-services and get it. As a team, we are solving difficult problems, working hard, and successfully competing against billion-dollar publicly-traded competition.The Opportunity: We are seeking exceptional, "A" players to add to our core team in the form of a Junior Sales Manager. In the last few years we’ve validated a need the market is starving for, demonstrated an ability to sell, and are now obsessed about creating an industry-changing customer experience. We need the right people to help us put fuel on the fire.- This is an entry-level sales position. We are looking to mold and create closers, not hire them. We're looking for raw ingredients.- You will be cold-calling every day. If the idea of making 150 dials a day is something that makes you nervous, this is not for you.- Unlike most Junior sales positions, you will also be closing. We will mold you into someone who can not just sell, but close. You will be leading an end-to-end sales process yourself, generating opportunities, developing relationships, and generating revenue as a Closer. You will also have accountability as an individual contributor.- You will generate revenue, be evaluated by your ability to do so (and have fun while doing it)- You will be helping contractors grow their businesses. You will be their champion, relentlessly focused on providing more value and learning about the market. Aside from closing clients, you will also ensure your customers are successful over the long-term.- You will be a multi-channel sales practitioner, selling on the phone, over email, and video recordings- You will be trained and molded by a successful team. This is a difficult, challenging, "slog-filled" role. However, if you are successful here, you will develop a lethal skillset that will serve you well for the rest of your life.- You will get hands-on experience working in a high-paced startup environment. That means together we will make decisions, make mistakes, and make improvements.About You (Personality): - You're hungry as hell. You're extremely results oriented. You don't make excuses and find ways to get the job done, period. You have a clear and powerful reason why you need to succeed right now.- You have Grit. You can take damage day after day. Working in an early-stage company is hard. You have a demonstrated ability to slog through difficult situations where most others would quit. You won't give up because of bad days, weeks, or months. Once you have a vision in your mind, you will make it happen.- You have a relentless commitment to Excellence. You're obsessed with not just becoming the best at what you do (you love to compete and win)...but with pulling your best out of you. You can always improve. When you hit your goal, you know it's time to raise your standards.- Above all, you are Trustworthy. While you love to win, your core desire is to help people. You have an unshakeable sense of ethics. Your core values are honesty, loyalty, and integrity. You take complete responsibility when you screw up.- While you love to win, your core desire is to help people. You have an unshakeable sense of ethics and are trustworthy. Your core values are honesty, loyalty, and integrity. You take complete responsibility when you screw up.- You're smart and systems-minded. You have self-awareness and improve your approach based on new information.About You (Ideal Experience): - You have a competitive athlete background- You had top grades in school or similar (objectively intelligent)- You have cold-calling experience- You have been an SDR and were told you can't close your own deals yet- You have a background in the trades / construction and "get" the space- You speak Spanish- You have previous client success / account management / client-relationship experienceWho this is NOT for: - You're looking for a "job". You want to punch the clock, do the bare minimum, and chill.- You've been in sales for more than 3 years- You have more than 5 years of professional experience (out of school). We're looking for people just out of school / beginning their careers.- You need a lot of structure, hand-holding, or accountability. The words, "That's not my job" has ever crossed your lips.- You think working remotely means working less hard- You're not coachableOtherHigh-performing reps will be on track to move up in the sales organization and substantially higher compensation. At or exceeding quota: Tier 3 (Junior) reps - $70K - $140K. Tier 2 - 80K - $200K. Tier 1 - $95K - $240K.There is a small base salary and most compensation is commission.There is a paid 30-day training / evaluation period. We will likely hire 2-3 folks and have you compete.You will be expected to have a quiet, professional setting to work remotely.References are mandatory and will be called.Please only apply if you are a high-performer and you are willing to work hard to earn more than the industry average. We want "A Players".Job Types: Full-time, ContractPay: $70,000.00 - $170,000.00 per yearEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Sales Experience: 1 year (Preferred)

Sesame Workshop is the nonprofit educational organization behind Sesame Street which reaches 156 million children across more than 150 countries. The Workshop’s mission is to use the educational power of media to help children everywhere grow smarter, stronger, and kinder. Delivered through a variety of platforms, including television programs, digital experiences, books and community engagement, its research-based programs are tailored to the needs of the communities and countries they serve. For more information, visit us at www.sesameworkshop.org.
The Summer Internship Program will give undergrad students an opportunity to gain experience in a business environment. As a Sesame Workshop Intern you will learn from the best minds in the industry and contribute to our success. This is a unique opportunity to work with a dynamic group in an organization dedicated to the education of children. Our aim is to reach out to a diverse college population to increase awareness and interest in the areas of non-profit and children’s media. We believe having a workforce that reflects our diverse and culturally rich society is essential to our success.

PROGRAM DATES
Sesame’s 9-week Internship Program will run from Monday, June 7 through Friday, August 6, 2021.

PROGRAM SPECIFICS
Internships will be fully remote. Interns are paid $18 per hour and work 35-hour week.

REQUIREMENTS

Qualified undergraduate candidates must be in good academic standing entering their junior or senior year in Fall 2021 at an accredited college or university with at least an overall 3.0 GPA.
Possess strong computer skills as well as excellent written and verbal communication skills
Available to work 35 hours a week.
Upon acceptance, you should be able to provide a copy of your transcript.

GUIDELINES FOR APPLYING
Apply online (instructions are below) by the application deadline March 12, 2021.
Application Materials Required:

Current resume – Apply with your resume in MS Word or PDF format.
Include at the end of your resume, add another page then List the 3 Departments you are interested in in order of importance at the top and answer the following questions. For each question - Describe in 500 words or less:
Why are you choosing these departments to work in?
How does your background and experiences inform your decision to choose your major?
What are you hoping to gain from an internship with Sesame Workshop?
What else should we know about you and your candidacy?
Cover Letter – cut and paste your letter in the box reserved for the cover letter and you cover letter that should include the following on it:
Your School’s Name
Your Major/ Degree
Graduation Date


Internship Departments:

Art, Design & Animation – The design aspects for all media vehicles including online, print and television shows.
Accounting & Finance – Manages the monetary side of all company transactions, ensures all entries are booked according to Generally Accepted Accounting Practice (GAAP), and reports on the financial performance of both the entire company and distinct projects within the organization. Accounting & Finance provides the necessary data that informs management about the fiscal health of the organization.
Content Research – Conducts formative and summative research, both quantitative and qualitative, with children and their caregivers to support concept development, planning, production and impact of our products and programs. Also provides information about a production’s particular curriculum area(s) i.e. mathematics, resilience, literacy, or science. Those Interested in Content Research must have experience working with young children, and prior experience in research with human subjects is preferred.
Creative Development – Develops new content and series to expand Sesame Workshop’s creative portfolio.
Digital Media Engineering – Cross-functional team within the Technology and Engineering Department that is responsible for building, maintaining, and monitoring digital products including websites, interactive media, and apps produced for domestic and international properties.
Digital Production - Production of all of the Workshop’s interactive products and platforms.
US Education – Defines, creates, and develops formal learning content (digital and print) for schools and education programs. Innovative content offerings include outcomes-based curricula in a range of content areas for children in Pre-K to Grade 3, professional development materials for educators, and family engagement supports.
Licensing – Creation and management contracts between the owner of a brand and a company or individual who wants to use the brand in association with a product, for an agreed period of time, within an agreed territory. As the brand owner, we are responsible for creating the design direction and the marketing umbrella that defines the brand's appeal.
Marketing – Promotes our business and drives sales of its products or services. They also research to identify target audiences.
Media & Publishing – Responsible for creating and distributing a wide array of media, including books, DVDs, e-books, apps, streaming media, music, and even museum exhibits.
Production – Creative content for Sesame Street, and other associated media. This includes ongoing creative development and long term planning of the show to drive forward the mission, increase child engagement and build the educational core.
International Production – Creative content for Sesame Workshop’s global presence. This includes ongoing creative development and long-term planning of local brand adaptions to drive forward the mission, increase child engagement, and build the educational core.
Production Management – Management of the planning, forecasting, and production costs at all stages of the production lifecycle.
Philanthropic Development – Responsible for generating revenue from both institutional (foundation, corporate, government) and individual donors to support all of Sesame’s social impact work domestically and around the world to reach the most vulnerable children with access to free content.
Public Relations – Strategic communication process that builds mutually beneficial relationships between organizations and the public.
Special Events – Project management to the creation and development of large scale events
International Social Impact – Responsible for growing Sesame Workshop’s global presence and initiating, implementing and strategically sustaining local brand adaptations to drive reach and impact. The team collaborates with a variety of international partners, stakeholders, and service providers to deliver educationally targeted, high-quality content through coalitions of local and global media, education, government, corporate, donor and civil society partners.
US Social Impact – Implements philanthropically funded community engagement initiatives that serve our nation’s vulnerable children and families. Based on fulfilling Sesame Workshop’s mission we created innovative, bilingual (English and Spanish), multiple media initiatives and resources that enrich children’s overall development through early learning basics, health and well-being and building resiliency skills to tackle challenging situations. There is a strong focus on localizing the implementation of these initiatives through key national and community organizational partnerships through individualized action plans and professional development.
Web – Work involved in developing a web site for the Internet non-design aspects of building web sites: writing markup and coding.

SELECTION OF INTERNS
Interns are selected on the basis of their academic standing, writing samples, participation in extracurricular activities, and previous work and/or internship experience. Incomplete applications or applicants that do not follow our directions will not be considered.
Interns may be interviewed by telephone or by video interviews. References may be requested.
Students accepted as summer interns will be notified on or before April 16th, 2021.
While we appreciate your interest in Sesame Workshop, only students under consideration will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Minorities/Females/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

With funding from leading venture capitalists in the consumer space, partnerships in the entertainment, sports and fashion arenas and a team of passionate individuals, we are on a mission to completely revolutionize the eyewear industry. We're excited that we already have the support of Good Morning America, The Today Show, Oprah Magazine, CNN and Forbes helping us share our story.

Retirement savings plan options
NYC dog friendly office with flexible remote work options
Free eyewear (plus discounts for family and friends)
