Text: LIS, a Woman Owned Small Business, was founded in 1994 as an advanced innovative language service provider. Since then we have organically expanded into Cyber Security, Intelligence Analysis and Information Technology to support our customers with their rapidly evolving global enterprise-wide requirements.Whether sources are hostile, friendly or neutral, it is LIS’ mission to provide our customers with relevant and effective intelligence data that incorporates the full spectrum of the intelligence life cycle. LIS enhances our industry, government and military partners’ situational awareness through the collection, exploitation, analysis and dissemination of source data.Program OverviewLIS Solutions is seeking qualified candidates in support of The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) over the phone interpretation. Support to this effort is to accept and respond to inquiries from its Limited English Proficient (LEP) customer service population. The objective of this task order is to ensure customer service availability for its Limited English Proficient (LEP) populations and address inquiries for callers who prefer to receive customer service in language other than English through over-the-phone interpretation service. CMS requires accurate interpretations, high performance standards, and other important oversight and monitoring functions.Roles & ResponsibilitiesProvide telephonic interpretations for customer service inquiries in languages other than English. Telephonic interpretations may be from English to the target language or from the target language back to English.Shall be available within the agreed upon timeframe to receive and respond to inquiries.Answer calls with an average service level of 80% of calls answered within 30 seconds for connection with a live interpreter.Maintain the confidentiality of all interpretations and translations; protect the integrity of information with respect to Personal Health Information (PHI) and Personally Identifiable Information (PII) (personal health records, etc.) while handling calls, and adhere to all applicable Federal Privacy and Security acts, especially the Health Insurance Portability & Accountability Act (HIPAA) and the Privacy Act.Qualifications/Knowledge/Skills/ExperienceNative-level mastery/fluency of both languages (English and target), especially:o An extensive vocabulary ranging from formal language to colloquialisms and slang.o Industry-specific vocabulary, including medical terminology, legal, insurance, etc.1-3 years of experience providing over the phone interpretation support.Demonstrated ability to work and communicate with the public.Trained and competent in healthcare and health insurance terminology in support of CMS’ consumers.Experience in all phases of language interpretation.Confident telephone voice for interpretation of inquiries received via telephone.Demonstrated strong listening and memory retention skills; relay information accurately, completely and succinctly.Demonstrated understanding of the role of the interpreter as a conduit to solve the problem and not as a problem solver.Ability to remain unbiased, objective, and impartial at all times.Information for Military ApplicantsSubmit your application with your most updated resume, if you have any questions feel free to send us an email.We are a proud employer of military personnel and veterans. We look forward to supporting your civilian career and transition, thank you for your service.StatementsLIS Solutions provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.LIS Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.Job Type: Part-timeSchedule:Monday to FridayOn callExperience:Medical Interpreting: 5 years (Preferred)Over the phone Interpretation: 5 years (Preferred)Location:North Carolina (Preferred)Language:Chinese Cantonese (Required)Work authorization:United States (Required)Working Days:Monday (Required)Tuesday (Required)Wednesday (Required)Thursday (Required)Friday (Required)Saturday (Required)Sunday (Required)Security Clearance Required:Top Secret (Preferred)Work Location:Fully RemoteThis Job Is:A job for which military experienced candidates are encouraged to applyOpen to applicants under 18 years old, provided it is legally allowed for the job and locationOpen to applicants who do not have a high school diploma/GEDA “Fair Chance” job (you or the employer follow Fair Chance hiring practices when performing background checks)A good fit for applicants with gaps in their resume, or who have been out of the workforce for the past 6 months or moreA good job for someone just entering the workforce or returning to the workforce with limited experience and educationA job for which all ages, including older job seekers, are encouraged to applyOpen to applicants who do not have a college diplomaA job for which people with disabilities are encouraged to applyWork Remotely:Yes

JobTitle: LMFT - Telehealth - Full-time or Part-time, co-employment ok
Text: Therapist – LMFT or LCSW or equivalentAbout Centered Mind TherapyCentered Mind Therapy is a cloud-based practice management platform that equips a network of therapists with the tools and infrastructure they need to deliver therapy. We are growing and have more clients than we can handle. We know that the worst part of any therapist’s job is notoriously the non-clinical work, and we want to make it easy for you. Our platform lets therapist focus on their clients while we focus on the practice operations including:Practice MarketingClient Acquisition and ReferralsClient IntakeClient and Appointment ManagementClient and Insurance BillingLegal ComplianceRisk Management and Malpractice InsuranceContinuing EducationOur mission is to help our extended network of clients discover healing and build a balanced life – to have them remain in the present moment, make meaningful space for their emotions, to identify and release unhelpful thoughts, and to support them in developing a sense of mastery over their life through mindfulness and taking action.Your Role and ResponsibilitiesAs a therapist on the Centered Mind Therapy platform, we want you to focus on clients and clinical work including:Complete assessments of client’s mental health needs and provide telehealth or in-person behavioral health services to individual clients and groupsDocumenting client services in EHR and practice management systemThat’s it, end of list. We do the rest! Optional paid activities include providing supervision, writing blog posts, and other practice marketing and growth activities.Why join Centered Mind TherapyThere are numerous benefits to operating on the Centered Mind Therapy platform including:Set your own working hours – Part-time or Full-timeSet your own client load – accept/reject our referrals as you’d likeMost of our clients are virtual – work from wherever you wantUnlimited time offWork independentlyWork with multiple therapy practices – your work with us can be a side gigWork expenses are potentially tax deductibleNo dress codeNo performance reviews – you are your own bossIn addition to those qualitative benefits, Centered Mind Therapy has several expense reimbursement and bonus programs to help you boost your income including:Mobile phone service allowanceInternet service allowanceTechnology equipment allowanceTax preparation assistanceMeal reimbursement allowanceFitness center membershipMileage reimbursementClient acquisition bonus programTherapist referral bonus programLicense renewal fee reimbursementContinuing education allowanceQualificationsMasters degree from an accredited schoolCurrent license to practice as a LCSW or LMFT or equivalentDemonstrates excellent clinical skillsFamiliarity and comfort with the DSM V diagnostic criteriaEvidence of mature judgment and crisis intervention skillsAbility to effectively present information both orally and writtenAbility to work both autonomously as a self-starter, and collaboratively as a team memberAbility to stay organized and keep calendar availability up to date to enable efficient client session schedulingAbility to effectively and efficiently complete progress notes after client sessionsExperience providing telehealth services, evidence-based treatment modalities (DBT, CBT, EFT, etc), and using Google G-suite and TheraNest systems a plusLet’s start building your caseload on the Centered Mind Therapy platform! Job Types: Full-time, Part-timePay: $30.00 - $50.00 per hourBenefits:Flexible scheduleWork Location:Fully RemoteCompany's website:www.centeredmindtherapy.com

JobTitle: Project Security Superintendent (French Speaker and Africa experience)
Text: Work Location: MADAGASCARImportant Note: French language skills and Africa experience. Kindly Submit Cover Letter, CV, and Writing Samples to https://valarfrontiersolutions.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=20Location: MadagascarTerms of Reference — Project Security Superintendent BackgroundA key Valar client is a progressive extractives company currently operating a successful mine in East Africa and starting an exciting large-scale project in Madagascar. If successful, the new project will catapult client into the next league of extractives companies and provide income and benefits for the people of Madagascar for the next 40 years or more.Extensive early works planning has been conducted by the client and a core team of Operations and ExternalAffairs personnel are on site in Madagascar. The project is nearing the construction phase which will involve a significant influx of client personnel and contractors; this it is estimated this phase will take two years to complete before beginning mining operations. The project has suffered delays due to political opposition to the project, lack of government support and incidents of local violence against field personnel and the role of security is essential to moving it forward.Security is part of the community relations and external affairs functions of the project and is built upon a culture of strong partnership with local communities and government. The Valar security team is embedded in the client organization while receiving full technical support and leadership from the Valar Team.Security on the project is led by a Security Manager and three Security Superintendents rotating into two positions on an eight and four basis. The project is currently supported by a subcontracted local security guard force. Key to the success of the project will be the rapid development of a security department staffed by local personnel as well as a significant expansion of subcontracted services.The Project Security Superintendent’s Role:> Be on the ground floor at start-up of this exciting private sector project and support theSecurity Manager in laying the foundation for the security of a world-leading construction and mining operation.> Take on the principles of both Valar and the client’s organization, learn the project through and through and fully integrate yourself into the on-site project team.> Act as key resource to the security management team which includes both local and expatriate personnel.> Act as an ambassador for both Valar and the Client at all times.> Become a focal point for security matters within the Client’s organisation.> Provide guidance and support to other Client departments as required,> Participate fully with client and Valar teams to develop and implement world-class security architecture for the project.> Fully support the department capacity-building strategy and training plans in order to rapidly build a robust and capable Malagasy team which includes supervisors, administrative officers and community-based security personnel. Support the client’s strategies for training and advancement of local personnel.Terms of Reference 1> Support the Security Manager with the implementation and delivery of security risk management practices and support the manager’s plans to integrate security fully into all company planning activities.> Mentor colleagues and maintain a culture of security throughout the project team and the client organization.> Under guidance of the Security Manager, provide coordination of day-to-day security operations.> Assist the Security Manager delivery of emergency response.> Work with the team to assess and mitigate security impacts of extensive client and contractor teams accessing the project area.> Support the Project Security Manager in enhancing relationships with government forces and ensuring that all partners are trained in security and human rights.> Support the Valar team in forecasting established or emerging threats, identifying potential risk events, and proposing adequate, cost effective control measures.> Assist the manager in maintaining reliable communications within the client and contractor communities.> Support security investigations with Valar, the client organization and security partners.> Support project leadership through the provision of oversight and management of security subcontractors.> Work to establish a secure working environment for the client, aid the PSM in the development and delivery of operational security and emergency response plans.> Maintain the highest standards of reporting and communications with Valar and with the client.> Be a strong resource and asset to the Valar team and work to advance its development and effectiveness.Contract typeValar employee with eight week on and four week off rotation schedule.Duty Location(s)Primary location: remote location in Madagascar- semi urban and field based. Secondary duty locationAntananarivo- urban.Fitness for WorkPersonnel will be assessed for fitness to work in this remote and challenging location which features limited initial access to healthcare.Skills and ExperienceMadagascar experienceTraining and capacity building experienceExperience working within the private sectorProven knowledgeable on human rights and skilled at working with community-based securityProven risk assessment abilitiesOperational security skills which are applicable to private sector field projects Established and demonstratable skills in all aspects of security risk management. Proven strategic and tactical planning abilityProven training and capacity-building abilityExperience in supporting progressive community-based security programsProven leadership skills which may be applied to supervision of subcontracted security and leadership of local security personnel.Proven ability to undertake project leadership functions on a temporary basisStrong English language communications skills, both written and verbal, and ability to communicate effectively in French and/or Malagasy.Job Type: Full-timeWork Location:Multiple locationsThis Job Is:A job for which military experienced candidates are encouraged to applyA “Fair Chance” job (you or the employer follow Fair Chance hiring practices when performing background checks)A job for which all ages, including older job seekers, are encouraged to applyCompany's website:www.valarfrontier.comCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processPersonal protective equipment provided or requiredPlastic shield at work stationsTemperature screeningsSocial distancing guidelines in placeVirtual meetingsSanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

Summary
Posted: Feb 1, 2021
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200216364
Home Office: Yes
Imagine what you could do here. The people here at Apple don’t just create products — they create the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it.
For over 40 years, we’ve had the privilege of working alongside educators around the world. From that experience, we know that educators with powerful technology can unlock the unique genius in every learner, so they can make a difference.
Our Apple Professional Learning organization helps educational institutions transform their teaching and learning environments and helps educators get the most from Apple technology at every point in their professional learning journey. Our teams provide educators with many ways to build foundational skills with Apple products, integrate them into classroom or remote learning activities, and create innovative instruction that deeply engages students.
As an Apple Professional Learning Manager, you will lead a team of Specialists dedicated to providing an amazing experience for our K-12 and Higher Education customers across the United States. Our Specialists are uniquely qualified to demonstrate how to best use Apple products for learning and teaching across multiple curricular and core content areas while adapting to needs of individual schools. Your team will provide leadership and planning support, professional learning plans, and hands-on instructional coaching and mentoring to support teachers in advancing their technology skills with an emphasis on innovation — to engage students in deeper learning.
This position is home-based and can be located in any major city within the US.
Key Qualifications
10+ years of proven experience in education as both an educator and instructional leader at the K-12 and/or higher education level with a focus on integration of technology through a coaching and instructional design methodology.
Exemplary leadership skills and business acumen to successfully lead a team focused on implementation and integration of technology at deep instructional levels.
Extensive knowledge of national educational trends in instructional technology and professional learning in face-to-face, virtual, and blended learning environments.
Proven expertise in professional learning, curriculum development, lesson planning, educational technology, and creating content for multicultural audiences and can lead a team to strengthen their capacity.
Ability to create end-to-end learning experiences and build a consistent learning journey with a team of Specialists that truly shape the future.
Proficiency with Apple’s ecosystem and presentation software applications, including Pages, Numbers, Keynote, iMovie, GarageBand, and Clips.
Superb writing and editing skills, with a knowledge of instructional design and coaching models to support the professional learning teams’ development of complex scope and sequences in the design of training opportunities.
Experience with professional learning activities such as mentoring colleagues, creating and delivering personalized experiences at local, state, and national venues and conferences, etc.
Self-directed leadership skills with exceptional decision-making abilities, tenacity, conviction, and attention to detail.
Description
As an Apple Professional Learning Manager, you will be responsible for the leadership and the day-to-day management of an Apple Professional Learning Specialist team, working closely with education sales leadership to drive customer satisfaction for using Apple technology in education. Success requires close partnership with the Education sales leaders, sales teams, and a variety of cross-functional partners to effectively deliver the highest quality and highest impact professional learning.
In this position, you will:
- Manage a team of highly productive and seasoned educators who deliver professional learning experiences, resources, and content.
- Collaborate internally and externally with key stakeholders in your territory.
- Partner with leadership, curriculum & instruction, and IT to understand the needs of individual K-12 districts, colleges, and/or universities.
- Empower your team to develop and deliver customized professional learning plans to match individual learning goals for schools.
- Coach and inspire your team to adapt to a coaching style and tailor communication to differing audiences as they integrate technology into curriculum through classroom support and virtual offerings.
- Strengthen the team’s effectiveness through feedback, collaborative reflection, and recommendations.
- Research and explore new ideas to innovate and influence pedagogy through research-based instructional technology practices, development workshops, and a variety of strategies.
- Be a subject matter expert on all Apple products, services, and offerings for education.
- Maintain a deep functional expertise of the education market: customer profile, market landscape, challenges, messages, and competitive issues.
Education & Experience
- Masters degree or equivalent experience required
- Doctorate preferred
Additional RequirementsProven experience in education, instructional design, educational leadership, and/or educational technology with success as a principal, assistant superintendent, instructional leader and/or curriculum consultant.

Gesture has combined an age-old gifting process with some of the coolest tech in the industry. We made sending gifts sociable and fun. Being one of the newest on-demand delivery services on the market, we live out our company mission by providing a user-friendly platform and streamlined logistics that make the experience of gifting simple, fast, and enjoyable. With Gesture, anyone can easily send flowers, wine, champagne, and so much more from all across the nation, starting at $25 with free delivery and no surprise fees.We are looking for a UI/UX Design Intern to join our team immediately! You will be a part of turning our current projects into an easy-to-use product for our users and will work directly with the creative, tech, and marketing teams to understand user requirements, design graphic elements, and build navigation components. Ultimately, you will create both functional and appealing features that address our clients’ needs and help us grow our customer base.Responsibilities: Brainstorming and collaborating with the product (SKU), creative, tech and marketing teams to come up with UI ideas for mobile applications and websites.Producing UI/UX design solutions through visual and graphic designs, wireframes, flow diagrams, prototypes, etc.Conducting user research and user interview and assisting in user experience design requirements for our suite of digital assetsDeveloping and conceptualizing a comprehensive UI/UX design for the brand.Qualifications: Proven work experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar rolePortfolio of design projects *Please include your portfolio in the application (e.g., link, attachment)*Knowledge of wireframe tools, e.g., Wireframe.cc and InVision, and web design/development.Up-to-date knowledge of design software like Figma, Miro, Adobe Illustrator, and PhotoshopUnderstanding of e-commerce business and platforms (app, websites, dashboards, etc.)Team spirit; strong communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholdersExcellent time management skillsOngoing education including Bootcamp and/or college/university aiming towards BSc in UI/UX Design, Visual Communication Design, Computer Science or relevant fieldWe encourage you to visit yourgesture.com at your earliest convenience.We look forward to meeting you soon.Job Types: Part-time, InternshipPay: $0.01 per yearSchedule:Monday to FridayEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:UI/UX design: 1 year (Preferred)Work Location:Fully RemoteInternship Compensation:College CreditCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

JobTitle: Part time faculty | Secured Transactions | JFK School of Law
Text:
What We Are Looking For
The School of Law at Northcentral University seeks applications for a non-tenure track, Adjunct Professor in Secured Transactions for our online JD program.
Adjunct Professors may teach JD courses as assigned. Primary responsibility is to engage students, offer excellent feedback, and inspire students to achieve course and program outcomes relevant to the JD program. This position works closely with other faculty teaching in the discipline, Assistant Dean and Dean.

Essential Functions
The role of Adjunct Professor may include teaching courses within the JD Program.

Demonstrates a commitment to Northcentral’s vision, mission, and goals and those of the School of Law.
Promotes a graduate culture of scholarship, teaching, service, and practice.
Demonstrates commitment to and capacity for Teaching through Engagement teaching model.
Teaches courses in the JD Program.
Participates in initial and ongoing training.
Contributes to developing training materials and provides input on improving training, courses, and processes.
Participates in trial use of new technologies and integrates new technologies into their teaching.
Participates in faculty and staff meetings.
Maintains contact with students via phone, video conferencing, and email through their courses.
Works collaboratively with Academic Advisors to ensure student engagement and success.
Exercises academic freedom in teaching course content and achieving learning outcomes in accordance with University policy, procedures, and curricula.
Participates in program and student assessment procedures, program review, and accreditation efforts.
Performs all educational services in accordance with NCU policies and procedures, the Family Education Rights to Privacy Act, Northcentral University’s Code of Conduct and all other state and federal laws.
Complete all required professional development activities as defined in the Faculty Handbook.
Tasks and projects as assigned by the Dean, or NCU administrators.
Reasonable and consistent attendance to fulfill requirements of the position.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Experience in legal doctrine and practice, as well as in teaching legal courses.
Skilled in verbal and written communication.
Skill in operating equipment, such as personal computer, fax, copier, phone systems.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
A desire to mentor students through the course.
Excellent organizational and communication skills, with a proven ability to provide timely feedback to students.
Proficient with Microsoft Word and other application in the Microsoft Office suite.

Education and Experience
Juris Doctor degree in law or a related field from a regionally accredited institution
Online teaching experience preferred.
Curriculum development experience preferred.
Experience with the online delivery of education and the systems that support it.
Proficiency in the use of technology in the delivery of education.
Experience in Higher Education preferred.
Experience working in a technology-driven enterprise preferred.
All skills, abilities and education will be considered for minimum qualifications.

Working Conditions
This position operates in a remote, home office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, printers, and phones.

NCU will not sponsor applicants for work visas.
Who We Are
Northcentral University (NCU) is a private, nonprofit, online University and a proud affiliate of the National University System with its headquarters in California. We are a graduate university, and a global leader in providing access to regionally-accredited higher education.
NCU offers doctoral, master’s and bachelor’s degrees in business, education, law, and psychology, as well as doctoral and master’s degrees in technology, health sciences and marriage and family therapy. Our collective goal at Northcentral University is to improve the human condition through the provision of high-quality online degree programs.
NCU was founded in 1996 to provide working professionals around the world with access to a richly- engaging, professionally-relevant, and academically-rigorous educational programs. Today, we continue to serve that mission. Many students at NCU are first-generation graduate students seeking to contribute to their communities through their pursuit of academic growth, research, and practice.
Though we support faculty and student research, NCU is a teaching university. Our faculty dedicate themselves to serving students through a pedagogical model of Teaching through Engagement (TTE). The goal is for all NCU students, faculty and team members to be actively engaged within the University community. Engagement is more than just grading and giving feedback, it is an active relationship between faculty and student, a give and take of ideas and information.
At NCU, we are widening access to education and reducing educational divides. We are proud of the educational opportunities that we provide, and we recognize that providing this kind of access to all students takes work and collaborative effort. We value diversity of people, thoughts, and ideas. Our global reach affords us the opportunity to teach and learn the significance of diversity – and the power it brings to our endeavors.
Take advantage of this exciting opportunity to join a growing team of passionate individuals.
Apply today!

Req Id: 2928
Location: New York, NY

Brighthouse Financial is on a mission to help people achieve financial security. As one of the largest providers of annuities and life insurance in the U.S., we specialize in products designed to help people protect what they've earned and ensure it lasts. We are built on a foundation of experience and knowledge, which allows us to keep our promises and provide the value they deserve.


At Brighthouse Financial, we're fostering a culture where diverse backgrounds and experiences are celebrated, and different ideas are heard and respected. We believe that by creating an inclusive workplace, we're better able to attract and retain our talent, provide valuable solutions that meet the needs of our advisors and their clients, and deliver on our mission of helping more people achieve financial security. We're se eking passionate, high-performing team member to join us. Sound like you? Read on.


How This Role Contributes to Brighthouse Financial:


Candidates should embrace leading in a team based environment and collaborating with other leaders to help Brighthouse Financial successfully grow market share and provide outstanding service to our in force customers. As an Underwriting Consultant - Life New Business and Operations, you will be responsible for reviewing cases to identify insurable risks, managing internal and external relationships with partners and working within a complex electronic environment.


Location:


Charlotte, NC (remote option)


To protect the health and safety of our employees, our offices are closed until at least May 2021. When our offices reopen, the individual hired for this role will be based in our Charlotte, NC office or can continue to work remotely if candidate resides outside of Charlotte, NC.


Key Responsibilities:

Underwrites and accepts/rejects individual mortality and morbidity risks in accordance to Brighthouse underwriting guidelines. Case level work assignments may vary and may include face amounts up to $7.5M.
Identifies trends and issues and offers the best underwriting solutions.
Interacts with customers to simplify the acquisition process while protecting mortality results.
Mentors less experienced underwriting professionals and may provide second signature review.
Makes business decisions that are financially responsible, accountable, justifiable, and defensible in accordance with departmental policies and procedures.


Essential Business Experience and Technical Skills:

Working knowledge of insurance principles including mortality, morbidity and insurable interest.
4+ years of individual mortality insurance underwriting or equivalent experience
Some morbidity underwriting experience preferred
Undergraduate degree preferred or equivalent work experience
AALU or FALU preferred
FLMI required or ability to obtain within 12-18 months of employment
Excellent written and oral communication skills to communicate clearly and concisely by telephone and email.
Strong listening skills to ensure understanding of associate and customer questions and concerns. Overall, ability to effectively communicate.
Ability to foster and develop successful professional relationships to elicit the trust and confidence of our customers and business partners
Works with a sense of accountability and ownership; results driven
Open to direction and Collaborative work style
Solid knowledge of insurance products, services, operations, and business systems
Competencies: Focuses on Customers, Use of Sound Business Judgment, Decision- making Ability, Communicates Effectively, Produces Results
Supervisory Responsibilities: Prior experience mentoring or training junior underwriters preferred.
Easily adaptable to changes in business processes, work priorities and work environment
Comfortable with new technology and operating within multiple systems/work environments.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office


Our Benefits:

Time Off: Minimum of 20 days of paid time off and 13 paid company holidays per full calendar year, plus paid volunteer time
Financial Benefits: 401(k) savings plan with up to a 6% annual match and 3% annual company nondiscretionary contribution of eligible compensation, annual incentive plan, and employee stock purchase plan
Family Focus: Up to 16 weeks of paid leave for new parents, back-up care program, dependent care flexible spending account, and adoption and surrogacy assistance
Health and Welfare: Competitive medical, vision and dental plans, plus tax-free health savings accounts with potential company contributions up to $1,000 per family
Wellness Programs: Wellness incentive platform, employee assistance program, financial counseling services, fitness center discounts and more
Life & Disability Benefits: Company-paid basic life insurance and short-term disability


Travel:


Limited


Number of Openings:


1


Nearest Major Market: Charlotte

Job Segment: Underwriter, Insurance

HireArt is helping our client find a bilingual Recruiter to recruit and onboard home health aides. In this role, you'll make a positive impact on others by finding caregivers who will bring dignity and support to patients needing care in their homes.
This is an excellent opportunity to work in a place where your voice matters, where you can build great relationships, and your work has meaning and a tangible positive impact on others!
This position is fully remote to start and will transition to on-site in Manhattan, NY as offices re-open.
As Recruiter, you will:
Execute high volume, full-cycle recruitment, and onboarding of home health aides.
Ensure compliance with all relevant regulatory and internal policies and procedures.
Maintain up to date notes in the company applicant tracking system.
Coordinate follow up interviews with required team members.
Collaborate with operations team to match, assign, and schedule caregivers based on skill level, availability, and client needs.
Learn a client’s unique needs and show compassion/empathy for the clients and the caregivers.
Requirements
Prior experience in human resources or recruiting
2+ years experience recruiting health aides strongly preferred
High energy, well-spoken, and excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
Must be able to quickly adapt to change and be able to work in a fast-paced environment
Must be comfortable with computers, and have the ability to learn and operate scheduling and training software systems
Fluent in Spanish (read, write, speak) in addition to English is required
Commitment: This is a full-time (40 hours per week), contract-to-hire position through HireArt. This position is fully remote to start and will transition to on-site in Manhattan, NY as offices re-open.
HireArt values diversity and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. Unfortunately, we are not able to sponsor visas.

JobTitle: Part time faculty, JFK Family Law
Text:
What We Are Looking For
The School of Law at Northcentral University seeks applications for a non-tenure track, Adjunct Professor in Family Law for our online JD program.
Adjunct Professors may teach JD courses as assigned. Primary responsibility is to engage students, offer excellent feedback, and inspire students to achieve course and program outcomes relevant to the JD program. This position works closely with other faculty teaching in the discipline, Assistant Dean and Dean.

Essential Functions
The role of Adjunct Professor may include teaching courses within the JD Program.

Demonstrates a commitment to Northcentral’s vision, mission, and goals and those of the School of Law.
Promotes a graduate culture of scholarship, teaching, service, and practice.
Demonstrates commitment to and capacity for Teaching through Engagement teaching model.
Teaches courses in the JD Program.
Participates in initial and ongoing training.
Contributes to developing training materials and provides input on improving training, courses, and processes.
Participates in trial use of new technologies and integrates new technologies into their teaching.
Participates in faculty and staff meetings.
Maintains contact with students via phone, video conferencing, and email through their courses.
Works collaboratively with Academic Advisors to ensure student engagement and success.
Exercises academic freedom in teaching course content and achieving learning outcomes in accordance with University policy, procedures, and curricula.
Participates in program and student assessment procedures, program review, and accreditation efforts.
Performs all educational services in accordance with NCU policies and procedures, the Family Education Rights to Privacy Act, Northcentral University’s Code of Conduct and all other state and federal laws.
Complete all required professional development activities as defined in the Faculty Handbook.
Tasks and projects as assigned by the Dean, or NCU administrators.
Reasonable and consistent attendance to fulfill requirements of the position.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Experience in legal doctrine and practice, as well as in teaching legal courses.
Skilled in verbal and written communication.
Skill in operating equipment, such as personal computer, fax, copier, phone systems.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
A desire to mentor students through the course.
Excellent organizational and communication skills, with a proven ability to provide timely feedback to students.
Proficient with Microsoft Word and other application in the Microsoft Office suite.

Education and Experience
Juris Doctor degree in law or a related field from a regionally accredited institution
Online teaching experience preferred.
Curriculum development experience preferred.
Experience with the online delivery of education and the systems that support it.
Proficiency in the use of technology in the delivery of education.
Experience in Higher Education preferred.
Experience working in a technology-driven enterprise preferred.
All skills, abilities and education will be considered for minimum qualifications.

Working Conditions
This position operates in a remote, home office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, printers, and phones.

NCU will not sponsor applicants for work visas.
Who We Are
Northcentral University (NCU) is a private, nonprofit, online University and a proud affiliate of the National University System with its headquarters in California. We are a graduate university, and a global leader in providing access to regionally-accredited higher education.
NCU offers doctoral, master’s and bachelor’s degrees in business, education, law, and psychology, as well as doctoral and master’s degrees in technology, health sciences and marriage and family therapy. Our collective goal at Northcentral University is to improve the human condition through the provision of high-quality online degree programs.
NCU was founded in 1996 to provide working professionals around the world with access to a richly- engaging, professionally-relevant, and academically-rigorous educational programs. Today, we continue to serve that mission. Many students at NCU are first-generation graduate students seeking to contribute to their communities through their pursuit of academic growth, research, and practice.
Though we support faculty and student research, NCU is a teaching university. Our faculty dedicate themselves to serving students through a pedagogical model of Teaching through Engagement (TTE). The goal is for all NCU students, faculty and team members to be actively engaged within the University community. Engagement is more than just grading and giving feedback, it is an active relationship between faculty and student, a give and take of ideas and information.
At NCU, we are widening access to education and reducing educational divides. We are proud of the educational opportunities that we provide, and we recognize that providing this kind of access to all students takes work and collaborative effort. We value diversity of people, thoughts, and ideas. Our global reach affords us the opportunity to teach and learn the significance of diversity – and the power it brings to our endeavors.
Take advantage of this exciting opportunity to join a growing team of passionate individuals.
Apply today!

Text: LIS, a Woman Owned Small Business, was founded in 1994 as an advanced innovative language service provider. Since then we have organically expanded into Cyber Security, Intelligence Analysis and Information Technology to support our customers with their rapidly evolving global enterprise-wide requirements.Whether sources are hostile, friendly or neutral, it is LIS’ mission to provide our customers with relevant and effective intelligence data that incorporates the full spectrum of the intelligence life cycle. LIS enhances our industry, government and military partners’ situational awareness through the collection, exploitation, analysis and dissemination of source data.Program OverviewLIS Solutions is seeking qualified candidates in support of The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) over the phone interpretation. Support to this effort is to accept and respond to inquiries from its Limited English Proficient (LEP) customer service population. The objective of this task order is to ensure customer service availability for its Limited English Proficient (LEP) populations and address inquiries for callers who prefer to receive customer service in language other than English through over-the-phone interpretation service. CMS requires accurate interpretations, high performance standards, and other important oversight and monitoring functions.Roles & ResponsibilitiesProvide telephonic interpretations for customer service inquiries in languages other than English. Telephonic interpretations may be from English to the target language or from the target language back to English.Shall be available within the agreed upon timeframe to receive and respond to inquiries.Answer calls with an average service level of 80% of calls answered within 30 seconds for connection with a live interpreter.Maintain the confidentiality of all interpretations and translations; protect the integrity of information with respect to Personal Health Information (PHI) and Personally Identifiable Information (PII) (personal health records, etc.) while handling calls, and adhere to all applicable Federal Privacy and Security acts, especially the Health Insurance Portability & Accountability Act (HIPAA) and the Privacy Act.Qualifications/Knowledge/Skills/ExperienceNative-level mastery/fluency of both languages (English and target), especially:o An extensive vocabulary ranging from formal language to colloquialisms and slang.o Industry-specific vocabulary, including medical terminology, legal, insurance, etc.1-3 years of experience providing over the phone interpretation support.Demonstrated ability to work and communicate with the public.Trained and competent in healthcare and health insurance terminology in support of CMS’ consumers.Experience in all phases of language interpretation.Confident telephone voice for interpretation of inquiries received via telephone.Demonstrated strong listening and memory retention skills; relay information accurately, completely and succinctly.Demonstrated understanding of the role of the interpreter as a conduit to solve the problem and not as a problem solver.Ability to remain unbiased, objective, and impartial at all times.Information for Military ApplicantsSubmit your application with your most updated resume, if you have any questions feel free to send us an email.We are a proud employer of military personnel and veterans. We look forward to supporting your civilian career and transition, thank you for your service.StatementsLIS Solutions provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.LIS Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.Job Types: Part-time, ContractSchedule:Monday to FridayOn callEducation:High school or equivalent (Preferred)Experience:Interpretation: 1 year (Preferred)Medical Terminology: 1 year (Preferred)Language:Chinese Mandarin (Required)Cantonese (Preferred)Work Location:Fully RemoteThis Job Is:A job for which military experienced candidates are encouraged to applyOpen to applicants under 18 years old, provided it is legally allowed for the job and locationOpen to applicants who do not have a high school diploma/GEDA “Fair Chance” job (you or the employer follow Fair Chance hiring practices when performing background checks)A good fit for applicants with gaps in their resume, or who have been out of the workforce for the past 6 months or moreA good job for someone just entering the workforce or returning to the workforce with limited experience and educationA job for which all ages, including older job seekers, are encouraged to applyOpen to applicants who do not have a college diplomaA job for which people with disabilities are encouraged to applyWork Remotely:Yes

Company OverviewVan Wagner has been connecting brands to sports for over twenty years. Our parent company, Van Wagner Group, was the largest privately held out-of-home advertising company in the country, responsible for transforming Time Square and creating some of the most memorable advertising in the world. When Van Wagner first entered the sports landscape, we used our outdoor creativity and expertise to develop unique signage in live sporting events and creative new ways for brands to reach sports fans. We were best known for our highly visible home plate signage in Major League Baseball and courtside signage in the NBA and NCAA and for developing, the much acclaimed college football field goal net program.Since our early days in sports, we have grown well beyond our in–game signage roots. Today we offer a wide range of services across the sports landscape. We not only remain the worlds’ experts in TV-visible signage, but we are industry leaders in naming rights and sponsorship sales, stadium construction and development, media sales, collegiate multimedia rights, video production, ticket sales and various other aspects of the sports industry. What remains unchanged is our commitment to our clients and to providing creative solutions, exciting opportunities and delivering unprecedented results.Intern responsibilities will vary based on projects and are not limited to: Accounts Payable: Assist with processing invoices, setting up vendors, obtaining vendor W-9sGeneral Accounting: Journal entries, bank statement reconciliationAssists in month-end and quarter-end close activities and reporting processesAssists in audit preparationWhy this may be Interesting to YouThis internship aims to deliver a well-rounded experience by exposing the intern to relevant day-to-day Accounting operations. In addition, provides interaction with management level employees, and delivers learning opportunities that offer real world insights at the workplace.What You Will Bring to the RoleCurrent college student seeking school credit.College student with a concentration in Accounting/Finance.Prior experience is a plus.Ability to learn, adapt and provide his/her own unique perspective to task/projects.Excellent mathematical skills and strong Excel.Strong organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills.Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, InternshipPay: Up to $1.00 per yearSchedule:Monday to FridayWork Location:Fully RemoteInternship Compensation:College CreditCompany's website:www.vanwagner.comCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

About Blue Prism

Blue Prism is the global leader in intelligent automation for the enterprise, transforming the way work is done. At Blue Prism, we have users in over 150 countries in more than 1,800 businesses, including Fortune 500 and public sector organizations, that are creating value with new ways of working, unlocking efficiencies, and returning millions of hours of work back into their businesses. Our Digital Workforce is smart, secure and accessible to all; freeing up humans to re-imagine work.

To understand more about Blue Prism’s intelligent automation click here. You can also visit http://www.blueprism.com/ and follow us on Twitter @blue_prism, LinkedIn and Instagram @blueprismofficial. Or have a look at our YouTube page for further insights about Blue Prism.

About Blue Prism Cloud
Blue Prism Cloud, previously known as Thoughtonomy, delivers an artificial intelligence (AI) driven intelligent automation platform that enables organizations and the people they employ to do more and achieve more. A leading provider of intelligent, cloud-based automation, the company’s award-winning Software as a Service (SaaS) platform gives companies access to a pool of cloud based intelligent digital workers that can perform the repetitive, time-intensive tasks that slow people down. By integrating this digital workforce with their human teams, companies can accelerate growth and achieve a step change in efficiency. Blue Prism Cloud has grown at a rapid rate since being founded in 2013, with more than 200 customers using its platform in 29 countries spread across four continents. In 2019, Blue Prism acquired Thoughtonomy, to add the SaaS offering into its wider Connected-RPA portfolio. Visit www.blueprismcloud.com to learn more.
This is a remote role

About the Role
The SQL Engineer is part of the Platform Engineering team and is responsible for the automation, engineering and managing of the SQL Databases across our internal platforms and customer platforms. This role is largely home based, and reports to the Blue Prism Cloud Head of Platform operations.

Requirements
Manage Microsoft (Azure) SQL Server databases
Configure and maintain database servers and processes
Monitor system's health and performance and perform healthchecks
Ensure high levels of performance, availability, sustainability and security
Analyze, solve, and correct issues in real time
Provide suggestions for solutions
Refine and automate regular processes, track issues, and document changes
Assist developers with query tuning and schema refinement
Provide 24x7 support for critical production systems
Perform scheduled maintenance and support release deployment activities after hours


Skills and Experience
2+ years of experience as a SQL Server DBA or similar role
2+ years of experience with Performance Tuning and Optimization (PTO)
2+ years of experience with backups, restores and recovery models
2+ years of experience of High Availability (HA) and Disaster Recovery (DR) options for SQL Server
2+ years of experience with Windows server, including Active Directory
Critical thinker and problem-solving skills
Team player & Great interpersonal and communication skills
Appropriate Microsoft Windows and SQL Database certification
Benefits
Blue Prism is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of actual or perceived race, creed, color, religion, alienage or national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, disability or handicap, sex, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, arrest record or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.
Blue Prism is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Blue Prism via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Blue Prism. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Blue Prism as a result of the referral or through other means.

Text: ARCHITECTURAL SURVEYOR / 3D SCANNING SPECIALIST (NOT A LAND SURVEYING POSITION)Since 1992, Field Services Unlimited, (FSU) has been delivering architectural as-built surveys to retailers, architects, restaurant owners/franchisees, health care providers, financial service companies, and facility managers across North America. We provide the cornerstone for renovation and construction projects by precisely documenting existing conditions. We provide our clients with Revit and AutoCAD as-built drawings, site evaluations, customized architectural as-built and facility assessment surveys. Our surveys, facility assessments and site due diligence provides our clients with the information and confidence needed to make their facility renovations run smoothly. At FSU, we do everything within our power to ensure the job is done right, saving our clients time and money down the road.FSU is seeking to fill a full-time position for an Architectural Surveyor/3D Scanning Specialist. This position includes on-site documentation of existing conditions of commercial /retail spaces using a LeicaBLK 360 to create a point cloud. This individual will be fully trained to use the scanning equipment, however, previous experience in traditional architectural surveying is required.Surveyor Requirements – The successful candidate will have a general understanding of building construction, architectural drafting using AutoCAD, the ability to read construction documents and experience documenting existing conditions for commercial spaces. Timely communication with team members is critical in delivering complete and accurate survey documents within the scheduled deadline. This position will involve extensive weekday travel and occasional weekend travel. The ability and willingness to travel to all 50 states is a requirement of this positionQualifications: Deadline and detail-orientedProficient in AutoCADRevit knowledge a plusGeneral understanding of building constructionAbility to read and understand construction documentsTech-savvy – able to learn new technology quicklyCommunicates with team effectivelyTeam mentalityDenver area candidates preferred, however candidates living in other areas of the USA will be considered if they live within a reasonable distance to a major airport.Salary is dependent on experience.1355 South Colorado Blvd. Building C Suite 801  * Denver, CO 80222(303) 355-7274 (303) 355-3550 www.fsusurveyor.comJob Type: Full-timeBenefits:401(k)401(k) MatchingDental InsuranceHealth InsuranceLife InsurancePaid Time OffRetirement PlanSchedule:Monday to FridayExperience:Architectural Survey: 1 year (Preferred)Work authorization:United States (Required)Required travel:75% (Required)Application Question:Do you currently reside in the greater Denver, CO area?Work Location:On the roadWork Remotely:Yes

JobTitle: Sexual Assault Forensic Examiner (SAFE) - Per Diem
Text: TeleSAFEPosition: Sexual Assault Forensic Examiner (SAFE) - Per DiemMission StatementTeleSAFE provides comprehensive, compassionate care to survivors of sexual assault in New York. The program, which is delivered through telehealth, partners with NY State hospitals to train, support, or even conduct full exams (in partnership with the onsite nurses) 24/7/365. We work with a wide range of facilities all over the state, including large hospitals that simply need backup coverage or training, to rural hospitals with no existing SAFE program at all. We are a highly mission-driven organization and strongly prioritize a service-oriented and caring approach towards our hospital partners and the patients they serve.Principal Duties and ResponsibilitiesSexual assault forensic examiners serve in an on-call capacity. When our hospital partners call us, they may be seeking answers to basic questions, training support, partnership in completing exam, or seeking a SAFE to fully manage a case remotely. This position is expected to be able to provide compassionate, clinically competent, and prompt service to hospitals when they seek support.Take a minimum of two 12-hour weekday shifts per month and one 12-hour weekend shift per month, for 36 hours total per month. Weekend shifts are Friday at 7:00pm to Monday at 7:00am. Nurse examiners will be on-call at least one Holiday per calendar year.Complete a multidisciplinary clinical/operational/technical training with TeleSAFE's VP of Nursing.Complete 5 hours of continuing education annually on sexual assault and forensic examination best practices.Follow all company, state, and federal policies, procedures and protocols for sexual assault exams, including the National Protocol for Sexual Assault Medical Forensic Examinations Adults/Adolescents.Participate in ongoing quality improvement and evaluation processes with the TeleSAFE team.Maintain contact information for at least three years after contract ends for any reason, in order to facilitate testimony or other case follow up that may be legally required.RequirementsRegistered Nurse or Advanced Practice Nurse with active NY State licensureCompletion of Sexual Assault Forensic Examiner training (40 hours) at a recognized SAFE programThree years of experience as a SAFE Provider, with a minimum of 50 cases completed independentlyDOH Certification (NYSAFE); IAFN certification preferred, but not requiredCertified and experienced in treating patients of all ages, including pediatricUp-to-date knowledge on exam best practices, including testing and post exposure prophylaxisAwareness of and compliance with HIPAA at all times. Maintain a HIPAA-compliant and quiet environment to use while seeing patients.Demonstrate initiative, resourcefulness, and good judgment in executing the role and responsibilities of a SAFEComfort with technology and telehealth generally. Our digital colposcope is very easy to use but it is important that nurses feel competent and confident delivering care remotely. Extensive training is provided.Bilingual (Spanish/English) desired, though not requiredTrainingHeld at company headquarters in Troy, NY. Training is typically done over two days - one in person and one remotely.All training will be conducted remotely if COVID does not allow for safe in-person meetings. No travel is required for being on call and all company efforts are evaluated for COVID safety regularly.Additional InformationCompensation: The on-call rate for being the primary on-call nurse is $10/hour. The on-call rate for the backup nurse is $7/hour. During a patient case, each nurse is paid $100/hour.TeleSAFE is a program managed by UCM Digital Health, a fast-growing general telehealth company in Troy, NY.TeleSAFE is grant-funded through the support of and partnership with St. Peter's Health Partners Foundation and the NY State Office of Victim Services. This position is solely an employee of UCM Digital Health.Job Type: Part-timeSchedule:12 hour shiftOn callExperience:NY SAFE RN: 3 years (Required)Work Location:Multiple locationsCompany's website:www.telesafe.orgWork Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processPersonal protective equipment provided or requiredTemperature screeningsSocial distancing guidelines in placeVirtual meetingsSanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

Den of Geek is seeking a Design Intern to join the company. This person will primarily provide design and content production support by collaborating with our editorial, design, and social media teams.The ideal candidate is organized and detail-oriented, enthusiastic about and fluent in all major social media platforms, and all things entertainment. We're looking for a self-starter with excellent creative vision and communication skills. A passion for and knowledge of pop culture like TV, movies, comics, video games, and other forms of entertainment is a must. While our office is located in New York, you may work remotely.Timeline/Hourly Rate: The Design Intern position would be a part-time (15 hours/week) paid internship. The internship runs from approximately mid-January to mid-June with flexible start and end dates. Work hours are also flexible.Responsibilities include: Production and design of Google Web Stories project.Creating visual content across all Den of Geek platforms, especially Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.Read and watch Den of Geek content and find creative ways to adapt stories and videos to social media platforms.Share insights, and pitch post/video ideas.Requirements: Understanding of social platforms, and why content on those platforms become popular.Intermediate skill in copywriting.Ability to give feedback that helps to optimize content based on insights and analytics.Knowledge of Microsoft Office essentials (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and Google Suite equivalents (Docs, Sheets, Slides, etc.)Familiarity with Adobe Creative Cloud (Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere Pro, InDesign).Previous social media experience and/or editorial experience and familiarity with social media scheduling tools, familiarity with Photoshop and content management systems.To apply: Please attach a resume, portfolio, and a cover letter with ideas on how you can help improve the creative direction of Den of Geek.Job Types: Part-time, InternshipPay: $8.00 - $15.00 per hourExperience:Social Media Management: 1 year (Preferred)Marketing: 1 year (Preferred)Work Location:Fully RemoteInternship Compensation:PayCompany's website:https://www.denofgeek.comCompany's Facebook page:www.facebook.com/denofgeekusCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview process

The mission of BusySquirrels (https://busysquirrels.com/) is to develop a free, seamless, AI-powered platform to help online shoppers save money and time in the easiest way, by providing easy-to-use cashback, price tracking, real-time price drop and restock alerts and most intelligent cross-store price comparison.We invite a student to join us remotely as a UX/UI design intern. The working schedule is flexible and you may plan your work at your own pace without interrupting school courseworks. The internship schedule can be either weekdays or weekends. The internship opportunities are unpaid but can be used for academic credit.You will be able to work with and mentored by product manager with real-world business experiences and also by Columbia and MIT alumni who have years of software development experiences in tech companies. For students who would like to apply for graduate schools, we will write awesome recommendation letters for your good performance. Limited spots are available and please apply ASAP!Duties and ResponsibilitiesAs a UX/UI Engineer, you will be responsible for building and designing web pages and applications, analyzing user interfaces, and integrating user-friendly features into every design.Evaluate user requirements, in collaboration with product managers and engineers.Maximize the user experience by creating and designing friendly user interface layouts and web pages.Test and analyze the results to gauge the consumer’s experience.Analyze user data to identify areas needing improvement.Identify and troubleshoot UX problems.RequirementsFamiliar with online shopping assistant, cashback and deals websitesDesign or related majorExcellent critical thinking and problem-solving skillsGood written and verbal communication skillsKnowledge in web development languages: HTML, CSS, JavascriptBenefitsPractical experience with varied engineering business activitiesFlexible schedule for studentsJoin a high standard engineering teamGoal-oriented approachFlexible work environment and working from home friendly policyJob Types: Part-time, InternshipSchedule:WeekendsWork Location:Fully RemoteHours per week:10-19Typical start time:9AMTypical end time:5PMInternship Compensation:College CreditThis Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:Adaptable/flexible -- enjoys doing work that requires frequent shifts in directionDetail-oriented -- would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger pictureAutonomous/Independent -- enjoys working with little directionCompany's website:https://busysquirrels.com/COVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

As part of our Winter Internship Program, you would focus on supporting new brands and startups in their launch phases: product design, go-to-market strategy, business planning and budget, hiring process, marketing strategy.The BBG is a venture studio based in NYC, backed by the Founder of Shutterstock, supporting brands and entrepreneurs in their ideation, testing, launch and scaling phases. Executive Team composed of former eCommerce Director and Venture Capital Consultant working with NYC and international luxury and Fortune 500 brands.Great internship for students wanting to add a lot of material to their portfolio and enhance their resume with impactful professional projects.New-York City based, this internship could be led entirely remotely too.*WHAT WOULD YOU FOCUS ON AS AN INTERN?*- Ground up, creating core brand elements (logo, brand book, etc.)- Website/landing page design- Working with UX team, helping to design actual product (how the product looks, user dashboards, front-end design)- Directly involved in strategizing brand*WHAT PROFILE ARE WE LOOKING FOR?*- Strong eye for design- Ability to work independently but also quick to ask for help if needed- Desire to stretch their abilities, learn and grow- Focused on furthering career in graphic design- A portfolio representative of your style and work- Experience with Adobe After Effects, Sketch, Figma, Invision, Photoshop, Illustrator is Required- Experience with Motion Design is a big plusJob Types: Could be part-time or full-time Internship* Note: this is an unpaid internship but would validate College credits if need be.Please message me with a link to your portfolio and availability to chat this week.Thank you!GabeJob Types: Part-time, InternshipPay: $0.00 per hourBenefits:Flexible scheduleSchedule:Monday to FridayWeekendsWork Location:Fully RemoteCompany's website:In DevelopmentCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview process

Academic Credit: Offered upon the school department’s approvalOverviewThe Renew Democracy Initiative (RDI) is a non-partisan, not-for-profit organization dedicated to renewing and advancing the values of liberal democracy in the U.S. and around the world. We promote intellectual humility and an empathetic approach to disagreement.We have a small, tight-knit executive team, so interns will have the unique opportunity to learn all aspects of how to run an organization and make a personal impact on America’s democratic landscape. Because we are a start-up organization, interns should also be ready to play multiple roles as we have an “all hands on deck” mentality. All roles will have a mix of substantive and administrative responsibilities.Interns will have unprecedented access to our Board of Directors through our lunch & learns and other events—including renowned chess grandmaster & Putin critic Garry Kasparov, Senator Heidi Heitkamp, Lt. Col Alexander Vindman, Pulitzer Prize winner Bret Stephens, former head of the Republican National Committee, Michael Steele, and many others. Check out our website for more info!About the roleThis role will involve working on some combination of the below. Please review our social media presence (Facebook, Twitter, Linkedin, and Youtube) and website to get a sense of our existing content, especially our videos.Working on video conceptualization with our video team, executive team, and members of the Board of Directors;Assisting with video editing and production. This will involve a number of tasks, including but not limited to: splicing video clips together, locating b-roll, as well as placing b-roll within videos during production, finding appropriate music for videos, and subtitling videos;Working with the marketing team to create video content for social media campaigns;Assisting with the promotion of RDI video content;Creatively strategizing ways to generate positive publicity for RDI videos;Working on other special projects as needed.Qualifications of an ideal candidate: Exceptional undergraduates, graduate students, recent grads; or those with relevant & commensurate work experience are encouraged to apply;Knowledge of video editing and production is a must;Experience editing with Final Cut Pro and/or Premiere is required;Detail-oriented to a fault;Strong belief in RDI’s mission and values;Experience thinking through effective distribution of video content is a plus;Animation skills (e.g. Adobe Animate, Powtoon) is a plus;Knowledge of graphic design is a plus;Open-minded and willing to interact with those whom they may disagree with;Social, articulate, and a self-starter unafraid to take initiative.Logistics & BenefitsAn ability to work remotely due to the current crisis and, if/when it’s safe to return to the office, an opportunity to work at an exciting start-up with unlimited snacks, coffee, and other perks.Our internships last 3-6 months. Interns can either work full time (40 hours/week) or part time (25+ hours/week); but can be flexible depending on applicant’s circumstance;Hours are flexible and we are willing to work around your academic schedule;An opportunity to work closely with senior organizational leadership, including the Executive Director, as well as access to members of the Board of Directors, and other individuals from RDI’s extended network;This is an unpaid internship;A typical day could include spending a few hours executing on a video project; participating in a lunch-and-learn with a prominent political figure, a world champion poker player, or a business leader; coordinating with the Executive Team to edit a new project; and attending team meetings to conceptualize new video ideas.We will be recruiting on a rolling basis starting in March, but you may submit your application early to ensure that it will be considered. Please send a resume, brief cover letter (optional), and a portfolio of your vide/creative work with your application. Only complete applications will be reviewed.Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, InternshipPay: $0.00 per hourSchedule:8 hour shiftEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Work Location:Fully RemoteHours per week:20-2930-39Internship Compensation:College CreditThis Company Describes Its Culture as:Detail-oriented -- quality and precision-focusedCompany's website:https://rdi.org/Company's Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/groups/278692470057391

As Product Marketing Manager, you are a key member of our growing Product Marketing organization and will contribute to the success of ActionIQ’s Customer Data Platform. In this role, you will work cross-functionally with Sales, Customer Success, Product Management, and Demand Generation to drive product marketing activities that help grow ActionIQ’s market share within a competitive market space.
You will help to empower the strategy and execution of ActionIQ’s go-to-market initiatives, including through customer advocacy activities, creation of content supporting product positioning and industry trends, and increasing brand and product visibility through thought leadership activities. The ideal candidate is collaborative, communicative, and clearly versed in product and customer use cases. They should possess outstanding presentation and communication skills alongside strong product and customer use case knowledge.


The Team
Marketing at ActionIQ plays a critical role in our efforts to educate the market on the value of our solution, foster deep customer relationships and generate new business opportunities. We spend our time conducting market and customer research, writing thought leadership content and finding the best pathways to conversations with prospective customers. As a member of the team, you’ll join a fast-paced, results-driven group of marketers that are passionate about taking our product to the next level of growth.
One year from now you will
Work cross-functionally with our marketing team to build a set of marketing programs designed for our prospect and existing customer base. Partner with our sales and product analytics team to measure the effectiveness and lift of these programs.
Chart your individual growth plan for FY22 to continue growing your career at ActionIQ and share with the Chief Marketing Officer.
Continuously evolve your initiatives to meet the ever-changing needs of ActionIQ’s business and customer base.
Responsibilities
GTM: Develop go-to-market strategy, collateral, sales material, and competitive intelligence information to enable the success of sales and partnerships team members
Customer Advocacy: Build relationships with customers and develop advocacy initiatives to deliver high-value content and generate references, testimonials and case studies
Content: Produce and deliver high fidelity external-facing content including thought leadership, presentations, and more by partnering with internal design teams
Presentation: Develop and present content at industry conferences, internal and external partner trainings, analyst workshops, and other events
Demand: Work with demand generation team to develop proper messaging for campaigns and review ideas to drive lead generation activity
Awareness: Collaborate with PR, AR, corporate marketing, and events teams on thought leadership, messaging, and product announcements to drive awareness and demand
Requirements
3-5 years experience developing core product marketing and go-to-market materials (marketing clouds and/or CDP a plus)
Expertise in B2C enterprise marketing technology stack, first-party customer data and marketing use cases
Excellent written and presentation skills, including experience in client-facing discussions
Ability to implement and support project execution with minimal guidance amidst multiple priorities and goals
Proven track record of distilling complex concepts and crafting compelling positioning and thought leadership content
Hands-on ability to design and create a range of marketing assets, including pitch decks, one-pagers and more
Benefits
Work with a fun, inclusive, and smart team of people as we build a NYC-based enterprise software company!
Competitive compensation package, including significant equity component
Backed by top-tier VCs (Sequoia, Andreessen Horowitz, FirstMark Capital)
Top health insurance benefits
Currently remote with expectation to be back in office in 2021.
Work from Home stipend to optimize office set up
ActionIQ is committed to building an inclusive, equitable, and diverse organization. We embrace equal opportunity for all applicants and seek to foster a culture of belonging for our employees. We recognize and appreciate that the more inclusive we are, the better we will function as a team. AIQ welcomes qualified applicants of any race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or family status, disability, military veteran status, and any other status or background. Join us on our journey to build a product that will help our customers deliver memorable experiences that will drive loyalty and growth.
