Motion Graphics Artist, Video Franchises
McLean, VA, USA  New York, NY, USA  Washington, DC, USA Req #13660
 Monday, February 1, 2021
Gannett Co., Inc. (NYSE: GCI) is an innovative, digitally focused media and marketing solutions company committed to strengthening communities across our network. With an unmatched reach at the national and local level, Gannett touches the lives of nearly 140 million people monthly with our Pulitzer-Prize winning content, consumer experiences and benefits, and advertiser products and services. Gannett brands include the USA TODAY and more than 260 daily local newspaper brands, digital marketing services companies ReachLocal, WordStream, and ThriveHive and U.K. media company Newsquest. There's never been a better time to join our talented team. Visit Gannett.com/Careers to learn more about our opportunities, and visit Gannett Privacy Policy to understand our privacy policy.
Motion Graphics Artist, Video Franchises
The USA TODAY NETWORK seeks a Motion Graphics Artist to join its expanding video franchises studio. The team is responsible for creating brand-defining digital video series and special projects for an array of audiences and platforms.

The position is remote to start, but based at our headquarters near Washington, DC or at our NYC office, once conditions allow.

The candidate must have a proven artistic ability to create motion graphics packages, animated infographics, and other animations from scratch. Demonstrated experience creating premium digital content is essential and experience at an agency and / or production studio is preferred. This role is key in helping define the brand, look and feel, voice and tone, of our franchises.

We’re looking for a candidate who is excited to brainstorm and create new video storytelling techniques, someone with the unique ability to create motion graphics that seamlessly fuse with videos and lift overall storytelling. The right candidate will be a team player with excellent communication skills, quick to respond to requests and assignments, receptive to feedback, and a self-starter who can juggle multiple projects simultaneously.

The ideal candidate will have experience with lifestyle, entertainment, sports, and other content beyond news and information. You’re digitally savvy and comfortable crafting stories ranging from short and mid-form episodic to socially-fueled segments. You’ll be a key participant in content development, including storyboarding and piloting.

Responsibilities:
-Create motion graphics packages, infographics, animations, titles and other digital video elements for an array of audiences and platforms.-Design storyboards, pilots, and demos to help bring new franchise concepts to life.-Help create pitches and presentations for internal and external stakeholders.-Be immersed in video industry design and presentation trends to ensure our slate of franchises stays ahead of the curve.

Requirements:
5+ years of motion graphics experience at an agency, media organization or publisher.
Advanced proficiency with AfterEffects, Photoshop, Premiere and the Adobe Creative Suite production workflow.
Demonstrated talent in creating illustrations from scratch.
Excellent communications skills, online and in person.
Work collaboratively with a passionate and highly-motivated team of videographers, reporters, editors and producers.
Working knowledge of the best types of videos for variety of digital platforms, including YouTube, Instagram, Twitter, Facebook and OTT.
Editorial storytelling experience preferred.

*Application Instructions: Interested and qualified candidates, please apply here and upload your materials combined into one single document with as much of the following as possible: your updated resume, a brief cover letter explaining your interest and fit for the position, and your portfolio/clips/links to a few samples of your work. **It's important that these items be combined into a single document attachment/upload (preferably in PDF format). The application will only allow one document upload. Completing these steps will ensure that you receive the highest consideration.

Gannett Co., Inc. is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are a drug free, EEO employer committed to a diverse workforce. We will consider all qualified candidates regardless of race, color, national origin, sex, age, marital status, personal appearance, sexual orientation, gender identity, family responsibilities, disability, education, political affiliation, or veteran status.

JobTitle: Product Line Manager - Opportunity for Working Remotely New York, NY
Text:
VMware is a global leader in cloud infrastructure and business mobility. VMware accelerates customers’ digital transformation journey by enabling enterprises to master a software-defined approach to business and IT. With VMware solutions, organizations are creating exceptional experiences by mobilizing everything, responding faster to opportunities with modern data and apps hosted across hybrid clouds, and safeguarding customer trust with a defense-in-depth approach to cybersecurity.
At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Do you dare to do the stuff you’ve always dreamed about? Dare to explore at http://careers.vmware.com.

Team Description:
VMware SD-WAN is a business within VMware’s Networking & Security Business Unit and was named a Leader in the 2020 Gartner Magic Quadrant for WAN Edge Infrastructure and placed furthest on Completeness of Vision. VeloCloud simplifies branch WAN networking by automating deployment and improving performance over private, broadband Internet and LTE links for today’s increasingly distributed enterprises. Gartner introduced a new category – Secure Access Service Edge (SASE) which includes SD-WAN, Cloud Web Security, Secure Access and Cloud Firewall (FWaaS). VMware SD-WAN business unit is looking to expand into the SASE space with new product offerings.

Job Description
Within the VMware SD-WAN business unit, product management plays a critical role in successfully driving products into the marketplace by understanding the current market environment, product features/benefits, and developing a strategy for awareness of the benefits of VMware SD-WAN.
SD-WAN is a rapidly growing market and has market adjacencies with multiple products within VMware. VMware product managers lead cross-functional teams by promoting the vision for the product across the company. This also includes monitoring key performance indicators, understanding the dynamics of different routes to market, and influencing many teams towards common goals. As part of this, our team is looking for a product manager to focus on driving pricing and packaging strategy for existing and new product offerings.

Job Responsibilities Develop and execute pricing and packaging plans associated with our new offerings. Consider how to balance customer growth, revenue growth and margin growth Develop positioning and messaging related to our commercial offerings that resonates with our various routes to market Analyze the sales cycle and channel mix for specific products and solutions and formulate ideas and approaches to optimize packaging and selling Create sales tools and collateral (PowerPoint presentations, data sheets, white papers, customer case studies, demos, and training materials) as required by the field
Competitive pricing and packaging benchmarks

Qualifications
A B.S. in engineering or computer science, and preferably an MBA
 4+ years of experience in product marketing or product management for enterprise or service provider networking solutions. Exposure to Networking and Security is preferred.
2+ years of experience in Pricing and Packaging along with Financial modeling is preferred.
Cloud management and/or Service provider experience a plus
Proven analytical skills and strategic thinking. Demonstrated ability to develop creative / non-traditional solutions
Excellent written and verbal communications skills as well as proficiency in public speaking.
Self-starter and proven team leader in a high paced and achievement-oriented environment

Category : Marketing
Subcategory: Product Management
Experience: Manager and Professional
Full Time/ Part Time: Full Time
Posted Date: 2021-01-28
VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at VMware are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.

JobTitle: SEO Content Strategy Internships (VIRTUAL) - Publicis Health
Text:
Company Description

At Publicis Health, we are united around one purpose: to create a world where people are equipped and motivated to take control of their health. We transform healthcare marketing and communications into healthcare engagement.
We believe healthcare marketing is healthcare, fostering healthy conversations, healthy behaviors and healthy people. Publicis Health is a Dynamic Health Engagement Platform, an organizing principle that seamlessly connects data, content and technology; is driven by marketing and business transformation; and offers our clients fluid access to world-class talent and game-changing capabilities.
With 40 offices and 11 brands across the globe, Publicis Health’s worldwide staff is comprised of more than 3,000 healthcare professionals who are experts in advertising and branding, data and analytics, strategic planning, service design, digital media and technology, science, and medicine. Publicis Health companies include Digitas Health, Heartbeat, insync, Langland, Payer Sciences, PlowShare Group, Publicis Health France, Publicis Health Media, Razorfish Health, Saatchi & Saatchi Wellness, and Verilogue. For more information, visit us at www.publicishealth.com.
We know the power of interning with purpose….from home. This Summer 2021, start your marketing career in healthcare and intern with purpose! Don’t miss the opportunity to gain relevant industry experience from the safety of your own home.
For two consecutive years, Publicis Health’s award-winning internship program was recognized by WayUp as one of the top 100 internship programs in the United States. As part of our virtual internship program, our 60+ interns gain valuable hands-on healthcare marketing and communications experience from the comfort and safety of their homes. Interns participate in weekly virtual learning sessions and gain exposure to senior leaders across the Publicis Health network, as well as expand their network with other PH interns across the U.S. By the conclusion of our 9-week virtual program, our interns learn what it means to intern with purpose.

Job Description

Have you ever Googled something and wondered why some results show up on Page 1 and others on Page 5? That’s called Search Engine Optimization!
We are looking for a SEO Content Strategy Intern to act as a key support resource to the SEO team. You will assist the team with keyword research, competitive analysis, content optimization, recommendation QA and implementation/results analysis. We will teach you how to apply basic media principles to execute and manage a client’s online media campaigns, specifically in the healthcare space. You must demonstrate a strong work ethic, outstanding analytical skills, and a knack for converting insights into creative, impactful recommendations for our clients.
Key Responsibilities:
Understands basic mathematical concepts and computer skills/programs (including Excel).
Has an understanding of digital marketing, and has a basic grasp of high-level concepts of SE.
Solid writing skills
Coordinate with manager to understand clients’ SEO goals and client deliverables
Provide progress reports to managers as needed
Research keywords target audience utilized in search
Assist with SEO recommendations and reporting analysis
Help support established strategy for department and brand teams

Qualifications

Full-time rising junior or rising senior, currently enrolled at an accredited 4-year College or University
Enrolled in an undergraduate degree program that aligns with the position such as Advertising, Marketing, Communications or Analytics.
Legally authorized to work in the US
Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

We are looking for people who are remarkably creative, want to get their sleeves dirty, and want to have an overall good time. We are an early stage startup looking to find people to help us grow quickly and work closely with our backend team to help edit and build new screens onto our live app. We are built within react native and will only be choosing people who have extensive experience in this space.The role will include but is not limited to: Building screens and connecting them to our infrastructureTraining on state of the are Chainstarters CloudAbility to guide and build new features for our companyAssisting the CEO and design team on strategy and designWilling to be flexible and do anything neededRequired skills: trellogitnpmjavascript (min. 1000 lines of code)Basic HTMLFamiliarity with api callsReact Native (min. Create React Native App)For many people, once they start dating their partner they don’t put in the same amount of effort as they did initially. Once a couple succumbs to complacency the relationship has a tendency to stall, we want to help people avoid this phenomenon.In today’s modern world of technology, there are a plethora of applications which allow for an individual to seek companionship, yet there is nothing that helps them be a better partner and enhance their relationship or bond with their partner. Official is a new kind of application that allows users to easily engage more with their partner and rewards them for doing things they should be doing naturally.Official looks to fill the void that remains once the initial relationship is formed by building upon the foundation of a primary relationship, and looks to provide the greatest chance for a lasting and healthy relationship between users. By allowing users to remember important details, no matter how big or small, and create memories that will last a lifetime, Official exists as the perfect addition for any relationship.Our goal is not to help you find someone, but to make sure that you keep the person you are already with. We believe the best way to sustain a healthy relationship, is to #GetOfficial.At the end of the day, our company is about making people's relationships better one step at a time. If that interests you and you want to help out, apply. This is an exciting opportunity to originate, negotiate, and close debt and equity financing opportunities across the country. The candidate will be joining a fast-growing team of industry professionals, with the opportunity to grow within the company.ResponsibilitiesOriginate debt and equity deals across all asset classes and geographies  * Manage and maintain existing client relationships to generate future opportunities  * Run entire placement to closing process  * Manage and maintain existing client relationships to generate future opportunities  * Use Excel-based analytical functions including financial models, cash flow projections, valuation models, and sensitivity analysisQualifications3+ Years of experience and a proven track record of success in an origination and placement role  * Real Estate Sales Person License (can be obtained after employment, if necessary)  * Existing relationships and experience working with real estate principals or lenders  * Ability to pre-screen a transaction and client, prior to engagement with Leviathan  * Understanding and knowledge of general underwriting and capital markets  * Strong interpersonal skills and ability to interact confidently with clients and peers  * Strong written and verbal communication and presentation skills  * Aspiration and willingness to collaborate in a team-based work environment  * Commitment to personal and professional growthJob Type: Full-timePay: $0.00 per hourSchedule:Monday to FridaySupplemental Pay:Commission payEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Loan Origination: 1 year (Preferred)License/Certification:NMLS (Preferred)Work Location:Fully RemoteTypical start time:8AMTypical end time:6PMThis Company Describes Its Culture as:Detail-oriented -- quality and precision-focusedAggressive -- competitive and growth-orientedOutcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance cultureStable -- traditional, stable, strong processesPeople-oriented -- supportive and fairness-focusedCompany's website:Levnyc.comCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview process

Merchant UnderwriterFinMkt is a fast growing, New York-based financial technology company providing financial marketplace technology solutions to consumers, merchants/retailers, banks and alternative finance companies. Our industry-leading Gateway platform connects customer loan offer requests to relevant third-party loan offers in real-time. We have deep integrations with some of the world’s largest tech-enabled lenders who use our marketplace platform to present loan offers and also to monetize declined applications. From a cultural perspective, we believe that a team’s shared values are critical to success and are proud of our beliefs which center around: honesty, integrity, passion, teamwork and loyalty.If those values describe you (and you have permanently removed the words “impossible” and “can’t” from your vocabulary), then FinMkt is the place for you!The RoleFinMkt is seeking a Merchant Underwriter to join our hardworking and fast-paced digital solutions team. This motivated self-starter will support our Gateway solution by implementing and managing our merchant underwriting workflow which uses third-party data sources and in-house underwriting processes to approve merchants for participation on our customer financing platform. This dynamic and versatile individual will make a significant contribution to our soon-to-be launched merchant qualification and onboarding operation and will be able to rapidly assume a significant amount of responsibility.As an experienced merchant or small and medium-sized business underwriter, you will lead efforts to implement and manage business processes including automated merchant underwriting, risk scoring and onboarding activities. In this role, you will work with cross-functional teams to address both technical and operational challenges related to our merchant underwriting processes. Your responsibilities will include: underwriting process design and refinement, maintaining our merchant risk scoring algorithms and processes optimization and documentation. In this role, your wealth of industry and technical knowledge gained through prior work experience will be the key to your success in making our merchant underwriting process a competitive advantage.Promotes a team mindset and commitment to achieving success with a sense of pride for FinMkt and the FinMkt Gateway technologyPossesses strong understanding of SMB or merchant underwritingIs familiar with underwriting process design including the incorporation of third-party data tools (identification, fraud, etc.)Willing to roll up sleeves to understand and refine our merchant onboarding risk scoring modelPrepares system and process updates and presents senior management with clear strategies to adjust models and mitigate riskEnsures compliance in credit policies and underwriting proceduresExhibits a sense of urgency towards meeting client requests while also meeting acceptable risk parametersRequirementsBA in accounting, finance or business1-2+ years of experience in SMB and consumer credit underwriting technology design and implementationExperienced with underwriting or risk models for financial institutionsCollaborates effectively in cross-functional team environment and leading cross-functional teamsAbility to effectively and clearly communicate instructions to others, summarize and articulate issues, and document findings in a clear and concise mannerSelf-directed and self-motivated with demonstrated experience in providing ideas and solutions to further business understandingAbility to handle sensitive information with the highest degree of integrity and confidentialityHigh degree of personal and professional integrity – consistent, trustworthy, honest and fair in dealing with bank staff and clientsLocation: New York, New York but this position can currently be conducted remotely. The hours for this position include one weekend day per week with flexibility to take one week day off. FinMkt is an equal opportunity employer and will not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of age, color, disability, gender, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any classification protected by federal, state, or local law.Job Type: Full-timeCOVID-19 considerations:Currently, all FinMkt employees are working remotely.Education:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Fair Housing Regulations: 1 year (Preferred)Underwriting: 1 year (Preferred)Work Location:Fully RemotePay frequency:Every other weekPaid Training:YesManagement:Key LeaderEmployees working per shift:11 or moreThis Company Describes Its Culture as:Detail-oriented -- quality and precision-focusedOutcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance culturePeople-oriented -- supportive and fairness-focusedTeam-oriented -- cooperative and collaborativeCompany's website:www.finmkt.io

Argo Group International Holdings, Ltd. (NYSE: ARGO) is a global multiline underwriter of specialty insurance and reinsurance products in the property and casualty market. We help power the businesses that drive the world economy, offering a comprehensive line of high-quality products and services designed to meet the unique coverage and claims-handling needs of our clients. We foster an inclusive culture that embraces diversity and design thinking, relies on innovation and agility, promotes collaborative service delivery, frequent, integrated communication, and authentic recognition of excellence. View the latest Investor Presentation to learn more about Argo.
Underwrite new Excess Casualty business and renewals according to authority level and established guidelines for the Northeast Region. At Argo Group, we work together to serve specialty markets, focused on the success of each of our customers by offering specialty coverage through our subsidiaries. Our full line of high-quality products and services is designed to meet the unique coverage and claim-handling needs of our clients. Learn more about Argo here.

This Excess Casualty underwriter will service the Northeast and ideally will be located in that region. The position can be remote or aligned to an Argo office.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Review and price policies to verify acceptability based upon company underwriting guidelines and granted underwriting authority both primary and supported excess.
Utilize underwriting tools to determine accurate classifications, rates, and premium charges.
Interact in person, via email, and by phone with wholesale brokers to obtain further risk-specific details, negotiate terms and pricing, and explain company positions.
Manage assigned underwriting territory, including management of agents and travel to agent offices.
Oversee and approve endorsements as indicated.
Resolve premium audit disputes within assigned territory.
Review state laws, including cancellation and non-renewal, within assigned territory to properly transact business within the state.
Create, analyze, and interpret data from various reports.
Other duties as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor's degree or one to three years related insurance experience and/or equivalent combination of education and experience.
One to three years underwriting experience with authority, preferably in excess and surplus lines.
Strong oral and written communication skills.
Previous insurance educational work, IIA and CPCU desirable.
Detail oriented with initiative and the ability to work independently in a fast paced environment.
Ability to travel.
Excellent analytical skills.
Proficient in the use of computer programs, including Word, Excel, and Outlook.

PLEASE NOTE: At this time, Argo Group will not sponsor an applicant for employment authorization for this position.

If you have a disability under the Americans with Disabilities Act or a similar law and you wish to discuss potential accommodations related to applying for employment at Argo Group, please contact our Benefits Department.

To all recruitment agencies: Unless you have been requested to work on this position, or other positions with Argo Group, please do not forward any resumes to Argo Group employees. Argo Group is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
How We Work - Our Employee Values

Employees at Argo thrive together as a responsible, profitable specialty insurer where all stakeholders share in our success.

We are committed to:


The entrepreneurial spirit

Doing the right thing

Collaborating

Respecting each other


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, ancestry, color, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information, marital status, national origin or citizenship (including language use restrictions), denial of family and medical care leave, disability (mental and physical) , including HIV and AIDS, medical condition (including cancer and genetic characteristics), race, religious creed (including religious dress and grooming practices), sex (including pregnancy, child birth, breastfeeding, and medical conditions related to pregnancy, child birth or breastfeeding), sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or other status protected by laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We do not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics.


Our Benefits

Developing our employees professionally and personally strengthens our organization.

Argo Group offers an attractive Total Rewards package that includes:

A culture that recognizes performance and empowers employees to excel, offering competitive compensation and merit driven profit sharing.

Flexible workplace policies that support employee well-being include compressed hours, flex-time, job-sharing, remote work, sabbatical leave, holiday and summer hours.

Comprehensive health, wellness, and financial planning options that employees can tailor to meet their personal and family needs. In addition to traditional health and wellness plans, benefits include retirement savings, matching 401K, generous paid time off (PTO), paid caregiver and parental leave, employee assistance program (EAP), an employee stock purchase plan (ESPP) offering a 15% discount, and an array of voluntary benefits.

Argo Academy, a digital and instructor-led platform that offers continuous learning and professional development – Training magazine lists Argo among the Training "Top 125" Companies. Argo encourages career mobility and continuing education to pursue and maintain professional and industry designations, in addition to traditional university and higher education programs.

An inclusive culture that develops and sponsors diverse teams, encourages cross-functional engagement and collaboration, builds community through employee resource groups (ERGs), and provides an environment that welcomes ongoing dialogue, creative innovation, professional and personal development.

Active community outreach and volunteer programs in addition to matching charitable gifts by 150%.

A generous Employee Referral program that has resulted in 25% of all new hires this year.

I live in NYC in the lower east side. Let me know if you're comfortable with in-person or if you would rather work together remotely. I can swing both ways.

LIS, a Woman Owned Small Business, was founded in 1994 as an advanced innovative language service provider. Since then we have organically expanded into Cyber Security, Intelligence Analysis and Information Technology to support our customers with their rapidly evolving global enterprise-wide requirements.Whether sources are hostile, friendly or neutral, it is LIS’ mission to provide our customers with relevant and effective intelligence data that incorporates the full spectrum of the intelligence life cycle. LIS enhances our industry, government and military partners’ situational awareness through the collection, exploitation, analysis and dissemination of source data.Program OverviewLIS Solutions is seeking qualified candidates in support of The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) over the phone interpretation. Support to this effort is to accept and respond to inquiries from its Limited English Proficient (LEP) customer service population. The objective of this task order is to ensure customer service availability for its Limited English Proficient (LEP) populations and address inquiries for callers who prefer to receive customer service in language other than English through over-the-phone interpretation service. CMS requires accurate interpretations, high performance standards, and other important oversight and monitoring functions.Roles & ResponsibilitiesProvide telephonic interpretations for customer service inquiries in languages other than English. Telephonic interpretations may be from English to the target language or from the target language back to English.Shall be available within the agreed upon timeframe to receive and respond to inquiries.Answer calls with an average service level of 80% of calls answered within 30 seconds for connection with a live interpreter.Maintain the confidentiality of all interpretations and translations; protect the integrity of information with respect to Personal Health Information (PHI) and Personally Identifiable Information (PII) (personal health records, etc.) while handling calls, and adhere to all applicable Federal Privacy and Security acts, especially the Health Insurance Portability & Accountability Act (HIPAA) and the Privacy Act.Qualifications/Knowledge/Skills/ExperienceNative-level mastery/fluency of both languages (English and target), especially:o An extensive vocabulary ranging from formal language to colloquialisms and slang.o Industry-specific vocabulary, including medical terminology, legal, insurance, etc.1-3 years of experience providing over the phone interpretation support.Demonstrated ability to work and communicate with the public.Trained and competent in healthcare and health insurance terminology in support of CMS’ consumers.Experience in all phases of language interpretation.Confident telephone voice for interpretation of inquiries received via telephone.Demonstrated strong listening and memory retention skills; relay information accurately, completely and succinctly.Demonstrated understanding of the role of the interpreter as a conduit to solve the problem and not as a problem solver.Ability to remain unbiased, objective, and impartial at all times.Information for Military ApplicantsSubmit your application with your most updated resume, if you have any questions feel free to send us an email.We are a proud employer of military personnel and veterans. We look forward to supporting your civilian career and transition, thank you for your service.StatementsLIS Solutions provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.LIS Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.Job Type: Part-timeSchedule:Day shiftHolidaysMonday to FridayNight shiftOn callWeekendsExperience:Armenian< >English Interpretation: 5 years (Preferred)Medical terminology: 5 years (Preferred)Language:Armenian (Required)Experience:Over the phone Interpretation: 5 years (Preferred)Medical Interpreting: 5 years (Preferred)Language:Italian (Required)Work authorization:United States (Required)Work Location:Fully RemoteWork Remotely:Yes

New York State will hire and train a team of staff working remotely to support the NYS Department of Health (NYSDOH) and Local Health Departments (LHDs) to perform COVID-19 contact tracing in communities across NYS. The aim of this initiative will be to call every person diagnosed with COVID-19, establish all contacts of this person, and proceed to call and maintain ongoing communication with every contact. In addition, the team will support the isolation and quarantine of individuals, as appropriate in cooperation with the LHD. This includes virtual needs checks and referral to community resources as needed. This contact tracing initiative is in tandem with statewide-wide efforts to increase testing, improve communication and knowledge of effective strategies to reduce transmission, and implementation of isolation and quarantine. This will fortify efforts to control the pandemic in NYS.
The Team Supervisor will lead a team of approximately 20 Contact Tracers, who are working remotely, and one Community Support Specialist who will have the similar hybrid remote/central location-based presence as the Team Supervisor. Each team will be collectively responsible for working with the LHD to contact people diagnosed with COVID-19 and determine their contacts, helping make care plans for people with COVID-19 and their contacts, and maintaining communication and connecting contacts with various services (including social support structures, testing, clinical care, etc.). The team will provide education about COVID-19, on isolation, quarantine procedures and about relevant social services. The Team Supervisor is responsible for the leadership of team, tracking progress against target goals, providing direct supervision, oversight, and mentorship. The Team Supervisor will be the team’s point of contact with the LHD and NYSDOH structures. The Team Supervisor will also be expected to perform many of the daily functions of the Contact Tracer role, albeit at a reduced volume.
Supervise a team of approximately 21 people that collectively performs all functions of the Contact Tracing Initiative.
Coordinate the team's schedules and provide daily remote supervision and troubleshooting.
Escalate issues from the team to local health department or regional DOH office point of contact, brainstorm and implement solutions.
Communicate any process changes or new instructions to the team as appropriate.
In consultation with the Case Investigator at the LHD, act as primary point person to call people with a positive diagnostic test for COVID-19, provide support and information about the disease and gather information including contacts.
Triage and coordinate next steps for communication with and care for individuals the person has been in contact with including possible isolation or quarantine.
Perform phone calls as needed, including to contacts who have been exposed to COVID-19, to places of business, health care providers, or other community-based locations where a COVID-19 positive patient has visited, and to refer patients and their families to different social services.
Track daily and weekly progress for the team including cases contacted successfully, contacts tracked and monitored, and patients and contacts referred to social support systems.
Perform quality assurance through listening in on calls or to recordings of calls and providing feedback to team as well as participating in quality improvement conversations with supervisors.
Liaise with partners and stakeholders at the LHD, NYSDOH and local community.
Maintain daily contact with supervisor.
The position is considered temporary with an expected duration through Aug 2021 with the possibility to extend as needed.

The contact center will operate 7 days a week between the hours of 8am and 8pm. Evening and/or weekend work will be required.

#LI-TM1
Minimum Qualifications:
A minimum of a bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience (minimum of 4 months experience with the NYS Contract Tracing Initiative) is required.
LPN or RN NYS licensure is preferred. Experience in clinical medicine and/or public health a plus.
At least one year of experience with the supervision of staff; experience leading remote staff and/or in a complex environment would be a plus
Experience in a health, human service, or community-based organization, or institutional setting is strongly preferred. Must be a NYS resident.
Ability to speak, read, and write English clearly and concisely. Fluency in a second or multiple languages would be a plus.
Employment is contingent on completion of a background check by NY State.
Own telephone, computer, wireless internet (WiFi) and electronic equipment. ( A partial reimbursement to maintain unlimited phone and data access will be provided.)
Must have access to a working PC with Windows 10, Antivirus Protection: Windows Defender and Windows Firewall; or Mac with Apple OS X 10.13, Antivirus Protection: Sophos; and personal mobile device to use for this job.
A headset is preferred.
Preferred Skills:
Ability to exhibit a professional, positive attitude and independent work ethic.

Excellent interpersonal skills required and ability to interact professionally with culturally diverse individuals during a time of crisis and distress.

Ability to show empathy to distressed individuals and assist with identifying solutions to problems identified.

Excellent organizational and communication skills.

Critical thinking and sound judgment required.

Ability to handle confidential information with discretion and professionalism.

Proficiency with computers including data entry into electronic tracking systems and running summary reports.

Internship Description:

Discovery's development teams generate ideas for great content internally as well as take pitches from external partners that follow each network's brand guidelines. They greenlight shows and series and partern with production, marketing, scheduling, publicity, etc. to bring their vision to the viewer's screen.

As a Development Intern, your adventure could lead you to work on projects and tasks such as:
Research new ideas and stories as well as casting for new characters in specific regions and content spaces.Attend pitch meetingsInternet research, phone calls, phone interviews, writing, Skype interviewing, attending local shoots, reviewing footageAssist with internal development and production meetingsDrafting treatments/pitch materialsGain exposure to development pipeline reporting, tape dubbing and related researchKeeping track of competitive networks and what they're developing

Although our summer internship program will be completely remote (students can apply from anywhere), please be aware that this intern will report into a New York City based manager and therefore should expect to work on eastern standard time.
Requirements:
Must be currently enrolled as a student (proof of enrollment will be required if selected for an internship)Must be a rising Junior, Senior, or Graduate studentMust have at least a 3.0 GPAMust have the legal right to work in the United States.Knowledge of video editing
More About the Intern Program:

Discovery’s internationally recognized intern program attracts the country’s boldest and brightest students for a paid, for-credit, real-world work experience in the entertainment and media industry.

Like other Fortune 500 companies, we believe in immersing our students in all aspects of our business, giving them first hand experience working for the global leader in real life entertainment. So what sets us apart? We’re passionate about investing in our interns- both personally and professionally. Whether our program is in-person or remote, every semester is packed with speaker sessions with executives, LinkedIn profile reviews, recruiter panels, roundtable events and professional seminars- and that just scratches the surface.

Think our program sounds pretty awesome? Our former interns thought so too! This year, we were voted into Vault’s 2021 internship rankings for best overall internships, best media and telecom internships, best sales and marketing internships and best internships for diversity.

Ready to learn more? Here’s what we offer:
Mentorship from some of the industry’s kindest and most passionate entertainment veterans
Professional development seminars, panels with recruiters and former interns, intern-exclusive events, and so much more
Access to top level executives and employees through our Speaker Series and Roundtables
Incredible networking opportunities and a robust intern alumni network
A creative, collaborative and inclusive company culture

What you can expect to take away from the semester:
Opportunity to develop professionally and uncover skills you didn’t know you had
The insider scoop on the TV industry and what happens behind the scenes
Relationships that will go beyond your collegiate career
Real life experiences that will provide you with the confidence to delve into your next adventure
And finally, what to know before applying:
We offer 12 week spring and summer opportunities
Our Summer 2021 program will be fully remote- the program will run from June 2-August 20.
The application deadline for Summer 2021 is March 19th. After this date, we cannot guarantee your application will be reviewed for the position.
Our internships are paid opportunities. Credit is not required; however, we will provide necessary documentation for school credit if desired.
We do not require a cover letter- please do not submit one. Instead, demonstrate your passion for the position through your resume and interviews.
Interviewing will take place from February through mid-April. A Discovery Intern team member will contact you if your experiences and interests match an open internship position. Due to the high volume of applications, we are unable to give individual status updates.

JobTitle: Temporary to Hire Trust Administration Clerk (REMOTE)
Text:
DESCRIPTION
Temporary to Hire Trust Administration Clerk

Network ESC A Division of Network Temps, Inc. New York, New York, United States

Save

Apply

Top financial services firm in the Wall Street district, NYC is offering an opportunity for a highly motivated entry-level Trust Administration Clerk. THIS IS A TEMP-TO HIRE POSITION! The hourly pay rate is $20.00 and the annual base salary upon conversion will be $50-60K + bonus (non-exempt). There will be EXTENSIVE overtime in the role (15-25 hours week paid at time + 1/2 or $30.00/hour). Potential to gross $1500+/week! This position will begin as a remote arrangement, however the company will be bringing employees back on once the public health impact of Covid is deemed under control.


The Trust Administrator I is responsible for servicing and maintaining existing relationships with investment management clients, trust clients, beneficiaries, and other interested parties in partnership with the accounts' designated trust officer.


Primary Accountabilities

 Serve as additional point of contact for existing clients in partnership with the assigned relationship manager.
 Handle a wide range of client requests, responding with updates, reports, confirmations, etc.
 Create, edit, and execute detailed email messages to clients regarding account information
 Ongoing telephone contact with clients regarding account status
 Maintain client data integrity as well as perform updates in the system on accounts/movements
 Maintains contact with existing clients, beneficiaries, and referral sources to deliver agreed upon services, address customer inquiries and resolve servicing issues.
 Represents the Bank in community activities and industry organizations to enhance the Bank's image.
 Interpret trust documents and client account agreements.
 Exercise judgement in determining how to process client requests.
 Make recommendation for fiduciary approvals by Trust Officer or Committee.

 General knowledge of investment products and ability to communicate basic investment information to clients.
 Ability to read and interpret trust and legal documents.
 Ability to meet time constraints without constant supervision
 Professionalism and courtesy in dealing with customers and bank employees.
 Ability to articulate ideas concisely and work in a dynamic and fast past environment.
 High degree of accuracy with attention to detail required
 Strong computer skills – must have strong proficiency with MS Excel.
 Proficiency with trust accounting systems preferred.


Competencies/Other Skills:
Building and Mending Relationships
Selecting, Developing, Accepting People
Participative Management
Change Management
Decisiveness with Insight
Influencing, Leadership, Power
Leading with a Purpose
Self-Management, Self-Insight, Self-Development
Coping with Pressure and Adversity - Integrity
Seeks and Uses Feedback
Acts on behalf of the customer


Qualified candidates please email CV and Cover letter to evp@networkesc.com

New York, NY, USA

JobTitle: Institutional Sales Manager, Proprietary Trading Coverage
Text:
What is BlockFi?

BlockFi’s mission is to provide liquidity, transparency, and efficiency to digital financial markets by creating products that meet the needs of consumers and corporations across the globe. We build bridges between traditional finance and digital markets that enable growth for all.

About the Role

We’re looking for a Sales and Relationship Manager to help us launch into our next phase of growth. You’ll join our Institutional team and support our relationship management efforts, developing deep and fruitful connections with institutional partners. This role will focus on Exchanges and Proprietary Trading Firms. The role could be based in either Chicago or New York.

If you’re excited to join a highly innovative and motivated team working to bridge the gap between new tech and institutional finance, we’d love to hear from you!

Responsibilities

Significantly grow our Institutional Revenue
Manage Institutional Relationships
Originate new institutional clients and identify new business opportunities
Understand the challenges of our institutional clients and assess the activities of our competitors to proactively satisfy and retain our clients

Qualifications

6+ years of experience in a sales origination role, preferably in prime brokerage, high frequency trading, FX or commodities
Large network of proprietary trading firms with a record of long-lasting and productive relationships
Proven ability to manage the complete sales process from prospecting to closing with an ownership mentality
Interest in crypto currencies and enthusiasm about BlockFi’s products and business model
Ability to represent the company’s culture and values to our institutional counter-parties
Inclusive team player attitude
Start-up mindset

Why BlockFi?

BlockFi has experienced incredible growth since our launch in August 2017. From raising over $100MM in debt and equity capital to helping thousands of clients (and growing!) do more with their crypto assets, we have established a dominant position as the debt and credit crypto market leader in the U.S. As we expand our product suite and geographic footprint, our addressable market will grow exponentially.

BlockFi's leadership team has decades of experience in the traditional financial services and banking world, and we take a conservative approach to regulation that will position us well for sustainable long-term growth and expansion.

Our team is comprised of highly motivated professionals from diverse backgrounds. We are aiming to become the leading lender in crypto and are poised to redefine the global financial ecosystem for the better. In addition:

BlockFi is one of the first companies to ever offer crypto-backed loans and the only company whose founding team has an institutional understanding of the debt capital markets and regulatory landscape in the U.S.
$4.3MM of seed funding and $50MM in capital for funding loans
$100 MM of Series A, B, and C funding led by Valar Ventures with participation from Susquehanna, Winklevoss Capital, Fidelity, Galaxy Digital, Akuna Capital, and Morgan Creek
We are moving quickly and have already deployed substantial capital into the space, proving our ability to execute and capture customer demand

We Offer

Competitive salary
Unlimited vacation / sick days
Employer paid health coverage (vision, dental, 401K)
Weekly lunch stipend
Work alongside an enthusiastic, collegial, and driven team in a highly meritocratic environment

To read more about our mission and values, check out our company website.

Above all, you should enjoy the journey. We, at BlockFi, genuinely like each other and enjoy the work we do - so should you!

Though we are operating fully remotely while we navigate the current public health climate, this role will ultimately be located in our downtown Manhattan office or remote in Chicago with access to investor work space.

Affirm is reinventing credit to make it more honest and friendly, giving consumers the flexibility to buy now and pay later without any hidden fees or compounding interest.
We're looking for an exceptional team member to join Affirm's Capital Markets team! Affirm Capital is responsible for structuring, negotiating, and executing a critical part of Affirm's revenue strategy. As a Capital Markets Lead, you will build and own a significant portion of the platform's funding strategy which drives Affirm's ability to scale its consumer point-of-sale lending business - this is a complex role essential to the functioning of a consumer finance and payments platform. The ideal team member will have strong technical and interpersonal skills and the desire to work closely with both internal and external stakeholders.

What you'll do

Develop a strong understanding of Affirm's business from a unique perspective and learn how Capital Markets fits into broader corporate initiatives
Play a meaningful role in developing and executing on Capital Markets strategy, including owning significant components of live transactions
Own deal processes from start to finish, including structuring, negotiation, documentation, and execution
Take charge of communication with Engineering, Product, Commercial, and Credit/Risk teams to drive scale for Affirm's capital platform and funding strategy
Help build and manage relationships with existing and potential investors
Given this role will require significant interaction with external stakeholders, including investors, outside counsel, ratings agencies, and investment banks, we are looking for individuals with outstanding communication skills and are adept at conveying the firm's capital strategy to sophisticated counterparties.

What we look for

3-6 years in structured finance, fixed-income investing, trading, private equity, consulting, or product/strategy roles.
Ability to reason through first principles and think outside of the box
High level of humility and ability to own mistakes
Experience with SQL or Python is a plus, but not required
Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail
Humility and a strong desire to learn and grow
Clear alignment with Affirm's core values
Location

We're excited to announce that Affirm is now a remote-first company! The majority of our roles can be accomplished anywhere in the U.S. and Canada (with the exception of Quebec). While most Affirmers will have the option to choose a remote-first accommodation, our offices in San Francisco, New York City, Pittsburgh, Chicago, and Salt Lake City will remain operational and accessible for anyone to use on a voluntary basis. This role requires you to live within reasonable access to a particular office in order to fulfill certain job responsibilities.
Check out our remote-first approach to learn more about the new ways we work.

If you got to this point, we hope you're feeling excited about the job description you just read. Even if you don't feel that you meet every single requirement, we still encourage you to apply. We're eager to meet people that believe in Affirm's mission and can contribute to our team in a variety of ways – not just candidates who check all the boxes.

At Affirm, "People Come First" is a core value and that's why diversity and inclusion are vital to our priorities as an equal opportunity employer. You can read about our D&I program here and our progress thus far in our 2019 D&I report.

We also believe "It's On Us" to provide an inclusive interview experience for all, including people with disabilities. We are happy to provide reasonable accommodations to candidates in need of individualized support during the hiring process.

We will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws, including the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. By clicking "Submit Application," I acknowledge that I have read the Affirm Employment Privacy Policy, and hereby consent to the collection, processing, use, and storage of my personal information as described therein.

Text: Company descriptionSociomix is an online platform where you can find inspiration and create new ideas.At Sociomix we believe that everyone has a unique sense of individuality. We all have ideas and perspectives that belong to us and that's what we promote. There has been a time when you have had different views and opinions about various topics that you care about, may it be in the field of fashion, lifestyle, entertainment, relationships, and more, but you were totally unheard. We give you the voice and freedom by providing you a platform to post whatever crosses your mind in your own Diary and reach out to our global community in the matter of a click.Our goal is to connect you with intellectuals across the globe, learn from them, get exposure to creative mindsets from different cultures and regions, and feel empowered to express yourself. Your single post can spark a global movement.Job descriptionWe are looking to hire interns, train them, and then work on a live project (goal-oriented) where they will be writing featured content on Sociomix.Training Details -As a content writer, it is very important to have a complete understanding of what it takes to write viral content, that can produce organic reach over time and can rank well on search engines like google, bing, yahoo search, etc.Before you start writing content on Sociomix, we will cover all the concepts related to building viral content, choosing the right titles, social media marketing, and various other topics listed here - https://www.sociomix.com/en/trainingLive Project -As part of the live project in the internship, you will have to choose a trending topic of your interest in categories like Fashion, Lifestyle, Entertainment, Beauty, DIY, Wellness, Relationships and more. SMB Capital, in a “JV” (joint venture) with Kershner Trading Group in NYC, is looking for experienced US Equities Traders with a strong track record, who seek capital and technology to build their trading business while maintaining the autonomy of working from a remote location while being connected to a team of high performing traders. Our technology will help you play more offense and make more PnL: proprietary execution platform, custom filters, single stock scripts and automated trading.

The SMB Capital - Kershner Trading Group JV provides all capital and a PnL firm infrastructure to traders, who actively trade stock instruments in financial markets. Traders share the profits from their trading activity with the firm. Each trader sets their own style and strategy, but in general, traders buy and sell in U.S. equity, options, and futures markets on both a manual and automated basis. Compensation in this role is based fully on an individual trader's performance.
The JV provides unique opportunities to talented, energetic people, rooted in the philosophy that everyone can do more than they realize if they try. The JV empowers independent thinkers who have the discipline to set long-term goals, the adaptability to “shift gears” but still stay on course, and who are open to being both a student and teacher in a learning organization.

In short, the Remote Trader role is a chance to join a high-performance team of:

•
experienced traders pushing their skills and adapting to new market opportunities;

•
talented technology professionals developing leading-edge trading and market analytics systems;

•
quantitative/business analysts providing tools and insights to fuel business growth;

•
top-notch support staff who keep everything humming and meet all challenges in a cool, casual atmosphere.

Our JV is currently seeking candidates who are excited about the prospect of pushing their own professional limits. Think you can do more? What are you capable of?

JobTitle: Virtual HBO Max Content Strategy Intern, Summer 2021
Text:
Virtual HBO Max Content Strategy Intern, Summer 2021
Location New York, New York
Business: Turner
Position Type: Intern
Job ID 179624BR
Summer 2021 Virtual Intern – HBO Max Content Strategy

The WarnerMedia Story
WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Now, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.

The Team
Content Strategy for HBO Max is the team responsible for identifying, researching, and qualifying potential content for SVOD service HBO Max. Team evaluates needs and opportunities of series, movies, and short form content.

The Daily
Catalog and categorize existing inventory for HBO Max and assist in preparing inventory for integration into new software.
Support team in preparing executive summaries for VPs and SVPs.
Follow industry news with an emphasis on emerging technology and short form content.
Research potential deal content and ancillary business opportunities.
Occasionally screen potential acquisitions and evaluate for brand and audience fit for HBO Max.

The Essentials
Passion for the television, streaming, and media landscape.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Positive attitude and work ethic in fast-paced environment.
Strong organization skills and attention to detail.
Major or focus in media, television, communications, or business.
Ability to self-motivate and manage time on their own in a virtual work environment.

Students must be currently enrolled in a college degree program for full duration of the internship.
Summer 2021 program dates are June 7th - August 13th; must be available for full program duration.
Full-time schedule (40 hours/week) designed to work around class schedule.
Fully remote/virtual experience; company owned laptop provided for the duration of the internship program.
Salary based on office location; relocation is not provided.
This position is targeted toward upperclassmen undergraduate students.

Hands-on work with passionate, talented team members in your field
Networking opportunities with industry-leading professionals
Engaging events including executive speakers sessions, professional development workshops, and more
Opportunity to join the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands

Interested in helping us change the world of payments forever? The Stellar Development Foundation is looking for someone to join our ecosystem team as a Developer Relations Associate. We’re looking for someone interested in blockchain and open-source technology who is curious, technical, organized, and a great writer.
In this role, you will define and create tools, processes, and content to engage developers and enterprises building on Stellar. You will work with every single department inside SDF — as well as external partners and ecosystem participants — to help figure out and explain what it is we’re doing, and why. Your goal: to help realize the network’s potential.
Among other things you will:

Write and maintain developer and API docsCollaborate with SDF developers on tutorials, blog posts, and reference apps and APIsManage, announce, and explain Stellar-network releasesParticipate in community forums and developer support queuesEvaluate, advise, and advocate for third-party projects built on StellarGenerate tons of content
You have:
2+ years real-world experience in developer management, business relations, or technical writing
An understanding of web technologies such as TCP/IP, HTTP, JSON, and REST
Proficiency with at least one programming language such as JavaScript, Go, C++, or Python
The ability to participate in technical discussions and explain technical details to non-technical people
A way with words
You are:
Interested in blockchain and emerging financial technology
An independent thinker, willing to float new ideas, and unafraid to ask obvious questions
Capable of hitting a deadline and, conversely, getting things done when there isn’t one
Results driven and skilled working in an environment with dynamic objectives
Logical, a strong problem solver, and a fast learner
An expert at crossing finish lines and bringing order to chaos
Someone who finds time to write, no matter what
About Stellar
Stellar is a decentralized, fast, scalable, and uniquely sustainable network for financial products and services. It is both a cross-currency transaction system and a platform for digital asset issuance, designed to connect the world’s financial infrastructure. Dozens of financial institutions worldwide issue assets and settle payments on the Stellar network, which has grown to over 4 million accounts.
About the Stellar Development Foundation
The Stellar Development Foundation (SDF) is a non-profit organization that supports the development and growth of Stellar, an open-source network that connects the world’s financial infrastructure. Founded in 2014, the Foundation helps maintain Stellar’s codebase, supports the technical and business communities building on the network, and serves as a voice to regulators and institutions. The Foundation seeks to create equitable access to the global financial system, using the Stellar network to unlock the world’s economic potential through blockchain technology.

We look forward to hearing from you!

A New York City services company is currently seeking an experienced Marketing professional to join their staff Remotely as their new Content Marketing Manager. In this role, the Content Marketing Manager (Remote) will be responsible for defining the company’s presence across earned and owned media, social media, email, and sales enablement materials by helping to educate key audiences, drive demand, and increase revenue.

Responsibilities:
The Content Marketing Manager (Remote) will:
Drive the high-quality, high-velocity production of content, including blog posts, podcast and video scripts/storyboards, white papers/e-books, customer case studies, thought leadership pieces, marketing emails, etc.
Create and edit content to target, reach, and nurture different prospect, client, and member audiences
Collaborate with internal stakeholders and subject matter experts to identify compelling stories, create educational materials for a variety of audiences, and establish new pathways for the collection and promotion of content
Partner with Clinical Operations to distill medical journal articles and complex benefits information into engaging content pieces that educate Carrot members about fertility care and family-forming services
Manage external agencies and freelancers to ensure a regular publishing cadence and consistent voice, style, and tone across all mediums and pieces
Partner with internal teams and agencies to effectively optimize and distribute content (through social media, organic search, paid placement, email campaigns, etc.)
Manage social media strategy and execution
Report on content effectiveness, using metrics to refine content strategy and copy and partnering with the growth team in testing

Qualifications
3+ years of Marketing experience
Bachelor's Degree in a related field
Fluency with Social Media, Content, SEO, and Email Marketing tools, such as Buffer and Marketo
Comfort with the ambiguity inherent in a fast-paced startup environment

ABOUT SEO

We Propel Human Potential. SEO is an educational non-profit focused on improving outcomes for students that come from underserved and historically underrepresented backgrounds. For over 50 years, SEO has been an innovator in education, mentorship, and creating educational programs and opportunities that maximize the full potential of our students. We are on a mission to create an ecosystem of excellence for the students we serve!

ABOUT HIGH SCHOOL SCHOLARS

SEO Scholars is a free eight-year academic program that gets low-income public high school students to and through college–with a 90% college graduation rate. In high school, we offer intensive year-round academic preparation via a carefully-calibrated, rigorously-assessed course of supplemental education. Scholars also receive one-on-one mentorship, enrichment opportunities, SAT prep and strategy courses, tutoring, and individualized guidance through the college application and admissions process. (Learn more here: SEO Scholars)

POSITION OVERVIEW AND RESPONSIBILITIES

The 9th Grade Program Manager position has a mix of student-facing and strategic responsibilities, perfect for someone looking to work one-on-one with students and use their talents to yield organization-wide impact. The 9th Grade Program Manager helps lead the execution of a Recruitment & Admissions strategy, including owning a portfolio of schools throughout NYC; developing special initiatives that support marketing, communications, partnerships, outreach; and project managing the admissions process to build a competitive class that meets target goals.

From March to June, 9th Grade Program Managers work directly with incoming Scholars to provide individualized guidance and support and implement quality advisory programming with effective intervention strategies to successfully meet student outcomes. As key players in the onboarding process for incoming Scholars, 9th Grade Program Managers set the foundation for critical habits, knowledge, and mindsets that allow Scholars to effectively leverage the opportunities offered at SEO Scholars. Reporting to the Assistant Director of Recruitment and Admissions, the position is part of a 7-person team that includes three Program Managers, a Recruitment Manager and two Recruiters/Program Assistants who provide additional capacity and support during high volume seasons.

Recruitment (40%)

In coordination with Program Managers and Recruitment Manager, lead, track and execute a recruitment strategy for the program including identifying flags for the team and proposing solutions to keep results on track.
Independently manage a portfolio of NYC public schools, including school partner relationship management; facilitate recruitment presentations and application workshops; and provide individual support to prospective applicants. Successful management of recruitment portfolios should result in meeting target application numbers and demographic goals and fostering school partner relationships.
Develop and lead the implementation, tracking, and iteration of special initiatives to expand marketing, communications, and outreach to support overall Recruitment strategy.

Admissions (30%)

In coordination with all 9th Grade Program Managers, project manages the admissions strategy and timeline to ensure timely execution of key milestones, sustainable documentation of processes and data, and the successful selection of a competitive incoming class.
In coordination with all 9th Grade Program Managers, develop, refine and lead staff training sessions and materials for every stage of the admissions processing including application reviews, student interviews, deliberation and orientation to ensure standard and equitable admissions processes.
Review incoming applications and make recommendations for advancement in the admissions process
Facilitate interviews for prospective Scholars on Saturdays from December to February.
Facilitate deliberation sessions with the team and work with senior staff to select the final class
Develop content, coordinate across teams and facilitate engaging and informative orientation sessions to ensure successful execution of Orientation for parents/families and students

Programming (30%)

Successfully onboard incoming Scholars class by providing individualized guidance and support and implementing quality advisory programming to meet target retention, attendance, and assignment completion goals
Translate data from Recruitment & Admissions cycle to strategically advise and support students through their first semester in the program
Hold all Scholars to high expectations, establishing a culture of growth mindset, belonging, utility value and self-efficacy, during Saturday and after school programming from March to May
Track progress and manage qualitative and quantitative data to make evidence-based decisions to improve Scholar performance and engagement, including making recommendations and ensuring that Scholars successfully follow through with additional supports and services
Lead effective and supportive instructor/Program Manager check-ins that yield concrete support plans for at-risk Scholars
Develop and refine advisory content, including whole group, small group, and one-on-one advising content based on feedback from assigned cohort and in collaboration with the larger team
Lead effective transition meetings with the 10th-grade team to support a successful transition of Scholars between grade levels

QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s degree required; Master’s degree preferred
Experience teaching in a public/private middle or high school for 2+ years (teaching experience in a NYC public high school highly preferred)
Experience in a fast-paced, dynamic start-up and/or entrepreneurial environment is highly preferred
Ability to work a Tuesday through Saturday schedule and some nights as dictated by programming needs
Strong communicator and writer, including the ability to effectively present in front of a room of 250+ Scholars
Intermediate to advanced Excel skills and experience working with databases ( i.e. Salesforce, Zegine etc.)

DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Demonstrated passion for closing the achievement and opportunity gap on the high school and college level for first-generation and under-served students
Data-driven and results-oriented with an unquestionable commitment to high-quality work
Ability to conduct difficult conversations with Scholars and families to give honest, productive feedback
Excellent interpersonal skills and a high level of professionalism
Bilingual Spanish/English is highly preferred

WORKING CONDITIONS

This is a full-time exempt position

Standard work week:
Fall Term: Monday through Friday
Spring Term: Tuesday through Saturday (3x a month); Monday through Friday (1x month)
Summer Term: Monday through Friday
This is an event-heavy position - managing sessions, workshops and special events with external partners is a near daily responsibility in addition to 1:1 student and family meetings as needed.
Work requires traveling to different physical locations for recruitment in the fall and weekday and Saturday programming in the spring
Currently a remote position – subject to change post COVID

COVID Update: All programming and office work will be done remotely through Spring 2021.

Equal Employment Opportunity is not just the law, it’s our commitment. Read more about the Equal Employment Opportunity Law.

If you need assistance applying due to visually or hearing impaired, please email SEO Careers Help.

Sponsors for Educational Opportunity is an Equal Opportunity Employer – M/F/D/V. We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We will consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of age, race, color, national origin, sex, religion, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status.

JobTitle: Public Relations Account Manager - B2B Enterprise (Remote Work Opportunity)
Text:
PUBLIC RELATIONS ACCOUNT MANAGER - TECH B2B (REMOTE WORK OPPORTUNITY)

Are you a PR pro with deep roots in Enterprise/B2B and Core Technology? Do you enjoy making complex ideas accessible? If yes, keep reading.


POSITION SUMMARY

Spark is hiring for an Account Manager with agency experience specifically in enterprise and B2B. The Account Manager assumes leadership for most of his/her client accounts, delivers solid results and manages budgets and resources to profitability. Additionally, the Account Manager will oversee account teams and supervise at least one direct report.


RESPONSIBILITIES

Perform insightful market assessments, develop communications and PR strategies, structure and grow budgets, and write thoughtful, organized PR plans
Interact with all levels of client contacts from day-to-day marketing contacts to the CEO
Manage junior staff on a project basis and provide day-to-day mentoring, as well as long-term professional development

Ability to multi-task and manage projects from start to finish
Creative and a self-starter Strong writing skills – able to develop great pitches, press releases, PR plans, etc., and be able to deliver client ready material

JobTitle: Research Planning and Business Development, Biotechnology ( Remote Work)
Text:
A leading international Biotechnology company is seeking a Research Planning and Business Development Representative that has extensive scientific knowledge, clear communication skills, and project coordinating skills.
This position can work at the company's NYC office or work remotely.
The successful candidate for this position will be able to effectively communicate and promote preclinical drug development tools to international pharmaceutical clients, while also managing several projects and tasks.
The role of the Research Planning & Business Development Representative has several integral responsibilities in client development, project coordinating and management, and scientific discussion to support the project and delivery services to existing and potential clients in Biotech, Pharma and Agrochemical in North America, Europe and Asia while also assisting the company to meet annual sales targets through its’ business strategy.

At least 3 years of experience in the client development role, project management role, business development role, life science field, etc
Working experience with CRO ( Contract Research Organization).
Strong proficiency with Microsoft Office suite including Word, Excel, PowerPoint
Professional appearance and excellent verbal and written communication skills
Possesses a high level of accuracy and organizational skills
Maintain a high level of trust and confidentiality
Ability to meet deadlines and work under pressure

Are you funnier than all of your friends? Do you always know the best place to go out to eat? Getting initial early adopters.For many people, once they start dating their partner they don’t put in the same amount of effort as they did initially. Once a couple succumbs to complacency the relationship has a tendency to stall, we want to help people avoid this phenomenon. In today’s modern world of technology, there are a plethora of applications which allow for an individual to seek companionship, yet there is nothing that helps them be a better partner and enhance their relationship or bond with their partner. Official is a new kind of application that allows users to easily engage more with their partner and rewards them for doing things they should be doing naturally.Official looks to fill the void that remains once the initial relationship is formed by building upon the foundation of a primary relationship, and looks to provide the greatest chance for a lasting and healthy relationship between users. By allowing users to remember important details, no matter how big or small, and create memories that will last a lifetime, Official exists as the perfect addition for any relationship.Our goal is not to help you find someone, but to make sure that you keep the person you are already with. We believe the best way to sustain a healthy relationship, is to #GetOfficial.At the end of the day, our company is about making people's relationships better one step at a time. If that interests you and you want to help out, apply.
