JobTitle: VMware Field Sales Enablement Business Partner for Synergy Channel, - Opportunity for Working Remotely New York, NY
Text:
VMWare is seeking a highly motivated, results-oriented Enablement Business Partner for driving strategic global enablement projects for VMware Dell EMC Enablement. Reporting to the Director, Worldwide Readiness and Customer Education and a strong dotted line to the Synergy Channel Director, the EBP will be responsible for managing programs designed to drive sales skills and productivity for Dell EMC Channel partners on VMW joint solutions.
VMware has a fast-paced, rapidly growing environment and will require the ability to build relationships and respond to top business priorities by helping to implement sales enablement programs in a repeatable and scalable fashion. The individual is proactive, organized, results-oriented, collaborative, assertive, and influential; and is committed to delivering impactful outcomes in a team environment.
This role is responsible for the creation and delivery of Partner sales-role specific training strategies and frameworks aligned to DT/VMware synergy sales/business priorities for the enablement of sales-makers using a variety of modalities. This person will partner with their peers in the DT and VMware (VMW) enablement teams, as well as functional organizations to ensure consistency, scalability and quality of enablement solutions. Learning and development responsibility includes defining role competency needs, evaluating as-is, creating training frameworks and strategies for sales-specific job tools, company products and selling skills.
The position requires a self-starter with robust project management skills, great communications and presentation skills, and the ability to understand the sales process and work with a variety of stakeholders at both Dell EMC and VMware to document and solicit their requirements, feedback and commitment to execute projects.
Lead the Global Channel Enablement business: be a trusted advisor to VMW & DT Channel Leadership and stakeholders to identify and prioritize enablement requirements aligned with synergy sales/business priorities
Accountable for channel sales enablement for key partners TBD
Develop strategies, frameworks and enablement plans focused on audience need, cross-functional consistency, and scalability
Execute and share best practices for ensuring excellence in sales facing aspects of learning and development
Perform detailed analysis of current skills and abilities and prescribe role-based learning paths for specific Dell channel partner roles in learning about VMware
Provide feedback to channel leadership on Learning and Development and audience experience
Continually measure the effectiveness of training, content, and delivery, while designing and executing plans for improvement
Responsibilities:
Working with the Channel Director, build the Channel Enablement Strategy yearly and quarterly
Build the Plan of Record for co-development of content & learning plan for Dell’s Partners (in tandem with RACE, who owns the learning plan for VMW sales and other VMware partners)
Conduct organizational level, program level, role level, and individual level needs analysis to identify strategies and frameworks to allow the development of high-impact sales training programs.
Manage and Lead Solutions messaging/content into T1 Channel Enablement Events (i.e. Heros Program, Dell Tech forums, etc.) with support from both RACE, Dell and VMware resources
Assist with the development of new and innovative approaches to improve the quality and effectiveness of sales enablement programs
Assist with onboarding and mentoring new Channel Partners
Build and/or maintain a stakeholder matrix within DT and VMW
Lead and facilitate virtual teams as necessary to execute training and enablement programs
Oversee effective measurement techniques for programs
Lead and track ongoing projects within DT in collaboration with VMW Enablement team includes project scoping, tracking, reporting for major initiatives and supporting activities
Communicate and drive standardized ROI metrics by program/activity
Support VMware Enablement & DSAT quarterly planning process to prioritize, plan and budget enablement events and ensure alignment with DT GSL&E
Coordinate regular cadence with DT and VMW enablement leads for program/activity metrics, team alignment, and project and status updates
Align closely with Dell GSL&E organization and the global enablement calendar for planning and execution of VMware training and enablement
Collaborate cross functionally with GSL&E, VMW Race, DSAT and regional stakeholders to ensure DT/VMW synergy priorities are embedded within NA DT Field Sales Enablement programs

Category : Sales
Subcategory: Field Enablement

Full Time/ Part Time: Full Time

JobTitle: Real Estate Compliance Consultant - DHCR Department (JD Preferred)
Text: Job descriptionThe compliance consultant in the DHCR department will be responsible for assisting building owners, developers and managing agents on matters associated with the Division of Housing and Community Renewal (DHCR). This position requires excellent attention to detail and efficient project management. Customer service-oriented individuals with outstanding writing and communication skills are encouraged to apply.ResponsibilitiesConduct all work required to manage assigned DHCR cases, overseeing their completion from start to finish. JobTitle: Virtual HBO Corporate Finance Intern, Summer 2021
Text:
Company Overview
WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.

HBO is one of the most respected and innovative entertainment brands in the world, serving iconic, award-winning programming to 140 million subscribers globally. A subsidiary of WarnerMedia, HBO is the world’s most successful pay TV service with an extensive array of programming that includes some of the most notable titles to be on television, including drama series Succession®, Watchmen®, Westworld®, Big Little Lies®, Game of Thrones®, The Sopranos®, Band of Brothers® and The Wire®, as well as comedy series Barry®, Insecure® and Sex and the City®. HBO is committed to retaining and recruiting skilled and motivated employees, placing a priority on qualified team players who contribute to the diversity of their workforce. HBO offers competitive benefits to include medical, dental, vision, a matched 401(k) plan, flexible spending, a commuter benefit program and tuition reimbursement.
Opportunity Overview
The Job
The intern will assist in two areas of West Coast Finance - Corporate and Planning.


The Daily
Assist Corporate Finance with financial reporting for HBO’s programming, including the current year forecast and long range plan.
Assist Planning with the review of production updates and talent contracts, and support various forecasting processes.
The Essentials
Knowledge of Accounting and/or Finance through related coursework or prior experience
Strong attention to detail
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Intermediate to Strong Excel skills (ability to pivot, consolidate, report)
Internship Program
Students must be currently enrolled in a college degree program for full duration of the internship.
Summer 2021 program dates are June 7th - August 13th; must be available for full program duration.
Full-time schedule (40 hours/week) designed to work around class schedule.
Fully remote/virtual experience; company owned laptop provided for the duration of the internship program.
Salary based on office location; relocation is not provided.
Warner Media, LLC and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

Responsibilities
NBC Universal is looking for a Writer/Digital Producer for NBCLX, a new brand dedicated to telling stories in our local communities that compel our audience to engage and take action. The Writer/Digital Producer will write, review and publish articles, headlines, display copy and other content for the NBCLX brand, and help the Digital Director manage content across all NBCLX digital platforms, including the web, apps, social and OTT.

The ideal Writer/Digital Producer candidate is an excellent writer with experience creating unique and compelling digital content aimed at a younger audience. S/he must have strong copy-editing skills, news judgment, and organizational ability, as well as a firm grasp of how younger news consumers use existing and emerging platforms. The right candidate has experience working on fast-paced deadlines and knows how to make stories shine on multiple platforms – whether it’s a story they’ve produced from scratch or something created by the NBCLX team. The candidate must be a natural collaborator who is able to work effectively with the NBCLX team and the broader NBC Owned Television Stations digital team.
Qualifications/Requirements
At least 3 years of professional experience writing for a digital-first news organization or brand.Experience working in a newsroom and creating content on fast-paced deadlines.Proven track record managing assets published to digital platforms, including reviewing for accuracy and grammar.Strong grasp of AP style.Prior experience working with a CMS.Understanding of digital analytics and trendsBasic current knowledge of copyright laws as it applies to digital publishing and social media
Eligibility Requirements
Interested candidates must submit a resume/CV through nbcunicareers.com to be considered.Must be able to work flexible hours including weekends and holidays.Must have unrestricted work authorization to work in the United States.Must be 18 years or older.Must be covered by Solutions, NBCU’s Alternative Dispute Resolution Program.
#LI-DNP
#LI-Remote

Strong editorial judgment and journalistic ethicsDemonstrated experience producing engaging content aimed at a younger audienceProven knowledge of libel, slander laws in regards to digital mediaDemonstrated ability to solve problems, prioritize decisions, and successfully manage multiple assignments concurrently in a high-pressure environmentGood collaborative and interpersonal skills to communicate at all levelsCreate content for multiple platforms aimed at younger news consumersExperience managing a homepage and or social media channels for a digital news organizationCopy editing experience is a plus.

At NBCUniversal, we believe in the talent of our people. It’s our passion and commitment to excellence that drives NBCU’s vast portfolio of brands to succeed. From broadcast and cable networks, news and sports platforms, to film, world-renowned theme parks and a diverse suite of digital properties, we take pride in all that we do and all that we represent. It’s what makes us uniquely NBCU. Here you can create the extraordinary. Join us.

5 years' experience in IT security, compliance, or risk management
BA/BS degree or equivalent experience or equivalent military experience
Experience in technology automation, implementation, integration, and/or deployment

Do you want to work on planetary scale security solutions in the cloud? Are you excited to help customers automate security operations giving them unprecedented capability and agility? Do you enjoy working on fast-paced complex projects focused on game changing business outcomes for customer globally?

As a member of the AWS Professional Services Global Security, Risk, and Compliance Practice you will have the opportunity to pioneer technically excellent security solutions supporting customer initiatives that are meaningful to their business. Building on those experiences you’ll collaborate AWS service teams on new features, innovate with new technologies and explore new challenges.

Roles and Responsibilities:

Build & deploy security infrastructure and automate security operations for customers
Collaborate on internal builder projects
Become a deep technical resource that earns our customers trust
Develop high-quality technical content such as automation tools, reference architectures, and white papers to help our consultants, partners, and customers build on the work you deliver.
Innovate on behalf of customers; translate your thoughts into action yielding measurable results.

This is a customer facing role. You will be required to travel to client locations and deliver professional services as needed.


Hands-on technical expertise in building security capabilities in code and deploying infrastructure in code
Strong scripting skills, i.e., PowerShell, Python, Node.js, JavaScript, Bash, Ruby, Perl, etc.
Technical expertise (design and/or implementation) in Cloud Computing technologies
Implementation experience with enterprise security solutions such as WAF, IPS, Anti-DDOS, and SIEM
Demonstrated understanding what it means to draw out customer needs and deliver practical outcomes addressing those needs.
Experience with Chef, Puppet, Salt, or Ansible in production environments at scale
Understanding architectural implications of meeting industry standards such as PCI DSS, ISO 27001, HIPAA, and NIST/DoD frameworks.

Mutual of Omaha Workplace Solutions is among the fastest-growing employee benefit insurance companies in the industry, and with good reason; we offer innovative products and services to meet the changing needs of the modern workforce. Mutual of Omaha is seeking a proven salesperson to join our team as an Employee Benefit Sales Representative in our New York office. The territory for this role will include New York City and Long Island and will target mid to large (10 -5000 employee) group segments. In this role, you will contribute to the generation and retention of Group Insurance premium income through the attainment of specific sales quotas. Performance is measured by attainment of personal sales quotas.

Type of Products Sold and/or Serviced: Group Life, STD, LTD, Dental, Statutory & Voluntary Products.

WHAT YOU'LL DO:

Attain annually established sales quota through developing and maintaining business to business relationships with employee benefit specialists, brokers, consultants, actuaries, accounting firms, and third party administrators, or contact prospective group clients directly. Develop and establish rapport conducive to the Company being considered for bidding on group insurance contracts. 50%
Personally present group insurance plan, obtain all proposal information, and negotiate for optimal contract provisions. Deliver all contract information to major account clients to install coverages and direct administration of contract procedures. 30%
Inform sales/service support staff of prospective clients. Oversee completion of contract proposals and paper workflow throughout the Field and Home Office. 10%
Stay abreast of industry and government changes affecting group insurance and maintain an awareness of existing and developing market trends. 10%

ABOUT YOU:

You are a self-starter with the ability to work independently, yet are a exceptional team player who values internal and external relationships as the key to a highly successful career.
You help promote a culture of diversity and inclusion within the department and the larger organization. You value different ideas and opinions. You listen courageously and remain curious in all that you do.
You are able to work remotely and have access to high-speed internet.
Currently have an active New York Life, Health, and Accident insurance license in good standing with the state.
Ability to meet ongoing continuing education requirements
Successful sales experience, evidenced by previous attainment of sales quotas
Excellent communication, problem solving, and negotiation skills
Thorough understanding of group insurance products, marketing techniques, and procedures for underwriting, rating, policy and contract issuance, and claims
Working knowledge of competitor products and services
Ability to travel outside of the office conducting sales at least 80% of each work week and has a valid driver's license
Access to reliable transportation in order to attend meetings on short notice and travel within assigned territory.

VALUABLE EXPERIENCE:

3+ years in ancillary employee benefit sales
Recent experience building relationships in New York territory preferred.

WHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU:

A diverse workplace where associates feel a sense of belonging.
An organization that feels like a small, close-knit community and has the strength of a Fortune 500 company.
Tuition reimbursement, training and career development.
Comprehensive benefits plan that includes medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance.
Flexible spending accounts for healthcare and childcare needs.
401(k) plan with a 2% company contribution and 6% company match.
Competitive pay with an opportunity for incentives for all associates.
Flexible work schedules with a healthy amount of paid time off.
For more information regarding available benefits, please visit our Career Site.


MUTUAL OF OMAHA:

Mutual of Omaha serves more than 4.8 million individual product customers and 39,000 employer groups. Our legacy of stability creates an environment where every associate is encouraged to experiment, innovate and grow in their own unique career path.

From day one, you’ll have the tools to be your best self at work. Here you’ll do meaningful work and your talents will have a positive impact on peoples’ lives as we help our customers protect what they care about and achieve their financial goals.

Each associate is a unique contributor to creating a diverse, dynamic, thriving and inclusive workplace. We want you to become engaged … feel a sense of belonging … and contribute to the company’s exceptional future.

Join forces with a company that can AMPLIFY YOUR STRENGTHS AND EMPOWER YOUR CAREER.

circa


For inquiries about the position or application process, contact our HR Helpline at 1-800-365-1405.

If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request an accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access our career center as a result of your disability. To request an accommodation, contact a Human Resources Representative at 1-800-780-0304. We are available Monday through Friday 7 am to 4:30 pm CST we will reply within 24 hours.

Mutual of Omaha and its affiliates are an Equal Opportunity /Affirmative Action Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

LiveRamp is the leading data connectivity platform. We are committed to connecting the world's data safely and effectively, advancing innovation, and empowering people to do good. Our platform powers customer experiences centered around the needs and concerns of real people, keeping the Internet open for all. We enable individuals around the world to connect with the brands and products they love. LiveRampers thrive on solving challenging problems for the good of humanity—and we're always looking for smart, kind, and creative people to help us get there.

Mission: LiveRamp makes it safe and easy for businesses to use data effectively.

As an Account Executive, Technology you are responsible for helping the biggest marketers and marketing platforms in the industry adopt and expand their use of LiveRamp's products and services within the context of the target platforms capabilities. You drive the sales cycle from start to finish including creating new business opportunities with prospects and clients, present LiveRamp capabilities to executive-level buyers, working with internal stakeholders to craft solutions & proposals with corresponding economic models to meet client needs. Ultimately, you will be measured on your ability to close deals for LiveRamp.

You will:

Deliver against revenue and bookings targets from a list of named accounts
Work collaboratively from multiple internal partners (Legal, Solutions Consulting, Product, Implementation and Data Ethics) to create and deliver proposals and ultimately close deals
Lead all partners, internal and external, through the full sales cycle - from lead generation to solution design to close
Meet or exceed your sales goals

Your team will:

The team is at the forefront of new verticals and use cases for LiveRamp. The team focuses on solving problems for technology first platforms (e.g. Adtech, Martech, publishers, consumer apps, etc).

About you:

You have a minimum of 2 years of successful quota carrying sales/BD experience in Adtech, Martech or SaaS sales.
You have experience as a strategic seller - consulting with clients to drive the best outcomes
You rely on understanding the technology and building trust to get deals done
You have excellent communication and presentation skills
You are remarkably strategic, driven, and entrepreneurial.
You work autonomously and need little management, only coaching and mentorship.
You are smart, nice and hardworking

Benefits:

People: work with talented, collaborative, and friendly people who love what they do.
In-Office Food: enjoy catered meals, boundless snacks, and the occasional food truck.
Fun: we host in-person and virtual events such as game nights, happy hours, camping trips, and sports leagues.
Work/Life Harmony: flexible paid time off, options for working from home, and paid parental leave.
Whole Health Package: medical, dental, vision, and disability insurance. Plus mental health support (via Talkspace) and fitness reimbursement up to $100 per month.
Savings: our 401K matching plan helps you plan ahead.
RampRemote: a comprehensive program to assist you in setting up a home office that works for you
Location: work in the heart of San Francisco or New York

More about us:

LiveRamp's mission is to connect data in ways that matter, and doing so starts with our people. We know that inspired teams enlist people from a blend of backgrounds and experiences. And we know that individuals do their best when they not only bring their full selves to work but feel like they truly belong. Connecting LiveRampers to new ideas and one another is one of our guiding principles—one that informs how we hire, train, and grow our global team across eight countries and four continents.

LiveRamp is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer (AA/EOE/W/M/Vet/Disabled) and does not discriminate in recruiting, hiring, training, promotion or other employment of associates or the awarding of subcontracts because of a person's race, color, sex, age, religion, national origin, protected veteran, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetics or other protected status. The Foundation Fighting Blindness is the largest nongovernmental foundation supporting retinal disease research in the world. Over the past four decades, FFB expanded its influence by raising more than $760 million to fund thousands of research studies at prominent institutions worldwide, attracting and investing in the first generation of clinicians and scientists focused on retinal disease research.We are actively recruiting an EVENTS ASSISTANT for our New York City region. The ideal candidate will provide administrative support for annual events in the region including wine tastings, golf tournaments, and other existing volunteer led events.Responsibilities include:- Provide day-to-day event support for Events Managers, including database entry and office support.- Draft event correspondence, gift acknowledgments, corporate proposals, website copy, printed materials, and auction solicitations.- Coordinate schedules and meetings among Event Committee members and staff.- Manage invitation responses, donations, guest lists and mailing lists.- Develop and design promotional materials such as invitations, advertisements, posters and presentations.- Research prospective event locations and funding resources, such as corporate, foundation and individual sponsors.- Negotiate contracts with outside vendors, and maintain invoices and expenses based on FFB accounting procedures.- Provide day of event support, including evening and weekend events, and minimal travel. Knowledge of Walk events highly desirable.- Solicit in-kind donations, auction items, and other services as needed.- Maintain excellent customer service and support with all volunteers, FFB Board Members and National Trustees, donors and event attendees.The successful candidate will possess:· This is a virtual position. Daily Internet accessibility is REQUIRED· Bachelor’s degree required· 4+ years’ experience as an assistant - non-profit experienced preferred· Thorough knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint required· Strong knowledge and experienced with non-profit relational databases· Excellent verbal and written communication skills, interpersonal skills and the ability to multitask· Able to lift up to 30 lbs.· Possess valid driver’s license with driving record acceptable to FFB insurance carrier· Successful and demonstrated ability to work in a virtual environment and independently· Some overtime is required as well as occasional travelWe offer a competitive salary and benefits, as well as a terrific team to work with! JobTitle: School for the Culture Lesson Creator
Text: School for the Culture Lesson Creator Please note:  In order to be considered for this role, you must apply here - https://forms.gle/GkG5E25gB1p1NnuH9At Practice Makes Perfect (PMP) we are passionate about leveling the playing field for some of our nation’s most deserving youth. We operate high impact programs before, during, and outside of school hours to drive student outcomes. Join us to create long-lasting, sustainable change across our K-12 school system.Our community of Interventionists empower low-income and inner-city kids by supporting them in Math, English, Science and more. Gain invaluable paid classroom experience and grow as a professional. We are looking for caring learners who possess strong patience, reliability and empathy.What you’ll do Work independently and efficiently to script out all 16 lessons via Google Docs or Microsoft Word.Research current events or culturally relevant information that is in alignment with the math content within the lesson plan.Submit a sample scripted lesson after reviewing all SFTC documents including the exemplar lesson plan provided for guidance before hired for the project.Able to effectively communicate via email, cell phone, or a video conferencing platform with PMP’s Program Manager, Brandon Hynson to provide and receive relevant updates of tasks.Who you are We are looking for experienced educators who are eager to construct culturally-responsive math lessons specifically for grades 3rd through 8th for the dynamic School for the Culture (SFTC) project. You must have at least 2-3 years experience teaching in a classroom. Proficiency in Google Docs or Microsoft Word is preferred, and there are some core values that we are also looking for. You are someone who strives for excellence, has a strong attention to detail, and a creative mindset. You are collaborative, positive and always willing to contribute and provide support. You care deeply, communicate with empathy and you are ready to disrupt the education status quo to create equal opportunity for all.Why you should join PMP was founded in 2010 at Cornell University by a first-generation college student to pay forward the blessings he received in route to attaining his college degree. Since 2010, PMP has served over 5,000 low-income children, created over 1,000 seasonal jobs, and trained almost 500 aspiring educators.You will be part of the PMP Program team. The Program team is the heart of our company. While the rest of the team works to make our services possible, your role is to make them happen. You’ll play a role in leading the impact that we hope to see in this world. For this School for the Culture Lesson Creator role, you will be paid at a basis of $50-$75 per lesson commensurate w/ your experience.PMP provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.At PMP, we care about our communities. We care about the generations who come after us and will ultimately inherit our communities. We care about our children and the education they receive. We care about excellence and we care about sustainability.We hope you’ll join us.Click the link below to apply!https://forms.gle/GkG5E25gB1p1NnuH9Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, ContractPay: $50.00 - $75.00 per weekBenefits:Flexible scheduleSchedule:Monday to FridayCOVID-19 considerations:During COVID-19 our full time staff is operating completely remotely.Education:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Teaching: 2 years (Required)Microsoft Office: 1 year (Required)Contract Length:3 - 4 monthsContract Renewal:PossibleWork Location:Fully RemoteThis Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneousDetail-oriented -- would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger pictureAchievement-oriented -- enjoys taking on challenges, even if they might failAutonomous/Independent -- enjoys working with little directionInnovative -- prefers working in unconventional ways or on tasks that require creativityHigh stress tolerance -- thrives in a high-pressure environmentCompany's website:https://www.practicemakesperfect.org/COVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

JobTitle: Corporate Litigation Analyst - Junior to Mid-Level Experience
Text: The Position: Top securities litigation law firm is seeking a JD/LLM to be part of a thriving practice group focused on research and analysis of complex corporate transactions as they relate to developing legal theories to achieve recoveries on behalf of shareholders in publicly traded companies. You must have exceptionally strong analytical skills, be detail oriented and have the ability and perseverance to dig deep into disclosure statements filed with the Securities Exchange Commission. You will work with a team of exceptionally talented lawyers, analysts, financial and accounting specialists to analyze complex corporate transactions and advise on various litigation strategies. Having a strong financial background is a requirement and an MBA or related financial analytical experience is very big plus. You will have the opportunity to advance and take on more responsibility as well as play an important role in the various cases you work on.The Firm: Levi & Korsinsky, LLP represents the interests of shareholders in complex securities class action and derivative litigation through the vigorous prosecution of corporations that have committed securities fraud and boards of directors who have breached their fiduciary duties. We are a national law firm with offices in New York City, California, Connecticut, and Washington, DC. Our law firm has served as lead counsel in many precedent-setting litigations, recovering millions of dollars in securities lawsuits for our clients, as well as litigated cases involving multi-billion-dollar merger transactions.Applicants should submit a cover letter, resume, and writing sample.Job Type: Full-timePay: From $65,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)Dental insuranceHealth insurancePaid time offVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridayLicense/Certification:Bar (Preferred)Work Location:Fully RemoteThis Company Describes Its Culture as:Detail-oriented -- quality and precision-focusedInnovative -- innovative and risk-takingOutcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance cultureCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

This is a growing in-house team that is looking to fill multiple paralegal positions. Candidates for the position should have a minimum of 3+ years of experience in progressive/broad based US business immigration practices.
Here’s just some of what you’ll do in this role:
Interact with and advise senior leadership on complex immigration matters and provide top notch immigration strategic analysis.
Lead and partner with cross-functional stakeholders on team projects to improve immigration function and client servicing
Prepare US employment-based, NIV and IV visa filings to US Dept. of Labor, USCIS, DOS, and CBP.
Gather and review immigration eligibility documents and strategically analyze individuals’ potential immigration options/benefits, including green card eligibility in the EB-1, EB-2 or EB-3 preference category and H-1B, L-1A, L-1B, E-3, TN qualifications. Responding to NIV RFE’s
Communicate clearly and effectively, and independently on immigration benefits, government procedures, and case processing timelines.
Responsible for monitoring and tracking visa expiration dates and filing deadlines for assigned cases.

Additional Details:
COVID-19 Precaution(s): Remote interview process
Location: NYC or Florida
Workplace Flexibility: Potential to work remotely on a limited basis after reasonable tenure with the team (Work remotely while Company’s COVID related protocols are in effect)
Travel: Little to none
Visa Sponsorship: Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for this position.
Minimum Qualifications
Minimum qualifications:
3+ years of progressive work experience preparing US nonimmigrant filings (including H-1Bs, L-1A/L-1Bs, E-3s, and TNs), as well as US immigrant filings, including EB-2 and EB-3 I-140s, Multi-national Manager and Adjustment of Status Applications
Must be able to work in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment, and communicate effectively with clients and governmental agencies, serving as a primary point of contact with the ability to function independently and to exercise discretion and judgment in sensitive matters

Preferred qualifications:
Prefer 2 years of current hands-on L-1 experience within overall work experience
Experience with LawLogix case management system is a plus
Bachelor's Degree Preferred

Visa Sponsorship: Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for this position.

Academic Credit: Offered upon the school department’s approvalOverviewThe Renew Democracy Initiative (RDI) is a non-partisan, not-for-profit organization dedicated to renewing and advancing the values of liberal democracy in the U.S. and around the world. We promote intellectual humility and an empathetic approach to disagreement.We have a small, tight-knit executive team, so interns will have the unique opportunity to learn all aspects of how to run an organization and make a personal impact on America’s democratic landscape. Because we are a start-up organization, interns should also be ready to play multiple roles as we have an “all hands on deck” mentality. All roles will have a mix of substantive and administrative responsibilities.Interns will have unprecedented access to our Board of Directors through our lunch & learns and other events—including renowned chess grandmaster & Putin critic Garry Kasparov, Senator Heidi Heitkamp, Lt. Col Alexander Vindman, Pulitzer Prize winner Bret Stephens, former head of the Republican National Committee, Michael Steele, and many others. Check out our website for more info!About the roleThis role will involve working on some combination of the below. Interns can either work full time (40 hours/week) or part time (25+ hours/week); but can be flexible depending on applicant’s circumstance;Hours are flexible and we are willing to work around your academic schedule;An opportunity to work closely with senior organizational leadership, including the Executive Director, as well as access to members of the Board of Directors, and other individuals from RDI’s extended network;This is an unpaid internship;A typical day could include spending a few hours updating the website and doing various CRM related tasks; posting updates to the website; building web pages; participating in a lunch-and-learn with a prominent political figure, a world champion poker player, or a business leader; and coordinating with the Newsletter and Event teams to put together digital contentWe are recruiting on a rolling basis. Basic Qualifications:

10+ years of technology related sales or sales engineering experience
5+ years of sales management experience
BA/BS degree required or equivalent experience

Startup Sales – District Manager Job Description

Amazon Web Services (AWS) offers a complete set of cloud services that enable all companies, from startups to enterprises, to run virtually everything in the cloud, including mobile applications, big data analytics, AI/ML platforms, and microservices/serverless infrastructures. Startups, which are primarily born-in-the-cloud now, represent a critically important and growing subset of customers to AWS. Startups have unique needs, priorities, and growth trajectories that distinguish them from traditional businesses and require different engagement strategies and sales motions from seller teams to effectively acquire, grow, and retain them on the AWS platform.

As AWS continues to rapidly grow, we seek a US Startup Sales District Manager to own, operate and define strategy for the fast growing early, mid, and late stage startups in your district. You will be responsible for building and developing a team of US startup account managers, driving revenue and user adoption, and ensuring new startups select AWS as their primary cloud provider. Your team will also be responsible for driving revenue growth and retention of existing AWS startup customers, as well as migrations to AWS of new startup customers currently running their infrastructure elsewhere. The district manager will align closely with go-to-market strategy and business development leaders who are driving strategic support, global co-programming, and portfolio engagement to help drive top and middle of funnel outcomes and accelerate seller cycles in the field. You will also work with a cross functional teams in marketing, solution architecture, and business development as well as cross-geo with your counterparts in other countries around the globe to implement a globally consistent coverage model, go-to-market strategy, and goals for the AWS startup business.

You will be at the heart of latest trends like artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), serverless and IoT. Your customers leverage state-of-the-art technologies on AWS to innovate and become the next disrupters, like today’s AirBnB, Slack, DoorDash, and Lyft. You are passionate about startups and a self-starter with entrepreneurial spirit (a builder!) who is prepared to work in a fast-paced environment, execute against ambitious goals, and consistently embrace the Amazon Culture.

This role is listed in New York City but we are open to remote locations with a STRONG preference near one of our major corporate hubs. Herndon VA, Austin TX, San Francisco CA, Seattle WA, Atlanta GA

Roles/Responsibilities:

Lead a Customer Obsessed business
Ensure customer success with early, mid and late stage startups
Accelerate customer adoption through well-developed sales engagements and successful GTM Strategy
Drive revenue and market share while meeting/exceeding revenue targets
Develop and execute goals to drive long term strategy with startups
Lead the team with engagements with Founders, CxO, Board of Directors and VC influencers
Partner with cross functional teams across Solution Architecture, Business Development, Marketing, Partners, and Training and execute customer acquisition programs and strategies
Define and drive operational processes and excellence with sales teams
Identify ways for AWS to add value to startups and help them grow beyond just providing great infrastructure services and support

Preferred Qualifications

MBA/MA/MS degree
Previous cloud expertise at a technology company
A technical background in engineering or computer science
History of working for, or selling to tech startups

5+ Years selling into the financial services industry

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation

Company Description

Have you ever worked for a company that actually wanted you to bring your whole self to work every single day?
About Tradeshift
Tradeshift is a unicorn in the fintech industry. We are disrupting a typically stagnant environment by connecting companies of all sizes and providing them with the platform and network needed to create value from old processes like procurement, invoicing, payments, and workflow. We recognize that business is both messy and social - two revelations that have driven the development of Tradeshift, a platform for all your business interactions.

Job Description

Are you a dynamic, innovative, and strategic Demand Generation marketing professional? Do you have a successful track record of running omni-channel marketing campaigns that achieve revenue and pipeline goals? Do you want to be part of a high-growth global startup?

If so, GREAT - Keep reading! We are currently expanding our marketing team and looking for a Demand Gen Pro to join our team.

Tradeshift is disrupting a stale e-invoicing, procure to pay, and financial solutions market. You’ll be a part of the Global Sales Team focusing on closing deals with Fortune 1000 companies across the globe!

We are connecting companies of all sizes and providing them with the platform and network needed to create value from old processes like procurement, invoicing, payments, and workflow. Tradeshift is redefining an enterprise space that has seen little change in many years. We recognize that business is messy and business is social. Understanding these two facts drives the development of Tradeshift - a platform for all your business interactions.
What you will be doing:
Create and manage end-to-end global digital marketing campaigns with heavy emphasis on building and executing complex email campaigns
Manage multiple stakeholders for global webinars, content syndication, 3rd party engagements with analysts and industry experts
Own and manage the marketing prospect database
Support customer communications programs
Familiar with database management and list segmentation best practices
Can create and manage multiple, omni-channel campaigns at once to achieve pipeline and revenue goals
Work with SDR team and sales managers to facilitate lead follow up and accelerate opportunity creation
Report on campaign success and return on marketing investment
Work cross functionally across design, product and content marketing teams to execute on campaigns

Qualifications

About you:
You have at least 3-5 years B2B marketing experience
Marketo and Salesforce expertise with experience managing other marketing tech platforms
You have a track record of running omni-channel marketing campaigns that achieve revenue and pipeline goals
Have experience with database management and list segmentation best practices
Work every day with a positive attitude and be a team player who can both coach and learn from their peers
Self starter with a positive attitude
HTML skills a plus

Additional Information

Location
Remote
Culture:
Our culture was formed from day one when three Danes poured their heart and soul into creating a platform that could connect every business in the world. We expect each employee to approach their job at Tradeshift with the same amount of pride and passion and embody the Tradeshift culture that makes us the best company in history.
Shifters come from various backgrounds and nations, and we all thrive off of challenging the status quo. We take pride in nurturing employee happiness, encouraging personal development, and welcoming teammates from all walks of life.
We value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
The Perks:
Career and professional development opportunities
Flexible hours and vacation policy
Supplemented cell phone plan
Fully paid 6 months parental leave
A competitive compensation package + equity
Life, short and long-term disability insurance
401k
Wellness and volunteer Programs

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

We are looking for a Human Resources Manager who is excited and ready to be a leader. The Human Resource Manager is responsible for managing and overseeing all phases of the employee life cycle. This includes but is not limited to all areas of human relations; recruitment, hiring, onboarding, performance review program, compensation, benefits, payroll, training, health and safety, employment exits, as well as managing compliance with state and federal regulations and applicable labor laws.About CertiK CertiK’s mission is to secure the cyber world, from blockchain to autonomous vehicles. Founded by Computer Science professors at Yale University and Columbia University, CertiK has applied its cutting-edge technologies and techniques to blockchain, quantum computing, and IoT. To date, CertiK has audited and secured over $8B in assets, including many of the world’s top blockchain projects.The research efforts of CertiK have received grants from IBM and the Ethereum Foundation, and notable blockchain investors include Binance Labs, Bitmain, Lightspeed Venture Partners, Matrix Partners, and NEO Global Capital, among others.ResponsibilitiesManaging all facets of the talent acquisition process including recruitment, vetting candidates, interviewing, selection, onboarding and affirmative action programs, and adhering to applicable employment laws and regulations;Partners with management team to understand and execute the organization’s human resources and talent strategy particularly as it relates to current and future needs, recruiting, retention, and succession planning;Responsible for employee engagement initiatives and aiding management team in this area;Work directly with the management team, to coordinate employee benefit programs, open enrollment activities, and serves as communication lead for benefit changes and announcements;Actively manages approach to health insurance, driving how health insurance is offered through internal resources and to provide the best balance of value to employees and cost containment;Work with oversea HR teams;Performs other duties as assigned.Minimum RequirementsBachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business, Industrial relations, Organizational Development or related field;Minimum of 5 - 7 years’ experience in HR functions with 3 years previous managerial experience;Specialized experience or training in organizational development, talent acquisition employment law, employee relations, safety and benefit administration;Excellent interpersonal skills. Ability to interact with a variety of persons throughout the corporation;Ability to remain calm and professional during confrontational situations;Fluent in English and Mandarin;Effective public speaking and presentation skills. Be able to present and defend a point of view;Possess excellent communication, written, oral, and interpersonal and teamwork skills, communicate constructively and confidently, listen openly, and collaborate well with staff and others in different groups.Job Types: Full-time, ContractPay: $60,000.00 - $100,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)Dental insuranceDisability insuranceFlexible scheduleHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offReferral programVision insuranceSchedule:On callSupplemental Pay:Bonus payCommission payEducation:Bachelor's (Required)Experience:HR functions: 5 years (Required)managerial: 3 years (Required)This Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:People-oriented -- enjoys interacting with people and working on group projectsAdaptable/flexible -- enjoys doing work that requires frequent shifts in directionAchievement-oriented -- enjoys taking on challenges, even if they might failCompany's website:https://certik.ioBenefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyOnly full-time employees eligibleWork Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

CBS BUSINESS UNIT: CBS Studios
JOB TYPE: Full-Time Staff
JOB SCHEDULE: Full-Time
JOB LOCATION: New York, NY
ABOUT US:
ViacomCBS is a leading global media and entertainment company that creates premium content and experiences for audiences worldwide. Driven by iconic consumer brands, its portfolio includes CBS, Showtime Networks, Paramount Pictures, Nickelodeon, MTV, Comedy Central, BET, CBS All Access, Pluto TV and Simon & Schuster, among others. The company delivers the largest share of the U.S. television audience and boasts one of the industry’s most important and extensive libraries of TV and film titles. In addition to offering innovative streaming services and digital video products, ViacomCBS provides powerful capabilities in production, distribution and advertising solutions for partners on five continents.
DESCRIPTION:
Paramount + daily animated variety series TOONING OUT THE NEWS seeks a researcher, preferably with late night or network/cable news background.
TOONING OUT THE NEWS features a cast of animated characters parodying top news stories and interviewing real-world guests, newsmakers, and analysts. The series is executive produced by Stephen Colbert and Chris Licht of CBS' The Late Show with Stephen Colbert and RJ Fried and Tim Luecke from Showtime's Our Cartoon President.
This researcher will be responsible for footage and print research, with greater emphasis on footage. Applicants should have strong working knowledge of Snapstream, stock and news footage companies, and other footage resources. Must be comfortable in a fast-paced environment under tight deadlines, and have a skill for identifying hypocrisy, illogical arguments, and magical thinking deployed by newsmakers on both sides of the aisle. This is a remote position but preference will be given to candidates located in the New York area or willing to relocate if it should become necessary.
This is currently a remote position but a New York based candidate preferred.
Responsibilities:
Source and log requested footage clips and additional broll for daily show
Work with editor to build montages of news clips
Contribute to daily research newsletter
Conduct deep dive research on guests and create packets
Fact check scripts
Proactively identify trending news stories and representative news clips, as well as seek out the stories that everyone else may be missing
QUALIFICATIONS:
Skills/Experience Required:
Late night footage research, news, and/or journalism background preferred
Ability to work under tight deadlines and keep up with the pace of a daily show is required
Strong editorial judgement, intellectual curiosity, awareness of news and politics, and knowledge of the inner workings of government
At least two years of television production, journalism, academic research or equivalent
Educational Requirements:
Undergraduate degree or equivalent work experience

Requisition ID: req12085
Job Title: Social Media for Programs Analyst
Sector: Violence Prevention and Response
Employment Category: Fixed Term
Employment Type: Full-Time
Open to Expatriates: No
Location: New York, NY HQ USA
Job Description
The Violence Prevention and Response Unit (VPRU) is comprised of approximately 50 team members supporting programming, resource development, research and policy and advocacy for over 20+ countries. The VPRU is formed by three teams that came together under one umbrella to better serve our beneficiaries. These are the Child Protection(CP), Protection & Rule of Law (PRoL) and Women’s Protection and Empowerment (WPE) teams. With an audacious vision of a world where women and girls, children and other vulnerable populations are valued and live free from violence, and can exercise their rights to promote their own safety, equality and voice, the IRC is known for its cutting edge anti-violence programming in humanitarian settings.
IRC is seeking a Social Media for Programs Specialist to be based in NY or DC. This position will have varied responsibilities, working on several different projects. They will be responsible for developing and implementing ways to use social media for programs, including social and behavior change communication messaging; providing quality technical support for these implementations; providing support to an cross-sectoral working group on ICT4P; and supporting on other uses of technology for programs in the Violence Prevention and Response unit.
One of the primary functions of the Specialist will be working with specialized technical staff, stakeholders in country programs, regions and across IRC operational and delivery areas, and other actors to further dissect how to use social media and digital technology safely for programming, to develop a strategy for social media and digital engagement, to co-design and test ways in which we can safely use social media to amplify IRC program impact, and to explore the development of further project phases targeting improved understanding and actions to prevent online/offline cycles of violence.
The Specialist will work under the direct supervision of the Senior Advisor for Information Management and Technology in the Violence Prevention and Response Unit. The Specialist will work closely with a Social Media for Programs Advisor as well.
Major Responsibilities:
Map teams engaged in partnership efforts with a social media platform and collect best practices for engagement (including KIIs with social media platform providers)
Work in collaboration on the development of a fit-for-purpose digital and social media engagement methodology that would support IRC to systematically understand and identify digital protection risks and gaps in access, translate analytics, and create a basis for advancing effective program design that could safely harness the power of social media
Identify opportunities, develop models, and support our various programming units to adapt and operationalize social media engagement strategies for scale
Develop a Digital and Social Media Engagement Strategy to enable safe and high impact deployment of digital and social media tools
Teach teams how to build, engage and retain an audience (on social media and other information platforms)
Maintain knowledge of, and ensure staff is trained on social media (and other) information sharing tools
Co-design and explore social media push strategies
Test co-designed approaches for increased programmatic deployment of social media
Develop project-specific tools / resources / curricula and provide technical support to programs following implementation
Provide technical support for field testing (tool development, assessment, training, troubleshooting)
Collaborate with Monitoring and Evaluation, HR, Finance, Supply Chain, Information Technology departments to ensure smooth implementation
Collaborate closely with other technical units departments such as health, economic recovery, and development and education to collaborate, track and develop collaborative guidance on the use of technology in programs
Share cross-context learning with program staff
Participate in/coordinate cross-sectoral working groups
Qualifications
Work Experience:
3-6 years of experience working within the humanitarian sector or with vulnerable populations
Demonstrated Skills and Competencies:
Basic understanding of the digital landscape, social media platforms and what makes digital content work
Experience developing and implementing social media strategies for diverse audiences.
Experience analyzing data and audience behavior to inform content creation.
Experience with ICT tools
Experience in web or social media content development and or management; preferred to have experience with social media mass messaging or other mass messaging
Ability to lead projects to successful completion
Preferred experience & skills:
Excellent communication skills, cultural sensitivity, flexibility, ability to improvise, great teammate
Strong organizational and time-management skills; ability to prioritize and deliver on time
Strong analytic problem-solving skills
The ability to work independently and productively in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent multi-tasking skills
Flexible and calm work attitude: the ability to respond rapidly to changing environments, yet remain productive and focused.
Ability to work both independently and in a dynamic, cross-functional team
Proficient in Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint etc.)
Working Environment:
Standard office working environment. This role may require working remotely full or part time and part time remote employees may be required to share workspace.
The IRC and IRC workers must adhere to the values and principles outlined in IRC Way - Standards for Professional Conduct. These are Integrity, Equality, Service, and Accountability. In accordance with these values, the IRC operates and enforces policies on Beneficiary Protection from Exploitation and Abuse, Child Safeguarding, Anti Workplace Harassment, Fiscal Integrity, and Anti-Retaliation.
IRC et les employés de IRC doivent adhérer aux valeurs et principes contenus dans le IRC WAY (normes de conduite professionnelle). Ce sont l’Intégrité, Egalite, le Service, et la Responsabilité. En conformité avec ces valeurs, IRC opère et fait respecter les politiques sur la protection des bénéficiaires contre l’exploitation et les abus, la protection de l’enfant, le harcèlement sur les lieux de travail, l’intégrité financière, et les représailles.

We are a startup nutrition company selling a vegan protein with adaptogens specifically designed to support mindful practices like yoga. We are a team of two, young, motivated individuals who designed our product from the ground up and are looking to scale our business and develop a stronger social media presence.We are seeking a US based content intern to own and manage our TikTok account.Responsibilities: - Post minimum 2x per day (preferably more).- Create content that: inspires people to live with intention, educates on our product benefits, resonates with the yoga community, recipes, drives sales.- Respond to comments/DMs on TikTok.- Stay up to date on trends (songs/dances/voiceovers etc.)Qualifications: - Must be familiar with the TikTok algorithm, features, and trends.- Must be comfortable being in content and embodying our brand.- Willing and excited to hustle, learn and get creative!- Must have a minimum of 10K followers on your personal TikTok account.- Must practice yoga and be comfortable doing yoga in the content.This role has huge growth potential! The more you create the more you earn. We will be tracking which sales come from our TikTok and you will receive 10% commission (product cost is $68 before discounts). We are also open to full time employment and growth with the company depending on performance.We can also offer you college credit.Contract length: 12 monthsPart-time hours: 10 per weekJob Types: Part-time, InternshipBenefits:Employee discountFlexible scheduleSupplemental Pay:Commission payLanguage:English (Required)Application Question:Do you have a personal TikTok account with 10K + followers? Please provide username.Work Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

Internship Description:

Our digital and social media teams throughout Discovery are responsible for creating original content for network websites as well as create social media content for our brands. These teams help drive tune-in to our networks and traffic to our websites while serving as liaisons to our communities of superfans. We have a number of internship opportunities across networks such as HGTV, Food Network, Travel Channel and more.

As an Editorial Intern, your adventure could lead you to work on projects and tasks such as:
Workflow organization for social teamOffer creative input on content and strategies for managing social platforms and conversationsResearch new industry trendsMarket shows, talents and events on social mediaPick stock photos for articles, research story ideas for our daily news videos, help track down photos for these videos, and even write our daily news scriptsAssist editors with building articles, photo galleries, and videos for our online propertiesAssist in implementing keyword research and SEO data in the creation of new content

Although our summer internship program will be completely remote (students can apply from anywhere), please be aware that this intern will report into a New York City based manager and therefore should expect to work on eastern standard time.
Requirements:
Must be currently enrolled as a student (proof of enrollment will be required if selected for an internship)Must be a rising Junior, Senior, or Graduate studentMust have at least a 3.0 GPAMust have the legal right to work in the United States.
More About the Intern Program:

Discovery’s internationally recognized intern program attracts the country’s boldest and brightest students for a paid, for-credit, real-world work experience in the entertainment and media industry.

Like other Fortune 500 companies, we believe in immersing our students in all aspects of our business, giving them first hand experience working for the global leader in real life entertainment. So what sets us apart? We’re passionate about investing in our interns- both personally and professionally. Whether our program is in-person or remote, every semester is packed with speaker sessions with executives, LinkedIn profile reviews, recruiter panels, roundtable events and professional seminars- and that just scratches the surface.

Think our program sounds pretty awesome? Our former interns thought so too! This year, we were voted into Vault’s 2021 internship rankings for best overall internships, best media and telecom internships, best sales and marketing internships and best internships for diversity.

Ready to learn more? Here’s what we offer:
Mentorship from some of the industry’s kindest and most passionate entertainment veterans
Professional development seminars, panels with recruiters and former interns, intern-exclusive events, and so much more
Access to top level executives and employees through our Speaker Series and Roundtables
Incredible networking opportunities and a robust intern alumni network
A creative, collaborative and inclusive company culture

What you can expect to take away from the semester:
Opportunity to develop professionally and uncover skills you didn’t know you had
The insider scoop on the TV industry and what happens behind the scenes
Relationships that will go beyond your collegiate career
Real life experiences that will provide you with the confidence to delve into your next adventure
And finally, what to know before applying:
We offer 12 week spring and summer opportunities
Our Summer 2021 program will be fully remote- the program will run from June 2-August 20.
The application deadline for Summer 2021 is March 19th. After this date, we cannot guarantee your application will be reviewed for the position.
Our internships are paid opportunities. Credit is not required; however, we will provide necessary documentation for school credit if desired.
We do not require a cover letter- please do not submit one. Instead, demonstrate your passion for the position through your resume and interviews.
Interviewing will take place from February through mid-April. A Discovery Intern team member will contact you if your experiences and interests match an open internship position. Due to the high volume of applications, we are unable to give individual status updates.

JobTitle: Communications Intern – Summer 2021 – New York, NY (remote)
Text:
Communications Intern – New York, New York (remote)
Summer 2021
Call for Applications
The Human Rights First Communications Department is seeking an intern to join our team. The Communications Intern will have the opportunity to learn about the breadth of Human Rights First’s policy and advocacy work, and how the communications department supports this work through branding, public relations, and communications strategy.
The intern will have diverse responsibilities across the department with opportunities to work in media relations, digital content creation, writing, website development, and video production. This internship is a great opportunity for a creative and motivated individual to gain hands-on experience shaping and executing Human Rights First’s communications strategy.
 A computer and internet connection are required for this position.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Research and track press mentions and relevant media coverage
Compile and update contact lists of journalists and media targets
Develop creative digital and social media content
Prepare written materials, including press materials, blogs, email communications, petitions, messaging documents, and factsheets
Conduct research for various communications projects
Assist with video shoots and transcribe video interviews, as needed
Update the Human Rights First website

REQUIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:
Demonstrated commitment to human rights issues
Demonstrated interest in the communications field
Excellent multitasking capabilities and attention to detail
Strong writing skills
Ability to work collaboratively with diverse groups in a remote environment
Tech-savvy, with experience in social media, web editing, and/or press strategy preferred
Area of study in communications, journalism, international relations, political science, public policy, or a related field, preferred
REQUIRED EDUCATION: Currently enrolled in, or recently graduated from, an accredited undergraduate or graduate university.
COMPENSATION: Unpaid
START DATE: June 2nd, 2021.
TIME COMMITMENT: 20 hours per week.
SUBMISSION DEADLINE: March 12th, 2021.
APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS: Interested candidates should apply at https://www.humanrightsfirst.org/careers. Resume, cover letter, & writing sample of 1-2 pages. (Additionally, sample social media posts are not necessary but encouraged)
Only selected applicants will be contacted for phone interviews. NO PHONE CALLS, PLEASE.
Human Rights First provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Are you funnier than all of your friends? Do you always know the best place to go out to eat?We are looking for people who are remarkably creative, want to get their sleeves dirty, and want to have an overall good time. We are an early stage startup looking to find people to help us grow quickly and create content for TikTok.The role will include but is not limited to: Researching TikTok trends (literally, just go on TikTok for us)Performing marketing research of potential users in order to help with growthEngage with the communityCreate content for tiktokPost and engage with usersHelp with marketing our productFor many people, once they start dating their partner they don’t put in the same amount of effort as they did initially. Once a couple succumbs to complacency the relationship has a tendency to stall, we want to help people avoid this phenomenon.In today’s modern world of technology, there are a plethora of applications which allow for an individual to seek companionship, yet there is nothing that helps them be a better partner and enhance their relationship or bond with their partner. Official is a new kind of application that allows users to easily engage more with their partner and rewards them for doing things they should be doing naturally.Official looks to fill the void that remains once the initial relationship is formed by building upon the foundation of a primary relationship, and looks to provide the greatest chance for a lasting and healthy relationship between users. By allowing users to remember important details, no matter how big or small, and create memories that will last a lifetime, Official exists as the perfect addition for any relationship.Our goal is not to help you find someone, but to make sure that you keep the person you are already with. We believe the best way to sustain a healthy relationship, is to #GetOfficial.At the end of the day, our company is about making people's relationships better one step at a time. If that interests you and you want to help out, apply. This is for college credit (sorry we don’t have funding yet).Job Types: Part-time, InternshipPay: $0.00 per hourWork Location:Fully RemoteHours per week:10-19Company's website:getofficial.coCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings

Eco-Soap Bank is an award-winning international humanitarian and environmental nonprofit organization that employs economically disadvantaged women in 10 developing countries to recycle leftover soap from factories and redistribute it to NGO partners in an effort to save lives. The organization employs 160 women and has reached over 4 million people with lifesaving soap and free hygiene education. For more information, please visit https://ecosoapbank.org/.The organization is searching for a part-time Marketing Manager to handle responsibilities related to both Eco-Soap Bank, including :Social media management across platforms: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedInNewsletter outreach: Create engaging newsletter content and communicate with donor supporters, NGO customers, and soap factory stakeholdersExecute B2B marketing strategies, promotional partnerships, and campaigns to partner with NGOs globally to procure soapGraphic design: Create engaging content and materials for donors, customers, soap factory stakeholders, and NGO partners to enhance hygiene education programming and soap bar sales worldwideInternship program: Independently recruit, manage, and oversee marketing internsThis is a remote position and requires frequent online communication with a remote and international team and stakeholders with different backgrounds. Cultural sensitivity is paramount. Candidates must display a commitment to environmental, humanitarian affairs—and must be able to internalize, articulate, and represent the mission of Eco-Soap Bank to a variety of stakeholders.The qualifications and experience for this position might include:Social media management experience: Product-focused social media marketing, B2B marketing, consumer goods marketingProven track record increasing social media likes and followersPrevious success with social media fundraisingSome experience in social ad management to international audiencesExperience with Facebook Ads Manager and social media management platformsNewsletter creation and outreach experience: Experience using MailchimpExperience creating nonprofit, product-focused, or other marketing newsletter contentExceptional writing and communications skills demonstrating attention to rhetorical goals and mastery of contextGraphic design experience: Extensive knowledge of Adobe suite programs including Photoshop and InDesignShould be ready to present a design portfolioInternship management experience: Should demonstrate past ability or desire to manage and recruit marketing internsCandidates should be looking to make a significant impact through this organization, be willing to speak with stakeholders regularly (in various time zones), and possess the inclination to learn from an experienced international team.Job Types: Part-time, ContractPay: $30,000.00 per year

HIP connects and convenes funders, nonprofits, researchers, and other leaders to identify emerging needs among Latinos as well as best practices for responsive and effective funding of social change. HIP pioneers new philanthropic models by leading collaborative initiatives and has provided grants and training to help build the capacity of more than 600 organizations and leaders.Position SummaryHispanics in Philanthropy (HIP) is currently seeking an Events and Communications Coordinator. The Coordinator will work directly with the Senior Manager of Network Engagement, the Communications team, and other staff to plan and execute HIP's annual conference and assist in other high priority areas. The Coordinator will assist with and gain experience in all facets of event planning including, but not limited to: timeline development, speaker outreach, correspondence management, event promotion, and logistics management. This position will also support the President and Associate Vice President of Public Affairs with administrative duties.Core ResponsibilitiesEvents timeline development, speaker outreach, correspondence management, event promotion, and logistics management;Support the Communications team with drafting, editing, graphic design, and monthly newsletters; andPrepare expense reports, reimbursement requests, and process receipts.QualificationsInterest in HIP's mission, Latinx issues, and philanthropy;Excellent writing, research, and proofreading skills;Great interpersonal skills and a professional demeanor;Strong organizational abilities and a keen attention to detail;High degree of independence, creativity, and initiative;Ability to prioritize, multitask, and work remotely; andAbility to work remotely with virtual teams across the U.S. and in Mexico City.Desired *Bilingual in English and Spanish;Previous event planning, marketing, policy, and/or communications experience;Experience working on issues of diversity, particularly in the Latino communityPhysical Demands & Work Environment*This position requires five or more hours per day sitting in an office on a computer. Occasional evening and weekend availability and overnight travel may be required.CompensationHispanics in Philanthropy offers a competitive compensation package with a range of benefits for full time employees including medical, dental, vision, 401K matching, commuter check benefits, discounts on services, as well as sick, vacation, and paid holiday time.How to ApplySubmit an application (https://forms.gle/JVD6n6qKpCmjFqSKA) to be considered for this position. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis with preference to applications received by February 26th. Required materials include a cover letter and resume. Incomplete applications will not be considered.Three references, with a minimum of two from former supervisors, will be requested of those continuing through the interview process.Hispanics in Philanthropy is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.Job Type: Full-timeWork Remotely:Yes
