Company Description

Twitter is committed to serving the public conversation by helping people stay informed, inform others, and discuss what matters. Our Curation team is on a mission to better facilitate this through the curation of the best, most relevant, and timely content that reaches, engages and delights one of the largest daily audiences in the world.

Job Description

We are looking for an ambitious editorial leader with hands-on experience building human-in-the-loop machine learning processes to pioneer new Event Detection methods.
This role can be remote in the UK/US or located in our London/New York/San Francisco office.
The ideal candidate will have a demonstrated operational background in human-in-the-loop machine learning systems, preferably involving content discovery and recommendations. They will have a proven track record building, motivating and managing high performing teams, a deep knowledge of social media and Twitter and substantial experience editing and reporting breaking news.
Twitter’s Curation team sits within its Consumer Product team, which works directly on developing the core Twitter product with our customers in mind. As the Event Detection Lead for Curation you will have a broad mandate to bring your content expertise to bear on developing next-generation technologies that effectively and continuously integrate the power of human judgment in Twitter’s Event Detection algorithms.
This is a high level strategic role offering a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to revolutionize how information is organized and contextualized on the world’s most influential social media platform.
Success in this role is measured by:
Hiring a team of high quality HITL content specialists and effectively integrating them into the Twitter Curation and Event Detection teams
Crafting and implementing high impact Event Detection HITL processes in collaboration with the Product and Engineering teams
Implementing a long-term strategy for success
Using data to inform and improve decision-making
Providing easy-to-understand, constructive feedback to aid team and individual development
Managing the team’s day-to-day operations and forward planning
Responsibilities:
Define and drive Curation’s HITL content strategy
Manage, train and develop a team of HITL content specialists
Stay abreast of new developments in HITL technologies and standard methodologies and incorporate them appropriately
Set and deliver on team goals and road maps
Communicate team progress within the Curation team and wider Twitter org
Collaborate with cross-functional partners as part of a distributed team
Track success metrics
Support Product and Tooling teams

Qualifications

BA/BSc degree or equivalent experience
Written and verbal fluency in English; other languages a plus
Excellent written communication skills
Proven experience in the field of HITL Event Detection
Can recognize emerging areas of interest/conversations on Twitter in their early stages.
Can identify and curate experts (publications and individuals) within niche topics.
Extensive experience of using Twitter, preferably as a tool in reporting
Experience with news gathering tools like Tweetdeck, Dataminr for News, etc preferred but not required.
Additional Information

We care about making work happy and productive for everyone, with a permanent option to work remotely or regularly work from home when our offices reopen; a home office expense budget; wellness benefits; regular #NoMeetingFridays; and six months of parental leave.
A few other things we value:
Challenge - We work with Twitter's product and standards teams to solve some of the industry’s hardest content problems. Come to be challenged, learn, and thrive as a curator.
Diversity - Diversity makes us a better organization and team. We value diverse backgrounds, ideas, and experiences.
Work-Life Balance - We work hard, but we believe with hard work should come balance.
We are committed to an inclusive and diverse Twitter. Twitter is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.
San Francisco applicants: In response to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we’d like to mention that we consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

CBS BUSINESS UNIT: ViacomCBS
JOB TYPE: Full-Time Staff
JOB SCHEDULE: Full-Time
JOB LOCATION: New York, NY
ABOUT US:
ViacomCBS is a leading global media and entertainment company that creates premium content and experiences for audiences worldwide. Driven by iconic consumer brands, its portfolio includes CBS, Showtime Networks, Paramount Pictures, Nickelodeon, MTV, Comedy Central, BET, CBS All Access, Pluto TV and Simon & Schuster, among others. The company delivers the largest share of the U.S. television audience and boasts one of the industry’s most important and extensive libraries of TV and film titles. In addition to offering innovative streaming services and digital video products, ViacomCBS provides powerful capabilities in production, distribution and advertising solutions for partners on five continents.
DESCRIPTION:
ViacomCBS is seeking a HR Analyst to join our HR M&A and Transformation team. This team primarily works with the Transformation PMO (Project Management Office), a group dedicated to driving strategic operational change across ViacomCBS. Current projects include: (1) managing the ViacomCBS merger program, (2) building a new strategy for reimagining a remote workplace, and (3) finding opportunities for future corporate transformation. The HR Analyst will collaborate directly with the PMO, key business leaders, and HR Business Partners (HRBPs) to expand and refine related people metrics, build analytical models, and deliver people insights across global corporate M&A and transformation programs. In addition, the group is responsible for building and managing operational excellence through all M&A activity. The ideal candidate is highly organized, data savvy and driven to learn, innovate, and drive transformation.
Responsibilities
Track and quantify multi-dimensional people/labor impacts of corporate transformation projects; package results for progress updates with c-suite and other senior leadership
Use people data to influence remote work policies, real estate demand, technology needs, budgetary impacts, and employee experience
Work closely with Transformation PMO team to size labor opportunities related to new programs and projects
Manage the translation of data from numerous sources (HRIS, Salesforce, surveys, etc.) into normalized data sets used for reporting and analytics
Collaborate with HRBPs to track organizational change initiatives in Excel and Salesforce, and improve on data collection processes
Find opportunities for improving overall data analytical and visualization capabilities and help the team to adopt new technologies
Partner with Sr Director to project manage HR planning and execution regarding new acquisitions, divestitures, or other corporate expansion projects
Empower functional leaders with data, tools, and process solutions to drive operational efficiencies through M&A activity
Establish framework of metrics and KPIs to measure success of M&A activities
\#LI-SJ1
QUALIFICATIONS:
Requirements
3-5 years of data analytics experience; preferably with some experience in People Analytics, HR Technology/Operations, or HRBP
Working knowledge of data and operational needs across HR functions
Expert ability to manage dynamic data sets in Excel and other data tools
Experience working with data visualization tools (Tableau, Google Analytics, Salesforce, etc.) a plus
Strong critical thinking and consultative skills; experience influencing decision makers with data-driven solution recommendations and measuring their outcomes
Strong consultative and partnering skills. Proven ability to adapt quickly to changing priorities, multi-task efficiently and work with diverse personalities and all levels of management in a fast paced environment
Ability to analyze processes within a cross-functional organization; effective in implementing new and improved processes
Executive presence - must be comfortable collaborating with senior business leaders
\#LI-SJ1
FUNCTION: Human Resources

Medallia’s mission is to help companies win through customer experience. The world’s best-loved brands trust Medallia’s Experience Cloud™, which embeds the pulse of the customer in an organization and empowers employees with the real-time customer data, insights, and tools they need to make every experience great. Named a leader in the most recent Forrester Wave and ranked in the 2018 Forbes Cloud 100 list, Medallia is growing quickly, with a global footprint that spans Silicon Valley, Austin, New York, Washington DC, London, Paris, Sydney, Buenos Aires, Tel Aviv, and Prague. Here, we value people for each of the aspects that make them whole. We believe that people should not be defined only by a job title—nobody is "just an engineer" or "just a salesperson." We are each partners, parents, children, siblings, friends, and former classmates. We have different backgrounds and we celebrate different cultures. And, just like our product, we honor each of the experiences that build our people.
At Medallia we hire the whole person, not just a part of them.
The Role and Team
The Medallia People Technology team is seeking a Workday Analyst who is experienced in HCM to design and implement elegant solutions that bring efficiency and scale to our global organization. Our ideal candidate will have experience implementing all phases of a Workday HCM project, including partnering with stakeholders to develop a comprehensive understanding of business process requirements, leveraging best practices to design, configure and test solutions, partnering with IT on integrations, running end-user training sessions, and providing post-implementation support. We’re looking for a critical thinker who is naturally curious and intrinsically motivated to continuously improve the system.
This role is remote and will report directly to the Senior Manager of People Technology.
Responsibilities
Triaging, diagnosing, and resolving Workday functional issues originating from end-users, business process events, etc.
Creating, maintaining and supporting a variety of reports or queries using appropriate reporting tools; helping to maintain data integrity and compliance in systems by running queries and analyzing data.
Developing user procedures, guidelines and documentation; training end users (new and existing employees) on new processes/functionality.
Assisting in the review, testing and implementation of system upgrades twice annually.
Providing pre and post-launch end-user support, testing, change management, and training.
Developing and enhancing Workday knowledge through training, independent research, and experimentation to become a SME.
Participating in initiatives by assisting with business requirement gathering, business process review, testing, training, and documentation development.
Leading projects as defined by leadership, which include leading meetings, providing regular project updates, and adhering to project deadlines.
Maintaining strong working relationships with Workday users across the organization.
Providing configuration and integration support with our internal ATS - Lever.
Minimum Qualifications
2+ years of experience working with Workday and Applicant Tracking systems.
Demonstrated Workday HCM configuration experience (i.e. Custom Reports & Calc Fields, Business Process Framework, and/or Domain Security Configuration & EIBs).
2+ years of experience in project management, requirements gathering, quality assurance & user acceptance testing, and preparing documentation and specifications.
Preferred Qualifications
Lever ATS systems experience
A Self-Starter/Team Player Attitude: Ability to work independently as well as collaborating with team members from various business functions to deliver on commitments.
Resilient: Thrive in a fast-paced environment and able to adapt to changing situations.
Analytical: Use data to problem solve and identify areas of improvement.
Proactive: Take initiative, follow-through reliably and work with a sense of urgency while owning multiple priorities in a dynamic environment.
A Quick Learner: Ability to absorb new technologies and features quickly through instruction and independent learning.
Detail-Oriented: Achieve thoroughness and accuracy when completing a task, and make a conscious effort to understand causes instead of just the effects.
Excellent analytical, written and oral communication skills.
Ability to foster and maintain strong working relationships with end users, peers and leaders.
At Medallia, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it and recognize the value it brings to our customers and employees. Medallia is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. Equal opportunity and consideration are afforded to all qualified applicants and employees. We won't unlawfully discriminate on the basis of gender identity or expression, race, ethnicity, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, Veteran status, sexual orientation, and any other category protected by law. We also consider all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.
Medallia is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with disabilities in accordance with the American Disabilities Act and local disability laws.

About the Role
NHF is looking for a Grants Administrator to join the team! Under the general supervision of the Head of Research, the Grants Administrator will be responsible for planning and implementing the research’s department grant/fellowship program from application to implementation and reconciliation and all related activities in between. This position will, in collaboration with finance, develop a clear communication policy outlining proper rules and regulations for grant reporting and recording process, its specifications, requirements and objectives across all departments of the organization and the management.
This person will also be responsible for the overall development/design/implementation/project management of the Health Care Providers Community Journal Club. Additional responsibilities include, but are not limited to;
Administratively oversee peer review process of grants.
Oversee communications with grant-funding agencies regarding use of grant funds.
Oversee collection and maintenance of demographic, statistical data, program models and outcomes data for reporting and evaluation purposes.
Develop, prepare and disseminate a semi-annual e-newsletters/updates to key stakeholders (past researchers/mentors/grant administrators/etc.) identifying and communicating funding opportunities through NHF and upcoming applications cycles with the goal to increase awareness and applications.
What You Bring:
Minimum of bachelor’s degree required or equivalent experience.
Grant administration experience preferred. Knowledge of grants and grant administration systems (pre and post), processes and budgeting.
Motivated, self-directed, self-starter with excellent problem-solving skills and proven ability to perform under pressure.
Extraordinary communication skills including verbal and written experience.
Strong organizational and quantitative skills, as well as a broad understanding of the nonprofit, research, and peer-review environment. Ability to adhere to priorities, meet multiple deadlines and effectively present and explain complex information.
Completion of the Collaborative Institutional Training Initiative’s (CITI) and Good Clinical Practices (GCP) web-based training program concerning the protection of human subjects in research preferred. If not certified at time of employment, must complete within first 6 months of employment.
Able to function remotely and manage virtual meetings on a regular basis.
Self-motivated, critical thinker with keen attention to detail and excellent organizational skills.
Excellent interpersonal, leadership and communication skills including presentation skills
Strong project management skills.
Good understanding of the organization's overall business and its objectives.
Possess good knowledge of planning and strategizing financial and budgeting issues.
Ability to work within a team.
Ability to perform in cross-functional team approach and job responsibilities.
Proficient in using computers with related knowledge of software programs, specifically Word and Excel.
Any combination of experience and training that would likely provide the required knowledge and abilities is qualifying.
Bilingual a plus!!
Where You Will Work:
This is a remote based position. Candidate will be expected to travel to events and meetings as requested by the Head of Research.
What We Offer:
At NHF our mission is to serve those affected by all inheritable bleeding disorders. We are committed to our employees as well as those we serve. To do so, NHF seeks and values those qualities, both visible and invisible, that makes individuals unique. We strive to be a safe place where regardless of age, color, disability, gender, gender identity, gender expression, family status, national origin, race, ethnicity, or sexual orientation; you are heard, empowered and valued because we truly believe that every person brings a unique perspective and experience to advance our mission.
In order to attract and retain a high performance team, we offer a dynamic and rewarding work environment. In addition to a competitive salary, NHF provides a comprehensive health and wellness program to eligible employees, family members and domestic partners. Our health and wellness programs include medical, dental, vision, prescription drug, preventative care, mental health services and an employee assistance / work-life balance program. We also offer:
Full time employees: Three weeks (+) of vacation, four personal days, 12 sick days, 11 paid holidays, 1 Floating Holiday
We also offer paid time off to Part-Time Employees
Paid Short-Term Disability insurance & Life Insurance
Pre-tax savings plan (including Flexible Spending Accounts and Commuter Transit Account)
a 403(b) retirement plan.
How To Apply:
If you are interested this opportunity, please send your resume, cover letter and salary requirements to jobs_nhf@hemophilia.org. No phone calls please.

JobTitle: Virtual HBO Business Affairs Intern, Summer 2021
Text:
Virtual HBO Business Affairs Intern, Summer 2021
Location New York, New York
Business: HBO
Position Type: Intern
Job ID 180227BR
Company Overview

WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.

HBO is one of the most respected and innovative entertainment brands in the world, serving iconic, award-winning programming to 140 million subscribers globally. A subsidiary of WarnerMedia, HBO is the world’s most successful pay TV service with an extensive array of programming that includes some of the most notable titles to be on television, including drama series Succession®, Watchmen®, Westworld®, Big Little Lies®, Game of Thrones®, The Sopranos®, Band of Brothers® and The Wire®, as well as comedy series Barry®, Insecure® and Sex and the City®. HBO is committed to retaining and recruiting skilled and motivated employees, placing a priority on qualified team players who contribute to the diversity of their workforce. HBO offers competitive benefits to include medical, dental, vision, a matched 401(k) plan, flexible spending, a commuter benefit program and tuition reimbursement.
The Job

We are looking for someone with an interest in the legal and business side of television to assist our department with clearing and assessing and tracking rights to music, footage and photos used in HBO shows, documentaries, Sports programming and promos.

The Daily
Assist with the workings of our department including music, footage and photo clearances and working on establishing the HBO music catalog.
Projects may include day to day clearances, document retention, keeping our database of rights current and organizing license agreements to assess and disseminate rights to older programs.

The Essentials

Normal familiarity with word, excel, etc.
Research skills, archival, database and library skills would be a plus.
Metadata and database knowledge would be a plus as would an interest in contracts/license agreements.
Organized, good attention to detail, ability to think critically preferred.
Internship Program
Students must be currently enrolled in an undergraduate degree program for full duration of the internship.
Summer 2021 program dates are June 7th - August 13th; must be available for full program duration.
Full-time schedule (40 hours/week) designed to work around class schedule.
Fully remote/virtual experience; company owned laptop provided for the duration of the internship program.
Salary based on office location; relocation is not provided.
Warner Media, LLC and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

Internship Description:

Both our network communications teams and our corporate communications teams work to brand Discovery and its networks as a world class company and programmer. Discovery’s network publicity teams ensure that our television and corporate programs get the best coverage in the media, while our internal corporate teams act as internal cheerleaders, making sure all employees are informed and engaged in the company. We will have a variety of publicity and communications internships available in the summer, that could include Food Network/Cooking Channel PR, Animal Planet PR, Travel Channel PR, corporate PR, and internal communications.


As a Communications or Public Relations Intern, your adventure could lead you to work on projects and tasks such as:
Drafting press releasesCreation of media listsMedia monitoringCrafting and editing press clipsLocal news outlet outreachDistribution of media materialsResearch for new media initiativesCreate digital signage for internal campaigns
Create and help implement internal engagement challenges
- Management of special events - either internal or external

Although our summer internship program will be completely remote (students can apply from anywhere), please be aware that this intern will report into a New York City based manager and therefore should expect to work on eastern standard time.
Requirements:
Must be currently enrolled as a student (proof of enrollment will be required if selected for an internship)Must be a rising Junior, Senior, or Graduate studentMust have at least a 3.0 GPAMust have the legal right to work in the United States.Experience with graphic design software (Photoshop, InDesign, etc) preferred for some positionsStrong writing skills preferred
More About the Intern Program:

Discovery’s internationally recognized intern program attracts the country’s boldest and brightest students for a paid, for-credit, real-world work experience in the entertainment and media industry.

Like other Fortune 500 companies, we believe in immersing our students in all aspects of our business, giving them first hand experience working for the global leader in real life entertainment. So what sets us apart? We’re passionate about investing in our interns- both personally and professionally. Whether our program is in-person or remote, every semester is packed with speaker sessions with executives, LinkedIn profile reviews, recruiter panels, roundtable events and professional seminars- and that just scratches the surface.

Think our program sounds pretty awesome? Our former interns thought so too! This year, we were voted into Vault’s 2021 internship rankings for best overall internships, best media and telecom internships, best sales and marketing internships and best internships for diversity.

Ready to learn more? Here’s what we offer:
Mentorship from some of the industry’s kindest and most passionate entertainment veterans
Professional development seminars, panels with recruiters and former interns, intern-exclusive events, and so much more
Access to top level executives and employees through our Speaker Series and Roundtables
Incredible networking opportunities and a robust intern alumni network
A creative, collaborative and inclusive company culture

What you can expect to take away from the semester:
Opportunity to develop professionally and uncover skills you didn’t know you had
The insider scoop on the TV industry and what happens behind the scenes
Relationships that will go beyond your collegiate career
Real life experiences that will provide you with the confidence to delve into your next adventure
And finally, what to know before applying:
We offer 12 week spring and summer opportunities
Our Summer 2021 program will be fully remote- the program will run from June 2-August 20.
The application deadline for Summer 2021 is March 19th. After this date, we cannot guarantee your application will be reviewed for the position.
Our internships are paid opportunities. Credit is not required; however, we will provide necessary documentation for school credit if desired.
We do not require a cover letter- please do not submit one. Instead, demonstrate your passion for the position through your resume and interviews.
Interviewing will take place from February through mid-April. A Discovery Intern team member will contact you if your experiences and interests match an open internship position. Due to the high volume of applications, we are unable to give individual status updates.

Company Description

Have you ever worked for a company that actually wanted you to bring your whole self to work every single day?
About Tradeshift
Tradeshift is a unicorn in the fintech industry. We are disrupting a typically stagnant environment by connecting companies of all sizes and providing them with the platform and network needed to create value from old processes like procurement, invoicing, payments, and workflow. We recognize that business is both messy and social - two revelations that have driven the development of Tradeshift, a platform for all your business interactions.

Job Description

Do you want to be part of a high-growth global financial startup spanning 160+ countries? Founded by three Danish visionaries with a dream of digitally transforming the way businesses work together, Tradeshift has emerged as a disrupter in the financial services, procurement, and supply chain space. Our global network of buyers, sellers, and partners provides a platform that will unlock $9 billion in existing unmet demand in supply chain financing. Our product team continues to develop innovative financial technology solutions that empower businesses to digitize, automate, and grow without limits.
We are looking for an experienced B2B product marketing manager to help us meet the challenges of our ongoing expansion. Under the guidance of the Head of Product Marketing, you and the product marketing team will be a critical component in the entire marketing organization. You will work closely with Product Management on all aspects of the product marketing strategy for their product(s), including developing product go-to-market strategies, understanding customer and market needs, building compelling product positioning and messaging, influencing product roadmaps, enabling the field on communication strategies, and executing successful product launches.
What you will be doing
Develop clear, concise, and compelling product positioning and messaging for the products you own
Collaborate with the product marketing team to define a broader vision for the product roadmap
Enable sales and customer success organizations to effectively understand and articulate the value of Tradeshift’s offerings
Create and manage the right set of sales tools, collateral, and enablement processes
Develop and deliver insightful market and competitive intelligence
Work closely with marketing, brand, sales, and demand generation teams to increase market presence and build pipeline and revenue
Partner with Product Management to help shape product roadmap and vision
Identify ideal customers to evangelize Tradeshift, develop references, and support case studies
Personally evangelize the Tradeshift story by delivering compelling presentations at live and virtual events
Spend time with customers to better understand market needs and gain an understanding of ICP, key personas, use cases, and value drivers for Tradeshift products

Qualifications

About you:
5+ years of experience in product marketing. B2B experience preferred. (Finance, SaaS, or Technology space a plus)
Proven success in developing messaging, positioning, and driving sales enablement
Agile mentality with the ability to easily move between strategic and tactical thought
Highly skilled at analytical decision-making and has the ability to recognize business challenges and provide a path to the solution.
Ability to distill actionable intelligence from data, compile and present findings and decisions.
Ability to work in a cross-functional environment, influence decision-making, and build authority
Strong ability to translate product features into value-based positioning and messaging that is meaningful and easily understood by customers and other business stakeholders
Ability to manage multiple priorities and projects simultaneously
Skilled at working with a high degree of autonomy and the ability to execute independently on initiatives
Comfortable in a remote work environment
Excellent creative writing, story creation, and storytelling capabilities
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required

Additional Information

Location
Remote
Culture:
Our culture was formed from day one when three Danes poured their heart and soul into creating a platform that could connect every business in the world. We expect each employee to approach their job at Tradeshift with the same amount of pride and passion and embody the Tradeshift culture that makes us the best company in history.
Shifters come from various backgrounds and nations, and we all thrive off of challenging the status quo. We take pride in nurturing employee happiness, encouraging personal development, and welcoming teammates from all walks of life.
We value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
The Perks:
Career and professional development opportunities
Flexible hours and vacation policy
Supplemented cell phone plan
Fully paid 6 months parental leave
A competitive compensation package + equity
Life, short and long-term disability insurance
401k
Wellness and volunteer Programs

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Fast-growing Life Science data company is looking for experienced Russian-speaking research analysts. Ideal candidates speak Russian fluently and have some life science, pharmaceutical, or financial market data experience.

Our SAAS platform comprises of healthcare providers, organizations and related claims, clinical trials, publications, and other assets. We use technology heavily to gather and process data on these topics, and as a Research Analyst, you will be responsible for validating the quality of our data collection, and doing additional manual collection where our technology does not provide the necessary level of granularity and/or accuracy.

Candidate must be curious, motivated, interested in the work we’re trying to do and the problems we are trying to solve to ultimately improve patients’ lives.

This is a contract position working remote (in the US) 29 hours a week for a four month commitment, paying $25 per hour. After the 4 month period, if this person demonstrates the right skillset and passion for our business they will be considered for a full-time position with H1 Insights.


Responsibilities
Learning and staying current with all guidelines and procedures for various data sets
Validation of QA reports of both machine-read data inputs and manual entry
Projects will be primarily be working with Japanese healthcare data
Maintain consistency and integrity of data collection
Manual entry of corrections and in some cases, updates
Recommendations for process/performance improvement initiatives and quality management
Feedback for automation improvements
Collaboration with team members across the US and internationally
Qualifications
Fluent Russian speaker, required
Bachelor's Degree in Basic Sciences or related field, required
Minimum of two years progressively responsible related work experience
Experience working in the Life Sciences or healthcare
Knowledge of research methods, data analysis, quality metrics
Working knowledge of Russian medical system preferred
Any experience using SQL is a plus.
Will consider management experience, so long as candidate expects to remain hands on
About H1Insights:
H1 is the first company to arm healthcare and life science companies with on-demand, live insights from across the data universe to accelerate the discovery and development of therapies to fight diseases. The company provides real-time data to support the end-to-end therapeutic development process from fundraising to product development to product launch, helping companies make smarter scientific decisions. Working with medical affairs and strategy teams who span all phases of the development lifecycle, H1 provides the complete picture of institutions, experts, scholarly content, markets, competitors and new opportunities through research grounded in actual data and clinical findings.

Must have friendly, can-do-attitude.Innate ability to take the initiative and does not wait to be asked to initiate/complete task objectives.Thinks big picture and anticipates workflow disruptions based on current workloads.Strong written, and verbal communication and analytical skills.Experience in working with:Google’s web-based software office suite including, Google docs, Google Sheets, and Google Slides.Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite including, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.Familiar with project management and DAM systems, a plus.Familiar with various video and image formats including TIFF, PNG, JPEG, CR2, WMV, MOV, MP4, etc.Ability to grasp new and changing technologies.Job Types: Full-time, ContractPay: $0.00 per yearSchedule:8 hour shiftDay shiftMonday to FridayCOVID-19 considerations:During COVID all staff works remotely.Education:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Project Management or Project Coordination: 2 years (Required)Agency Setting: 2 years (Preferred)Google Suite: 2 years (Required)Video image formats: 2 years (Required)Full Time Opportunity:YesWork Location:Fully RemoteThis Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneousPeople-oriented -- enjoys interacting with people and working on group projectsAdaptable/flexible -- enjoys doing work that requires frequent shifts in directionCompany's website:www.wondros.comCompany's Facebook page:www.facebook.com/wondros

About the Team
The Audience Development team is composed of SEO and content experts, working to reach and build audiences for Future’s diverse online brands. Audience Development helps Future’s brands connect to their 400+ million fans online through search engine optimization and content strategies, maximizing organic and social referrals alike.

Job Purpose
The Audience Development Assistant will support the Audience Development Manager in researching and optimizing content through social and SEO strategies to drive traffic to multiple brand websites, starting with the Entertainment and Gaming verticals.

Key Responsibilities
Help build SEO content strategies to improve and stabilize brand visibility in search engines for multiple brands
Perform ongoing SEO Reporting, sorting and analyzing website data
Perform SEO content research (including remaining up-to-date on industry trends and performing keyword research)
Support social media team with paid social ads and overall social strategies
Provide Technical SEO support, working with development teams as needed
Provide editorial support, auditing and suggesting content improvements and updates based on competitor analyses and brand organic search goals
Requirements
What do I need to succeed?
In this entry-level position, you’ll have the eagerness to learn the in's and out's of SEO, including learning the various research tools Future uses (training will be provided)
Bachelor’s Degree preferred
Strong communication and collaboration skills
Analytical and creative thinker
Understanding of media landscape with a general interest in media and marketing
Excellent spelling and grammar
Familiarity with Microsoft Office, Google sheets is a plus

Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Future.
Whilst we have specified the location, we are happy for someone to work remotely in any of the following States in the US:
Arizona, California, Connecticut, Colorado, District of Columbia, Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Indiana, Kansas, Massachusetts, Maryland, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, North Carolina, Nebraska, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New York, Ohio, Oklahoma, Oregon, Pennsylvania, South Carolina, Texas, Utah, Virginia, Washington, Wisconsin, West Virginia
Benefits
What will I get in return?
As well as our standard benefits, we have a number of awesome perks available to our staff including:
Unlimited paid time off (yes you read that right!)
A share in our success- every member of staff receives a profit pool bonus at the end of our financial year
Free food (monthly munchies, bagel Fridays, fresh fruit & snacks and coffee and tea on tap)
Central office locations with cool open plan working spaces
Free digital magazine subscriptions and access to back copies of our print magazines and bookazines
Discounted gym membership and onsite health & wellbeing (yoga at lunch anyone?!)
Regular staff socials arranged by our wonderful Employee Community & Culture committees
Huge opportunities to learn and develop whether through professional qualifications, exposure to incredible business projects or informal lunch & learns, hosted by your colleagues

Are you the PR whizz who’ll get everyone talking about VanMoof?
VanMoof bikes are already ridden across the world, but we want to get even more people in the saddle by sharing our disruptive vision even further. As our US PR Specialist, you’ll become our in-house PR expert for the US. You’ll be responsible for building quality press relations, securing reviews at top-tier publications, selecting and working with the right ambassadors, and developing and executing surprising PR projects that get the next billion on bikes.
In short, you’ll lead the way in our US mainstream breakthrough!
What you’ll do
Facilitate reviews for top US press, arranging bike deliveries, pickups and on-demand assistance to make sure they enjoy a first-class VanMoof experience.
Expand our black book of top-level press contacts and build long-lasting relationships with the creative tastemakers in our market – turning them into brand ambassadors.
Select tech and lifestyle events that VanMoof should be a part of in the US and beyond – and create interesting opportunities for us to be present there.
Review and distribute press releases and media kits with major US publishers, making sure they get to the best people possible.
Monitor, track and report media coverage and press clippings.
Keep an eye on trends, movements, and tastemakers that can help us in our mission to get the next billion on bikes.
You are an integral part of our internal PR team, and work closely with our wider brand team as well as our US-retail and sales teams.
What you'll bring
5+ years of relevant experience working in a US PR environment.
You bring a network of meaningful contacts, and have experience working with brand ambassadors.
US-based, and available for international travel.
An entrepreneurial spirit, with a knack for spotting (big) opportunities and making them happen.
Excellent English skills, both written and spoken, with bonus points for other languages.
What you'll get
Health Insurance benefits
Your very own loaner-VanMoof bike
Annually 4 Holidays / 15 PTO days
Laptop, screens, and software tools
Insider experience in a rapidly-growing international company
Office in NY / remote work for now (while we are in lockdown)
About us
We’re obsessed with cities. So are our bikes. Truly city-proof, they shrink long commutes, scare off bike thieves, and amplify your pedal power.
We made it our mission to get the next billion on bikes. Join us on this journey.

This job is US based and we're accepting candidates from any US location. The deadline for applying is Wednesday the 10th of February.

We are looking for enthusiastic and energetic educators/gamers/programmers to join our virtual camp team! We run virtual camps on school holidays and summer break. It was one of the small gifts the COVID pandemic gave us. Our programs are fun and inspiring with an immersive experience like Disney World. We seriously care about children’s holistic growth. If you love working with children, have a can-do attitude, love playing & developing games in Roblox, Scratch, and/or Minecraft, and are available for seasonal teaching opportunities, we invite you to NORY!What is NORY?Our NORY Core Values of resilience, intuitiveness, and empathy nurture purposeful problem-solving in children. We believe these core skills are critical for the next generation. We use STEM, Art, and Entrepreneurship as a vehicle to provide 3-12-year-old children with a meaningful learning experience.NORY Programs at a glance: Summer Camps: In 2019, 3000+ campers participated in NORY summer camp in NYC.Virtual Classes: We launched virtual STEM classes aimed toward 5 - 12 year oldsSchool Year: We work with over 35 schools to provide after school and in-school STEM classes throughout NYC.What it's like to work with NORY: We are a company that seeks joy in all aspects of our work. We are purpose-driven and we focus on creating high-quality instructional experiences for our Campers and Students. We value innovation in our administration, curriculum design, instructional practices, and educational experiences. We empower our employees to be risk-takers; to try new things that enhance the NORY core values. Above all, we strive to develop our NORY Core Values in all the children we work with by demonstrating them through our daily interactions. Proclinical is currently recruiting for a Clinical Project Manager with a leading CRO located remotely. As the Clinical Project Manager, you will plan, direct, coordinate and deliver activities for designated clinical study projects to ensure that project objectives of quality, scope, cost and time are accomplished.
Job Responsibilities:
Serve as primary point-of-contact and primary escalation point to the client.
Coordinate and oversees all functional services including external vendors to the established timeline and budget.
Manage the study budget, ensuring project remains within scope and that any out-of-scope activities are identified and handled as appropriate.
Develop robust and comprehensive project plans, including timelines, to guide all parameters of trial execution with consistency and quality.
Maintain integrated collaboration with clinical operations in the delivery and participates in clinical activities as appropriate. For projects of very limited scope (i.e. number of sites), PM may assume all clinical activities.
Establish tracking metrics to monitor trial and team progress towards project goals.
Prepare project status updates and report on progress to clients and senior management, offering solutions and opportunities as they arise.
Lead team meetings with the client and sets expectations for the project team.
Communicate effectively with client and company management to relay protocol/study issues including any deviations and implements necessary actions in response to those issues.
Travel as necessary according to project needs.
Mentor, train, and supervise staff at a functional level.
Assist with review of clinical study reports.
Support business development and marketing activities as appropriate.
Perform other duties as assigned by management.
May participate in review of protocols and other study documentation.
Provides on-going feedback, development and coaching for functional team members including annual performance reviews.
Skills and Requirements:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education/experience in science or health-related field. Advanced degree preferred.
Minimum of 3 years of clinical research experience or proven competencies for this position and a minimum of 1 years of leading a project.
Experience with Microsoft Office Products (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint), Microsoft Project.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively interface with others in a team setting.
Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail, and a customer service demeanour.
Ability to travel domestically and internationally including overnight stays.
If you are having difficulty in applying or if you have any questions, please contact Anabel Balsebre at (+1) 646-779-7965 or a.balsebre@proclinical.com.
Proclinical is a specialist employment agency and recruitment business, providing job opportunities within major pharmaceutical, biopharmaceutical, biotechnology and medical device companies.
Proclinical Staffing is an equal opportunity employer.
#LI-AB4

About Sollis Health

Founded in 2016, Sollis is a healthcare services business that is revolutionizing emergency medicine and urgent care. Our 24/7 concierge medical centers can handle acute medical emergencies, advanced imaging needs and simple complaints all in a single location with no wait, so patients receive the smart, simple and stress-free care they deserve. Our flagship center is on the Upper East Side of Manhattan, with a second center in Tribeca, house calls in the Hamptons, and a LA office.

We now serve over 5,000+ members and have an extraordinarily high renewal rate, because we treat everyone like family and go the extra mile in an often inefficient industry. We are a fast-growing, VC-backed organization that is rapidly expanding across the country. We are looking for energetic and passionate self-starters who are excited about healthcare and want to raise the standards for excellent emergency and urgent care.


Your responsibilities

Sollis is looking for an energetic, highly structured and patient-focused Care Navigator to manage several aspects of our clinical operations and ongoing patient care. Strong project management and exceptional organizational skills are critical. This role could be performed by an administrative individual looking for increased operational experience and has worked in medical settings before.


Specifically, your duties will include:

Organizing physician referrals for patients who need to see specialists in NYC, the Hamptons, and sometimes globally
Managing requests for private nursing, hospice and other external care requests. This will require strong perseverance and research skills
Facilitating home imaging for patients via our list of approved providers
Entering data to eCW (our electronic health record) and Salesforce (our CRM)

Schedule: MUST be willing to work some weekends! We have a second person currently in this role, so our goal is to coordinate 7 day a week coverage between two people.


Skills

To be successful in this role, candidates will demonstrate the following:

Exceptional organizational and project management skills
Excellent attention to detail and a conscientious personality type
Excellent communication skills and the ability to work cross-functionally among departments and teams
Strong database and systems skills, especially with Salesforce and eCW
Ownership for projects and problems to ensure they are executed to the highest standards
Ability to think and work independently, effectively, and efficiently
Ambitious, strong work ethic, and open to new ideas


Experience

We believe extraordinary people come from a variety of backgrounds, but ideally we would expect that you:

A strong administrative leader, who has worked in medical settings before
Looking for a challenging opportunity to help build the operations of a growing business
Previously worked in operations within an urgent care practice, concierge physician office, medical dept or hospital division

Schedule: Full-Time, immediate start. MUST be willing to work some weekends!

Full-Time positions are categorized as employees working more than 35 hours per week for Sollis, and includes:
Competitive Salary
Excellent Health, Dental and Vision Benefits
401k plan with 3% company matching
3 weeks PTO

Key Details:

Full-time role in NYC
Location: Upper East Side, NY (potential to work from home)
Reporting to: Director of Patient Experience, NY
Desired start date: ASAP


#SollisHealth

In this role, the Content Marketing Manager (Remote) will be responsible for defining the company’s presence across earned and owned media, social media, email, and sales enablement materials by helping to educate key audiences, drive demand, and increase revenue.

Drive the high-quality, high-velocity production of content, including blog posts, podcast and video scripts/storyboards, white papers/e-books, customer case studies, thought leadership pieces, marketing emails, etc.
Create and edit content to target, reach, and nurture different prospect, client, and member audiences
Collaborate with internal stakeholders and subject matter experts to identify compelling stories, create educational materials for a variety of audiences, and establish new pathways for the collection and promotion of content
Partner with Clinical Operations to distill medical journal articles and complex benefits information into engaging content pieces that educate Carrot members about fertility care and family-forming services
Manage external agencies and freelancers to ensure a regular publishing cadence and consistent voice, style, and tone across all mediums and pieces
Partner with internal teams and agencies to effectively optimize and distribute content (through social media, organic search, paid placement, email campaigns, etc.)
Manage social media strategy and execution
Report on content effectiveness, using metrics to refine content strategy and copy and partnering with the growth team in testing

3+ years of Marketing experience
Bachelor's Degree in a related field
Fluency with Social Media, Content, SEO, and Email Marketing tools, such as Buffer and Marketo

Great interpersonal skills
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)
Strong attention to detail
Highly organized
Desired Skills:

Experience with Multimedia Content Creation (video, audio, etc.)
Experience with Benefits

Our client is a well known global professional services firm. They are looking for a strong Social Media Manager - role is remote for the time being and then will be in either their NYC or Boston office.
Job Description
The Social Media Manager is responsible for continuing to develop and implement the firm’s social media strategy. They will coordinate the firm’s presence within social media, help ensure a consistent voice across the host of social media channels and supports the firm’s social media policies. He or she will work closely with colleagues and relevant firm committees to develop training modules for the effective individual and team use of social media channels. The Manager is responsible for staying abreast of emerging technologies, communications best practices and trends in the digital communications and social media arena.

In addition, as a part of the Brand & Communications Department global digital media team, the Manager may be called upon to assist with the development or distribution of content for other firm digital media platforms, including, but not limited to, websites, blogs, webcasts and podcasts.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

“Essential duties” are those that an individual must be able to perform with or without reasonable accommodation.
Leads strategic review of the firm’s social media presence, including providing counsel on integration of social media activities with the firm’s brand and communications program, development of policies and governance.
Plays integral role in the design and development of a comprehensive digital communications and social media strategy, incorporating multiple social media platforms.
Works with colleagues to develop integrated, multi-channel communications programs to reach internal and external stakeholders.
Promotes social media tactics as a fundamental part of the brand and communications media mix and ensures social media/digital communications approach is aligned with firm’s web site and digital media strategy.
Leads the development of the firm’s presence and effectiveness within multiple social media platforms.
Serves as the administrator of the firm’s presence within core social media platforms.
Supports the design, development and maintenance of practice and committee blogs.
Advises on social media strategy to support distribution of firm materials, substantive legal updates and other commentaries.
Helps ensure consistent brand presence and firm voice across multiple social media channels.
Stays abreast of social media developments, emerging technologies, communications best practices and trends in the social media universe as well as the competitive landscape.
Develops and delivers internal social media training modules for colleagues.
Leads development of internal social media training modules for attorneys and works with colleagues to roll out an education and familiarization program for attorneys.
Plays an integral role in vendor review and selection and manages vendor relationships.
In conjunction with the Brand & Communications team, oversees monitoring of the firm’s profile and presence within social media universe.
Works with colleagues to establish key metrics to measure effectiveness of the firm’s social media program.
Completes special projects regarding various issues as needed.
Promotes effective work practices, works collaboratively as a team member, and shows respect for co-workers.

Position Specifications
Education: Bachelor’s degree in Digital Media, PR/Communications, Marketing, Journalism or a related field required.
Work Experience:
Experience working in digital communications / social media, providing strategic counsel and hands-on execution required.
Significant relevant experience; demonstrable experience developing and implementing social media initiatives for a professional services firm or company required.
Experience in a professional services / B2B context preferred.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Excellent communication skills; creative writing and editing skills required.
Excellent language skills, including reading, grammar, spelling and vocabulary to ensure proper and efficient proofreading and writing.
Highly developed experience communicating within various social and digital media platforms.
Excellent leadership and project management skills (e.g., organizing, planning, problem-solving and decision-making) necessary for effective management.
Practical problem solving skills and well developed analytical skills.
Advanced knowledge of social media strategies with regards to issues management, as well as experience proactively managing a firm’s / company’s online reputation.
Ability to perceive and analyze problems and develop alternative strategies to solve them.
Ability to use independent judgment and discretion when making majority of decisions.
Ability to work in a high-pace environment, either independently or as a member of a project team.
Well developed and professional interpersonal skills; ability to interact effectively with people at all organizational levels of the firm.
Ability to work in a team environment with a customer service focus.
Ability to handle confidential and sensitive information with the appropriate discretion.
Organizational skills needed to manage time well, prioritize effectively, and handle multiple deadlines.
Knowledge of and experience with online analytics/measurement platforms
Knowledge and proficiency in PC applications, including MS Office

Successful candidates will not only be provided with an outstanding opportunity, but will also be provided with a generous total compensation package with bonuses awarded in recognition of both individual and firm performance.

Yoh, a Day & Zimmermann company, is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. Visit https://www.yoh.com/applicants-with-disabilities to contact us if you are an individual with a disability and require accommodation in the application process.

JobTitle: Research Planning and Business Development, Biotechnology ( Remote Work)
Text:
A leading international Biotechnology company is seeking a Research Planning and Business Development Representative that has extensive scientific knowledge, clear communication skills, and project coordinating skills.
This position can work at the company's NYC office or work remotely.
The successful candidate for this position will be able to effectively communicate and promote preclinical drug development tools to international pharmaceutical clients, while also managing several projects and tasks.
The role of the Research Planning & Business Development Representative has several integral responsibilities in client development, project coordinating and management, and scientific discussion to support the project and delivery services to existing and potential clients in Biotech, Pharma and Agrochemical in North America, Europe and Asia while also assisting the company to meet annual sales targets through its’ business strategy.
Qualification for the role
Bachelor Degree in the life sciences such as Biochemistry, Molecular Biology, Organic Chemistry, Biotechnology, Medical Sciences; Master and PhD are a plus.
At least 3 years of experience in the client development role, project management role, business development role, life science field, etc
Working experience with CRO ( Contract Research Organization).
Strong proficiency with Microsoft Office suite including Word, Excel, PowerPoint
Professional appearance and excellent verbal and written communication skills
Possesses a high level of accuracy and organizational skills
Maintain a high level of trust and confidentiality
Ability to meet deadlines and work under pressure
Travel: Ability and willingness to travel up to 30%
To apply, please email your resume to nkagaya@pasona.com.
